205.2b. Some objects havemore than one card type (forexample, an artifactcreature). Such`objects <#object>`__ satisfy the criteria forany effect that applies to any oftheir card types.

205.2c. Tokens have cardtypes even though they aren’t`cards <#card>`__. The same is true of`copies <#copy>`__ of spells and`copies <#copy>`__ of cards.

205.3. Subtypes

205.3a. A card can have oneor more subtypes printed on its`type line <#type_line>`__.

205.3b. Subtypes of each`card type <#card_type>`__ except`plane <#plane>`__ are always single words andare listed after a long dash. Eachword after the dash is a separate`subtype <#subtype>`__; such`objects <#object>`__ may have multiple`types <#type>`__. Subtypes of`planes <#plane>`__ are also listed after a long`dash <#dash>`__, but may be multiple words; allwords after the dash are,collectively, a single subtype.*Example:”`Basic <#basic>`__`Land <#land>`__*–Mountain„means thecardisalandwiththesubtypeMountain.”Creature– Goblin Wizard”means thecardisacreaturewiththesubtypesGoblin andWizard.”Artifact–Equipment„means thecardisanartifactwiththesubtypeEquipment.

205.3c. If a card withmultiple card types has one ormore subtypes, each`subtype <#subtype>`__ is correlated to itsappropriate card type.*Example: Dryad Arbor’s*typelinesays”LandCreature–ForestDryad.”Forestisaland type, and Dryad isacreature type.

205.3d. An object can’tgain a subtype that doesn’tcorrespond to one of that object’s`types <#type>`__.

205.3e. If an effect <#effect>`__instructs a `player to choose a`subtype <#subtype>`__, that`player <#player>`__ must choose one, and onlyone, existing subtype, and the`subtype <#subtype>`__ must be for theappropriate card type. Forexample, the player can’t choose a`land type <#land_type>`__ if an instructionrequires choosing a creaturetype. Example: Whenchoosing acreaturetype, „Merfolk” or”Wizard” is acceptable, but „Merfolk Wizard” isnot. Words like”artifact,””opponent,””Swamp,” or „truck” can’t bechosen because they aren’tcreaturetypes.

205.3f. Many cards wereprinted with subtypes that arenow obsolete. Many cards haveretroactively received subtypes.Use the Oracle card <#card>`__reference to determine what a `card’s`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are. (See rule`108.1 <#R1081>`__.)

205.3g. Artifacts havetheir own unique set of subtypes;these subtypes are called`artifact types <#artifact_type>`__. The`artifact types <#artifact_type>`__ are Clue,Contraption, Equipment (seerule 301.5), Food,`Fortification <#fortification>`__ (see rule`301.6 <#R3016>`__), Gold, Treasure, and`Vehicle <#vehicle>`__ (see rule`301.7 <#R3017>`__).

205.3h. Enchantments <#enchantment>`__have their own unique set of`subtypes; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called enchantmenttypes. The enchantmenttypes are`Aura <#aura>`__ (see rule 303.4),Cartouche, Curse, Rune, Saga (seerule 714), Shard, and Shrine.

205.3i. Lands have theirown unique set of subtypes; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called landtypes. The landtypes are Desert,`Forest <#forest>`__, Gate,`Island <#island>`__, Lair, Locus, Mine,`Mountain <#mountain>`__, Plains,`Power <#power>`__-Plant, Swamp,Tower, and Urza’s. Of that list,`Forest <#forest>`__, Island,`Mountain <#mountain>`__, Plains,and Swamp are the basic landtypes. See rule`305.6 <#R3056>`__.

205.3j.`Planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ have their ownunique set of subtypes; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called planeswalkertypes. The planeswalkertypes are Ajani,Aminatou, Angrath, Arlinn, Ashiok, Basri, Bolas,Calix, Chandra, Dack, Daretti, Davriel, Domri,Dovin, Elspeth, Estrid, Freyalise, Garruk,Gideon, Huatli, Jace, Jaya, Jeska, Karn,Kasmina, Kaya, Kiora, Koth, Liliana, Lukka,Nahiri, Narset, Niko, Nissa, Nixilis, Oko, Ral,Rowan, Saheeli, Samut, Sarkhan, Serra, Sorin,Szat, Tamiyo, Teferi, Teyo, Tezzeret, Tibalt,Tyvar, Ugin, Venser, Vivien, Vraska, Will,Windgrace, Wrenn, Xenagos, Yanggu, and Yanling.

205.3k. Instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__ share their lists of`subtypes <#subtype>`__; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called spelltypes. The spelltypes are Adventure, Arcane,and Trap.

205.3m. Creatures and`tribals <#tribal>`__ share their lists of`subtypes <#subtype>`__; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called creaturetypes. The creaturetypes are Advisor,Aetherborn, Ally, Angel, Antelope, Ape, Archer,Archon, Army, Artificer, Assassin,Assembly-Worker, Atog, Aurochs, Avatar, Azra,Badger, Barbarian, Basilisk, Bat, Bear, Beast,Beeble, Berserker, Bird, Blinkmoth, Boar,Bringer, Brushwagg, Camarid, Camel, Caribou,Carrier, Cat, Centaur, Cephalid, Chimera,Citizen, Cleric, Cockatrice, Construct, Coward,Crab, Crocodile, Cyclops, Dauthi, Demigod,Demon, Deserter, Devil, Dinosaur, Djinn, Dog,Dragon, Drake, Dreadnought, Drone, Druid, Dryad,Dwarf, Efreet, Egg, Elder, Eldrazi, Elemental,Elephant, Elf, Elk, Eye, Faerie, Ferret, Fish,Flagbearer, Fox, Frog, Fungus, Gargoyle, Germ,Giant, Gnome, Goat, Goblin, God, Golem, Gorgon,Graveborn, Gremlin, Griffin, Hag, Harpy,Hellion, Hippo, Hippogriff, Homarid, Homunculus,Horror, Horse, Human, Hydra, Hyena, Illusion,Imp, Incarnation, Insect, Jackal, Jellyfish,Juggernaut, Kavu, Kirin, Kithkin, Knight,Kobold, Kor, Kraken, Lamia, Lammasu, Leech,Leviathan, Lhurgoyf, Licid, Lizard, Manticore,Masticore, Mercenary, Merfolk, Metathran,Minion, Minotaur, Mole, Monger, Mongoose, Monk,Monkey, Moonfolk, Mouse, Mutant, Myr, Mystic,Naga, Nautilus, Nephilim, Nightmare,Nightstalker, Ninja, Noble, Noggle, Nomad,Nymph, Octopus, Ogre, Ooze, Orb, Orc, Orgg,Otter, Ouphe, Ox, Oyster, Pangolin, Peasant,Pegasus, Pentavite, Pest, Phelddagrif, Phoenix,Phyrexian, Pilot, Pincher, Pirate, Plant,Praetor, Prism, Processor, Rabbit, Rat, Rebel,Reflection, Rhino, Rigger, Rogue, Sable,Salamander, Samurai, Sand, Saproling, Satyr,Scarecrow, Scion, Scorpion, Scout, Sculpture,Serf, Serpent, Servo, Shade, Shaman,Shapeshifter, Shark, Sheep, Siren, Skeleton,Slith, Sliver, Slug, Snake, Soldier, Soltari,Spawn, Specter, Spellshaper, Sphinx, Spider,Spike, Spirit, Splinter, Sponge, Squid,Squirrel, Starfish, Surrakar, Survivor,Tentacle, Tetravite, Thalakos, Thopter, Thrull,Treefolk, Trilobite, Triskelavite, Troll,Turtle, Unicorn, Vampire, Vedalken, Viashino,Volver, Wall, Warlock, Warrior,Weird, Werewolf, Whale, Wizard, Wolf, Wolverine,Wombat, Worm, Wraith, Wurm, Yeti, Zombie, andZubera.

205.3n. Planes have theirown unique set of subtypes; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called planar`types <#type>`__. The planar `types <#type>`__are Alara, Arkhos, Azgol, Belenon, Bolas’sMeditation Realm, Dominaria, Equilor, Ergamon,Fabacin, Innistrad, Iquatana, Ir, Kaldheim,Kamigawa, Karsus, Kephalai, Kinshala, Kolbahan,Kyneth, Lorwyn, Luvion, Mercadia, Mirrodin,Moag, Mongseng, Muraganda, New Phyrexia,Phyrexia, Pyrulea, Rabiah, Rath, Ravnica,Regatha, Segovia, Serra’s Realm, Shadowmoor,Shandalar, Ulgrotha, Valla, Vryn, Wildfire,Xerex, and Zendikar.

205.3p. Phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`cards, scheme <#scheme>`__`cards, vanguard <#vanguard>`__`cards, and`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ cards <#card>`__have no `subtypes.

205.4. Supertypes

205.4a. An object canhave one or more supertypes. A`card <#card>`__’s supertypes <#supertype>`__are printed directly before its `cardtypes. The`supertypes <#supertype>`__ are`basic <#basic>`__, legendary,`ongoing <#ongoing>`__, snow, and`world <#world>`__.

205.4b. An object’s`supertype <#supertype>`__ is`independent <#independent>`__ of its cardtype and subtype,even though some supertypes areclosely identified with specific cardtypes. Changing an`object <#object>`__’s cardtypes or subtypes <#subtype>`__won’t change its `supertypes.Changing an object’s`supertypes <#supertype>`__ won’t change its`card types <#card_type>`__ or`subtypes <#subtype>`__. When an`object <#object>`__ gains or loses a`supertype <#supertype>`__, it retains any other`supertypes <#supertype>`__ it had. Example:Anabilityreads,”Alllandsare1/1creaturesthat arestilllands.” If any of theaffectedlandswerelegendary,they are stilllegendary.

205.4c. Any land with the`supertype <#supertype>`__ „basic”is a basic land. Any`land <#land>`__ that doesn’t have this`supertype <#supertype>`__ is a nonbasicland, even if it has a`basic land type <#basic_land_type>`__.`Cards <#card>`__ printed in sets prior to theEighth Edition core set didn’t use the word”basic” to indicate a`basic <#basic>`__ land.`Cards <#card>`__ from those sets with thefollowing names are`basic <#basic>`__ lands and havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference accordingly:Forest, Island,`Mountain <#mountain>`__, Plains,`Swamp <#swamp>`__,`Snow-Covered <#snow-covered>`__`Forest <#forest>`__,`Snow-Covered <#snow-covered>`__`Island <#island>`__,`Snow-Covered <#snow-covered>`__`Mountain <#mountain>`__,`Snow-Covered <#snow-covered>`__`Plains <#plains>`__, and`Snow-Covered <#snow-covered>`__`Swamp <#swamp>`__.

205.4d. Any permanent <#permanent>`__with the `supertype”legendary” is subject to the`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__for legendary <#legendary>`__`permanents, also called the”legend rule” (see rule`704.5j <#R7045j>`__).

205.4e. Any instant or`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ spell withthe supertype”legendary” is subject to acasting restriction. A`player <#player>`__ can’t cast a`legendary <#legendary>`__`instant <#instant>`__ or sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell unless that`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__ a`legendary <#legendary>`__`creature <#creature>`__ or a`legendary <#legendary>`__`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__.

205.4f. Any permanent <#permanent>`__with the `supertype”world” is subject to the`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__for world <#world>`__`permanents, also called the”world rule” (see rule`704.5k <#R7045k>`__).

205.4g. Any permanent <#permanent>`__with the `supertype”snow” is a snow <#snow>`__`permanent. Any`permanent <#permanent>`__ that doesn’t havethis supertype is a nonsnow`permanent <#permanent>`__, regardless of its`name <#name>`__.

205.4h. Any scheme <#scheme>`__`card with the`supertype <#supertype>`__”ongoing” is exempt from the`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__for schemes (see rule`704.6e <#R7046e>`__).

206. ExpansionSymbol

206.1. The expansionsymbol indicates whichMagic set a card is from. It’s asmall icon normally printed below the right edgeof the illustration. It hasno effect on game`play <#play>`__.

206.2. The color of the`expansion symbol <#expansion_symbol>`__indicates the rarity of the card <#card>`__within its set. A red-orange symbol indicatesthe `card is mythic rare. A goldsymbol indicates the card is rare. Asilver symbol indicates the card isuncommon. A black or white symbol indicates the`card <#card>`__ is common or is a`basic <#basic>`__ land. A purplesymbol signifies a special rarity; to`date <#date>`__, only the Time Spiral(r)”timeshifted” cards, which wererarer than that set’s rare cards,have had purple expansionsymbols. (Prior to theExodus (tm) set, all expansionsymbols were black,regardless of rarity. Also, prior to the SixthEdition core set, with the exception of theSimplified Chinese Fifth Edition core set, Magiccore sets didn’t have expansionsymbols at all.)

206.3. Previously, a spell <#spell>`__or `ability that affected`cards <#card>`__ from a particular set checkedfor that set’s expansionsymbol. These`cards <#card>`__ have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card referenceto say they affect cards „with a`name <#name>`__ originally printed” in aparticular set.

206.3a. One card (City in aBottle) refers to permanents <#permanent>`__and `cards with a name <#name>`__originally printed in the Arabian Nights (tm)expansion. Those `names are AbuJa’far, Aladdin, Aladdin’s Lamp, Aladdin’s Ring,Ali Baba, Ali from Cairo, Army of Allah, Bazaarof Baghdad, Bird Maiden, Bottle of Suleiman,Brass Man, Camel, City in a Bottle, City ofBrass, Cuombajj Witches, Cyclone, DancingScimitar, Dandan, Desert, Desert Nomads, DesertTwister, Diamond Valley, Drop of Honey, EbonyHorse, Elephant Graveyard,El-Hajjaj, Erg Raiders, Erhnam Djinn, Eye for anEye, Fishliver Oil, Flying Carpet,`Flying <#flying>`__ Men, Ghazban Ogre, GiantTortoise, Guardian Beast, Hasran Ogress, HurrJackal, Ifh-Biff Efreet, Island <#island>`__Fish Jasconius, `Island of Wak-Wak,Jandor’s Ring, Jandor’s Saddlebags, JeweledBird, Jihad, Junun Efreet, Juzam Djinn, KhabalGhoul, King Suleiman, Kird Ape,`Library <#library>`__ of Alexandria, Magnetic`Mountain <#mountain>`__, Merchant Ship,Metamorphosis, Mijae Djinn, Moorish Cavalry,Nafs Asp, Oasis, Old Man of the Sea, Oubliette,Piety, Pyramids, Repentant Blacksmith, Ring ofMa’ruf, Rukh Egg, Sandals of Abdallah,Sandstorm, Serendib Djinn, Serendib Efreet,Shahrazad, Sindbad, Singing Tree, SorceressQueen, Stone-Throwing Devils, Unstable Mutation,War Elephant, Wyluli Wolf, and Ydwen Efreet.

206.3b. One card <#card>`__(Golgothian Sylex) refers to`permanents with a`name <#name>`__ originally printed in theAntiquities (tm) expansion. Those`names <#name>`__ are Amulet of Kroog, ArgivianArchaeologist, Argivian Blacksmith, ArgothianPixies, Argothian Treefolk, Armageddon Clock,`Artifact <#artifact>`__ Blast,`Artifact <#artifact>`__ Possession,`Artifact <#artifact>`__ Ward, Ashnod’s Altar,Ashnod’s Battle Gear, Ashnod’s Transmogrant,Atog, Battering Ram, Bronze Tablet, Candelabraof Tawnos, Circle of`Protection <#protection>`__:Artifacts, Citanul Druid, ClayStatue, Clockwork Avian, Colossus of Sardia,Coral Helm, Crumble, Cursed Rack, Damping Field,Detonate, Drafna’s Restoration, Dragon Engine,Dwarven Weaponsmith, Energy Flux, Feldon’s Cane,Gaea’s Avenger, Gate to Phyrexia, GoblinArtisans, Golgothian Sylex, Grapeshot Catapult,Haunting Wind, Hurkyl’s Recall, Ivory Tower,Jalum Tome, Martyrs of Korlis, Mightstone,Millstone, Mishra’s Factory, Mishra’s WarMachine, Mishra’s Workshop, Obelisk of Undoing,Onulet, Orcish Mechanics, Ornithopter, PhyrexianGremlins, Power <#power>`__`Artifact, Powerleech, Priest ofYawgmoth, Primal Clay, The Rack, Rakalite,Reconstruction, Reverse Polarity, RocketLauncher, Sage of Lat-Nam, Shapeshifter,Shatterstorm, Staff of Zegon, Strip Mine,Su-Chi, Tablet of Epityr, Tawnos’s Coffin,Tawnos’s Wand, Tawnos’s Weaponry, Tetravus,Titania’s Song, Transmute <#transmute>`__`Artifact, Triskelion, Urza’sAvenger, Urza’s Chalice, Urza’s Mine, Urza’sMiter, Urza’s Power Plant, Urza’sTower, Wall of Spears, Weakstone,Xenic Poltergeist, Yawgmoth Demon, and YotianSoldier.

206.3c. One card <#card>`__(Apocalypse Chime) refers to`permanents with a`name <#name>`__ originally printed in theHomelands (tm) expansion. Those`names <#name>`__ are Abbey Gargoyles; AbbeyMatron; Aether Storm; Aliban’sTower; Ambush; Ambush Party; AnabaAncestor; Anaba Bodyguard; Anaba Shaman; AnabaSpirit Crafter; An-Havva Constable; An-HavvaInn; An-Havva Township; An-Zerrin Ruins;Apocalypse Chime; Autumn Willow; Aysen Abbey;Aysen Bureaucrats; Aysen Crusader; AysenHighway; Baki’s Curse; Baron Sengir; BeastWalkers; Black Carriage; Broken Visage;Carapace; Castle Sengir; Cemetery Gate; ChainStasis; Chandler; Clockwork Gnomes; ClockworkSteed; Clockwork Swarm; Coral Reef; Dark Maze;Daughter of Autumn; Death Speakers; Didgeridoo;Drudge Spell; Dry`Spell <#spell>`__; Dwarven Pony; Dwarven SeaClan; Dwarven Trader; Ebony Rhino; Eron theRelentless; Evaporate; Faerie Noble; Feast ofthe Unicorn; Feroz’s Ban; Folk of An-Havva;Forget; Funeral March; Ghost Hounds; GiantAlbatross; Giant Oyster; Grandmother Sengir;Greater Werewolf; Hazduhr the Abbot; Headstone;Heart Wolf; Hungry Mist; Ihsan’s Shade; IriniSengir; Ironclaw Curse; Jinx; Joven; Joven’sFerrets; Joven’s Tools; Koskun Falls; KoskunKeep; Labyrinth Minotaur; Leaping Lizard;Leeches; Mammoth Harness; Marjhan; Memory Lapse;Merchant Scroll; Mesa Falcon; Mystic Decree;Narwhal; Orcish Mine; Primal Order; Prophecy;Rashka the Slayer; Reef Pirates; Renewal;Retribution; Reveka, Wizard Savant; Root Spider;Roots; Roterothopter; Rysorian Badger; SamiteAlchemist; Sea Sprite; Sea Troll; SengirAutocrat; Sengir Bats; Serra Aviary; SerraBestiary; Serra Inquisitors; Serra Paladin;Serrated Arrows; Shrink; Soraya the Falconer;Spectral Bears; Timmerian Fiends; Torture; TradeCaravan; Truce; Veldrane of Sengir;`Wall <#wall>`__ of Kelp; Willow Faerie; WillowPriestess; Winter Sky; and Wizards» School.

206.4. Players mayinclude cards from any printing intheir constructed <#constructed>`__`decks if those cards <#card>`__appear in sets allowed in that format (or those`cards are specifically allowed bythe Magic: The Gathering TournamentRules). See the Magic:The Gathering TournamentRules for the currentdefinitions of the`constructed <#constructed>`__ formats(WPN.Wizards.com/en/resources/rules-documents).

206.5. The full list of expansions and`expansion symbols <#expansion_symbol>`__ can befound in the Card Set Archivesection of the Magic website(Magic.Wizards.com/en/game-info/products/card-set-archive).

207. Text Box

207.1. The text box isprinted on the lower half of the`card <#card>`__. It usually contains rulestext defining the`card <#card>`__’s abilities.

207.2. The text box mayalso contain italicized text that has no gamefunction.

207.2a. Remindertext is italicized textwithin parentheses that summarizes a rule thatapplies to that card. It usuallyappears on the same line as the`ability <#ability>`__ it’s relevant to, but itmay appear on its own line if it applies to anaspect of the card other than an`ability <#ability>`__.

207.2b. Flavor text <#flavor_text>`__is italicized text that, like the`illustration, adds artisticappeal to the game. It appears below the rulestext.

207.2c. An abilityword appears in italics atthe beginning of some abilities.`Ability words <#ability_word>`__ are similar tokeywords in that they tie together`cards <#card>`__ that have similarfunctionality, but they have no special rulesmeaning and no individual entries in theComprehensive Rules. The abilitywords are adamant, addendum,battalion, bloodrush, channel, chroma, cohort,constellation, converge, council’s dilemma,delirium, domain, eminence, enrage, fatefulhour, ferocious, formidable, grandeur, hellbent,heroic, imprint, inspired, joinforces, kinship, landfall, lieutenant,metalcraft, morbid, parley, radiance, raid,rally, revolt, spell mastery,strive, sweep, tempting offer,`threshold <#threshold>`__, undergrowth, andwill of the council.

207.3. Some cards havedecorative icons in the background of their`text boxes <#text_box>`__. For example, a guildicon appears in the text box ofmany cards associated with theguilds of Ravnica, and a faction icon appears inthe text box of most Scars ofMirrodin (tm) block <#block>`__`cards. Similarly, many promotional`cards <#card>`__ include decorative icons.These icons have no effect on game`play <#play>`__.

207.4. The chaossymbol {CHAOS} appears in the`text box <#text_box>`__ of each`plane <#plane>`__ card to the leftof a triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__that `triggers whenever {CHAOS} isrolled on the planar die. Thesymbol itself has no special rules meaning.

208.`Power <#power>`__/Toughness

208.1. A creature <#creature>`__`card has two numbers separated by aslash printed in its lower right corner. Thefirst number is its power (theamount of damage it`deals <#deal>`__ in combat); the second is its`toughness <#toughness>`__ (the amount of`damage <#damage>`__ needed to`destroy <#destroy>`__ it). For example, 2/3means the object has`power <#power>`__ 2 and`toughness <#toughness>`__ 3. Power <#power>`__and `toughness can be modifiedor set to particular values by`effects <#effect>`__.

208.2. Rather than a fixed number, some`creature <#creature>`__ cards have`power <#power>`__ and/or`toughness <#toughness>`__ that includes a star(*).

208.2a. The card may have a`characteristic-definingability <#characteristic-defining_ability>`__that sets its power and/or`toughness <#toughness>`__ according to somestated condition. (See rule 604.3.)Such an ability is worded „[This`creature <#creature>`__’s] [power <#power>`__or `toughness] is equal to . ..” or „[This creature’s]`power <#power>`__ and`toughness <#toughness>`__ are each equal to . ..” This ability functionseverywhere, even outside thegame. If the`ability <#ability>`__ needs to use a numberthat can’t be determined, including inside acalculation, use 0 instead ofthat number. Example: Lost Order of Jarkeldhaspowerandtoughnesseachequal to 1+. It hasthe*abilities„As Lost Orderof Jarkeldenters thebattlefield,choose anopponent” and”Lost Order ofJarkeld’spowerandtoughnessareeach equal to 1 plus the numberofcreaturesthechosenplayercontrols.”While Lost Order of Jarkeld isn’t onthebattlefield, therewon’t be a chosenplayer.Itspowerandtoughnesswilleach be equal to 1 plus 0, so it’s 1/1.

208.2b. The card may have a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ that`creates <#create>`__ a replacementeffect that sets the`creature <#creature>`__’s power <#power>`__and `toughness to one of anumber of specific values as it enters thebattlefield or isturned face up. (See rule`614 <#R614>`__, „ReplacementEffects.”) Such an`ability <#ability>`__ is worded „As [this`creature <#creature>`__] enters thebattlefield …,” „As [this creature] is turned`face up <#face_up>`__ … ,” or „[This`creature <#creature>`__] enters thebattlefield as . ..” and lists two or more specific`power <#power>`__ and`toughness <#toughness>`__ values (and may alsolist additional`characteristics <#characteristics>`__). The`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ chosen ordetermined with these effects <#effect>`__affect the `creature’s copiablevalues. (See rule`706.2 <#R7062>`__.) While the card <#card>`__isn’t on the `battlefield, its`power <#power>`__ and`toughness <#toughness>`__ are each consideredto be 0.

208.3. A noncreature`permanent <#permanent>`__ has no`power <#power>`__ or`toughness <#toughness>`__, even if it’s a`card <#card>`__ with a power and`toughness <#toughness>`__ printed on it (suchas a Vehicle). A noncreature`object <#object>`__ not on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ has`power <#power>`__ or toughness <#toughness>`__only if it has a `power and`toughness <#toughness>`__ printed on it.

208.3a. If an effect <#effect>`__would be created that affects the`power and/or`toughness <#toughness>`__ of a noncreature`permanent <#permanent>`__, that`effect <#effect>`__ is created even though itdoesn’t do anything unless that`permanent <#permanent>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ a`creature <#creature>`__. Example: VeteranMotorist hastheability„Whenever VeteranMotoristcrewsaVehicle,thatVehiclegets +1/+1 untilend of turn,” andit’stappedtopaythecrewcostofaVehicle. ThistriggeredabilityresolveswhiletheVehicleit crewed isn’tyet acreature.Thecontinuouseffectis created andwill apply totheVehicleonceitbecomesacreature.

208.4. Effects that set a`creature <#creature>`__’s power <#power>`__and/or `toughness to specificvalues may refer to that`creature <#creature>`__’s „basepower,” „basetoughness,” or”base power and`toughness <#toughness>`__.” Other continuouseffects may furthermodify the creature’s`power <#power>`__ and`toughness <#toughness>`__. See rule`613 <#R613>`__, „Interaction of ContinuousEffects.”

208.5. If a creature <#creature>`__somehow has no value for its `power,its power is 0. The same is truefor toughness.

209. Loyalty

209.1. Each`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`card <#card>`__ has a loyalty <#loyalty>`__number printed in its lower right corner. Thisindicates its `loyalty while it’snot on the battlefield, andit also indicates that the`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ enters thebattlefield withthat many loyalty <#loyalty>`__`counters on it.

209.2. An activatedability with a`loyalty <#loyalty>`__ symbol in its`cost <#cost>`__ is a loyaltyability. Loyaltyabilities follow specialrules: A player may`activate <#activate>`__ a loyaltyability of a`permanent <#permanent>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ any time theyhave priority and the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty during <#during>`__a `main phase of their turn,but only if none of that`permanent <#permanent>`__’s loyaltyabilities have beenactivated that turn. See rule 606,”Loyalty Abilities.”

210. Hand Modifier

210.1. Each vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card has a handmodifier printed in itslower left corner. This is a number preceded bya plus sign, a number preceded by a minus sign,or a zero. This modifier is applied as the`starting hand size <#starting_hand_size>`__ andthe maximum hand size <#maximum_hand_size>`__of the `vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card’s owner aredetermined. See rule 103.4.

211. Life Modifier

211.1. Each vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card has a lifemodifier printed in itslower right corner. This is a number preceded bya plus sign, a number preceded by a minus sign,or a zero. This modifier is applied as the`starting life total <#starting_life_total>`__of the vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card’s owner isdetermined. See rule 103.3.

212. Information Below the TextBox

212.1. Each card featurestext printed below the text box <#text_box>`__that has no `effect on game`play <#play>`__. Not all card setswere printed with all of the information listedbelow on each card.

212.1a. Most card setsfeature collectornumbers. This informationis printed in the form [card <#card>`__number]/[total `cards in the set] orsimply [card number]. Some`cards <#card>`__, such as unique`cards <#card>`__ in`Planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`Decks <#deck>`__, have card numbersthat exceed the listed total number of`cards <#card>`__.

212.1b. A card’s rarity isindicated with a single letter following the`collector number <#collector_number>`__.

212.1c. Some promotional`cards <#card>`__ include information toindicate the specific promotion the`card <#card>`__ is associated with.

212.1d. The three-character coderepresenting the set in which a card <#card>`__is printed and the two-character coderepresenting the language in which a`card is printed are separated by abullet point. If a card is premium,these codes are instead separatedby a star.

212.1e. The illustrationcredit for a`card <#card>`__ follows the paintbrush icon or,on older cards, the abbreviation”Illus.”

212.1f. Legal text <#legal_text>`__(the fine print at the bottom or bottom-right ofthe `card) lists the trademark andcopyright information.

3. Card Types

300. General

300.1. The card types <#card_type>`__are `artifact,`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__,`creature <#creature>`__,`enchantment <#enchantment>`__,`instant <#instant>`__, land,`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__,`plane <#plane>`__,`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__,`scheme <#scheme>`__, sorcery,`tribal <#tribal>`__, and`vanguard <#vanguard>`__.

300.2. Some objects havemore than one card type (forexample, an artifactcreature). Such`objects <#object>`__ combine the aspects ofeach of those card types, andare subject to spells and`abilities <#ability>`__ that affect either orall of those card types.

300.2a. An object that’sboth a land and another cardtype (for example, an artifactland) can only be played asa land. It can’t be cast <#cast>`__as a `spell.

300.2b. Each tribal <#tribal>`__`card has another cardtype. Casting and resolving a`tribal <#tribal>`__ card follow therules for casting and resolving a`card <#card>`__ of the other cardtype.

301. Artifacts

301.1. A player who has`priority <#priority>`__ may cast an`artifact <#artifact>`__ card fromtheir hand during a`main phase <#main_phase>`__ of their turn whenthe stack is empty. Casting an`artifact <#artifact>`__ as a spell <#spell>`__uses the `stack. (See rule`601 <#R601>`__, „Casting Spells.”)

301.2. When an artifact <#artifact>`__`spell resolves, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ puts itonto the battlefield undertheir control.

301.3. Artifact <#artifact>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash:”Artifact –Equipment.”Artifact subtypes <#subtype>`__are also called `artifacttypes.`Artifacts <#artifact>`__ may have multiple`subtypes <#subtype>`__. See rule`205.3g <#R2053g>`__ for the complete list of`artifact types <#artifact_type>`__.

301.4. Artifacts haveno characteristics <#characteristics>`__specific to their `card type.Most artifacts have no colored`mana symbols <#mana_symbol>`__ in their manacosts, and are therefore`colorless <#colorless>`__. However, there is nocorrelation between being`colorless <#colorless>`__ and being an`artifact <#artifact>`__:artifacts may be colored, and`colorless <#colorless>`__ objects <#object>`__may be `card types other than`artifact <#artifact>`__.

301.5. Some artifacts <#artifact>`__have the `subtype”Equipment.” An`Equipment <#equipment>`__ can be attached to a`creature <#creature>`__. It can’t legally beattached to anything that isn’t a`creature <#creature>`__.

301.5a. The creature an`Equipment <#equipment>`__ is attached to iscalled the „equipped creature.”The Equipment is attached to,or „equips,” that`creature <#creature>`__.

301.5b. An Equipment <#equipment>`__is `cast and enters thebattlefield justlike any other artifact. An`Equipment <#equipment>`__ doesn’t enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attached to a`creature <#creature>`__. The equip <#equip>`__`keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__`attaches the`Equipment <#equipment>`__ to a`creature <#creature>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control (see rule`702.6 <#R7026>`__, „Equip”).`Control <#control_controller>`__ of the`creature <#creature>`__ matters only when the`equip <#equip>`__ ability isactivated and when it resolves.`Spells <#spell>`__ and other`abilities <#ability>`__ may also`attach <#attach>`__ an`Equipment <#equipment>`__ to a`creature <#creature>`__. If an`effect <#effect>`__ attempts to`attach <#attach>`__ an`Equipment <#equipment>`__ to an`object <#object>`__ that can’t be equipped byit, the Equipment doesn’t`move <#move>`__.

301.5c. An Equipment <#equipment>`__that’s also a `creature can’t`equip <#equip>`__ a creature.An Equipment that loses the`subtype <#subtype>`__”Equipment” can’t`equip <#equip>`__ a creature.An Equipment can’t`equip <#equip>`__ itself. An`Equipment <#equipment>`__ that`equips <#equip>`__ an illegal or nonexistent`permanent <#permanent>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ unattached from that`permanent <#permanent>`__ but remains on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. (This is a`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__.See rule 704.) An`Equipment <#equipment>`__ can’t`equip <#equip>`__ more than one`creature <#creature>`__. If a`spell <#spell>`__ or ability <#ability>`__would cause an `Equipment to`equip <#equip>`__ more than one`creature <#creature>`__, the`Equipment <#equipment>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ chooseswhich creature it`equips <#equip>`__.

301.5d. An Equipment’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ is separatefrom the equipped creature’s`controller <#control_controller>`__; the twoneed not be the same. Changing`control <#control_controller>`__ of the`creature <#creature>`__ doesn’t change`control <#control_controller>`__ of the`Equipment <#equipment>`__, and vice versa. Onlythe Equipment’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ can`activate <#activate>`__ its`abilities <#ability>`__. However, if the`Equipment <#equipment>`__ grants an`ability <#ability>`__ to the equipped`creature <#creature>`__ (with „gains” or”has”), the equipped creature’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ is the onlyone who can activate that`ability <#ability>`__.

301.5e. An ability of a`permanent <#permanent>`__ that refers to the”equipped creature” refers towhatever creature that`permanent <#permanent>`__ is attached to, evenif the permanent with the`ability <#ability>`__ isn’t an`Equipment <#equipment>`__.

301.6. Some artifacts <#artifact>`__have the `subtype”Fortification.” A`Fortification <#fortification>`__ can beattached to a land. It can’t legallybe attached to an object thatisn’t a land.`Fortification <#fortification>`__’s analog tothe equip keywordability is the`fortify <#fortify>`__ keywordability. Rules`301.5a <#R3015a>`__-e apply to`Fortifications <#fortification>`__ in relationto lands just as they apply to`Equipment <#equipment>`__ in relation to`creatures <#creature>`__, with oneclarification relating to rule`301.5c <#R3015c>`__: a`Fortification <#fortification>`__ that’s also a`creature <#creature>`__ (not a`land <#land>`__) can’t fortify a`land <#land>`__. (See rule`702.66 <#R70266>`__, „Fortify.”)

301.7. Some artifacts <#artifact>`__have the `subtype”Vehicle.”Vehicles have a crew <#crew>`__`ability, which allows them to`become <#becomes>`__ artifactcreatures. See rule`702.121 <#R702121>`__, „Crew.”

301.7a. Each Vehicle hasa printed power and`toughness <#toughness>`__, but it has these`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ only ifit’s also a creature. See rule`208.3 <#R2083>`__.

301.7b. If a Vehicle <#vehicle>`__`becomes a`creature <#creature>`__, it immediately has itsprinted power and`toughness <#toughness>`__. Other`effects <#effect>`__, including the`effect <#effect>`__ that makes it a`creature <#creature>`__, may modify thesevalues or set them to different values.

302. Creatures

302.1. A player who has`priority <#priority>`__ may cast a`creature <#creature>`__ card fromtheir hand during a`main phase <#main_phase>`__ of their turn whenthe stack is empty. Casting a`creature <#creature>`__ as a spell <#spell>`__uses the `stack. (See rule`601 <#R601>`__, „Casting Spells.”)

302.2. When a creature <#creature>`__`spell resolves, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ puts itonto the battlefield undertheir control.

302.3. Creature <#creature>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash:”Creature – Human Soldier,””Artifact Creature –Golem,” and so on. Creature <#creature>`__`subtypes are also called`creature types <#creature_type>`__.`Creatures <#creature>`__ may have multiple`subtypes <#subtype>`__. See rule`205.3m <#R2053m>`__ for the complete list of`creature types <#creature_type>`__. Example:”Creature– Goblin Wizard”means thecardisacreaturewiththesubtypesGoblin andWizard.

302.4. Power and`toughness <#toughness>`__ are`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ only`creatures <#creature>`__ have.

302.4a. A creature’s`power <#power>`__ is the amount of`damage <#damage>`__ it deals incombat.

302.4b. A creature’s`toughness <#toughness>`__ is the amount of`damage <#damage>`__ needed to`destroy <#destroy>`__ it.

302.4c. To determine a`creature <#creature>`__’s power <#power>`__and `toughness, start with thenumbers printed in its lower right corner, thenapply any applicable continuouseffects. (See rule`613 <#R613>`__, „Interaction of ContinuousEffects.”)

302.5. Creatures can`attack <#attack>`__ and block.(See rule 508, „Declare AttackersStep,” and rule`509 <#R509>`__, „Declare BlockersStep.”)

302.6. A creature’s`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ withthe tap symbol or the untapsymbol in its activationcost can’t be activated`unless <#unless>`__ the`creature <#creature>`__ has been under its`controller <#control_controller>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__ continuouslysince their most recent turn began. A`creature <#creature>`__ can’t`attack <#attack>`__ unless it hasbeen under its`controller <#control_controller>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__ continuouslysince their most recent turn began. This rule isinformally called the „summoning sickness” rule.

302.7. Damage dealt to a`creature <#creature>`__ by a source withneither wither nor`infect <#infect>`__ is marked on that`creature <#creature>`__ (see rule`120.3 <#R1203>`__). If the total`damage <#damage>`__ marked on that`creature <#creature>`__ is greater than orequal to its toughness, that`creature <#creature>`__ has been dealt lethaldamage and is destroyed as a`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__(see rule 704). All`damage <#damage>`__ marked on a`creature <#creature>`__ is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__when it regenerates (see rule`701.15 <#R70115>`__,”Regenerate”) and`during <#during>`__ the cleanupstep (see rule`514.2 <#R5142>`__).

303. Enchantments

303.1. A player who has`priority <#priority>`__ may cast an`enchantment <#enchantment>`__ card <#card>`__from their `hand during <#during>`__a `main phase of their turnwhen the stack is empty. Casting an`enchantment <#enchantment>`__ as a`spell <#spell>`__ uses the stack.(See rule 601, „Casting`Spells <#spell>`__.”)

303.2. When an`enchantment <#enchantment>`__`spell <#spell>`__ resolves, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ puts itonto the battlefield undertheir control.

303.3. Enchantment <#enchantment>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash:”Enchantment – Shrine.” Eachword after the dash is a separate`subtype <#subtype>`__.`Enchantment <#enchantment>`__`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are also called`enchantment types <#enchantment_type>`__.`Enchantments <#enchantment>`__ may havemultiple subtypes. See rule`205.3h <#R2053h>`__ for the complete list of`enchantment types <#enchantment_type>`__.

303.4. Some`enchantments <#enchantment>`__ have the`subtype <#subtype>`__ „Aura.” An`Aura <#aura>`__ enters thebattlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__attached to an `object or`player <#player>`__. What an Aura <#aura>`__can be attached to is defined by its`enchant keywordability (see rule`702.5 <#R7025>`__, „Enchant”).Other effects can limit what a`permanent <#permanent>`__ can be enchanted by.

303.4a. An Aura <#aura>`__`spell requires a`target <#target>`__, which is defined by its`enchant <#enchant>`__ ability.

303.4b. The object or`player <#player>`__ an Aura isattached to is called enchanted. The`Aura <#aura>`__ is attached to, or”enchants,” that`object <#object>`__ or player.

303.4c. If an Aura isenchanting an illegal object or`player <#player>`__ as defined by its`enchant <#enchant>`__ ability <#ability>`__and other applicable `effects, the`object <#object>`__ it was attached to nolonger exists, or the player itwas attached to has left the game, the`Aura <#aura>`__ is put into its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard.(This is a state-basedaction. See rule`704. <#R704>`__)

303.4d. An Aura can’t`enchant <#enchant>`__ itself. If this occurssomehow, the Aura is put into its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard.An Aura that’s also a`creature <#creature>`__ can’t`enchant <#enchant>`__ anything. If this occurssomehow, the Aura <#aura>`__`becomes unattached, then is putinto its owner’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__. (These are`state-based actions <#state-based_actions>`__.See rule 704.) An Aura <#aura>`__can’t `enchant more than one`object <#object>`__ or player. Ifa spell or ability <#ability>`__would cause an `Aura to`become <#becomes>`__ attached to more than one`object <#object>`__ or player,the Aura’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ chooseswhich object or`player <#player>`__ it `becomes <#becomes>`__attached to.

303.4e. An Aura’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ is separatefrom the enchanted object’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ or theenchanted player; the two need notbe the same. If an Aura <#aura>`__`enchants an object,changing control ofthe object doesn’t change`control <#control_controller>`__ of the`Aura <#aura>`__, and vice versa. Only the`Aura <#aura>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ can`activate <#activate>`__ its`abilities <#ability>`__. However, if the`Aura <#aura>`__ grants an`ability <#ability>`__ to the enchanted`object <#object>`__ (with „gains” or „has”),the enchanted object’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ is the onlyone who can activate that`ability <#ability>`__.

303.4f. If an Aura isentering the battlefield <#battlefield>`__under a `player’s`control <#control_controller>`__ by any meansother than by resolving as an Aura <#aura>`__`spell, and the effect <#effect>`__putting it onto the`battlefield doesn’t specifythe object or player <#player>`__the `Aura will`enchant <#enchant>`__, that`player <#player>`__ chooses what it will`enchant <#enchant>`__ as the Aura <#aura>`__`enters thebattlefield. The`player <#player>`__ must choose a legal`object <#object>`__ or player <#player>`__according to the `Aura’s`enchant <#enchant>`__ ability <#ability>`__and any other applicable `effects.

303.4g. If an Aura isentering the battlefield andthere is no legal object or`player <#player>`__ for it to`enchant <#enchant>`__, the Aura <#aura>`__remains in its current `zone,`unless <#unless>`__ that zone isthe stack. In that case, the`Aura <#aura>`__ is put into its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard <#graveyard>`__`instead of entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__.

303.4h. If an effect <#effect>`__attempts to put a `permanent <#permanent>`__that isn’t an `Aura,`Equipment <#equipment>`__, or`Fortification <#fortification>`__ onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attached to an`object <#object>`__ or player, it`enters thebattlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__unattached.

303.4i. If an effect <#effect>`__attempts to put an `Aura onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attached to an`object <#object>`__ or player itcan’t legally enchant, the`Aura <#aura>`__ remains in its current`zone <#zone>`__, unless that`zone <#zone>`__ is the stack. Inthat case, the Aura is put into its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard <#graveyard>`__`instead of entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. If the`Aura <#aura>`__ is a token, itisn’t created.

303.4j. If an effect <#effect>`__attempts to `attach an`Aura <#aura>`__ on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ to an`object <#object>`__ or player itcan’t legally enchant, the`Aura <#aura>`__ doesn’t move.

303.4k. If an effect <#effect>`__allows an `Aura that’s being turned`face up <#face_up>`__ to become <#becomes>`__attached to an `object or`player <#player>`__, the Aura’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ considersthe characteristics ofthat Aura as it would exist if itwere face up to determine what itmay be attached to, and they must choose a legal`object <#object>`__ or player <#player>`__according to the `Aura’s`enchant <#enchant>`__ ability <#ability>`__and any other applicable `effects.

303.4m. An ability of a`permanent <#permanent>`__ that refers to the”enchanted [object or`player <#player>`__]” refers to whatever`object <#object>`__ or player <#player>`__that `permanent is attached to,even if the permanent with the`ability <#ability>`__ isn’t an`Aura <#aura>`__.

303.5. Some`enchantments <#enchantment>`__ have the`subtype <#subtype>`__ „Saga.” Seerule 714 for more information about`Saga <#saga>`__ cards.

304. Instants

304.1. A player who has`priority <#priority>`__ may cast an`instant <#instant>`__ card fromtheir hand. Casting an`instant <#instant>`__ as a spell <#spell>`__uses the `stack. (See rule`601 <#R601>`__, „Casting Spells.”)

304.2. When an instant <#instant>`__`spell resolves, theactions stated in its rulestext are followed. Then it’sput into its owner’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.

304.3. Instant <#instant>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash:”Instant – Arcane.” Each wordafter the dash is a separate`subtype <#subtype>`__. The set of`instant <#instant>`__ subtypes <#subtype>`__is the same as the set of `sorcery <#sorcery>`__`subtypes; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called spelltypes. Instants <#instant>`__may have multiple `subtypes. Seerule 205.3k for the complete listof spell types.

304.4. Instants can’tenter the battlefield. If an`instant <#instant>`__ would enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, it remains inits previous zone <#zone>`__`instead.

304.5. If text states that a`player <#player>`__ may do something „any timethey could cast an`instant <#instant>`__,” it means only that the`player <#player>`__ must have`priority <#priority>`__. The`player <#player>`__ doesn’t need to have an`instant <#instant>`__ they could`cast <#cast>`__. Effects thatwould preclude that player fromcasting a spell or casting an`instant <#instant>`__ don’t affect the`player <#player>`__’s capability to performthat action (unless the action isactually casting a spell or castingan instant).

305. Lands

305.1. A player who has`priority <#priority>`__ may play a`land <#land>`__ card from their`hand <#hand>`__ during a mainphase of their turn when the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty. Playing a`land <#land>`__ is a specialaction; it doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__ (see rule 116).Rather, the player simply puts the`land <#land>`__ onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. Since the`land <#land>`__ doesn’t go on the`stack <#stack>`__, it is never a`spell <#spell>`__, and players <#player>`__can’t `respond to it with`instants <#instant>`__ or activatedabilities.

305.2. A player cannormally play one land <#land>`__`during their turn; however,`continuous effects <#continuous_effect>`__ mayincrease this number.

305.2a. To determine whether a`player <#player>`__ can play a`land <#land>`__, compare the number of`lands <#land>`__ the player can`play <#play>`__ this turn with the number of`lands <#land>`__ they have already played thisturn (including lands played as`special actions <#special_action>`__ and`lands <#land>`__ played during <#during>`__the resolution of `spells and`abilities <#ability>`__). If the number of`lands <#land>`__ the player can`play <#play>`__ is greater, the`play <#play>`__ is legal.

305.2b. A player can’t`play <#play>`__ a land, for anyreason, if the number of lands the`player <#player>`__ can play thisturn is equal to or less than the number of`lands <#land>`__ they have already played thisturn. Ignore any part of an effect <#effect>`__that instructs a `player to do so.

305.3. A player can’t`play <#play>`__ a land, for anyreason, if it isn’t their turn. Ignore any partof an effect that instructs a`player <#player>`__ to do so.

305.4. Effects may alsoallow players to „put”lands onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. This isn’t thesame as „playing a land” and doesn’tcount as a land played`during <#during>`__ the current turn.

305.5. Land <#land>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash.`Land <#land>`__ subtypes arealso called land types.`Lands <#land>`__ may have multiple`subtypes <#subtype>`__. See rule`205.3i <#R2053i>`__ for the complete list of`land types <#land_type>`__. Example:”BasicLand–Mountain„means thecardisalandwiththesubtypeMountain.

305.6. The basic landtypes are`Plains <#plains>`__, Island,`Swamp <#swamp>`__, Mountain,and Forest. If an`object <#object>`__ uses the words „basic landtype,” it’s referring toone of these subtypes. An`object <#object>`__ with the land <#land>`__`card type and a basic landtype has the intrinsic`ability <#ability>`__ „{T}: Add [manasymbol],” even if the textbox doesn’t actually contain thattext or the object has no textbox. For Plains,[mana symbol] is {W}; for`Islands <#island>`__, {U}; for`Swamps <#swamp>`__, {B}; for`Mountains <#mountain>`__, {R}; and for`Forests <#forest>`__, {G}. See rule`107.4a <#R1074a>`__. See also rule`605 <#R605>`__, „ManaAbilities.”

305.7. If an effect setsa land’s subtype toone or more of the basic landtypes, the`land <#land>`__ no longer has its old landtype. It loses all`abilities <#ability>`__ generated from its`rules text <#rules_text>`__, its old landtypes, and any copy <#copy>`__`effects affecting that`land <#land>`__, and it gains the appropriate`mana ability <#mana_ability>`__ for each new`basic land type <#basic_land_type>`__. Notethat this doesn’t remove any`abilities <#ability>`__ that were granted tothe land by other`effects <#effect>`__. Setting a`land <#land>`__’s subtype <#subtype>`__doesn’t add or remove any `cardtypes (such as`creature <#creature>`__) or`supertypes <#supertype>`__ (such as`basic <#basic>`__, legendary,and snow) the land mayhave. If a land gains one or more`land types <#land_type>`__ in addition to itsown, it keeps its land types <#land_type>`__and `rules text, and it gainsthe new land types and manaabilities.

305.8. Any land with the`supertype <#supertype>`__ „basic”is a basic land. Any`land <#land>`__ that doesn’t have this`supertype <#supertype>`__ is a nonbasicland, even if it has a`basic land type <#basic_land_type>`__.

305.9. If an object isboth a land and another cardtype, it can be played only as a`land <#land>`__. It can’t be cast <#cast>`__as a `spell.

306. Planeswalkers

306.1. A player who has`priority <#priority>`__ may cast a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`card <#card>`__ from their hand <#hand>`__`during a mainphase of their turn when the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty. Casting a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ as a`spell <#spell>`__ uses the stack.(See rule 601, „Casting`Spells <#spell>`__.”)

306.2. When a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`spell <#spell>`__ resolves, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ puts itonto the battlefield undertheir control.

306.3. Planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash:”Planeswalker – Jace.” Eachword after the dash is a separate`subtype <#subtype>`__.`Planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are also called`planeswalker types <#planeswalker_type>`__.`Planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ may havemultiple subtypes. See rule`205.3j <#R2053j>`__ for the complete list of`planeswalker types <#planeswalker_type>`__.

306.4. Previously,`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ were subjectto a „planeswalker uniquenessrule” thatstopped a player from controllingtwo planeswalkers of thesame planeswalker type.This rule has been`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__and planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`cards printed before this changehave received errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to have the`legendary <#legendary>`__`supertype <#supertype>`__. Like other`legendary <#legendary>`__`permanents <#permanent>`__, they are subject tothe „legend rule” (see rule`704.5j <#R7045j>`__).

306.5. Loyalty is a`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ only`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ have.

306.5a. The loyalty of a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`card <#card>`__ not on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ is equal to thenumber printed in its lower right corner.

306.5b. A`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ has theintrinsic ability „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield with anumber of loyalty <#loyalty>`__`counters on it equal to itsprinted loyalty number.” This`ability <#ability>`__ creates a`replacement effect <#replacement_effect>`__(see rule 614.1c).

306.5c. The loyalty of a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ is equal to thenumber of loyalty <#loyalty>`__`counters on it.

306.5d. Each`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ has a number of`loyalty abilities <#loyalty_ability>`__, whichare activated abilities <#activated_ability>`__with `loyalty symbols in their`costs <#cost>`__. Loyaltyabilities follow specialrules: A player may`activate <#activate>`__ a loyaltyability of a`permanent <#permanent>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ any time theyhave priority and the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty during <#during>`__a `main phase of their turn,but only if none of that`permanent <#permanent>`__’s loyaltyabilities have beenactivated that turn. See rule 606,”Loyalty Abilities.”

306.6.`Planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ can beattacked. (See rule 508, „DeclareAttackers Step.”)

306.7. Previously,`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ were subjectto a redirectioneffect that allowed a`player <#player>`__ to have noncombat`damage <#damage>`__ that would be dealt to an`opponent <#opponent>`__ be dealt to a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ under that`opponent <#opponent>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__`instead <#instead>`__. This rule has been`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__and certain cards have receivederrata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to deal <#deal>`__`damage directly to`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__.

306.8. Damage dealt to a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ results in thatmany loyalty <#loyalty>`__`counters being`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from it.

306.9. If a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__’s`loyalty <#loyalty>`__ is 0, it’s put into its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard.(This is a state-basedaction. See rule`704. <#R704>`__)

307. Sorceries

307.1. A player who has`priority <#priority>`__ may cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ card fromtheir hand during a`main phase <#main_phase>`__ of their turn whenthe stack is empty. Casting a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ as a spell <#spell>`__uses the `stack. (See rule`601 <#R601>`__, „Casting Spells.”)

307.2. When a sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell resolves, theactions stated in its rulestext are followed. Then it’sput into its owner’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.

307.3. Sorcery <#sorcery>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash:”Sorcery – Arcane.” Each wordafter the dash is a separate`subtype <#subtype>`__. The set of`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ subtypes <#subtype>`__is the same as the set of `instant <#instant>`__`subtypes; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called spelltypes. Sorceries <#sorcery>`__may have multiple `subtypes. Seerule 205.3k for the complete listof spell types.

307.4. Sorceries can’tenter the battlefield. If a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ would enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, it remains inits previous zone <#zone>`__`instead.

307.5. If a spell,`ability <#ability>`__, or effect <#effect>`__states that a `player can dosomething only „any time they could`cast <#cast>`__ a sorcery,” itmeans only that the player musthave priority, it must be`during <#during>`__ the mainphase of their turn, and the`stack <#stack>`__ must be empty. The`player <#player>`__ doesn’t need to have a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ they could`cast <#cast>`__. Effects thatwould preclude that player fromcasting a spell or casting a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ don’t affect the`player <#player>`__’s capability to performthat action (unless the action isactually casting a spell or castinga sorcery).

307.5a. Similarly, if an`effect <#effect>`__ checks to see if a`spell <#spell>`__ was cast „anytime a sorcery couldn’t have been`cast <#cast>`__,” it’s checking only whetherthe spell’s`controller <#control_controller>`__`cast <#cast>`__ it without having`priority <#priority>`__, during a`phase <#phase>`__ other than their mainphase, or while another`object <#object>`__ was on the`stack <#stack>`__.

308. Tribals

308.1. Each tribal <#tribal>`__`card has another cardtype. Casting and resolving a`tribal <#tribal>`__ card followsthe rules for casting and resolving a`card <#card>`__ of the other cardtype.

308.2. Tribal <#tribal>`__`subtypes are always a single wordand are listed after a long dash:”Tribal <#tribal>`__`Enchantment – Merfolk.” Theset of tribal <#tribal>`__`subtypes is the same as the setof creature <#creature>`__`subtypes; these`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called creaturetypes. Tribals <#tribal>`__may have multiple `subtypes. Seerule 205.3m for the complete listof creature types.

309. Planes

309.1. Plane is a cardtype seen only on`nontraditional Magiccards <#nontraditional_magic_card>`__. Only the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__ uses plane <#plane>`__`cards. See rule 901,”Planechase.”

309.2. Plane <#plane>`__`cards remain in the`command <#command>`__ zone <#zone>`__throughout the game, both while they’re part ofa `planar deck and whilethey’re face up. They’re not`permanents <#permanent>`__. They can’t be`cast <#cast>`__. If a plane <#plane>`__`card would leave the`command <#command>`__ zone, itremains in the command <#command>`__`zone.

309.3. Plane <#plane>`__`subtypes are listed after a long`dash <#dash>`__, and may be multiple words:”Plane – Serra’s Realm.” All wordsafter the dash are, collectively, asingle subtype. Planar`subtypes <#subtype>`__ are called planar`types <#type>`__. A plane can haveonly one subtype. See rule`205.3n <#R2053n>`__ for the complete list ofplanar types.

309.4. A plane <#plane>`__`card may have any number of static,triggered, and/or activatedabilities. As long as a`plane <#plane>`__ card is faceup in the command <#command>`__`zone, its staticabilities affect the game,its triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__may `trigger, and its activatedabilities may beactivated.

309.5. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of aface-up plane card isthe player designated as theplanar controller.Normally, the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ is whoeverthe active player is.However, if the current planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ would leavethe game, instead the next`player <#player>`__ in turn order that wouldn’tleave the game becomes the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__, then theold planar controller <#control_controller>`__leaves the game. The new planar`controller retainsthat designation until they leave the game or adifferent player <#player>`__`becomes the activeplayer, whichever comesfirst.

309.6. A face-up plane <#plane>`__`card that’s turned facedown becomes anew object.

309.7. Each plane <#plane>`__`card has a triggeredability that`triggers <#trigger>`__ „Whenever`you <#you_your>`__ roll {CHAOS}.” These arecalled „chaos abilities.”Each one is indicated by a {CHAOS} to its left,though the symbol itself has no special rulesmeaning.

310. Phenomena

310.1. Phenomenon isa card type seen only on`nontraditional Magiccards <#nontraditional_magic_card>`__. Only the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__ uses`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards.See rule 901,”Planechase.”

310.2. Phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`cards remain in the`command <#command>`__ zone <#zone>`__throughout the game, both while they’re part ofa `planar deck and whilethey’re face up. They’re not`permanents <#permanent>`__. They can’t be`cast <#cast>`__. If a`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card <#card>`__would leave the `command <#command>`__`zone, it remains in the`command <#command>`__ zone.

310.3. Phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`cards have no`subtypes <#subtype>`__.

310.4. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of aface-up phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`card is the player <#player>`__designated as the planar`controller. Normally,the planar controller <#control_controller>`__is whoever the `activeplayer is. However, if thecurrent planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ would leavethe game, instead the next`player <#player>`__ in turn order that wouldn’tleave the game becomes the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__, then theold planar controller <#control_controller>`__leaves the game. The new planar`controller retainsthat designation until they leave the game or adifferent player <#player>`__`becomes the activeplayer, whichever comesfirst.

310.5. Each`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card <#card>`__has a `triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__that `triggers when`you <#you_your>`__ encounter <#encounter>`__it. „When `you <#you_your>`__`encounter [this`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__]” means „When`you <#you_your>`__ move this`card <#card>`__ off a planardeck and turn it faceup.”

310.6. A face-up`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card <#card>`__that’s turned `face down <#face_down>`__`becomes a new`object <#object>`__.

310.7. If a`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card is`face up <#face_up>`__ in the`command <#command>`__ zone, and itisn’t the source of a triggeredability that hastriggered but not yet left the`stack <#stack>`__, the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__`planeswalks <#planeswalk>`__ the next time a`player <#player>`__ would receive`priority <#priority>`__. (This is a`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__;see rule 704. See also rule`701.24 <#R70124>`__,”Planeswalk.”)

311. Vanguards

311.1. Vanguard is a`card type <#card_type>`__ seen only on`nontraditional Magiccards <#nontraditional_magic_card>`__. Only the`Vanguard <#vanguard>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__ uses`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ cards. Seerule 902,”Vanguard.”

311.2. Vanguard <#vanguard>`__`cards remain in the`command <#command>`__ zone <#zone>`__throughout the game. They’re not`permanents. They can’t be`cast <#cast>`__. If a vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card would leave the`command <#command>`__ zone, itremains in the command <#command>`__`zone.

311.3. Vanguard <#vanguard>`__`cards have no`subtypes <#subtype>`__.

311.4. A vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card may have any number of static,triggered, and/or activatedabilities. As long as a`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card is inthe command zone, its`static abilities <#static_ability>`__ affectthe game, its triggeredabilities may`trigger <#trigger>`__, and its activatedabilities may beactivated.

311.5. The owner of a`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card is the`player <#player>`__ who started the game withit in the command <#command>`__`zone. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of aface-up vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card is its owner.

311.6. Each vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card has a handmodifier printed in itslower left corner. This is a number preceded bya plus sign, a number preceded by a minus sign,or a zero. This modifier is applied to the`starting hand size <#starting_hand_size>`__ and`maximum hand size <#maximum_hand_size>`__ ofthe vanguard card’s`owner <#owner>`__ (normally seven). Theresulting number is both how many`cards <#card>`__ that player <#player>`__`draws at the beginning of the gameand their maximum handsize.

311.7. Each vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card has a lifemodifier printed in itslower right corner. This is a number preceded bya plus sign, a number preceded by a minus sign,or a zero. This modifier is applied as the`starting life total <#starting_life_total>`__of the vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card’s owner (normally20) to is determined. See rule`103.3 <#R1033>`__.

312. Schemes

312.1. Scheme is a cardtype seen only on`nontraditional Magiccards <#nontraditional_magic_card>`__. Only the`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__ uses scheme <#scheme>`__`cards. See rule 904,”Archenemy.”

312.2. Scheme <#scheme>`__`cards remain in the`command <#command>`__ zone <#zone>`__throughout the game, both while they’re part ofa `scheme deck andwhile they’re face up. They’renot permanents. They can’t be`cast <#cast>`__. If a scheme <#scheme>`__`card would leave the`command <#command>`__ zone, itremains in the command <#command>`__`zone.

312.3. Scheme <#scheme>`__`cards have no`subtypes <#subtype>`__.

312.4. A scheme <#scheme>`__`card may have any number of static,triggered, and/or activatedabilities. As long as a`scheme <#scheme>`__ card is faceup in the command <#command>`__`zone, its staticabilities affect the game,its triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__may `trigger, and its activatedabilities may beactivated.

312.5. The owner of a`scheme <#scheme>`__ card is the`player <#player>`__ who started the game withit in the command <#command>`__`zone. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of aface-up scheme card isits owner.

312.6. If a non-ongoing <#ongoing>`__`scheme card is faceup in the command <#command>`__`zone, and no triggeredabilities of any`scheme <#scheme>`__ are on the`stack <#stack>`__ or waiting to be put on the`stack <#stack>`__, that scheme <#scheme>`__`card is turned facedown and put on the bottom ofits owner’s scheme <#scheme>`__`deck the next time a`player <#player>`__ would receive`priority <#priority>`__. (This is a`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__.See rule 704.)

312.7. If an ability ofa scheme card includesthe text „this scheme,” it meansthe scheme card in the`command <#command>`__ zone that’sthe source of that ability. Thisis an exception to rule 109.2.

313. Conspiracies

313.1. Conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`cards are used only in`limited <#limited>`__ play,particularly in the ConspiracyDraft <#conspiracy_draft>`__`variant (see rule`905 <#R905>`__). Conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`cards aren’t used in`constructed <#constructed>`__ play.

313.2. At the start of a game, before`decks <#deck>`__ are shuffled, each`player <#player>`__ may put any number of`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ cards <#card>`__from their `sideboard into the`command <#command>`__ zone.`Conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ cards <#card>`__with `hidden agenda are putinto the command zone <#zone>`__`face down. (See rule`702.105 <#R702105>`__, „HiddenAgenda.”)

313.3. Conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`cards remain in the`command <#command>`__ zone <#zone>`__throughout the game. They’re not`permanents. They can’t be`cast <#cast>`__ or included in a`deck <#deck>`__. If a`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ card <#card>`__would leave the `command <#command>`__`zone, it remains in the`command <#command>`__ zone.`Conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ `cards <#card>`__that aren’t in the game can’t be brought intothe game.

313.4. Conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`cards have no`subtypes <#subtype>`__.

313.5. Conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`cards may have any number of staticor triggered abilities.As long as a conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`card is face up inthe command zone, its`static abilities <#static_ability>`__ affectthe game, and its triggeredabilities may`trigger <#trigger>`__.

313.5a. Abilities of`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ `cards <#card>`__may affect the start-of-game procedure.

313.5b. Face-down`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ cards <#card>`__have no `characteristics.

313.6. The owner of a`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ card isthe player who put it into the`command <#command>`__ zone at thestart of the game. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of a`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ card isits owner.

313.7. At any time, you <#you_your>`__may look at a face-down`conspiracy card <#card>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control.`You <#you_your>`__ can’t look at face-down`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ cards <#card>`__controlled by other `players.

4. Zones

400. General

400.1. A zone is a placewhere objects can be`during <#during>`__ a game. There are normallyseven zones: library,`hand <#hand>`__,`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`graveyard <#graveyard>`__, stack,`exile <#exile>`__, and command.Some older cards also use the`ante <#ante>`__ zone. Each`player <#player>`__ has their own`library <#library>`__, hand, and`graveyard <#graveyard>`__. The other`zones <#zone>`__ are shared by all`players <#player>`__.

400.2. Public zones <#public_zone>`__are `zones in which all`players <#player>`__ can see the`cards <#card>`__» faces, except for those`cards <#card>`__ that some rule or`effect <#effect>`__ specifically allow to be`face down <#face_down>`__.`Graveyard <#graveyard>`__,`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`stack <#stack>`__, exile,`ante <#ante>`__, and command are`public zones <#public_zone>`__. Hiddenzones are zones inwhich not all players can beexpected to see the cards» faces.`Library <#library>`__ and hand are`hidden zones <#hidden_zone>`__, even if all the`cards <#card>`__ in one such `zone <#zone>`__happen to be revealed.

400.3. If an object wouldgo to any library,`graveyard <#graveyard>`__, or hand <#hand>`__other than its `owner’s, it goes toits owner’s corresponding`zone <#zone>`__.

400.4. Cards with certain`card types <#card_type>`__ can’t enter certain`zones <#zone>`__.

400.4a. If an instant or`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ card wouldenter the battlefield, itremains in its previous zone.

400.4b. If a`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__,`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__,`plane <#plane>`__, scheme, or`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card wouldleave the command <#command>`__`zone, it remains in the`command <#command>`__ zone.

400.5. The order of`objects <#object>`__ in a`library <#library>`__, in a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__, or on the`stack <#stack>`__ can’t be changed except when`effects <#effect>`__ or rules allow it. Thesame is true for objects arrangedin face-down piles in other`zones <#zone>`__. Other objects <#object>`__in other `zones can be arrangedhowever their owners wish, althoughwho controls those`objects <#object>`__, whether they’re`tapped <#tapped>`__ or flipped,and what other objects areattached to them must remain clear to all`players <#player>`__.

400.6. If an object would`move <#move>`__ from one zone toanother, determine what event ismoving the object. If the`object <#object>`__ is moving to a publiczone and its`owner <#owner>`__ will be able to look at it inthat zone, its owner <#owner>`__looks at it to see if it has any`abilities that would affect the`move <#move>`__. If the object ismoving to the battlefield,each other player who will be ableto look at it in that zone does so.Then any appropriate replacementeffects, whether theycome from that object or fromelsewhere, are applied to that`event <#event>`__. If any effects <#effect>`__or rules try to do two or more contradictory ormutually exclusive things to a particular`object, that`object <#object>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__–or its`owner <#owner>`__ if it has no`controller <#control_controller>`__–chooseswhich effect to apply, and whatthat effect does. (Note thatmultiple instances of the same thing may bemutually exclusive; for example, twosimultaneous „destroy”effects.) Then the`event <#event>`__ moves the`object <#object>`__. Example: ExquisiteArchangel hasanabilitywhich reads”Ifyouwouldlose thegame,insteadexileExquisiteArchangel andyourlifetotalbecomesequaltoyourstarting lifetotal.”Aspelldeals5damagetoaplayerwith5lifeand5damageto an ExquisiteArchangel underthatplayer«scontrol.Asstate-basedactionsareperformed,thatplayer«slifetotalbecomesequalto theirstarting lifetotal, andthatplayerchooses whetherExquisite Archangelmovestoitsowner«sgraveyardortoexile.

400.7. An object that`moves <#move>`__ from one zone toanother becomes a new`object <#object>`__ with no memory of, orrelation to, its previous existence. There arenine exceptions to this rule:

400.7a. Effects from`spells <#spell>`__, activatedabilities, and`triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__that change the`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ or`controller <#control_controller>`__ of a`permanent spell <#permanent_spell>`__ on the`stack <#stack>`__ continue to apply to the`permanent <#permanent>`__ that`spell <#spell>`__ becomes.

400.7b. Preventioneffects that apply to`damage <#damage>`__ from a permanentspell on the`stack <#stack>`__ continue to apply to`damage <#damage>`__ from the`permanent <#permanent>`__ that`spell <#spell>`__ becomes.

400.7c. An ability of a`permanent <#permanent>`__ can referenceinformation about the spell thatbecame that permanent as itresolved, including what costs werepaid to cast that spell <#spell>`__or what `mana was spent to`pay <#pay>`__ those costs.

400.7d. Abilities that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when an`object <#object>`__ moves from one`zone <#zone>`__ to another (for example, „WhenRancor is put into a graveyard <#graveyard>`__from the `battlefield”) canfind the new object that it becamein the zone it moved to when the`ability <#ability>`__ triggered, if that`zone <#zone>`__ is a publiczone.

400.7e. Abilities of`Auras <#aura>`__ that trigger <#trigger>`__when the enchanted `permanent <#permanent>`__`leaves thebattlefield canfind the new object that`Aura <#aura>`__ became in its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard <#graveyard>`__if it was put into that`graveyard at the same time theenchanted permanent left the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. It can also findthe new object that`Aura <#aura>`__ became in its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard <#graveyard>`__as a result of being put there as a `state-basedaction for not beingattached to a permanent. (Seerule 704.5m.)

400.7f. If an effect <#effect>`__grants a nonland `card an`ability <#ability>`__ that allows it to be`cast <#cast>`__, that ability <#ability>`__will continue to apply to the new`object that card <#card>`__became after it moved to the `stack <#stack>`__as a result of being `cast this way.

400.7g. If an effect <#effect>`__allows a nonland `card to be`cast <#cast>`__, other parts of that`effect <#effect>`__ can find the new`object <#object>`__ that card <#card>`__`becomes after it`moves <#move>`__ to the stack as aresult of being cast this way.

400.7h. If an effect <#effect>`__causes an `object to`move <#move>`__ to a publiczone, other parts of that`effect <#effect>`__ can find that`object <#object>`__. If the cost ofa spell or ability <#ability>`__causes an `object to`move <#move>`__ to a publiczone, that spell <#spell>`__or `ability’s`effects <#effect>`__ can find that`object <#object>`__.

400.7i. After resolving a`madness <#madness>`__ triggeredability (see rule`702.34 <#R70234>`__), if the exiled`card <#card>`__ wasn’t cast and wasmoved to a public zone,`effects <#effect>`__ referencing the discarded`card <#card>`__ can find that`object <#object>`__.

400.8. If an object inthe exile zone isexiled, it doesn’t change zones, butit becomes a new`object <#object>`__ that has just been exiled.

400.9. If a face-up`object <#object>`__ in the`command <#command>`__ zone isturned face down, it`becomes <#becomes>`__ a new`object <#object>`__.

400.10. If an object inthe command zone isput into the command <#command>`__`zone, it doesn’t change`zones <#zone>`__, but it becomes <#becomes>`__a new `object that has just enteredthe command zone.

400.11. An object is`outside the game <#outside_the_game>`__ if itisn’t in any of the game’s zones.`Outside the game <#outside_the_game>`__ is nota zone.

400.11a. Cards in a`player <#player>`__’s`sideboard <#sideboard>`__ are outside thegame. See rule`100.4 <#R1004>`__.

400.11b. Some effects <#effect>`__bring `cards into a game from outsideof it. Those cards remain in thegame until it ends.

400.11c. Cards outside thegame can’t be affected by`spells <#spell>`__ or abilities,except for characteristic-definingabilities <#characteristic-defining_ability>`__printed on them (see rule `604.3)and spells and`abilities <#ability>`__ that allow those`cards <#card>`__ to be brought into the game.

400.12. Some effects <#effect>`__instruct a `player to do somethingto a zone (such as”Shuffle your <#you_your>`__`hand into your <#you_your>`__`library”). That action isperformed on all cards in that`zone <#zone>`__. The zone itself isnot affected.

401. Library

401.1. When a game begins, each`player <#player>`__’s deck <#deck>`__`becomes their`library <#library>`__.

401.2. Each library mustbe kept in a single face-down pile.`Players <#player>`__ can’t look at or changethe order of cards in a`library <#library>`__.

401.3. Any player maycount the number of cards remainingin any player’s`library <#library>`__ at any time.

401.4. If an effect putstwo or more cards in a specificposition in a library at the sametime, the owner of those`cards <#card>`__ may arrange them in any order.That library’s owner <#owner>`__doesn’t `reveal the order in whichthe cards go into the`library <#library>`__.

401.5. Some effects tella player to play withthe top card of their`library <#library>`__ revealed, or say that a`player <#player>`__ may look at the top`card <#card>`__ of their`library <#library>`__. If the top`card <#card>`__ of the player’s`library <#library>`__ changes while a`spell <#spell>`__ is being cast,the new top card won’t be revealedand can’t be looked at until the`spell <#spell>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__`cast (see rule`601.2i <#R6012i>`__). The same is true withrelation to an ability beingactivated.

401.6. If an effect <#effect>`__causes a `player to`play <#play>`__ with the top card <#card>`__of their `library revealed, andthat particular card stops beingrevealed for any length of time before beingrevealed again, it becomes a new`object <#object>`__.

401.7. If an effect <#effect>`__causes a `player to put a`card <#card>`__ into a library”Nth from the top,” and that`library <#library>`__ has fewer than N`cards <#card>`__ in it, the`player <#player>`__ puts that card <#card>`__on the bottom of that `library.

402. Hand

402.1. The hand is where a`player <#player>`__ holds cards <#card>`__that have been drawn. `Cards can beput into a player’s`hand <#hand>`__ by other effects <#effect>`__as well. At the beginning of the game, each`player draws a numberof cards equal to that`player <#player>`__’s starting handsize, normally seven.(See rule 103, „Starting the Game.”)

402.2. Each player has a`maximum hand size <#maximum_hand_size>`__,which is normally seven cards. A`player <#player>`__ may have any number of`cards <#card>`__ in their hand, butas part of their cleanupstep, the`player <#player>`__ must discard <#discard>`__excess `cards down to the maximumhand size.

402.3. A player mayarrange their hand in any convenientfashion and look at it at any time. A`player <#player>`__ can’t look at the`cards <#card>`__ in another`player <#player>`__’s hand but maycount those cards at any time.

403. Battlefield

403.1. Most of the area between the`players <#player>`__ represents the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. The`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ starts out empty.`Permanents <#permanent>`__ a`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__ are normallykept in front of them on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, though there aresome cases (such as an Aura attachedto another player’s`permanent <#permanent>`__) when a`permanent <#permanent>`__ one`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__ is keptcloser to a different player.

403.2. A spell or`ability <#ability>`__ affects and checks onlythe battlefield <#battlefield>`__`unless it specifically mentions a`player <#player>`__ or another`zone <#zone>`__.

403.3. Permanents <#permanent>`__exist only on the`battlefield. Every`object <#object>`__ on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ is a`permanent <#permanent>`__. See rule`110 <#R110>`__, „Permanents.”

403.4. Whenever a`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield, it`becomes <#becomes>`__ a new`object <#object>`__ and has no relationship toany previous permanent <#permanent>`__represented by the same `card, exceptfor the cases listed in rule 400.7.(This is also true for any objects <#object>`__entering any `zone.)

403.5. Previously, the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ was called the”in-play zone.”Cards that were printed with textthat contains the phrases „inplay,” „from play,””into play,” or the like arereferring to the battlefield.`Cards <#card>`__ that were printed with thattext have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.

404. Graveyard

404.1. A player’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ is their`discard <#discard>`__ pile. Any`object <#object>`__ that’s countered,discarded, destroyed, or sacrificed is put ontop of its owner’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__, as is any`instant <#instant>`__ or sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell that’s finished resolving.Each player’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ starts out empty.

404.2. Each graveyard <#graveyard>`__is kept in a single face-up `pile. A`player <#player>`__ can examine the`cards <#card>`__ in any`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ at any time butnormally can’t change their order. Additionalrules applying to sanctioned`tournaments <#tournament>`__ may allow a`player <#player>`__ to change the order of`cards <#card>`__ in their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.

404.3. If an effect orrule puts two or more cards into thesame graveyard at the sametime, the owner of those`cards <#card>`__ may arrange them in any order.

405. Stack

405.1. When a spell is`cast <#cast>`__, the physical card <#card>`__is put on the `stack (see rule`601.2a <#R6012a>`__). When an`ability <#ability>`__ is activated or`triggers <#trigger>`__, it goes on top of the`stack <#stack>`__ without any card <#card>`__associated with it (see rules`602.2a and 603.3).

405.2. The stack keepstrack of the order that spells <#spell>`__and/or `abilities were added toit. Each time an object is put onthe stack, it’s put on top of all`objects <#object>`__ already there.

405.3. If an effect putstwo or more objects on the`stack <#stack>`__ at the same time, thosecontrolled by the activeplayer are put on lowest,followed by each other player’s`objects <#object>`__ in APNAPorder (see rule`101.4 <#R1014>`__). If a player <#player>`__`controls more than oneof these objects, that`player <#player>`__ chooses their relativeorder on the stack.

405.4. Each spell has allthe characteristics ofthe card associated with it. Eachactivated or triggeredability that’s on the`stack <#stack>`__ has the text of the`ability <#ability>`__ that created it and noother characteristics.The controller of a`spell <#spell>`__ is the person who`cast <#cast>`__ it.
