The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ isthe player who activated it. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ isthe player who controlled the`ability <#ability>`__’s source when ittriggered, unless it’s a delayedtriggeredability. Todetermine the`controller <#control_controller>`__ of a`delayed triggeredability <#delayed_triggered_ability>`__, seerules 603.7d-f.

405.5. When all players <#player>`__`pass in succession,the top (last-added) spell or`ability <#ability>`__ on the stack <#stack>`__`resolves. If the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty when all`players <#player>`__ pass, thecurrent step or `phase <#phase>`__ends and the next begins.

405.6. Some things that happen`during <#during>`__ the game don’t use the`stack <#stack>`__.

405.6a. Effects don’t goon the stack; they’re the result of`spells <#spell>`__ and abilities <#ability>`__resolving. `Effects may`create <#create>`__ delayed triggeredabilities,however, and these may go on the`stack <#stack>`__ when they`trigger <#trigger>`__ (see rule`603.7 <#R6037>`__).

405.6b. Staticabilities continuouslygenerate effects and don’t go onthe stack. (See rule`604 <#R604>`__, „Handling StaticAbilities.”) This includes`characteristic-definingabilities <#characteristic-defining_ability>`__such as „[This object] is red”(see rule 604.3).

405.6c. Manaabilities <#mana_ability>`__`resolve immediately. If a manaability both produces`mana <#mana>`__ and has another`effect <#effect>`__, the mana isproduced and the other effect <#effect>`__happens immediately. If a `player <#player>`__had `priority before a manaability was activated, that`player <#player>`__ gets`priority <#priority>`__ after it`resolves <#resolve>`__. (See rule`605 <#R605>`__, „ManaAbilities.”)

405.6d. Specialactions don’t use the`stack <#stack>`__; they happen immediately. Seerule 116, „SpecialActions.”

405.6e. Turn-basedactions don’t use the`stack <#stack>`__; they happen automaticallywhen certain steps or`phases <#phase>`__ begin. They’re dealt withbefore a player would receive`priority <#priority>`__ (see rule`117.3a <#R1173a>`__). Turn-basedactions also happenautomatically when each step and`phase <#phase>`__ ends; no player <#player>`__receives `priority afterward. Seerule 703.

405.6f. State-basedactions don’t use the`stack <#stack>`__; they happen automaticallywhen certain conditions are met. See rule`704. <#R704>`__ They are dealt with before a`player <#player>`__ would receive`priority <#priority>`__. See rule`117.5 <#R1175>`__.

405.6g. A player may`concede <#concede>`__ the game at any time.That player leaves the gameimmediately. See rule 104.3a.

405.6h. If a player <#player>`__leaves a `multiplayergame,`objects <#object>`__ may leave the game, ceaseto exist, change`control <#control_controller>`__, or be exiledas a result. These actions happen immediately.See rule 800.4a.

406. Exile

406.1. The exile <#exile>`__`zone is essentially a holding areafor objects. Some`spells <#spell>`__ and abilities <#ability>`__`exile an object <#object>`__without any way to return that`object to another`zone <#zone>`__. Other spells and`abilities <#ability>`__ exile an`object <#object>`__ only temporarily.

406.2. To exile an`object <#object>`__ is to put it into the`exile <#exile>`__ zone fromwhatever zone it’s currently in. Anexiled card is a card <#card>`__that’s been put into the `exile <#exile>`__`zone.

406.3. Exiled cards are, bydefault, kept face up and may beexamined by any player at anytime. Cards „exiled facedown” can’t be examined by any`player <#player>`__ except when instructionsallow it. However, once a player <#player>`__is allowed to look at a `card exiled`face down <#face_down>`__, that`player <#player>`__ may continue to look atthat card as long as it remainsexiled, even if the instruction allowing the`player <#player>`__ to do so no longer applies.

406.3a. A card exiled facedown has no`characteristics <#characteristics>`__, but the`spell <#spell>`__ or ability <#ability>`__that exiled it may allow it to be played from`exile. Unless that`card <#card>`__ is being cast facedown (see rule`707.4 <#R7074>`__), the card isturned face up just before the`player <#player>`__ announces that they areplaying the card (see rule`601.2 <#R6012>`__).

406.3b. Some spells and`abilities <#ability>`__ allow a`player <#player>`__ to cast <#cast>`__`spells with certain qualities fromamong face-down cards in`exile <#exile>`__. A player may`cast <#cast>`__ such a spell onlyif they are allowed to look at the face-down`card <#card>`__ in exile and ifthe resulting spell has thespecified qualities.

406.4. Face-down cards in`exile <#exile>`__ should be kept in separate`piles <#pile>`__ based on when they were exiledand how they were exiled. If a`player <#player>`__ is instructed to choose anexiled card, the`player <#player>`__ may choose a specificface-down card only if the`player <#player>`__ is allowed to look at that`card <#card>`__. Otherwise, they may choose a`pile <#pile>`__ of face-down exiled`cards <#card>`__, and then a card <#card>`__is chosen at random from within that`pile. If choosing such a`card <#card>`__ is part of casting a`spell <#spell>`__ or activating an`ability <#ability>`__, the chosen`card <#card>`__ isn’t revealed until after that`cost <#cost>`__ is fully paid. (See rule`601.2i <#R6012i>`__.)

406.5. Exiled cards thatmight return to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ or any other`zone <#zone>`__ should be kept in separate`piles <#pile>`__ to keep track of theirrespective ways of returning. Exiled`cards <#card>`__ that may have an impact on thegame due to their own abilities <#ability>`__(such as `cards with`haunt <#haunt>`__) or the`abilities <#ability>`__ of the`cards <#card>`__ that exiled them shouldlikewise be kept in separate piles.

406.6. An object may haveone ability printed on it thatcauses one or more cards to beexiled, and another ability thatrefers either to „the exiled cards”or to cards „exiled with [this`object <#object>`__].” These`abilities <#ability>`__ are linked: the secondrefers only to cards that have beenexiled due to the first. See rule`607 <#R607>`__, „LinkedAbilities.”

406.7. If an object inthe exile zone <#zone>`__`becomes exiled, it doesn’t change`zones <#zone>`__, but it becomes <#becomes>`__a new `object that has just beenexiled.

406.8. Previously, the`exile <#exile>`__ zone was calledthe „removed-from-the-gamezone.”Cards that were printed with textthat „removes [an object] from thegame” exiles that`object <#object>`__. The same is true for`cards <#card>`__ printed with text that „sets[an object] aside.”Cards that were printed with thattext have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.

407. Ante

407.1. Earlier versions of the Magicrules included an ante rule as a wayof playing „for keeps.” Playing Magic games for`ante <#ante>`__ is now considered an optionalvariation on the game, and it’s allowed onlywhere it’s not forbidden by law or by otherrules. Playing for ante is strictlyforbidden under the Magic: The Gathering`Tournament Rules <#tournament_rules>`__(WPN.Wizards.com/en/resources/rules-documents).

407.2. When playing for`ante <#ante>`__, each player putsone random card from their`deck <#deck>`__ into the ante <#ante>`__`zone after determining which`player <#player>`__ goes first but before`players <#player>`__ draw any`cards <#card>`__. Cards in the`ante <#ante>`__ zone may beexamined by any player at anytime. At the end of the game, the winner`becomes <#becomes>`__ the owner ofall the cards in the`ante <#ante>`__ zone.

407.3. A few cards have thetext „Remove [this card] from`your <#you_your>`__ deck beforeplaying if you’re not playingfor ante.” These are the only`cards <#card>`__ that can add or remove`cards <#card>`__ from the ante <#ante>`__`zone or change a card’s`owner <#owner>`__. When not playing for`ante <#ante>`__, players can’tinclude these cards in their`decks <#deck>`__ or`sideboards <#sideboard>`__, and these`cards <#card>`__ can’t be brought into the gamefrom outside the game.

407.4. To ante an`object <#object>`__ is to put that`object <#object>`__ into the ante <#ante>`__`zone from whichever zone <#zone>`__it’s currently in. The `owner of an`object <#object>`__ is the only person who can`ante <#ante>`__ that object.

408. Command

408.1. The command <#command>`__`zone is a game area reserved forcertain specialized objects thathave an overarching effect on thegame, yet are not `permanents <#permanent>`__and cannot be destroyed.

408.2. Emblems may becreated in the command <#command>`__`zone. See rule 114,”Emblems.”

408.3. In the`Planechase <#planechase>`__,`Vanguard <#vanguard>`__,`Commander <#commander>`__,`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__, and ConspiracyDraft casual`variants <#variant>`__, nontraditional Magiccards and/orspecially designated cards start thegame in the command <#command>`__`zone. Each variant <#variant>`__has its own rules regarding such`cards. See section 9,”Casual Variants.”

5. Turn Structure

500. General

500.1. A turn consists of five`phases <#phase>`__, in this order: beginning,precombat main, combat, postcombat main, andending. Each of these phases takesplace every turn, even if nothing happens`during <#during>`__ the phase. Thebeginning, combat, and endingphases are further brokendown into steps, which proceed inorder.

500.2. A phase or`step <#step>`__ in which players <#player>`__receive `priority ends when the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty and all`players <#player>`__ pass insuccession. Simplyhaving the stack <#stack>`__`become empty doesn’t cause such a`phase <#phase>`__ or step to end;all players have to pass insuccession with the`stack <#stack>`__ empty. Because of this, each`player <#player>`__ gets a chance to add newthings to the stack before that`phase <#phase>`__ or step ends.

500.3. A step in which no`players <#player>`__ receive`priority <#priority>`__ ends when all specifiedactions that take place during <#during>`__that `step are completed. The onlysuch steps are the untapstep (see rule 502)and certain cleanup steps <#cleanup_step>`__(see rule `514).

500.4. When a step or`phase <#phase>`__ ends, any unused`mana <#mana>`__ left in a`player <#player>`__’s manapool empties. This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__.

500.5. When a phase or`step <#step>`__ ends, any effects <#effect>`__scheduled to last „until end of” that`phase or step expire.When a phase or step <#step>`__begins, any `effects scheduled tolast „until” that phase or`step <#step>`__ expire. Effects <#effect>`__that last „until end of combat” expire at theend of the `combat phase, notat the beginning of the end of combatstep.`Effects <#effect>`__ that last „until end ofturn” are subject to special rules; see rule`514.2 <#R5142>`__.

500.6. When a phase or`step <#step>`__ begins, any`abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ „at the beginning of”that phase or step <#step>`__`trigger. They are put on the`stack <#stack>`__ the next time a`player <#player>`__ would receive`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

500.7. Some effects cangive a player extraturns. They do this by addingthe turns directly after the specified turn. Ifa player is given multiple extraturns, the extraturns are added one at a time.If multiple players are given`extra turns <#extra_turn>`__, the extraturns are added one at a time,in APNAP order (see rule`101.4 <#R1014>`__). The most recently createdturn will be taken first.

500.8. Some effects canadd phases to a turn. They do thisby adding the phases directly afterthe specified phase. If multipleextra phases are created after thesame phase, the most recentlycreated phase will occur first.

500.9. Some effects canadd steps to a phase.They do this by adding the steps <#step>`__directly after a specified `step ordirectly before a specified step. Ifmultiple extra steps are createdafter the same step, the mostrecently created step will occurfirst.

500.10. Some effects cancause a step, phase, orturn to be skipped. To skip a`step <#step>`__, phase, or turn isto proceed past it as though itdidn’t exist. See rule 614.10.

500.11. No game events canoccur between turns, phases, or`steps <#step>`__.

501. BeginningPhase

501.1. The beginningphase consists of three`steps <#step>`__, in this order:untap, upkeep, and`draw <#draw>`__.

502. Untap Step

502.1. First, all phased-in`permanents <#permanent>`__ with`phasing <#phasing>`__ that the activeplayer <#active_player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__`phase out, and all phased-out`permanents <#permanent>`__ that the activeplayer controlled when they`phased out <#phased_in_phased_out>`__`phase <#phase>`__ in. This all happenssimultaneously. This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__. See rule`702.25 <#R70225>`__, „Phasing.”

502.2. Second, the activeplayer determines which`permanents <#permanent>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ will`untap <#untap>`__. Then they untap <#untap>`__them all simultaneously. This `turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__. Normally, all of a`player <#player>`__’s`permanents <#permanent>`__ untap,but effects can keep one or moreof a player’s`permanents <#permanent>`__ from untapping.

502.3. No player receives`priority <#priority>`__ during <#during>`__the `untap step, so no`spells <#spell>`__ can be cast or`resolve <#resolve>`__ and no`abilities <#ability>`__ can be activated or`resolve <#resolve>`__. Any`ability <#ability>`__ that`triggers <#trigger>`__ during <#during>`__this `step will be held until thenext time a player would receive`priority <#priority>`__, which is usually`during <#during>`__ the upkeepstep. (See rule`503 <#R503>`__, „UpkeepStep.”)

503. Upkeep Step

503.1. The upkeepstep has no turn-basedactions. Once itbegins, the active player <#active_player>`__gets `priority. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

503.1a. Any abilities <#ability>`__that triggered `during the untapstep and any`abilities <#ability>`__ that triggered at thebeginning of the upkeep are put onto the`stack <#stack>`__ before the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__; the order in whichthey triggered doesn’t matter. (See rule`603 <#R603>`__, „Handling TriggeredAbilities.”)

503.2. If a spell statesthat it may be cast only „after [a`player <#player>`__’s] upkeepstep,” and the turn hasmultiple upkeep steps, that`spell <#spell>`__ may be cast anytime after the first upkeepstep ends.

504. Draw Step

504.1. First, the activeplayer draws a`card <#card>`__. This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__.

504.2. Second, the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

505. Main Phase

505.1. There are two mainphases in a turn. In each turn,the first main phase (alsoknown as the precombat mainphase) and the second`main phase <#main_phase>`__ (also known as the`postcombat mainphase <#postcombat_main_phase>`__) are separatedby the combat phase (seerule 506, „CombatPhase”). The precombat and`postcombat mainphases <#postcombat_main_phase>`__ areindividually and collectively known as the mainphase.

505.1a. Only the first mainphase of the turn is a`precombat mainphase <#precombat_main_phase>`__. All other`main phases <#main_phase>`__ are postcombatmain phases. Thisincludes the second main phase <#main_phase>`__of a turn in which the `combatphase has been skipped. It isalso true of a turn in which an`effect <#effect>`__ has caused an additional`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ and anadditional main phase to becreated.

505.2. The main phase <#main_phase>`__has no `steps, so a mainphase ends when all`players <#player>`__ pass insuccession while the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty. (See rule`500.2 <#R5002>`__.)

505.3. First, but only if the`players <#player>`__ are playing an`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__ game (see rule`904 <#R904>`__), the activeplayer is the`archenemy <#archenemy>`__, and it’s the activeplayer’s precombat mainphase, the activeplayer sets the top`card <#card>`__ of their scheme <#scheme>`__`deck in motion (see rule`701.25 <#R70125>`__). This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__.

505.4. Second, if the activeplayer <#active_player>`__`controls one or more`Saga <#saga>`__ enchantments <#enchantment>`__and it’s the `activeplayer’s precombat mainphase, the activeplayer puts a lore`counter <#counter>`__ on each Saga <#saga>`__they `control. (Seerule 714, „Saga <#saga>`__`Cards.”) This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__.

505.5. Third, the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

505.5a. The mainphase is the only`phase <#phase>`__ in which a`player <#player>`__ can normally`cast <#cast>`__ artifact,`creature <#creature>`__,`enchantment <#enchantment>`__,`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__, and`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ spells. The`active player <#active_player>`__ may`cast <#cast>`__ these spells.

505.5b. During either`main phase <#main_phase>`__, the activeplayer may play <#play>`__one `land card from their`hand <#hand>`__ if the stack isempty, if the player has`priority <#priority>`__, and if they haven’tplayed a land this turn(unless an effect <#effect>`__states the `player may`play <#play>`__ additional lands).This action doesn’t use the stack.Neither the land nor the action ofplaying the land is a`spell <#spell>`__ or ability, soit can’t be countered, and players <#player>`__can’t `respond to it with`instants <#instant>`__ or activatedabilities. (See rule`305 <#R305>`__, „Lands.”)

506. Combat Phase

506.1. The combatphase has five`steps <#step>`__, which proceed in order:beginning of combat, declareattackers, declareblockers, combatdamage, and end of combat.The declare blockers and`combat damage steps <#combat_damage_step>`__are skipped if no creatures aredeclared as attackers or put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking (seerule 508.8). There are two combatdamage steps if anyattacking or blockingcreature has firststrike (see rule`702.7 <#R7027>`__) or doublestrike (see rule`702.4 <#R7024>`__).

506.2. During the combatphase, the activeplayer is the attacking`player <#player>`__; creatures <#creature>`__that `player <#player>`__`controls may`attack <#attack>`__. During the`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ of atwo-player game, the nonactive`player <#player>`__ is the defendingplayer; that`player <#player>`__ and`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ may beattacked.

506.2a. During the`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ of a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__, theremay be one or more defendingplayers, depending on the`variant <#variant>`__ being played and the`options <#option>`__ chosen for it.`Unless <#unless>`__ all the attacking`player <#player>`__’s opponents <#opponent>`__automatically `become defendingplayers <#defending_player>`__`during the combatphase, the attacking`player <#player>`__ chooses one of their`opponents <#opponent>`__ as a turn-basedaction <#turn-based_actions>`__`during the beginning of combatstep. (Note thatthe choice may be dictated by the`variant <#variant>`__ being played or the`options <#option>`__ chosen for it.) That`player <#player>`__ becomes the`defending player <#defending_player>`__. Seerule 802, „Attack Multiple PlayersOption,”rule 803, „Attack Leftand Attack RightOptions,” and rule`809 <#R809>`__, „EmperorVariant.”

506.2b. In multiplayergames using the sharedteam turnsoption, the`active team <#active_team>`__ is the attackingteam and the nonactive`team <#team>`__ is the defendingteam. See rule`805 <#R805>`__, „Shared Team TurnsOption.”

506.3. Only a creature <#creature>`__can `attack or block.Only a player or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ can beattacked.

506.3a. If an effect <#effect>`__would put a noncreature`permanent onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking orblocking, the permanent doesenter the battlefield butit’s never considered to be an attacking orblocking permanent.

506.3b. If an effect <#effect>`__would put a `creature onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking underthe control of any`player <#player>`__ except an attacking`player <#player>`__, that`creature <#creature>`__ does enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, but it’s neverconsidered to be an attackingcreature.

506.3c. If an effect <#effect>`__would put a `creature onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking eithera player not in the game or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ no longer onthe battlefield or no longera planeswalker, that`creature <#creature>`__ does enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, but it’s neverconsidered to be an attackingcreature.

506.3d. If an effect <#effect>`__would put a `creature onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ blocking but the`creature <#creature>`__ it would`block <#block>`__ isn’t attacking either thefirst creature’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__, that`creature <#creature>`__ does enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, but it’s neverconsidered to be a blockingcreature.

506.4. A permanent is`removed from combat <#removed_from_combat>`__if it leaves thebattlefield, if its`controller <#control_controller>`__ changes, ifit phases out, if an`effect <#effect>`__ specifically removes itfrom combat, if it’s a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that’s beingattacked and stops being a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__, or if it’s anattacking or blockingcreature that`regenerates <#regenerate>`__ (see rule`701.15 <#R70115>`__) or stops being a`creature <#creature>`__. A`creature <#creature>`__ that’s removed fromcombat stops being anattacking, blocking, blocked, and/or unblockedcreature. A`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that’s removedfrom combat stopsbeing attacked.

506.4a. Once a creature <#creature>`__has been declared as an attacking or `blockingcreature,`spells <#spell>`__ or abilities <#ability>`__that would have kept that`creature from attacking orblocking don’t remove the`creature <#creature>`__ from combat.

506.4b. Tapping or untapping a`creature <#creature>`__ that’s already beendeclared as an attacker or blocker doesn’tremove it from combat and doesn’t`prevent <#prevent>`__ its combatdamage.

506.4c. If a creature <#creature>`__is attacking a `planeswalker,removing that planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__from combat doesn’t remove that`creature from combat. Itcontinues to be an attackingcreature, although itis attacking neither a player nora planeswalker. It may beblocked. If it is unblocked, it will`deal <#deal>`__ no combatdamage.

506.4d. A permanent <#permanent>`__that’s both a `blockingcreature and a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that’s beingattacked is removed fromcombat if it stopsbeing both a creature and a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__. If it stopsbeing one of those card types <#card_type>`__but continues to be the other, it continues tobe either a `blockingcreature or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that’s beingattacked, whichever is appropriate.

506.5. A creature <#creature>`__`attacks alone if it’s the only`creature <#creature>`__ declared as an attacker`during <#during>`__ the declare attackersstep. A`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking alone ifit’s attacking but no other`creatures <#creature>`__ are. A`creature <#creature>`__ blocks <#block>`__alone if it’s the only `creature <#creature>`__declared as a blocker `during the`declare blockersstep <#declare_blockers_step>`__. A`creature <#creature>`__ is blocking alone ifit’s blocking but no other`creatures <#creature>`__ are.

506.6. Some spells statethat they may be cast „only[before/after] [a particular point in the`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__],” in whichthat point may be „attackers are declared,””blockers are declared,” „the combat damagestep,” „the end ofcombat step,” „the`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__,” or „combat.”

506.6a. A spell thatstates it may be cast „only before(or after) attackers are declared” is referringto the turn-basedaction of declaringattackers. It may be cast onlybefore (or after) the declare attackersstep begins,regardless of whether any attackers are actuallydeclared. (See rule 508.)

506.6b. A spell thatstates it may be cast „only before(or after) blockers are declared” is referringto the turn-basedaction of declaringblockers. It may be cast only before(or after) the declare blockersstep begins,regardless of whether any blockers are actuallydeclared. (See rule 509.)

506.6c. Some spells statethat they may be cast only”during combat” or”during a certain`player <#player>`__’s combatphase” in addition to thecriteria described in rule 506.6.If a turn has multiple combatphases, such`spells <#spell>`__ may be cast atan appropriate time during any ofthem.

506.6d. Some spells statethat they may be cast „only before(or after) [a particular point in the combatphase],” but don’t meet theadditional criteria described in rule`506.6c <#R5066c>`__. If a turn has multiple`combat phases <#combat_phase>`__, such`spells <#spell>`__ may be cast thatturn only before (or after) the stated point ofthe first combat phase.

506.6e. If a spell statesthat it may be cast „only before [aparticular point in the combatphase],” but the stated pointdoesn’t exist within the relevant combatphase because the declareblockers step andthe combat damage step <#combat_damage_step>`__are skipped (see rule `508.8), thenthe spell may be cast <#cast>`__only before the `declare attackersstep ends. If thestated point doesn’t exist because the relevant`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ has beenskipped, then the spell may be`cast <#cast>`__ only before the precombat mainphase ends.

506.6f. If a spell statesthat it may be cast „only`during <#during>`__ combat after blockers aredeclared,” but the declare blockersstep is skipped that`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ (see rule`508.8 <#R5088>`__), then the spell <#spell>`__may not be `cast during <#during>`__that `combat phase.

506.6g. Rules 506.6 and`506.6a <#R5066a>`__-f apply to`abilities <#ability>`__ that state that theymay be activated only at certain times withrespect to combat just as they apply to`spells <#spell>`__ that state that they may be`cast <#cast>`__ only at certain times withrespect to combat.

507. Beginning of CombatStep

507.1. First, if the game being playedis a multiplayer game inwhich the active player’s`opponents <#opponent>`__ don’t allautomatically become defendingplayers, the activeplayer chooses one of their`opponents <#opponent>`__. That`player <#player>`__ becomes the`defending player <#defending_player>`__. This`turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__doesn’t use the stack. (See rule`506.2 <#R5062>`__.)

507.2. Second, the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

508. Declare AttackersStep

508.1. First, the activeplayer declares attackers.This turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__doesn’t use the `stack. To declareattackers, the activeplayer follows the`steps <#step>`__ below, in order. If at anypoint during the declaration ofattackers, the activeplayer is unable to complywith any of the steps listed below,the declaration is illegal; the game returns tothe moment before the declaration (see rule`723 <#R723>`__, „Handling IllegalActions”).

508.1a. The activeplayer chooses which`creatures <#creature>`__ that they`control <#control_controller>`__, if any, will`attack <#attack>`__. The chosen`creatures <#creature>`__ must be`untapped <#untapped>`__, and each one musteither have haste or have beencontrolled by the activeplayer continuously sincethe turn began.

508.1b. If the defendingplayer <#defending_player>`__`controls any`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__, or the gameallows the active player to`attack <#attack>`__ multiple other`players <#player>`__, the activeplayer announces which`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ each of thechosen creatures is attacking.

508.1c. The activeplayer checks each`creature <#creature>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ to see whetherit’s affected by any`restrictions <#restriction>`__(effects that say a`creature <#creature>`__ can’t`attack <#attack>`__, or that it can’t`attack <#attack>`__ unless somecondition is met). If any`restrictions <#restriction>`__ are beingdisobeyed, the declaration of attackers isillegal. Example:Aplayercontrolstwocreatures,each witharestrictionthat states”[Thiscreature]can’tattack alone.”It’s legal to declare both as attackers.

508.1d. The activeplayer checks each`creature <#creature>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ to see whetherit’s affected by any`requirements <#requirement>`__(effects that say a`creature <#creature>`__ attacks <#attack>`__if able, or that it `attacks ifsome condition is met). If the number of`requirements <#requirement>`__ that are beingobeyed is fewer than the maximum possible numberof requirements that could beobeyed without disobeying any`restrictions <#restriction>`__, the declarationof attackers is illegal. If a`creature <#creature>`__ can’t`attack <#attack>`__ unless a`player <#player>`__ pays a cost,that player is not required to`pay <#pay>`__ that cost, even ifattacking with that creature <#creature>`__would increase the number of`requirements being obeyed. Ifa requirement that says a`creature <#creature>`__ attacks <#attack>`__if able `during a certain turnrefers to a turn with multiple combatphases, the`creature <#creature>`__ attacks <#attack>`__if able `during each declareattackers step inthat turn. Example:Aplayercontrolstwocreatures:one that „attacksif able”and one with noabilities.Aneffectstates „No more thanonecreaturecanattackeachturn.” The onlylegalattackis for justthecreaturethat”attacksif able”toattack. It’s illegaltoattackwith theothercreature,attackwithboth, orattackwith neither.

508.1e. If any of the chosen`creatures <#creature>`__ have`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ or a”bands with other” ability, the`active player <#active_player>`__ announceswhich creatures, if any, arebanded with which. (See rule`702.21 <#R70221>`__,”Banding.”)

508.1f. The activeplayer taps thechosen creatures. Tapping a`creature <#creature>`__ when it’s declared asan attacker isn’t a cost; attackingsimply causes creatures to`become <#becomes>`__ tapped.

508.1g. If there are any optional`costs <#cost>`__ to attack withthe chosen creatures (expressedas costs a player may`pay <#pay>`__ „as” a creature <#creature>`__`attacks), the activeplayer chooses which, ifany, they will pay.

508.1h. If any of the chosen`creatures <#creature>`__ require paying`costs <#cost>`__ to attack, or ifany optional costs to`attack <#attack>`__ were chosen, the activeplayer determines the totalcost to attack.`Costs <#cost>`__ may include paying`mana <#mana>`__, tapping`permanents <#permanent>`__, sacrificing`permanents <#permanent>`__, discarding`cards <#card>`__, and so on. Once the totalcost is determined, it`becomes <#becomes>`__ „locked in.” If`effects <#effect>`__ would change the totalcost after this time, ignorethis change.

508.1i. If any of the costs <#cost>`__require `mana, the activeplayer then has a chance to`activate <#activate>`__ manaabilities (see rule`605 <#R605>`__, „ManaAbilities”).

508.1j. Once the player <#player>`__has enough `mana in their manapool, they pay all`costs <#cost>`__ in any order. Partial paymentsare not allowed.

508.1k. Each chosen`creature <#creature>`__ still controlled by the`active player <#active_player>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ an attackingcreature. It remains an`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__until it’s removed fromcombat or the combatphase ends, whichever comesfirst. See rule 506.4.

508.1m. Any abilities <#ability>`__that `trigger on attackers beingdeclared trigger.

508.2. Second, the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

508.2a. Abilities that`trigger <#trigger>`__ on a`creature <#creature>`__ attacking`trigger <#trigger>`__ only at the point the`creature <#creature>`__ is declared as anattacker. They will not trigger <#trigger>`__if a `creature <#creature>`__`attacks and then that`creature <#creature>`__’s`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ change to`match <#match>`__ the ability’s`trigger condition <#trigger_condition>`__.*Example: A*permanenthastheability„Whenever agreencreatureattacks,destroythatcreatureatend of combat.” If abluecreatureattacksandis later turned green,theabilitywillnottrigger.

508.2b. Any abilities <#ability>`__that triggered on attackers being declared orthat triggered `during the processdescribed in rules 508.1 are putonto the stack before the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__; the order in whichthey triggered doesn’t matter. (See rule`603 <#R603>`__, „Handling TriggeredAbilities.”)

508.3. Triggeredabilities that`trigger <#trigger>`__ on attackers beingdeclared may have different triggerconditions.

508.3a. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a creature]`attacks <#attack>`__, …”triggers if that`creature <#creature>`__ is declared as anattacker. Similarly, „Whenever [a`creature <#creature>`__] attacks <#attack>`__[a `player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__], …”triggers if that`creature <#creature>`__ is declared as anattacker attacking that player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__. Such`abilities <#ability>`__ won’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ if a`creature <#creature>`__ is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking.

508.3b. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__] is attacked, .. .” triggers if one or more`creatures <#creature>`__ are declared asattackers attacking that player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__. It won’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ if a`creature <#creature>`__ is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking that`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__.

508.3c. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a player]`attacks <#attack>`__ with [a`creature <#creature>`__], …”triggers whenever a`creature <#creature>`__ that`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__ is declaredas an attacker.

508.3d. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a creature]`attacks and isn’tblocked <#attacks_and_isnt_blocked>`__, …”triggers during the`declare blockersstep <#declare_blockers_step>`__, not the`declare attackersstep <#declare_attackers_step>`__. See rule`509.5g <#R5095g>`__.

508.4. If a creature isput onto the battlefield <#battlefield>`__attacking, its`controller chooseswhich defending player <#defending_player>`__or which `planeswalker a`defending player <#defending_player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__ it’sattacking as it enters thebattlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__(`unless the effect <#effect>`__that put it onto the`battlefield specifies whatit’s attacking). Similarly, if an`effect <#effect>`__ states that a`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ chooseswhich defending player <#defending_player>`__or which `planeswalker a`defending player <#defending_player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__ it’sattacking it becomes attacking(unless the effect <#effect>`__has already specified). Such`creatures are „attacking” but,for the purposes of triggerevents and`effects <#effect>`__, they never „attacked.”

508.4a. If the effect <#effect>`__that puts a `creature onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attackingspecifies it’s attacking a certain`player <#player>`__, and that`player <#player>`__ is no longer in the gamewhen the effect <#effect>`__`resolves, the`creature <#creature>`__ is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ but is neverconsidered an attackingcreature. The same istrue if the effect specifies a`creature <#creature>`__ is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ and that`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ is no longer onthe battlefield or is nolonger a planeswalker whenthe effect <#effect>`__`resolves.

508.4b. If the effect <#effect>`__that states a `creature isattacking specifies it’s attacking a certain`player <#player>`__, and that`player <#player>`__ is no longer in the gamewhen the effect <#effect>`__`resolves, the`creature <#creature>`__ doesn’t`become <#becomes>`__ an attackingcreature. The same istrue if the effect specifies a`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ and that`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ is no longer onthe battlefield or is nolonger a planeswalker whenthe effect <#effect>`__`resolves.

508.4c. A creature <#creature>`__that’s put onto the`battlefield attacking or thatis stated to be attacking isn’t affected by`requirements <#requirement>`__ or`restrictions <#restriction>`__ that apply tothe declaration of attackers.

508.5. If an ability ofan attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__refers to a `defendingplayer, or a`spell <#spell>`__ or ability <#ability>`__refers to both an `attackingcreature and a`defending player <#defending_player>`__, then`unless <#unless>`__ otherwise specified, the`defending player <#defending_player>`__ it’sreferring to is the player that`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking, or the`controller <#control_controller>`__ of the`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking. If that`creature <#creature>`__ is no longer attacking,the defending player <#defending_player>`__it’s referring to is the `player <#player>`__that `creature was attackingbefore it was removed fromcombat or the`controller <#control_controller>`__ of the`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that`creature <#creature>`__ was attacking before itwas removed fromcombat.

508.5a. In a multiplayergame, any rule,`object <#object>`__, or effect <#effect>`__that refers to a „`defendingplayer” refers to onespecific defendingplayer, not to all of the`defending players <#defending_player>`__. If a`spell <#spell>`__ or ability <#ability>`__could apply to multiple `attackingcreatures, theappropriate defendingplayer is individuallydetermined for each of those attackingcreatures. If there aremultiple defendingplayers that could bechosen, the controller <#control_controller>`__of the `spell or`ability <#ability>`__ chooses one.

508.6. A player is”attacking [a player]” if thefirst player <#player>`__`controls a`creature <#creature>`__ that is attacking thesecond player. A`player <#player>`__ has „attacked [a`player <#player>`__]” if the first`player <#player>`__ declared one or more`creatures <#creature>`__ as attackers attackingthe second player.

508.7. One card (PortalMage) allows a player to reselectwhich player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ a`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking.

508.7a. The attackingcreature isn’t removedfrom combat and itisn’t considered to have attacked a second time.That creature is attacking thereselected player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__, but it’s stillconsidered to have attacked the`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ chosen as itwas declared as an attacker.

508.7b. While reselecting which`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ a`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking, that`creature <#creature>`__ isn’t affected by`requirements <#requirement>`__ or`restrictions <#restriction>`__ that apply tothe declaration of attackers.

508.7c. The reselected`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ must be an`opponent <#opponent>`__ of the attackingcreature’s`controller <#control_controller>`__, or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ controlled byan opponent of the attackingcreature’s`controller <#control_controller>`__.

508.7d. In a multiplayergame not using the`attack multiple playersoption <#attack_multiple_players_option>`__ (seerule 802), the reselected`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ must be thechosen defending player <#defending_player>`__or a `planeswalker controlledby that player.

508.7e. In a multiplayergame using the limitedrange ofinfluence <#limited_range_of_influence>`__`option (see rule 801),the reselected player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ must be withinthe range of influence <#range_of_influence>`__of the `attackingcreature’s`controller <#control_controller>`__.

508.8. If no creatures <#creature>`__are declared as attackers or put onto the`battlefield attacking,`skip <#skip>`__ the declareblockers and combatdamage steps.

509. Declare BlockersStep

509.1. First, the defendingplayer declares blockers.This turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__doesn’t use the `stack. To declareblockers, the defendingplayer follows the`steps <#step>`__ below, in order. If at anypoint during the declaration ofblockers, the defendingplayer is unable tocomply with any of the steps listedbelow, the declaration is illegal; the gamereturns to the moment before the declaration(see rule 723, „Handling IllegalActions”).

509.1a. The defendingplayer chooses which`creatures <#creature>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__, if any, will`block <#block>`__. The chosen`creatures <#creature>`__ must be`untapped <#untapped>`__. For each of the chosen`creatures <#creature>`__, the defendingplayer chooses one`creature <#creature>`__ for it to`block <#block>`__ that’s attacking that`player <#player>`__ or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__.

509.1b. The defendingplayer checks each`creature <#creature>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ to see whetherit’s affected by any`restrictions <#restriction>`__(effects that say a`creature <#creature>`__ can’t`block <#block>`__, or that it can’t`block <#block>`__ unless somecondition is met). If any`restrictions <#restriction>`__ are beingdisobeyed, the declaration of blockers isillegal. A restriction may becreated by an evasionability (a staticability an attackingcreature has thatrestricts what can block it). If an`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__gains or loses an evasionability after a legal`block <#block>`__ has been declared, it doesn’taffect that block. Different`evasion abilities <#evasion_ability>`__ arecumulative. Example: Anattackingcreaturewithflyingandshadowcan’tbe blocked byacreaturewithflyingbutwithoutshadow.

509.1c. The defendingplayer checks each`creature <#creature>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ to see whetherit’s affected by any`requirements <#requirement>`__(effects that say a`creature <#creature>`__ must`block <#block>`__, or that it must`block <#block>`__ if some condition is met). Ifthe number of requirements <#requirement>`__that are being obeyed is fewer than the maximumpossible number of`requirements that could beobeyed without disobeying any`restrictions <#restriction>`__, the declarationof blockers is illegal. If a`creature <#creature>`__ can’t`block <#block>`__ unless a`player <#player>`__ pays a cost,that player is not required to`pay <#pay>`__ that cost, even ifblocking with that creature <#creature>`__would increase the number of`requirements being obeyed. Ifa requirement that says a`creature <#creature>`__ blocks ifable during a certain turn refersto a turn with multiple combatphases, the`creature <#creature>`__ blocks ifable during each declare blockersstep in that turn.*Example:A*playercontrolsonecreaturethat”blocksif able” andanothercreaturewithnoabilities. Ifacreaturewithmenaceattacksthatplayer,theplayermustblockwithbothcreatures. Having onlythefirstcreatureblockviolatestherestrictioncreatedbymenace(theattackingcreaturecan’t beblocked except by two ormorecreatures). Havingonly thesecondcreatureblockviolatesboththemenacerestrictionandthe firstcreature«sblockingrequirement.Havingneithercreatureblockfulfillstherestrictionbut nottherequirement.

509.1d. If any of the chosen`creatures <#creature>`__ require paying`costs <#cost>`__ to block, the`defending player <#defending_player>`__determines the total cost to`block <#block>`__. Costs mayinclude paying mana, tapping`permanents <#permanent>`__, sacrificing`permanents <#permanent>`__, discarding`cards <#card>`__, and so on. Once the totalcost is determined, it`becomes <#becomes>`__ „locked in.” If`effects <#effect>`__ would change the totalcost after this time, ignorethis change.

509.1e. If any of the costs <#cost>`__require `mana, the defendingplayer then has a chanceto activate manaabilities (see rule`605 <#R605>`__, „ManaAbilities”).

509.1f. Once the player <#player>`__has enough `mana in their manapool, they pay all`costs <#cost>`__ in any order. Partial paymentsare not allowed.

509.1g. Each chosen`creature <#creature>`__ still controlled by the`defending player <#defending_player>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ a blockingcreature. Each one isblocking the attackingcreatures chosen forit. It remains a blockingcreature until it’s`removed from combat <#removed_from_combat>`__or the combat phase ends,whichever comes first. See rule`506.4 <#R5064>`__.

509.1h. An attackingcreature with one ormore creatures declared asblockers for it becomes a`blocked creature <#blocked_creature>`__; onewith no creatures declared asblockers for it becomes an`unblocked creature <#unblocked_creature>`__.This remains unchanged until the`creature <#creature>`__ is removed fromcombat, an`effect <#effect>`__ says that it`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked or unblocked, orthe combat phase ends,whichever comes first. A`creature <#creature>`__ remains blocked even ifall the creatures blocking itare removed fromcombat.

509.1i. Any abilities <#ability>`__that `trigger on blockers beingdeclared trigger. See rule`509.4 <#R5094>`__ for more information.

509.2. Second, for each attackingcreature that’s`become <#becomes>`__ blocked, the activeplayer announces that`creature <#creature>`__’s damage assignmentorder, whichconsists of the creatures <#creature>`__blocking it in an order of that`player’s choice.(During the combat damagestep, an attackingcreature can’t assigncombat damage to a`creature <#creature>`__ that’s blocking it`unless <#unless>`__ each`creature <#creature>`__ ahead of that blockingcreature in its order isassigned lethal damage.)This turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__doesn’t use the `stack. Example:Vastwood Gorger is blocked by Llanowar Elves,Runeclaw Bear, and Serra Angel. VastwoodGorger’scontrollerannouncesthe Vastwood Gorger’sdamage assignmentorderas SerraAngel, then Llanowar Elves, then Runeclaw Bear.

509.2a. During the`declare blockersstep <#declare_blockers_step>`__, if a blockingcreature is removedfrom combat or a`spell <#spell>`__ or ability <#ability>`__causes it to stop blocking an `attackingcreature, the blockingcreature is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from all relevant damage assignmentorders. Therelative order among the remaining blockingcreatures is unchanged.

509.3. Third, for each blockingcreature, the defendingplayer announces that`creature <#creature>`__’s damage assignmentorder, whichconsists of the creatures it’sblocking in an order of that`player <#player>`__’s choice.(During the combat damagestep, a blockingcreature can’t assigncombat damage to a`creature <#creature>`__ it’s blocking`unless <#unless>`__ each`creature <#creature>`__ ahead of that blockedcreature in its order isassigned lethal damage.)This turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__doesn’t use the `stack.

509.3a. During the`declare blockersstep <#declare_blockers_step>`__, if an`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__ is`removed from combat <#removed_from_combat>`__or a spell or`ability <#ability>`__ causes it to stop beingblocked by a blockingcreature, the attackingcreature is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from all relevant damage assignmentorders. Therelative order among the remaining attackingcreatures is unchanged.

509.4. Fourth, the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

509.4a. Any abilities <#ability>`__that triggered on blockers being declared orthat triggered `during the processdescribed in rules 509.1-3 are putonto the stack before the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__; the order in whichthey triggered doesn’t matter. (See rule`603 <#R603>`__, „Handling TriggeredAbilities.”)

509.5. Triggeredabilities that`trigger <#trigger>`__ on blockers beingdeclared may have different triggerconditions.

509.5a. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a creature]`blocks <#block>`__, …” generally`triggers <#trigger>`__ only once each combatfor that creature, even if it`blocks <#block>`__ multiple`creatures <#creature>`__. It`triggers <#trigger>`__ if the`creature <#creature>`__ is declared as ablocker. It will also trigger ifthat creature <#creature>`__`becomes a blocker as the resultof an effect, but only if itwasn’t a blockingcreature at that time.(See rule 509.1g.) It won’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ if the`creature <#creature>`__ is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ blocking.

509.5b. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a creature]`blocks <#block>`__ a creature,…” triggers once for each`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__ the`creature <#creature>`__ with the`ability <#ability>`__ blocks. It`triggers <#trigger>`__ if the`creature <#creature>`__ is declared as ablocker. It will also trigger ifan effect causes that`creature <#creature>`__ to block <#block>`__an `attacking creature,but only if it wasn’t already blocking that`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__ atthat time. It won’t trigger ifthe creature is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ blocking.

509.5c. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a creature]`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked, …” generally`triggers <#trigger>`__ only once each combatfor that creature, even if it’sblocked by multiple creatures.It will trigger if that`creature <#creature>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__blocked by at least one `creature <#creature>`__declared as a blocker. It will also`trigger if that`creature <#creature>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__blocked by an `effect or by a`creature <#creature>`__ that’s put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ as a blocker, butonly if the attackingcreature was an`unblocked creature <#unblocked_creature>`__ atthat time. (See rule 509.1h.)

509.5d. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a creature]`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked by a`creature <#creature>`__, …”triggers once for each`creature <#creature>`__ that`blocks <#block>`__ the named`creature <#creature>`__. It`triggers <#trigger>`__ if a`creature <#creature>`__ is declared as ablocker for the attackingcreature. It will also`trigger <#trigger>`__ if an`effect <#effect>`__ causes a`creature <#creature>`__ to block <#block>`__the `attackingcreature, but only ifit wasn’t already blocking that attackingcreature at that time.In addition, it will trigger if a`creature <#creature>`__ is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ blocking that`creature <#creature>`__. It won’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ if the`creature <#creature>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__blocked by an `effect rather than a`creature <#creature>`__.

509.5e. If an ability <#ability>`__`triggers when a`creature <#creature>`__ blocks or`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked by a particularnumber of creatures, the`ability <#ability>`__ triggers <#trigger>`__if the `creature <#creature>`__`blocks or is blocked by that many`creatures <#creature>`__ when blockers aredeclared. Effects that add orremove blockers can also cause such`abilities <#ability>`__ to`trigger <#trigger>`__. This applies to`abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ on a`creature <#creature>`__ blocking or beingblocked by at least a certain number of`creatures <#creature>`__ as well.

509.5f. If an ability <#ability>`__`triggers when a`creature <#creature>`__ with certain`characteristics <#characteristics>`__`blocks <#block>`__, it will`trigger <#trigger>`__ only if the`creature <#creature>`__ has those`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ at thepoint blockers are declared, or at the point an`effect <#effect>`__ causes it to`block <#block>`__. If an ability <#ability>`__`triggers when a`creature <#creature>`__ with certain`characteristics <#characteristics>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked, it will`trigger <#trigger>`__ only if the`creature <#creature>`__ has those`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ at thepoint it becomes a blockedcreature. If an`ability <#ability>`__ triggers <#trigger>`__when a `creature <#creature>`__`becomes blocked by a`creature <#creature>`__ with certain`characteristics <#characteristics>`__, it will`trigger <#trigger>`__ only if the latter`creature <#creature>`__ has those`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ at thepoint it becomes a blockingcreature. None of those`abilities <#ability>`__ will`trigger <#trigger>`__ if the relevant`creature <#creature>`__’s`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ change to`match <#match>`__ the ability’s`trigger condition <#trigger_condition>`__ lateron. Example: Acreaturehastheability„Wheneverthiscreaturebecomesblockedby awhitecreature,destroythatcreatureatend of combat.” Ifthecreaturebecomesblockedby a blackcreaturethat islater turned white,theabilitywillnottrigger.

509.5g. An ability thatreads „Whenever [a creature]`attacks and isn’tblocked <#attacks_and_isnt_blocked>`__, …”triggers if no`creatures <#creature>`__ are declared asblockers for that creature. Itwill trigger even if the`creature <#creature>`__ was never declared asan attacker (for example, if it entered the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking). Itwon’t trigger if the attackingcreature is blocked andthen all its blockers are removed fromcombat.

509.6. If a spell or`ability <#ability>`__ causes a`creature <#creature>`__ on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ to`block <#block>`__ an attackingcreature, the activeplayer announces the`blocking creature <#blocking_creature>`__’splacement in the attackingcreature’s damageassignment order.The relative order among the remaining blockingcreatures is unchanged.Then the defendingplayer announces the`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__’splacement in the blockingcreature’s damageassignment order.The relative order among the remaining`attacking creatures <#attacking_creature>`__ isunchanged. This is done as part of the blocking`effect <#effect>`__.

509.7. If a creature isput onto the battlefield <#battlefield>`__blocking, its`controller chooseswhich attackingcreature it’s blockingas it enters thebattlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__(`unless the effect <#effect>`__that put it onto the`battlefield specifies whatit’s blocking), then the activeplayer announces the new`creature <#creature>`__’s placement in the`blocked creature <#blocked_creature>`__’s`damage assignmentorder <#damage_assignment_order>`__. Therelative order among the remaining blockingcreatures is unchanged.A creature put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ this way is”blocking” but, for the purposes of triggerevents and`effects <#effect>`__, it never „blocked.”Example: Giant Spider is blocked by CanyonMinotaur. ThedefendingplayercastsFlashFoliage,whichcreatesaSaprolingcreaturetokenblockingthe Giant Spider. GiantSpider’scontrollerannouncesthe Giant Spider’sdamage assignmentorderas theSaprolingtoken, then CanyonMinotaur.

509.7a. If the effect <#effect>`__that puts a `creature onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ blockingspecifies it’s blocking a certain`creature <#creature>`__ and that`creature <#creature>`__ is no longer attacking,the creature is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ but is neverconsidered a blockingcreature. The same istrue if the controller <#control_controller>`__of the `creature that’s put ontothe battlefield blockingisn’t a defending player <#defending_player>`__for the specified `attackingcreature.

509.7b. A creature <#creature>`__that’s put onto the`battlefield blocking isn’taffected by requirements or`restrictions <#restriction>`__ that apply tothe declaration of blockers.

510. Combat DamageStep

510.1. First, the activeplayer announces how each`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__assigns its combat damage,then the defendingplayer announces how each`blocking creature <#blocking_creature>`__assigns its combat damage.This turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__doesn’t use the `stack. A`player <#player>`__ assigns a`creature <#creature>`__’s combatdamage according to thefollowing rules:

510.1a. Each attackingcreature and each`blocking creature <#blocking_creature>`__assigns combat damage equalto its power.`Creatures <#creature>`__ that would assign 0 orless damage this way don’t assigncombat damage at all.

510.1b. An unblockedcreature assigns its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ to the`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ it’s attacking.If it isn’t currently attacking anything (if,for example, it was attacking a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that has leftthe battlefield), it assignsno combat damage.

510.1c. A blockedcreature assigns its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ to the`creatures <#creature>`__ blocking it. If no`creatures <#creature>`__ are currently blockingit (if, for example, they were destroyed or`removed from combat <#removed_from_combat>`__),it assigns no combatdamage. If exactly one`creature <#creature>`__ is blocking it, itassigns all its combatdamage to that`creature <#creature>`__. If two or more`creatures <#creature>`__ are blocking it, itassigns its combat damage <#combat_damage>`__to those `creatures according tothe damage assignmentorder announcedfor it. This may allow the blockedcreature to divide its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__. However, itcan’t assign combatdamage to a`creature <#creature>`__ that’s blocking it`unless <#unless>`__, when combatdamage assignments arecomplete, each creature thatprecedes that blockingcreature in its order isassigned lethal damage.When checking for assigned lethaldamage, take into account`damage <#damage>`__ already marked on the`creature <#creature>`__ and`damage <#damage>`__ from other`creatures <#creature>`__ that’s being assigned`during <#during>`__ the same combat damagestep, but not any`abilities <#ability>`__ or`effects <#effect>`__ that might change theamount of damage that’s actuallydealt. An amount of damage that’sgreater than a creature’s`lethal damage <#lethal_damage>`__ may beassigned to it. Example: Thedamageassignmentorderof anattacking Vastwood Gorger (a5/6creature) is PrideGuardian (a 0/3creature)then Llanowar Elves (a1/1creature). VastwoodGorger can assign 3damagetothe Guardian and 2damagetothe Elves, 4damageto theGuardian and 1damageto theElves, or 5damageto theGuardian. Example: Thedamage assignmentorderof anattacking Vastwood Gorger (a5/6creature) is PrideGuardian (a 0/3creature)then Llanowar Elves (a1/1creature).Duringthedeclareblockers step,thedefendingplayercastsGiantGrowth targeting Pride Guardian, which gives it+3/+3 until end of turn. Vastwood Gorger mustassign its 5damageto theGuardian. Example: Thedamage assignmentorderof anattacking Vastwood Gorger (a5/6creature) is PrideGuardian (a 0/3creature)then Llanowar Elves (a1/1creature).Duringthedeclareblockers step,thedefendingplayercastsMendingHandstargetingPride Guardian,whichpreventsthe next4damagethat would be dealtto it. Vastwood Gorger can assign3damageto the Guardian and2damageto the Elves,4damageto the Guardian and1damageto the Elves, or5damageto the Guardian.**Example: Thedamage assignmentorderof anattacking Enormous Baloth (a7/7creature) is TrainedArmodon (a 3/3creature)that already has2damagemarked on it, thenForiysian Brigade (a2/4creaturethatcanblockanadditionalcreature), thenSilverback Ape (a5/5creature).Thedamage assignmentorderof anattacking Durkwood Boars (a4/4creature) is the sameForiysian Brigade, then Goblin Piker (a2/1creature). Among otherpossibilities, theactiveplayermay have the Balothassign 1damageto theArmodon, 1damageto theBrigade, and 5damageto theApe, and have the Boars assign3damageto the Brigade and1damageto the Piker.

510.1d. A blockingcreature assigns combatdamage to the`creatures <#creature>`__ it’s blocking. If itisn’t currently blocking any`creatures <#creature>`__ (if, for example, theywere destroyed or removed fromcombat), it assigns no`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__. If it’sblocking exactly one creature,it assigns all its combatdamage to that`creature <#creature>`__. If it’s blocking twoor more creatures, it assignsits combat damage to those`creatures <#creature>`__ according to the`damage assignmentorder <#damage_assignment_order>`__ announcedfor it. This may allow the blockingcreature to divide its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__. However, itcan’t assign combatdamage to a`creature <#creature>`__ that it’s blocking`unless <#unless>`__, when combatdamage assignments arecomplete, each creature thatprecedes that blockedcreature is assigned`lethal damage <#lethal_damage>`__. Whenchecking for assigned lethaldamage, take into account`damage <#damage>`__ already marked on the`creature <#creature>`__ and`damage <#damage>`__ from other`creatures <#creature>`__ that’s being assigned`during <#during>`__ the same combat damagestep, but not any`abilities <#ability>`__ or`effects <#effect>`__ that might change theamount of damage that’s actuallydealt. An amount of damage that’sgreater than a creature’s`lethal damage <#lethal_damage>`__ may beassigned to it.

510.1e. Once a player hasassigned combat damage fromeach attacking or blockingcreature they`control <#control_controller>`__, the total`damage <#damage>`__ assignment (not solely the`damage <#damage>`__ assignment of anyindividual attacking or blockingcreature) is checked tosee if it complies with the above rules. If itdoesn’t, the combat damage <#combat_damage>`__assignment is illegal; the game returns to themoment before that `player began to`assign combatdamage <#assign_combat_damage>`__. (See rule`723 <#R723>`__, „Handling IllegalActions.”)

510.2. Second, all combatdamage that’s been assignedis dealt simultaneously. This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__. No player hasthe chance to cast <#cast>`__`spells or activate <#activate>`__`abilities between the time`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ is assignedand the time it’s dealt. Example: Squadron Hawk(a1/1creaturewithflying)and Goblin Piker (a2/1creature) areattacking. Mogg Fanatic (a1/1creaturewiththeability„SacrificeMoggFanatic: MoggFanaticdeals1damagetoanytarget.”)blockstheGoblin Piker. ThedefendingplayersacrificesMoggFanaticduringthedeclareblockerssteptodeal1damagetothe Squadron Hawk. The Hawk is destroyed. ThePikerdealsand is dealtnocombat damagethisturn. If thedefendingplayerinsteadleftMogg Fanatic onthebattlefield, theFanatic and the Piker would have dealtlethaldamageto one another, butthe Squadron Hawk couldn’t have beendealtdamage.

510.3. Third, the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

510.3a. Any abilities <#ability>`__that triggered on `damage beingdealt or while state-basedactions are performedafterward are put onto the stack <#stack>`__before the `active player <#active_player>`__gets `priority; the order inwhich they triggered doesn’t matter. (See rule`603 <#R603>`__, „Handling TriggeredAbilities.”)

510.4. If at least one attacking or`blocking creature <#blocking_creature>`__ has`first strike <#first_strike>`__ (see rule`702.7 <#R7027>`__) or doublestrike (see rule`702.4 <#R7024>`__) as the combat damagestep begins, the only`creatures <#creature>`__ that assign combatdamage in that`step <#step>`__ are those with firststrike or doublestrike. After that`step <#step>`__, instead ofproceeding to the end of combatstep, the`phase <#phase>`__ gets a second combat damagestep. The only`creatures <#creature>`__ that assign combatdamage in that`step <#step>`__ are the remaining attackers andblockers that had neither firststrike nor doublestrike as the first combatdamage step began, aswell as the remaining attackers and blockersthat currently have doublestrike. After that`step <#step>`__, the phase <#phase>`__proceeds to the `end of combatstep.

511. End of CombatStep

511.1. The end of combatstep has no turn-basedactions. Once itbegins, the active player <#active_player>`__gets `priority. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

511.2. Abilities that`trigger <#trigger>`__ „at end of combat”trigger as the end of combatstep begins.`Effects <#effect>`__ that last „until end ofcombat” expire at the end of the combatphase.

511.3. As soon as the end of combatstep ends, all`creatures <#creature>`__ and`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ are removedfrom combat. After the`end of combat step <#end_of_combat_step>`__ends, the combat phase isover and the postcombat mainphase begins (seerule 505).

512. Ending Phase

512.1. The endingphase consists of two`steps <#step>`__: end and cleanup.

513. End Step

513.1. The end step hasno turn-based actions.Once it begins, the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”)

513.1a. Previously,`abilities <#ability>`__ that triggered at thebeginning of the end step wereprinted with the triggercondition „at end ofturn.” Cards <#card>`__that were printed with that text have receivederrata in the `Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to say „at thebeginning of the end step” or”at the beginning of the next endstep.”

513.2. If a permanent <#permanent>`__with an `ability that`triggers <#trigger>`__ „at the beginning of the`end step <#end_step>`__” enters thebattlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__`during this step, that`ability <#ability>`__ won’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ until the next turn’s`end step <#end_step>`__. Likewise, if a`delayed triggeredability <#delayed_triggered_ability>`__ that`triggers <#trigger>`__ „at the beginning of thenext end step” is created`during <#during>`__ this step, that`ability <#ability>`__ won’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ until the next turn’s`end step <#end_step>`__. In other words, the`step <#step>`__ doesn’t „back up” so those`abilities <#ability>`__ can go on the`stack <#stack>`__. This rule applies only to`triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__; itdoesn’t apply to continuouseffects whose durationssay „until end of turn” or „this turn.” (Seerule 514, „CleanupStep.”)

514. Cleanup Step

514.1. First, if the activeplayer’s hand <#hand>`__contains more `cards than their`maximum hand size <#maximum_hand_size>`__(normally seven), they discard <#discard>`__enough `cards to reduce their`hand <#hand>`__ size to that number. This`turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__doesn’t use the stack.

514.2. Second, the following actionshappen simultaneously: all damage <#damage>`__marked on `permanents (includingphased-out permanents) is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__and all „until end of turn” and „this turn”effects end. This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__.

514.3. Normally, no`player <#player>`__ receives`priority <#priority>`__ during <#during>`__the `cleanup step, so no`spells <#spell>`__ can be cast andno abilities can be activated.However, this rule is subject to the followingexception:

514.3a. At this point, the game checksto see if any state-basedactions would beperformed and/or any triggeredabilities are waiting tobe put onto the stack (includingthose that trigger „at thebeginning of the next cleanupstep”). If so, those`state-based actions <#state-based_actions>`__are performed, then those triggeredabilities are put on the`stack <#stack>`__, then the activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. Players <#player>`__may `cast spells and`activate <#activate>`__`abilities <#ability>`__. Once the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty and all`players <#player>`__ pass insuccession, another`cleanup step <#cleanup_step>`__ begins.

6. Spells,`Abilities <#ability>`__, and`Effects <#effect>`__

600. General

601. Casting Spells

601.1. Previously, the action ofcasting a spell, or casting a`card <#card>`__ as a spell, wasreferred to on cards as „playing”that spell or that`card <#card>`__. Cards that wereprinted with that text have received errata inthe Oracle card <#card>`__reference so they now refer to „casting” that`spell or that card.

601.1a. Some effects <#effect>`__still refer to „playing” a `card.”Playing a card” means playing that`card <#card>`__ as a land orcasting that card as a`spell <#spell>`__, whichever is appropriate.

601.2. To cast a`spell <#spell>`__ is to take it from where itis (usually the hand), put it on the`stack <#stack>`__, and pay its`costs <#cost>`__, so that it will eventually`resolve <#resolve>`__ and have its`effect <#effect>`__. Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ includes proposal of the`spell <#spell>`__ (rules`601.2a <#R6012a>`__-d) and determination andpayment of costs (rules`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h). To cast a`spell <#spell>`__, a player <#player>`__follows the `steps listed below, inorder. A player must be legallyallowed to cast the`spell <#spell>`__ to begin this process (seerule 601.3). If a`player <#player>`__ is unable to comply withthe requirements of a`step <#step>`__ listed below while performingthat step, the casting of the`spell <#spell>`__ is illegal ; the game returnsto the moment before the casting of that`spell <#spell>`__ was proposed (see rule`723 <#R723>`__, „Handling IllegalActions”).

601.2a. To propose the casting of a`spell <#spell>`__, a player first`moves <#move>`__ that card (or that`copy <#copy>`__ of a card) fromwhere it is to the stack. It`becomes <#becomes>`__ the topmost`object <#object>`__ on the stack.It has all the`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ of the`card <#card>`__ (or the copy of a`card <#card>`__) associated with it, and that`player <#player>`__ becomes its`controller <#control_controller>`__. The`spell <#spell>`__ remains on the`stack <#stack>`__ until it`resolves <#resolve>`__, it’s countered, or arule or effect `moves <#move>`__it elsewhere.

601.2b. If the spell is`modal <#modal_mode>`__, the`player <#player>`__ announces the`mode <#modal_mode>`__ choice (see rule`700.2 <#R7002>`__). If the player <#player>`__wishes to `splice any`cards <#card>`__ onto the spell <#spell>`__(see rule `702.46), they`reveal <#reveal>`__ those cards intheir hand. If the`spell <#spell>`__ has alternative or`additional costs <#additional_cost>`__ thatwill be paid as it’s being cast suchas buyback or`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__ costs <#cost>`__(see rules `118.8 and`118.9 <#R1189>`__), the player <#player>`__announces their intentions to `pay anyor all of those costs (see rule`601.2f <#R6012f>`__). A player <#player>`__can’t apply two alternative methods of castingor two `alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__to a single `spell. If the`spell <#spell>`__ has a variable`cost <#cost>`__ that will be paid as it’s being`cast <#cast>`__ (such as an {X} in its`mana cost <#mana_cost>`__; see rule`107.3 <#R1073>`__), the player <#player>`__announces the value of that variable. If thevalue of that variable is defined in the text ofthe `spell by a choice that`player <#player>`__ would make later in theannouncement or resolution of the`spell <#spell>`__, that player <#player>`__makes that choice at this time`instead of that later time. If a`cost <#cost>`__ that will be paid as the`spell <#spell>`__ is being cast <#cast>`__includes `hybrid manasymbols, the`player <#player>`__ announces the nonhybridequivalent cost they intend to`pay <#pay>`__. If a cost that willbe paid as the spell is being`cast <#cast>`__ includes Phyrexian manasymbols, the`player <#player>`__ announces whether theyintend to pay 2`life <#life_life_total>`__ or the correspondingcolored mana cost for each ofthose symbols. Previously made choices (such aschoosing to cast a`spell <#spell>`__ with`flashback <#flashback>`__ from a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ or choosing to`cast <#cast>`__ a creature with`morph <#morph>`__ face down)may restrict the player’s`options <#option>`__ when making these choices.

601.2c. The player <#player>`__announces their choice of an appropriate`object or player foreach target the spell <#spell>`__requires. A `spell may require some`targets <#target>`__ only if an alternative or`additional cost <#additional_cost>`__ (such asa kicker cost)or a particular mode waschosen for it; otherwise, the spell <#spell>`__is `cast as though <#as_though>`__it did not require those `targets.Similarly, a spell may requirealternative targets only if analternative or additionalcost was chosen for it. Ifthe spell has a variable number of`targets <#target>`__, the player <#player>`__announces how many `targets theywill choose before they announce those`targets <#target>`__. In some cases, the numberof targets will be defined by the`spell <#spell>`__’s text. Once the number of`targets <#target>`__ the spell hasis determined, that number doesn’t change, evenif the information used to determine the numberof targets does. The same`target <#target>`__ can’t be chosen multipletimes for any one instance of the word”target” on the`spell <#spell>`__. However, if the`spell <#spell>`__ uses the word”target” in multiple places, thesame object or`player <#player>`__ can be chosen once for eachinstance of the word „target” (aslong as it fits the targeting criteria). If any`effects <#effect>`__ say that an`object <#object>`__ or player <#player>`__must be chosen as a `target, the`player <#player>`__ chooses`targets <#target>`__ so that they obey themaximum possible number of such`effects <#effect>`__ without violating anyrules or effects that say that an`object <#object>`__ or player <#player>`__can’t be chosen as a `target. Thechosen objects and/or`players <#player>`__ each become <#becomes>`__a `target of that`spell <#spell>`__. (Any`abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when those`objects <#object>`__ and/or`players <#player>`__ become the`target <#target>`__ of a spell <#spell>`__`trigger at this point; they’llwait to be put on the stack untilthe spell has finished being`cast <#cast>`__.) Example: Ifaspellsays”Taptwotargetcreatures,”then the samecreaturecan’tbe chosen twice;thespellrequires twodifferent legaltargets.Aspellthat says”Destroytargetartifactandtargetland,”however, cantargetthesameartifactlandtwice because it usesthe word „target” inmultiple places.

601.2d. If the spell <#spell>`__requires the `player to divide ordistribute an effect (such as`damage <#damage>`__ or counters)among one or more targets, the`player <#player>`__ announces the division.Each of these targets must receiveat least one of whatever is being divided.

601.2e. The game checks to see if theproposed spell can legally be`cast <#cast>`__. If the proposed`spell <#spell>`__ is illegal, the game returnsto the moment before the casting of that`spell <#spell>`__ was proposed (see rule`723 <#R723>`__, „Handling IllegalActions”).

601.2f. The player <#player>`__determines the `total cost ofthe spell. Usually this is just the`mana cost <#mana_cost>`__. Some`spells <#spell>`__ have additional or`alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__. Some`effects <#effect>`__ may increase or reduce the`cost <#cost>`__ to pay, or mayprovide other alternativecosts. Costs <#cost>`__may include paying `mana, tapping`permanents <#permanent>`__, sacrificing`permanents <#permanent>`__, discarding`cards <#card>`__, and so on. The totalcost is the manacost or alternativecost (as determined inrule 601.2b), plus all additionalcosts and cost <#cost>`__increases, and minus all `cost <#cost>`__reductions. If multiple `cost <#cost>`__reductions apply, the `player mayapply them in any order. If the mana <#mana>`__component of the `total cost isreduced to nothing by cost reduction`effects <#effect>`__, it is considered to be{0}. It can’t be reduced to less than {0}. Oncethe total cost is determined,any effects that directly affectthe total cost are applied.Then the resulting total cost <#total_cost>`__`becomes „locked in.” If`effects <#effect>`__ would change the totalcost after this time, they haveno effect.

601.2g. If the totalcost includes a`mana <#mana>`__ payment, the`player <#player>`__ then has a chance to`activate <#activate>`__ manaabilities (see rule`605 <#R605>`__, „ManaAbilities”). Manaabilities must be activatedbefore costs are paid.

601.2h. The player paysthe total cost in any order.Partial payments are not allowed. Unpayable`costs <#cost>`__ can’t be paid.*Example:`You <#you_your>`__`cast <#cast>`__*Altar’sReap, whichcosts{1}{B} and hasanadditional costofsacrificingacreature.YousacrificeThunderscapeFamiliar,whoseeffectmakesyourblackspellscost{1}less tocast. Becauseaspell«stotalcostis „locked in” beforepayments are actuallymade,youpay{B},not {1}{B}, eventhoughyou«re sacrificingthe Familiar.

601.2i. Once the steps <#step>`__described in `601.2a-h arecompleted, effects that modify the`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ of the`spell <#spell>`__ as it’s cast areapplied, then the spell <#spell>`__`becomes cast. Any`abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when a spell <#spell>`__is `cast or put onto the`stack <#stack>`__ trigger atthis time. If the spell’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ had`priority <#priority>`__ before casting it, theyget priority.

601.3. A player can beginto cast a spell only ifa rule or effect allows that`player <#player>`__ to cast it andno rule or effect prohibits that`player <#player>`__ from casting it.

601.3a. If an effect <#effect>`__prohibits a `player from casting a`spell <#spell>`__ with certain qualities, that`player <#player>`__ may consider any choices tobe made during that`spell <#spell>`__’s proposal that may causethose qualities to change. If any such choicescould cause that effect to nolonger prohibit that player fromcasting that spell, the`player <#player>`__ may begin to`cast <#cast>`__ the spell,ignoring the effect. Example:AplayercontrolsVoidWinnower, which reads, in part,”Youropponentscan’tcastspellswithevenconverted manacosts.”Thatplayer«sopponentmaybegin tocastRolling Thunder,acardwhosemanacostis{X}{R}{R}, because the chosenvalue ofXmay causethespell«sconverted manacosttobecomeodd.

601.3b. If an effect <#effect>`__allows a `player to`cast <#cast>`__ a spell withcertain qualities as though ithad flash, that`player <#player>`__ may consider any choices tobe made during that`spell <#spell>`__’s proposal that may causethat spell’s qualities to change.If any such choices could cause that`effect <#effect>`__ to apply, that`player <#player>`__ may begin to`cast <#cast>`__ that spell asthough it had`flash <#flash>`__. Example:AneffectsaysthatyoumaycastAuraspellsasthoughtheyhadflash,andyouhaveacreaturecardwithbestowinyourhand.Because choosingthebestowability«salternativecostcausesthatspelltobecomeanAuraspell,youmaylegally begintocastthatspellasthoughithadflash.

601.3c. If an effect <#effect>`__allows a `player to`cast <#cast>`__ a spell asthough it had flash <#flash>`__only if an alternative or `additionalcost is paid, that`player <#player>`__ may begin to`cast <#cast>`__ that spell asthough it had`flash <#flash>`__.

601.3d. If a spell wouldhave flash only if certainconditions are met, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ may beginto cast that spell asthough it had `flash <#flash>`__if those conditions are met.

601.3e. Some rules and`effects <#effect>`__ state that an alternativeset of characteristics ora subset of`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ areconsidered to determine if a card or`copy <#copy>`__ of a card is legalto cast. These alternative`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ replacethe object’s`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ for thisdetermination. Continuouseffects that would applyto that object once it has those`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ are alsoconsidered.
