701.26b. To abandon a`scheme <#scheme>`__, turn it facedown and put it on the bottom ofits owner’s scheme <#scheme>`__`deck.

701.27. Proliferate

701.27a. To`proliferate <#proliferate>`__ means to chooseany number of permanents and/or`players <#player>`__ that have a`counter <#counter>`__, then give each oneadditional counter of each kindthat permanent or`player <#player>`__ already has.

701.27b. In a Two-Headed Giant game,`poison counters <#poison_counter>`__ are sharedby the team. If more than one`player <#player>`__ on a team ischosen this way, only one of those`players <#player>`__ can be given an additional`poison counter <#poison_counter>`__. The`player <#player>`__ who`proliferates <#proliferate>`__ chooses which`player <#player>`__ that is. See rule`810 <#R810>`__, „Two-Headed GiantVariant.”

701.28. Transform

701.28a. To transform <#transform>`__a `permanent, turn it over sothat its other face is up. Only`permanents <#permanent>`__ represented by`transforming double-facedcards <#transforming_double-faced_cards>`__ can`transform <#transform>`__. (See rule`711 <#R711>`__, „Double-FacedCards.”)

701.28b. Although transforming a`permanent <#permanent>`__ uses the samephysical action as turning a`permanent <#permanent>`__ faceup or face down,they are different game actions.`Abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when a`permanent <#permanent>`__ is turned facedown won’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ when that`permanent <#permanent>`__`transforms <#transform>`__, and so on.

701.28c. If a spell or`ability <#ability>`__ instructs a`player <#player>`__ to`transform <#transform>`__ a`permanent <#permanent>`__ that isn’trepresented by a transforming double-facedcard,nothing happens.

701.28d. If a spell or`ability <#ability>`__ instructs a`player <#player>`__ to`transform <#transform>`__ a`permanent <#permanent>`__, and the face that`permanent <#permanent>`__ would`transform <#transform>`__ into is representedby an instant or`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ card face,nothing happens.

701.28e. Some triggeredabilities <#triggered_ability>`__`trigger when an`object <#object>`__”transforms into” an`object <#object>`__ with a specified`characteristic <#characteristics>`__. Such an`ability <#ability>`__ triggers <#trigger>`__if the `object <#object>`__`transforms and has thespecified characteristic <#characteristics>`__immediately after it`transforms.

701.28f. If an activated or triggeredability of a`permanent <#permanent>`__ that isn’t a delayedtriggeredability of that`permanent <#permanent>`__ tries to`transform <#transform>`__ it, the`permanent <#permanent>`__`transforms <#transform>`__ only if it hasn’ttransformed since the ability wasput onto the stack. If a delayedtriggeredability of a`permanent <#permanent>`__ tries to`transform <#transform>`__ that`permanent <#permanent>`__, the`permanent <#permanent>`__`transforms <#transform>`__ only if it hasn’ttransformed since that delayed triggeredability wascreated. In either case, if the`permanent <#permanent>`__ has alreadytransformed, the instruction to`transform <#transform>`__ is ignored.

701.29. Detain

701.29a. Certain spells <#spell>`__and `abilities can`detain <#detain>`__ a`permanent <#permanent>`__. Until the next turnof the controller ofthat spell or`ability <#ability>`__, that`permanent <#permanent>`__ can’t`attack <#attack>`__ or block andits `activated abilities <#activated_ability>`__can’t be activated.

701.30. Populate

701.30a. To populate <#populate>`__means to choose a `creature <#creature>`__`token you <#you_your>`__`control and`create <#create>`__ a token that’sa copy of that`creature <#creature>`__ token.

701.30b. If you <#you_your>`__`control no`creature <#creature>`__ tokens <#token>`__when instructed to `populate,`you <#you_your>`__ won’t create a`token <#token>`__.

701.31. Monstrosity

701.31a.”Monstrosity N” means „Ifthis permanent isn’t`monstrous <#monstrous>`__, put N +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it and it`becomes <#becomes>`__`monstrous <#monstrous>`__.”

701.31b. Monstrous isa designation that has no rules meaning otherthan to act as a marker that the`monstrosity <#monstrosity>`__ action and other`spells <#spell>`__ and abilities <#ability>`__can identify. Only `permanents <#permanent>`__can be or `become <#becomes>`__`monstrous. Once a`permanent <#permanent>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__`monstrous <#monstrous>`__, it stays`monstrous <#monstrous>`__ until it leaves thebattlefield.`Monstrous <#monstrous>`__ is neither an`ability <#ability>`__ nor part of the`permanent <#permanent>`__’s copiablevalues.

701.31c. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__’s`ability <#ability>`__ instructs a`player <#player>`__ to”monstrosity X,”other abilities of that`permanent <#permanent>`__ may also refer to`X <#x>`__. The value of X in those`abilities <#ability>`__ is equal to the valueof X as that permanent <#permanent>`__became `monstrous.

701.32. Vote

701.32a. Some spells and`abilities <#ability>`__ instruct`players <#player>`__ to vote forone choice from a list of options <#option>`__to determine some aspect of the`effect of that spell <#spell>`__or `ability. To vote,each player, starting with aspecified player and proceeding inturn order, chooses one of those choices.

701.32b. The listed choices may be`objects <#object>`__, words with no rulesmeaning that are each connected to a different`effect <#effect>`__, or other variablesrelevant to the resolution of the`spell <#spell>`__ or ability.

701.32c. If the text of a`spell <#spell>`__ or ability <#ability>`__refers to „voting,” it refers only to an actual`vote, not to any spell <#spell>`__or `ability that involves the`players <#player>`__ making choices ordecisions without using the word”vote.”

701.32d. If an effect <#effect>`__gives a `player multiple`votes <#vote>`__, those votes allhappen at the same time the `player <#player>`__would otherwise have voted.

701.33. Bolster

701.33a. „Bolster N”means „Choose a creature <#creature>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control with the least`toughness <#toughness>`__ or tied for least`toughness <#toughness>`__ among`creatures <#creature>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control. Put N +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on that`creature <#creature>`__.”

701.34. Manifest

701.34a. To manifest a`card <#card>`__, turn it facedown. It becomes <#becomes>`__a 2/2 face-down `creature <#creature>`__`card with no text, no`name <#name>`__, no subtypes,and no mana cost. Put that`card <#card>`__ onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ facedown. That`permanent <#permanent>`__ is a manifested`permanent <#permanent>`__ as long as it remains`face down <#face_down>`__. The`effect <#effect>`__ defining its`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ workswhile the card is facedown and ends when it’s turned`face up <#face_up>`__.

701.34b. Any time you <#you_your>`__have `priority,`you <#you_your>`__ may turn a manifested`permanent <#permanent>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control faceup. This is a specialaction that doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__ (see rule`116.2b <#R1162b>`__). To do this, show all`players <#player>`__ that the card <#card>`__representing that `permanent isa creature card andwhat that card’s manacost is, pay that`cost <#cost>`__, then turn the`permanent <#permanent>`__ faceup. The effect <#effect>`__defining its`characteristics while itwas face down ends, and itregains its normal`characteristics <#characteristics>`__. (If the`card <#card>`__ representing that`permanent <#permanent>`__ isn’t a`creature <#creature>`__ card or itdoesn’t have a mana cost, itcan’t be turned face up thisway.)

701.34c. If a card with`morph <#morph>`__ is manifested, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ may turnthat card face up <#face_up>`__using either the procedure described in rule`702.36e to turn a face-down`permanent <#permanent>`__ with`morph <#morph>`__ face up or theprocedure described above to turn a manifested`permanent <#permanent>`__ faceup.

701.34d. If an effect <#effect>`__instructs a `player to`manifest <#manifest>`__ multiple`cards <#card>`__ from their`library <#library>`__, those `cards <#card>`__are manifested one at a time.

701.34e. If an effect <#effect>`__instructs a `player to`manifest <#manifest>`__ a card anda rule or effect prohibits theface-down object from entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, that`card <#card>`__ isn’t manifested. Its`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ remainunmodified and it remains in its previous`zone <#zone>`__. If it was faceup, it remains faceup.

701.34f. If a manifested`permanent <#permanent>`__ that’s represented byan instant or`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ card wouldturn face up, its`controller <#control_controller>`__`reveals <#reveal>`__ it and leaves it facedown. Abilities <#ability>`__that `trigger whenever a`permanent <#permanent>`__ is turned faceup won’t trigger.

701.34g. See rule 707,”Face-Down Spells and`Permanents <#permanent>`__,” for moreinformation.

701.35. Support

701.35a. „Support N” ona permanent means „Put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on each of up to N other`target <#target>`__ creatures.””Support N” on an`instant <#instant>`__ or sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell means „Put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on each of up to N`target <#target>`__ creatures.”

701.36. Investigate

701.36a.”Investigate” means”Create a`colorless <#colorless>`__ Clue`artifact <#artifact>`__ token with»{2}, Sacrifice this`artifact <#artifact>`__: Draw a`card <#card>`__.»”

701.37. Meld

701.37a. Meld is a keywordaction that appears in an`ability <#ability>`__ on one card <#card>`__in a `meld pair. (See rule`712 <#R712>`__, „MeldCards.”) To meld <#meld>`__the two `cards in a meld <#meld>`__pair, put them onto the`battlefield with their backfaces up and combined. The resulting`permanent <#permanent>`__ is a single`object <#object>`__ represented by two`cards <#card>`__.

701.37b. Only two cards <#card>`__belonging to the same `meld pair canbe melded. Tokens,`cards <#card>`__ that aren’t meldcards, or meldcards that don’t form a`meld <#meld>`__ pair can’t be melded.

701.37c. If an effect <#effect>`__instructs a `player to`meld <#meld>`__ objects thatcan’t be melded, they stay in their current`zone <#zone>`__. Example:AplayerownsandcontrolsMidnightScavengers and atokenthat’sacopyof Graf Rats. At thebeginning of combat, both are exiled but can’tbe melded. Midnight Scavengers remains exiledand the exiledtokenceases toexist.

701.38. Goad

701.38a. Certain spells <#spell>`__and `abilities can`goad <#goad>`__ a creature.Until the next turn of the`controller <#control_controller>`__ of that`spell <#spell>`__ or ability,that creature <#creature>`__`attacks each combat if able and`attacks <#attack>`__ a player <#player>`__other than that `player if able.

701.38b. A staticability may state that a`creature <#creature>`__ „is goaded.” That`creature <#creature>`__ attacks <#attack>`__each combat if able and `attacks a`player <#player>`__ other than the`controller <#control_controller>`__ of the`permanent <#permanent>`__ with that staticability if able.

701.38c. Once a player <#player>`__has goaded a `creature, the same`player <#player>`__ goading it again has no`effect <#effect>`__. It doesn’t`create <#create>`__ additional combat`requirements <#requirement>`__.

701.39. Exert

701.39a. To exert a`permanent <#permanent>`__, you <#you_your>`__choose to have it not `untap <#untap>`__`during your next`untap step <#untap_step>`__.

701.39b. A permanent <#permanent>`__can be exerted even if it’s not`tapped or has already been exertedin a turn. If you <#you_your>`__`exert a permanent <#permanent>`__more than once before `your next`untap step <#untap_step>`__, each`effect <#effect>`__ causing it not to`untap <#untap>`__ expires during <#during>`__the same `untap step.

701.39c. An object thatisn’t on the `battlefield <#battlefield>`__can’t be exerted.

701.39d. „You may`exert <#exert>`__ [this`creature <#creature>`__] as it`attacks <#attack>`__” is an optional`cost <#cost>`__ to attack (seerule 508.1g). Some`objects <#object>`__ with this staticability have a triggeredability that`triggers <#trigger>`__ „when`you <#you_your>`__ do” printed in the sameparagraph. These abilities arelinked. (See rule 607.2g.)

701.40. Explore

701.40a. Certain`abilities <#ability>`__ instruct a`permanent <#permanent>`__ to`explore <#explore>`__. To do so, that`permanent <#permanent>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__`reveals <#reveal>`__ the top card <#card>`__of their `library. If a`land <#land>`__ card is revealedthis way, that player puts that`card <#card>`__ into their hand.Otherwise, that player puts a+1/+1 counter on the exploring`permanent <#permanent>`__ and may put therevealed card into their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.

701.40b. A permanent”explores” after the processdescribed in rule 701.40a iscomplete, even if some or all of those actionswere impossible.

701.40c. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ changes`zones <#zone>`__ before an effect <#effect>`__causes it to `explore, its `lastknown information <#last_known_information>`__is used to determine which `object <#object>`__explored and who controlled it.

701.41. Assemble

701.41a. Assemble is a`keyword action <#keyword_action>`__ in theUnstable set that puts Contraptions onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. Outside of`silver-bordered <#silver-bordered>`__`cards <#card>`__, only one card <#card>`__(Steamflogger Boss) refers to assembling aContraption. `Cards and mechanicsfrom the Unstable set aren’t included in theserules. See the Unstable FAQ for moreinformation.

701.42. Surveil

701.42a. To „surveil N”means to look at the top N cards of`your <#you_your>`__ library,then put any number of them into`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard <#graveyard>`__and the rest on top of `your <#you_your>`__`library in any order.

701.42b. If an effect <#effect>`__allows `you to look at additional`cards <#card>`__ while you <#you_your>`__`surveil, those cards <#card>`__are included among the `cards <#card>`__`you may put into`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard <#graveyard>`__and on top of `your <#you_your>`__`library in any order.

701.43. Adapt

701.43a. „Adapt N” means”If this permanent has no +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it, put N +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it.”

701.44. Amass

701.44a. To amass N means”If you don’t`control <#control_controller>`__ an Army`creature <#creature>`__, create a0/0 black Zombie Army creature <#creature>`__`token. Choose an Army`creature <#creature>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control. Put N +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on that`creature <#creature>`__.”

701.44b. The phrase „the[subtype] you <#you_your>`__amassed” refers to the `creature <#creature>`__`you chose, whether or not itreceived counters.

702. KeywordAbilities

702.1. Most abilities <#ability>`__describe exactly what they do in the`card’s rules text.Some, though, are very common or would requiretoo much space to define on the`card <#card>`__. In these cases, the`object <#object>`__ lists only the`name <#name>`__ of the ability <#ability>`__as a „keyword”; sometimes `remindertext summarizes the gamerule.

702.1a. If an effect <#effect>`__refers to a „[`keywordability]`cost <#cost>`__,” it refers only to thevariable costs for that keyword.*Example: Varolz, the Scar-Striped hasan*abilitythat says”Eachcreaturecardinyourgraveyardhasscavenge.Thescavengecostisequal to itsmana cost.”Acreaturecard«sscavengecostisan amount ofmanaequal toitsmana cost, andtheactivationcostofthescavengeabilityisthat amount ofmanaplus”Exilethiscardfromyourgraveyard.”

702.1b. An effect thatgrants an object a keywordability may define avariable in that ability based on`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ of that`object <#object>`__ or other information aboutthe game state. For these`abilities <#ability>`__, the value of thatvariable is constantly reevaluated. Example:Volcano Hellion hastheability„Volcano Hellionhasecho{X},whereXisyourlifetotal.”Ifyourlifetotalis 10 when VolcanoHellion’sechoabilitytriggersbut5 when itresolves,theechocosttopayis{5}. Example: Fire//Ice is asplitcardwhose halves havethemana costs{1}{R} and{1}{U}. Past in Flames reads”Eachinstantandsorcerycardinyourgraveyardgainsflashbackuntilend of turn.Theflashbackcostisequal to itsmana cost.”Fire//Ice has”Flashback{2}{U}{R}”while it isinyourgraveyard,but ifyouchoosetocastFire, theresultingspellhas”Flashback{1}{R}.”

702.1c. An effect maystate that „the same is true for” a list of`keyword abilities <#keyword_ability>`__ orsimilar. If one of those keywordabilities has`variants <#variant>`__ or variables and the`effect <#effect>`__ grants that keyword or`counters <#counter>`__ of that keyword to oneor more objects and/or`players <#player>`__, it grants eachappropriate variant and variableof that keyword. Example: Concerted Effort isanenchantmentthat reads”At the beginning of eachupkeep,creaturesyoucontrolgainflyinguntilend of turn ifacreatureyoucontrolhasflying.The same is trueforfear,firststrike,doublestrike,landwalk,protection,trample,andvigilance.” Asthattriggeredabilityresolves,eachlandwalkandprotectionabilityfromamongcreaturesyoucontrolisgranted toeachcreatureyoucontrol.

702.1d. An effect mayrefer to an object „with [keywordability]” or „that has[keyword ability].” Thismeans the same thing as an object”with a [keyword ability]`ability <#ability>`__” or an`object <#object>`__ „that has a [keywordability]`ability <#ability>`__.”

702.2. Deathtouch

702.2a. Deathtouch isa static ability.

702.2b. A creature with`toughness <#toughness>`__ greater than 0 that’sbeen dealt damage by a source with`deathtouch <#deathtouch>`__ since the last time`state-based actions <#state-based_actions>`__were checked is destroyed as a state-basedaction. See rule`704. <#R704>`__

702.2c. Any nonzero amount of combatdamage assigned to a`creature <#creature>`__ by a source with`deathtouch <#deathtouch>`__ is considered to be`lethal damage <#lethal_damage>`__ for thepurposes of determining if a proposed combatdamage assignment is valid,regardless of that creature’s`toughness <#toughness>`__. See rules`510.1c <#R5101c>`__-d.

702.2d. The`deathtouch <#deathtouch>`__ rules function nomatter what zone an`object <#object>`__ with`deathtouch <#deathtouch>`__ deals <#deal>`__`damage from.

702.2e. If an object <#object>`__changes `zones before an`effect <#effect>`__ causes it to`deal <#deal>`__ damage, its lastknown information <#last_known_information>`__is used to determine whether it had`deathtouch.

702.2f. Multiple instances of`deathtouch <#deathtouch>`__ on the same`object <#object>`__ are redundant.

702.3. Defender

702.3a. Defender is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.

702.3b. A creature with`defender <#defender>`__ can’t`attack <#attack>`__.

702.3c. Multiple instances of`defender <#defender>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.4. DoubleStrike

702.4a. Doublestrike is a staticability that modifies therules for the combat damagestep. (See rule`510 <#R510>`__, „Combat DamageStep.”)

702.4b. If at least one attacking or`blocking creature <#blocking_creature>`__ has`first strike <#first_strike>`__ (see rule`702.7 <#R7027>`__) or doublestrike as the combat damagestep begins, the only`creatures <#creature>`__ that assign combatdamage in that`step <#step>`__ are those with firststrike or doublestrike. After that`step <#step>`__, instead ofproceeding to the end of combatstep, the`phase <#phase>`__ gets a second combat damagestep. The only`creatures <#creature>`__ that assign combatdamage in that`step <#step>`__ are the remaining attackers andblockers that had neither firststrike nor doublestrike as the first combatdamage step began, aswell as the remaining attackers and blockersthat currently have doublestrike. After that`step <#step>`__, the phase <#phase>`__proceeds to the `end of combatstep.

702.4c. Removing doublestrike from a`creature <#creature>`__ during <#during>`__the first `combat damagestep will stop it fromassigning combat damage inthe second combat damagestep.

702.4d. Giving doublestrike to a`creature <#creature>`__ with firststrike after it has alreadydealt combat damage in thefirst combat damagestep will allow the`creature <#creature>`__ to assign combatdamage in the second`combat damage step <#combat_damage_step>`__.

702.4e. Multiple instances of doublestrike on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.5. Enchant

702.5a. Enchant is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__, written”Enchant [object or`player <#player>`__].” The`enchant <#enchant>`__ ability <#ability>`__restricts what an `Aura <#aura>`__`spell can target andwhat an Aura can`enchant <#enchant>`__.

702.5b. For more information about`Auras <#aura>`__, see rule 303,”Enchantments.”

702.5c. If an Aura hasmultiple instances of enchant,all of them apply. The Aura’s`target <#target>`__ must follow the`restrictions <#restriction>`__ from all theinstances of enchant. The`Aura <#aura>`__ can enchant only`objects <#object>`__ or players <#player>`__that `match all of its`enchant <#enchant>`__ abilities.

702.5d. Auras that can`enchant <#enchant>`__ a player <#player>`__can `target and be attached to`players <#player>`__. Such Auras <#aura>`__can’t `target <#target>`__`permanents and can’t beattached to permanents.

702.6. Equip

702.6a. Equip is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ of`Equipment <#equipment>`__ cards.”Equip [cost]” means”[Cost]: Attach this`permanent <#permanent>`__ to`target <#target>`__ creature <#creature>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.6b. For more information about`Equipment <#equipment>`__, see rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts.”

702.6c. „Equip [quality]`creature <#creature>`__” is a`variant <#variant>`__ of the equip <#equip>`__`ability. „Equip <#equip>`__[quality] [`cost]” means”[Cost]: Attach this`permanent <#permanent>`__ to`target <#target>`__ [quality]`creature <#creature>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.” This`ability <#ability>`__ doesn’t restrict what the`Equipment <#equipment>`__ may be attached to.

702.6d. An „equip <#equip>`__[quality] `creature”ability is an equip <#equip>`__`ability, and an”equip [quality]`creature <#creature>`__” cost is an`equip <#equip>`__ cost. Any`effect <#effect>`__ that modifies how orwhether a player may`activate <#activate>`__ an equip <#equip>`__`ability of an`object <#object>`__ affects „equip <#equip>`__[quality] `creature”abilities of that`object <#object>`__. Any effect <#effect>`__that increases or reduces an `equip <#equip>`__`cost will increase or reduce a”equip [quality]`creature <#creature>`__” cost.

702.6e. If a permanent <#permanent>`__has multiple `equip <#equip>`__`abilities, any of its`equip <#equip>`__ abilities maybe activated.

702.7. First Strike

702.7a. Firststrike is a staticability that modifies therules for the combat damagestep. (See rule`510 <#R510>`__, „Combat DamageStep.”)

702.7b. If at least one attacking or`blocking creature <#blocking_creature>`__ has`first strike <#first_strike>`__ or doublestrike (see rule`702.4 <#R7024>`__) as the combat damagestep begins, the only`creatures <#creature>`__ that assign combatdamage in that`step <#step>`__ are those with firststrike or doublestrike. After that`step <#step>`__, instead ofproceeding to the end of combatstep, the`phase <#phase>`__ gets a second combat damagestep. The only`creatures <#creature>`__ that assign combatdamage in that`step <#step>`__ are the remaining attackers andblockers that had neither firststrike nor doublestrike as the first combatdamage step began, aswell as the remaining attackers and blockersthat currently have doublestrike. After that`step <#step>`__, the phase <#phase>`__proceeds to the `end of combatstep.

702.7c. Giving firststrike to a`creature <#creature>`__ without it after`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ has alreadybeen dealt in the first combat damagestep won’t precludethat creature from assigning`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ in the second`combat damage step <#combat_damage_step>`__.Removing first strike from a`creature <#creature>`__ after it has alreadydealt combat damage in thefirst combat damagestep won’t allow it toalso assign combatdamage in the second`combat damage step <#combat_damage_step>`__(unless the`creature <#creature>`__ has doublestrike).

702.7d. Multiple instances of firststrike on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.8. Flash

702.8a. Flash is a staticability that functions inany zone from which`you <#you_your>`__ could play the`card <#card>`__ it’s on. „Flash”means „You may play <#play>`__this `card any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast an`instant <#instant>`__.”

702.8b. Multiple instances of`flash <#flash>`__ on the same`object <#object>`__ are redundant.

702.9. Flying

702.9a. Flying is an`evasion ability <#evasion_ability>`__.

702.9b. A creature with`flying <#flying>`__ can’t be blocked except by`creatures <#creature>`__ with`flying <#flying>`__ and/or reach.A creature with`flying <#flying>`__ can block a`creature <#creature>`__ with or without`flying <#flying>`__. (See rule 509,”Declare BlockersStep,” and rule`702.17 <#R70217>`__, „Reach.”)

702.9c. Multiple instances of`flying <#flying>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.10. Haste

702.10a. Haste is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.

702.10b. If a creature <#creature>`__has `haste, it can`attack <#attack>`__ even if it hasn’t beencontrolled by its`controller <#control_controller>`__continuously since their most recent turn began.(See rule 302.6.)

702.10c. If a creature <#creature>`__has `haste, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ can`activate <#activate>`__ its activatedabilities whose`cost <#cost>`__ includes the tapsymbol or the untapsymbol even if that`creature <#creature>`__ hasn’t been controlledby that player continuously sincetheir most recent turn began. (See rule`302.6 <#R3026>`__.)

702.10d. Multiple instances of`haste <#haste>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.11. Hexproof

702.11a. Hexproof is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.

702.11b. „Hexproof” ona permanent means „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ can’t be the`target <#target>`__ of spells or`abilities <#ability>`__ your <#you_your>`__`opponents <#opponent>`__`control.”

702.11c. „Hexproof” ona player means”You can’t be the`target <#target>`__ of spells or`abilities <#ability>`__ your <#you_your>`__`opponents <#opponent>`__`control.”

702.11d. „Hexproof from[quality]” is a variant of the`hexproof <#hexproof>`__ ability.”Hexproof from [quality]” on a`permanent <#permanent>`__ means „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ can’t be the`target <#target>`__ of [quality]`spells <#spell>`__ your <#you_your>`__`opponents <#opponent>`__`control or`abilities <#ability>`__ your <#you_your>`__`opponents <#opponent>`__`control from [quality]sources.” A „hexproof from[quality]” ability is a`hexproof <#hexproof>`__ ability.

702.11e. Any effect thatcauses an object to lose`hexproof <#hexproof>`__ will cause an`object <#object>`__ to lose all”hexproof from [quality]”abilities. Any`effect <#effect>`__ that allows a`player <#player>`__ to choose a`creature <#creature>`__ with`hexproof <#hexproof>`__ as a`target <#target>`__ as though <#as_though>`__it didn’t have `hexproof willallow a player to choose a`creature <#creature>`__ with a”hexproof from [quality]”ability. Any effect <#effect>`__that looks for a `card with`hexproof <#hexproof>`__ will find a`card <#card>`__ with a”hexproof from [quality]”ability.

702.11f. „Hexproof from[quality A] and from [quality B]” is shorthandfor „hexproof from [quality A]”and „hexproof from [quality B]”;it behaves as two separate`hexproof <#hexproof>`__`abilities <#ability>`__. If an`effect <#effect>`__ causes an`object <#object>`__ with such an`ability <#ability>`__ to lose`hexproof <#hexproof>`__ from [quality A], forexample, that object would stillhave hexproof from [quality B].

702.11g. Multiple instances of the same`hexproof <#hexproof>`__ ability <#ability>`__on the same `permanent or`player <#player>`__ are redundant.

702.12.`Indestructible <#indestructible>`__

702.12a.`Indestructible <#indestructible>`__ is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.

702.12b. A permanent <#permanent>`__with `indestructible can’tbe destroyed. Such permanents <#permanent>`__aren’t destroyed by `lethaldamage, and they ignore the`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__that checks for lethaldamage (see rule`704.5g <#R7045g>`__).

702.12c. Multiple instances of`indestructible <#indestructible>`__ on the same`permanent <#permanent>`__ are redundant.

702.13. Intimidate

702.13a. Intimidate <#intimidate>`__is an `evasion ability.

702.13b. A creature <#creature>`__with `intimidate can’t beblocked except by artifactcreatures and/or`creatures <#creature>`__ that share a`color <#color>`__ with it. (See rule`509 <#R509>`__, „Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.13c. Multiple instances of`intimidate <#intimidate>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.14. Landwalk

702.14a. Landwalk is ageneric term that appears within an`object <#object>`__’s rulestext as”[type]walk,” where[type] is usually a`subtype <#subtype>`__, but can be the cardtype land, any landtype, any`supertype <#supertype>`__, or any combinationthereof.

702.14b. Landwalk is an`evasion ability <#evasion_ability>`__.

702.14c. A creature <#creature>`__with `landwalk can’t be blockedas long as the defendingplayer <#defending_player>`__`controls at least one`land <#land>`__ with the specified`subtype <#subtype>`__ (as in”islandwalk”), with thespecified supertype (as in”legendary <#legendary>`__`landwalk”), without thespecified supertype (as in”nonbasic landwalk”), or withboth the specified supertype <#supertype>`__and the specified `subtype (as in”snow swampwalk”).(See rule 509, „Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.14d. Landwalk <#landwalk>`__`abilities don’t „cancel” oneanother. Example: IfaplayercontrolsasnowForest,thatplayercan’tblockanattackingcreaturewithsnowforestwalkevenif theyalsocontrolacreaturewithsnowforestwalk.

702.14e. Multiple instances of the samekind of landwalk on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.15. Lifelink

702.15a. Lifelink is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.

702.15b. Damage dealt bya source with lifelink causesthat source’s`controller <#control_controller>`__, or its`owner <#owner>`__ if it has no`controller <#control_controller>`__, to gainthat much life (inaddition to any other results that`damage <#damage>`__ causes). See rule`120.3 <#R1203>`__.

702.15c. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ leaves thebattlefield beforean effect causes it to`deal <#deal>`__ damage, its lastknown information <#last_known_information>`__is used to determine whether it had`lifelink.

702.15d. The lifelink <#lifelink>`__rules function no matter what `zone <#zone>`__an `object with`lifelink <#lifelink>`__ deals <#deal>`__`damage from.

702.15e. If multiple sources with`lifelink <#lifelink>`__ deal <#deal>`__`damage at the same time, theycause separate life gain`events <#event>`__ (see rules`119.9 <#R1199>`__-10). Example:AplayercontrolsAjani’sPridemate, which reads”Wheneveryougainlife,put a +1/+1counteronAjani’s Pridemate,” andtwocreatureswithlifelink.Thecreatureswithlifelinkdealcombatdamagesimultaneously.Ajani’sPridemate’sabilitytriggerstwice.

702.15f. Multiple instances of`lifelink <#lifelink>`__ on the same`object <#object>`__ are redundant.

702.16. Protection

702.16a. Protection <#protection>`__is a `static ability,written „Protection from[quality].” This quality is usually a`color <#color>`__ (as in”protection from black”) butcan be any characteristic <#characteristics>`__value or information. If the quality happens tobe a `card name, it istreated as such only if the`protection <#protection>`__`ability <#ability>`__ specifies that thequality is a name. If the quality isa card type,`subtype <#subtype>`__, or`supertype <#supertype>`__, the`ability <#ability>`__ applies to sources thatare permanents with that cardtype, subtype, or`supertype <#supertype>`__ and to any sourcesnot on the battlefield thatare of that card type,`subtype <#subtype>`__, or`supertype <#supertype>`__. This is an exceptionto rule 109.2.

702.16b. A permanent <#permanent>`__or `player with`protection <#protection>`__ can’t be targetedby spells with the stated qualityand can’t be targeted by`abilities <#ability>`__ from a source with thestated quality.

702.16c. A permanent <#permanent>`__or `player with`protection <#protection>`__ can’t be enchantedby Auras that have the statedquality. Such Auras attached to the`permanent <#permanent>`__ or`player <#player>`__ with`protection <#protection>`__ will be put intotheir owners»graveyards as a state-basedaction. (See rule`704 <#R704>`__, „State-BasedActions.”)

702.16d. A permanent <#permanent>`__with `protection can’t beequipped by Equipment that havethe stated quality or fortified by`Fortifications <#fortification>`__ that havethe stated quality. Such`Equipment <#equipment>`__ or`Fortifications <#fortification>`__`become <#becomes>`__ unattached from that`permanent <#permanent>`__ as a state-basedaction, but remain onthe battlefield. (See rule`704 <#R704>`__, „State-BasedActions.”)

702.16e. Any damage thatwould be dealt by sources that have the statedquality to a permanent or`player <#player>`__ with`protection <#protection>`__ is prevented.

702.16f. Attackingcreatures with`protection <#protection>`__ can’t be blocked by`creatures <#creature>`__ that have the statedquality.

702.16g. „Protection <#protection>`__from [quality A] and from [quality B]” isshorthand for „`protection from[quality A]” and „protection <#protection>`__from [quality B]”; it behaves as two separate`protection <#protection>`__`abilities. If an`effect <#effect>`__ causes an`object <#object>`__ with such an`ability <#ability>`__ to lose`protection <#protection>`__ from [quality A],for example, that object wouldstill have protection from[quality B].

702.16h. „Protection <#protection>`__from all[`characteristic]” isshorthand for „protection from[quality A],” „protection from[quality B],” and so on for each possiblequality the listed`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ couldhave; it behaves as multiple separate`protection <#protection>`__`abilities <#ability>`__. If an`effect <#effect>`__ causes an`object <#object>`__ with such an`ability <#ability>`__ to lose`protection <#protection>`__ from [quality A],for example, that object wouldstill have protection from[quality B], [quality C], and so on.

702.16i. „Protection <#protection>`__from each [set of`characteristics,qualities, or players]” isshorthand for „protection from[A],” „protection from [B],”and so on for each`characteristic <#characteristics>`__, quality,or player in the set. It behavesas multiple separate`protection <#protection>`__`abilities <#ability>`__.

702.16j. „Protection <#protection>`__from everything” is a `variant ofthe protection <#protection>`__`ability. A`permanent <#permanent>`__ with`protection <#protection>`__ from everything has`protection <#protection>`__ from each`object <#object>`__ regardless of that`object <#object>`__’s`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ values.Such a permanent can’t betargeted by spells or`abilities <#ability>`__, enchanted by`Auras <#aura>`__, equipped by`Equipment <#equipment>`__, fortified by`Fortifications <#fortification>`__, or blockedby creatures, and all`damage <#damage>`__ that would be dealt to itis prevented.

702.16k. „Protection <#protection>`__from [a `player]” is a`variant <#variant>`__ of the`protection <#protection>`__`ability <#ability>`__. A`permanent <#permanent>`__ with`protection <#protection>`__ from a specific`player <#player>`__ has`protection <#protection>`__ from each`object <#object>`__ the player <#player>`__`controls and`protection <#protection>`__ from each`object <#object>`__ the player <#player>`__owns not controlled by another`player, regardless of that`object <#object>`__’s`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ values.Such a permanent can’t betargeted by spells or`abilities <#ability>`__ the`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__, enchanted by`Auras <#aura>`__ the player <#player>`__`controls, equipped by`Equipment <#equipment>`__ the`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__, fortified by`Fortifications <#fortification>`__ the`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__, or blockedby creatures the`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__, and all`damage <#damage>`__ that would be dealt to itby sources controlled by the`player <#player>`__ or owned by the`player <#player>`__ but not controlled byanother player is prevented.

702.16m. Multiple instances of`protection <#protection>`__ from the samequality on the same permanent <#permanent>`__or `player are redundant.

702.16n. Some Auras bothgive the enchanted creature <#creature>`__`protection from a quality andsay „this effect doesn’t remove”either that specific Aura or all`Auras <#aura>`__. This means that the specified`Auras <#aura>`__ aren’t put into their`owners <#owner>`__» graveyards <#graveyard>`__as a `state-basedaction. If the`creature <#creature>`__ has other instances of`protection <#protection>`__ from the samequality, those instances affect`Auras <#aura>`__ as normal.

702.16p. One Aura <#aura>`__(Benevolent Blessing) gives the enchanted`creature <#creature>`__`protection from a quality andsays the effect doesn’t removecertain permanents that are”already attached to” that`creature <#creature>`__. This means that, whenthe protection <#protection>`__`effect starts to apply, any`objects <#object>`__ with the stated qualitythat are already attached to that`creature <#creature>`__ (including the`Aura <#aura>`__ giving that`creature <#creature>`__`protection <#protection>`__) will not be putinto their owners»graveyards as a state-basedaction. Other`permanents <#permanent>`__ with the statedquality can’t become attached tothe creature. If the`creature <#creature>`__ has other instances of`protection <#protection>`__ from the samequality, those instances affect attached`permanents <#permanent>`__ as normal.

702.17. Reach

702.17a. Reach is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.

702.17b. A creature <#creature>`__with `flying can’t be blockedexcept by creatures with`flying <#flying>`__ and/or reach.(See rule 509, „Declare BlockersStep,” and rule`702.9 <#R7029>`__, „Flying.”)

702.17c. Multiple instances of`reach <#reach>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.18. Shroud

702.18a. Shroud is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.”Shroud” means „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ or`player <#player>`__ can’t be the`target <#target>`__ of spells or`abilities <#ability>`__.”

702.18b. Multiple instances of`shroud <#shroud>`__ on the same`permanent <#permanent>`__ or`player <#player>`__ are redundant.

702.19. Trample

702.19a. Trample is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatmodifies the rules for assigning an attackingcreature’s combatdamage. The`ability <#ability>`__ has no`effect <#effect>`__ when a`creature <#creature>`__ with`trample <#trample>`__ is blocking or is dealingnoncombat damage. (See rule`510 <#R510>`__, „Combat DamageStep.”)

702.19b. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of an`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__with trample first assigns`damage <#damage>`__ to the`creature <#creature>`__(s) blocking it. Onceall those blockingcreatures are assigned`lethal damage <#lethal_damage>`__, any excessdamage is assigned as its`controller <#control_controller>`__ choosesamong those blockingcreatures and the`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ the`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking. Whenchecking for assigned lethaldamage, take into account`damage <#damage>`__ already marked on the`creature <#creature>`__ and`damage <#damage>`__ from other`creatures <#creature>`__ that’s being assigned`during <#during>`__ the same combat damagestep, but not any`abilities <#ability>`__ or`effects <#effect>`__ that might change theamount of damage that’s actuallydealt. The attackingcreature’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ need notassign lethal damage to allthose blockingcreatures but in thatcase can’t assign any damage tothe player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ it’s attacking.*Example: A2/2*creaturethatcanblockanadditionalcreatureblockstwoattackers: a 1/1 withnoabilitiesand a 3/3withtrample. Theactiveplayercould assign1damagefrom the firstattacker and 1damagefrom thesecond to theblockingcreature, and2damageto thedefendingplayerfromthecreaturewithtrample.**Example: A 6/6greencreaturewithtrampleisblocked by a2/2creaturewithprotectionfromgreen. Theattackingcreature«scontrollermustassign at least 2damagetothe blocker, even thoughthatdamagewill be preventedby theblocker’sprotectionability.Theattackingcreature«scontrollercandivide the rest ofthedamageas they choosebetween theblockingcreatureandthedefendingplayer.

702.19c. If an attackingcreature with`trample <#trample>`__ is blocked, but there areno creatures blocking it when`damage <#damage>`__ is assigned, all its`damage <#damage>`__ is assigned to the`player <#player>`__ or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ it’s attacking.

702.19d. If a creature <#creature>`__with `trample is attacking a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__, none of its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ can beassigned to the defendingplayer, even if that`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ has been`removed from combat <#removed_from_combat>`__or the damage the attackingcreature could assignis greater than the`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__’s`loyalty <#loyalty>`__.

702.19e. Multiple instances of`trample <#trample>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.20. Vigilance

702.20a. Vigilance isa static ability thatmodifies the rules for the declare attackersstep.

702.20b. Attacking doesn’t cause`creatures <#creature>`__ with`vigilance <#vigilance>`__ to tap.(See rule 508, „Declare AttackersStep.”)

702.20c. Multiple instances of`vigilance <#vigilance>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.21.`Banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__

702.21a.`Banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatmodifies the rules for combat.

702.21b. „Bands with other” is aspecial form of`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__. If an`effect <#effect>`__ causes a`permanent <#permanent>`__ to lose`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__, the`permanent <#permanent>`__ loses all „bands withother” abilities as well.

702.21c. As a player <#player>`__declares attackers, they may declare that one ormore `attackingcreatures with`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ and upto one attackingcreature without`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ (even ifit has „bands with other”) are all in a „band.”They may also declare that one or more attacking[quality] creatures with „bandswith other [quality]” and any number of otherattacking [quality] creatures <#creature>`__are all in a band. A `player maydeclare as many attacking bands as they want,but each creature may be amember of only one of them. (Defendingplayers can’t declarebands but may use`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ in adifferent way; see rule 702.21j.)

702.21d. All creatures <#creature>`__in an attacking band must `attack <#attack>`__the same `player or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__.

702.21e. Once an attacking band hasbeen announced, it lasts for the rest of combat,even if something later removes`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ or”bands with other” from one or more of the`creatures <#creature>`__ in the band.

702.21f. An attackingcreature that’s`removed from combat <#removed_from_combat>`__is also`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from the band it was in.

702.21g.`Banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ doesn’tcause attackingcreatures to share`abilities <#ability>`__, nor does it remove any`abilities <#ability>`__. The attackingcreatures in a band areseparate permanents.

702.21h. If an attackingcreature <#attacking_creature>`__`becomes blocked by a`creature <#creature>`__, each other`creature <#creature>`__ in the same band as the`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked by that same`blocking creature <#blocking_creature>`__.*Example:A*playerattackswitha band consisting ofacreaturewithflyingandacreaturewithswampwalk.Thedefendingplayer,whocontrolsaSwamp,canblocktheflyingcreatureifable. If they do, thenthecreaturewithswampwalkwillalsobecomeblocked bytheblockingcreature(s).

702.21i. If one member of a band would`become <#becomes>`__ blocked due to an`effect <#effect>`__, the entire band`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked.

702.21j. During the`combat damage step <#combat_damage_step>`__, ifan attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__is being blocked by a `creature <#creature>`__with `banding, orby both a [quality] creature <#creature>`__with „bands with other [quality]” and another[quality] `creature, the`defending player <#defending_player>`__ (ratherthan the active player)chooses how the attackingcreature’s`damage <#damage>`__ is assigned. That`player <#player>`__ can divide that`creature <#creature>`__’s combatdamage as they choose amongany creatures blocking it. Thisis an exception to the procedure described inrule 510.1c.

702.21k. During the`combat damage step <#combat_damage_step>`__, ifa blocking creature isblocking a creature with`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__, or botha [quality] creature with „bandswith other [quality]” and another [quality]`creature <#creature>`__, the activeplayer (rather than the`defending player <#defending_player>`__)chooses how the blockingcreature’s`damage <#damage>`__ is assigned. That`player <#player>`__ can divide that`creature <#creature>`__’s combatdamage as they choose amongany creatures it’s blocking.This is an exception to the procedure describedin rule 510.1d.

702.21m. Multiple instances of`banding <#banding_bands_with_other>`__ on thesame creature are redundant.Multiple instances of „bands with other” of thesame kind on the same `creature <#creature>`__are redundant.

702.22. Rampage

702.22a. Rampage is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Rampage N” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__blocked, it gets +N/+N until end of turn foreach `creature blocking it beyondthe first.” (See rule 509, „DeclareBlockers Step.”)

702.22b. The rampage <#rampage>`__bonus is calculated only once per combat, whenthe `triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__`resolves. Adding or removingblockers later in combat won’t change the bonus.

702.22c. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`rampage, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.23. CumulativeUpkeep

702.23a. Cumulativeupkeep is a triggeredability that imposes anincreasing cost on a`permanent <#permanent>`__. „Cumulativeupkeep <#cumulative_upkeep>`__[`cost]” means „At the beginning of`your <#you_your>`__ upkeep, if this`permanent <#permanent>`__ is on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, put an age`counter <#counter>`__ on this`permanent <#permanent>`__. Then`you <#you_your>`__ may pay <#pay>`__[`cost] for each age`counter <#counter>`__ on it. If`you <#you_your>`__ don’t,`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ it.” If[cost] has choices associated withit, each choice is made separately for each age`counter <#counter>`__, then either the entireset of costs is paid, or none ofthem is paid. Partial payments aren’t allowed.*Example: A*creaturehas”Cumulativeupkeep{W} or {U}” andtwo agecounterson it. Whenitsabilitynexttriggersandresolves,thecreature«scontrollerputsan agecounteron it and thenmaypay{W}{W}{W}, {W}{W}{U},{W}{U}{U}, or {U}{U}{U} to keepthecreatureonthebattlefield.**Example: Acreaturehas”Cumulativeupkeep–Sacrificeacreature„and one agecounteron it.Whenitsabilitynexttriggersandresolves,itscontrollercan’tchoose thesamecreaturetosacrificetwice.Either twodifferentcreaturesmust besacrificed, orthecreaturewithcumulativeupkeepmust besacrificed.

702.23b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of cumulativeupkeep, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately. However, theage counters are not connected toany particular ability; each`cumulative upkeep <#cumulative_upkeep>`__`ability <#ability>`__ will count the totalnumber of age counters on the`permanent <#permanent>`__ at the time that`ability <#ability>`__ resolves.*Example: A*creaturehas twoinstances of „Cumulativeupkeep–Pay1life.”Thecreaturehas noagecounters, andbothcumulativeupkeepabilitiestrigger.When thefirstabilityresolves,thecontrolleraddsacounterand then choosestopay1life.When thesecondabilityresolves,thecontrolleraddsanothercounterand thenchooses topayan additional2life.

702.24. Flanking

702.24a. Flanking is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ that`triggers <#trigger>`__ during the`declare blockersstep <#declare_blockers_step>`__. (See rule`509 <#R509>`__, „Declare BlockersStep.”)”Flanking” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__blocked by a `creature without`flanking <#flanking>`__, the blockingcreature gets -1/-1until end of turn.”

702.24b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`flanking, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.25. Phasing

702.25a. Phasing is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatmodifies the rules of the untapstep. During each`player <#player>`__’s untapstep, before the activeplayer untaps <#untap>`__`permanents, all phased-in`permanents <#permanent>`__ with`phasing <#phasing>`__ that player <#player>`__`controls”phase out.” Simultaneously, allphased-out permanents that had`phased out <#phased_in_phased_out>`__ underthat player’s`control <#control_controller>`__”phase in.”

702.25b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ phases <#phase>`__out, its `status changes to”phased out.” Exceptfor rules and effects thatspecifically mention phased-out`permanents <#permanent>`__, a phased-out`permanent <#permanent>`__ is treated asthough it does not exist. Itcan’t affect or be affected by anything else inthe game. A permanent that`phases <#phase>`__ out is removed fromcombat. (See rule`506.4 <#R5064>`__.)*Example:`You <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__*threecreatures,one of which isphasedout.Youcastaspellthatsays”Drawacardforeachcreatureyoucontrol.”Youdrawtwocards.**Example:Youcontrolaphased-outcreature.Youcastaspellthatsays”Destroyallcreatures.”The phased-outcreatureisnot destroyed.

702.25c. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ phases <#phase>`__in, its `status changes to „phasedin.” The game onceagain treats it as though itexists.

702.25d. The phasing <#phasing>`__`event doesn’t actually cause a`permanent <#permanent>`__ to change`zones <#zone>`__ or`control <#control_controller>`__, even thoughit’s treated as though it’s noton the battlefield and notunder its controller’s`control <#control_controller>`__ while it’s`phased out <#phased_in_phased_out>`__.`Zone-change triggers <#zone-change_triggers>`__don’t trigger when a`permanent <#permanent>`__ phases <#phase>`__in or out. `Tokens continue to existon the battlefield while`phased out <#phased_in_phased_out>`__.`Counters <#counter>`__ remain on a`permanent <#permanent>`__ while it’s phasedout.`Effects <#effect>`__ that check a phased-in`permanent <#permanent>`__’s history won’t treatthe phasing event ashaving caused the permanent toleave or enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ or its`controller <#control_controller>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__.

702.25e. If a continuouseffect generated by theresolution of a spell or`ability <#ability>`__ modifies the`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ orchanges the controller <#control_controller>`__of any `objects, a phased-out`permanent <#permanent>`__ won’t be included inthe set of affected objects. Thisincludes continuouseffects that referencethe permanent specifically,`unless <#unless>`__ they also specificallyrefer to the permanent as`phased out <#phased_in_phased_out>`__.

702.25f. Continuouseffects that affect aphased-out permanent may expirewhile that permanent is phasedout. If so, they willno longer affect that permanent <#permanent>`__once it’s `phased in.In particular, effects with „foras long as” durations that track that`permanent <#permanent>`__ (see rule`611.2b <#R6112b>`__) end when that`permanent <#permanent>`__ `phases <#phase>`__out because they can no longer see it.

702.25g. When a`permanent <#permanent>`__ phases <#phase>`__out, any `Auras,`Equipment <#equipment>`__, or`Fortifications <#fortification>`__ attached tothat permanent <#permanent>`__`phase out at the same time. Thisalternate way of phasing out isknown as phasing out”indirectly.” An Aura,`Equipment <#equipment>`__, or`Fortification <#fortification>`__ that phasedout indirectly won’t`phase <#phase>`__ in by itself, but`instead <#instead>`__ phases inalong with the permanent it’sattached to.

702.25h. If an object <#object>`__would simultaneously `phase outdirectly and indirectly, it just`phases <#phase>`__ out indirectly.

702.25i. An Aura,`Equipment <#equipment>`__, or`Fortification <#fortification>`__ that phasedout directly will`phase <#phase>`__ in attached to the`object <#object>`__ or player itwas attached to when it phasedout, if that`object <#object>`__ is still in the same`zone <#zone>`__ or that player isstill in the game. If not, that`Aura <#aura>`__, Equipment, or`Fortification <#fortification>`__`phases <#phase>`__ in unattached. State-basedactions apply asappropriate. (See rules 704.5m and`704.5n <#R7045n>`__.)

702.25j. Abilities that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when a`permanent <#permanent>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ attached or unattachedfrom an object or`player <#player>`__ don’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ when that`permanent <#permanent>`__ `phases <#phase>`__in or out.

702.25k. Phased-out`permanents <#permanent>`__ owned by a`player <#player>`__ who leaves the game alsoleave the game. This doesn’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ zone-changetriggers. See rule`800.4 <#R8004>`__.

702.25m. If an effect <#effect>`__causes a `player to`skip <#skip>`__ their untapstep, the`phasing <#phasing>`__ event simplydoesn’t occur that turn.

702.25n. In a multiplayergame, game rules maycause a phased-out permanent toleave the game or to be exiled once a`player <#player>`__ leaves the game. (See rules`800.4a <#R8004a>`__ and 800.4c.)If a phased-out permanent <#permanent>`__`phased out under the`control <#control_controller>`__ of a`player <#player>`__ who has left the game, that`permanent <#permanent>`__ phases <#phase>`__in `during the next untapstep after that`player <#player>`__’s next turn would havebegun.

702.25p. Multiple instances of`phasing <#phasing>`__ on the same`permanent <#permanent>`__ are redundant.

702.26. Buyback

702.26a. Buyback appearson some instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__. It represents two`static abilities <#static_ability>`__ thatfunction while the spell is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Buyback <#buyback>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `pay an additional[cost] as you <#you_your>`__`cast this spell” and”If the buyback cost <#cost>`__was paid, put this `spell into its`owner <#owner>`__’s hand <#hand>`__`instead of into that`player <#player>`__’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ as it`resolves <#resolve>`__.” Paying a`spell <#spell>`__’s buyback <#buyback>`__`cost follows the rules for paying`additional costs <#additional_cost>`__ in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.27. Shadow

702.27a. Shadow is an`evasion ability <#evasion_ability>`__.

702.27b. A creature <#creature>`__with `shadow can’t be blocked by`creatures <#creature>`__ without`shadow <#shadow>`__, and a`creature <#creature>`__ without`shadow <#shadow>`__ can’t be blocked by`creatures <#creature>`__ with`shadow <#shadow>`__. (See rule 509,”Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.27c. Multiple instances of`shadow <#shadow>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.28. Cycling

702.28a. Cycling is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ thatfunctions only while the card with`cycling <#cycling>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand.”Cycling [cost]”means „[Cost],`Discard <#discard>`__ this card:Draw a card.”

702.28b. Although the`cycling <#cycling>`__ ability <#ability>`__can be activated only if the `card isin a player’s hand, itcontinues to exist while the`object <#object>`__ is on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ and in all other`zones <#zone>`__. Therefore`objects <#object>`__ with`cycling <#cycling>`__ will be affected by`effects <#effect>`__ that depend on`objects <#object>`__ having one or more`activated abilities <#activated_ability>`__.

702.28c. Some cards with`cycling <#cycling>`__ have`abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when they’re cycled.”When you cycle [this`card <#card>`__]” means „When`you <#you_your>`__ discard [this`card <#card>`__] to pay an`activation cost <#activation_cost>`__ of a`cycling <#cycling>`__ ability.”These abilities <#ability>`__`trigger from whatever`zone <#zone>`__ the card winds upin after it’s cycled.

702.28d. Some cards have`abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ whenever a`player <#player>`__ „cycles or`discards <#discard>`__” a card.These abilities <#ability>`__`trigger only once when a`card <#card>`__ is cycled.

702.28e. Typecycling <#typecycling>`__is a `variant of the`cycling <#cycling>`__ ability.”[Type]cycling <#cycling>`__[`cost]” means „[Cost],`Discard <#discard>`__ this card:Search your <#you_your>`__`library for a [type]`card <#card>`__, reveal it, andput it into your <#you_your>`__`hand. Then shuffle <#shuffle>`__`your library.”This type is usually a`subtype <#subtype>`__ (as in”mountaincycling”) butcan be any card type,`subtype <#subtype>`__,`supertype <#supertype>`__, or combinationthereof (as in „basiclandcycling”).

702.28f. Typecycling <#typecycling>`__`abilities are`cycling <#cycling>`__ abilities,and typecycling <#typecycling>`__`costs are cycling <#cycling>`__`costs. Any cards that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when a`player <#player>`__ cycles a card <#card>`__will `trigger when a`card <#card>`__ is discarded to pay <#pay>`__an `activation cost of a`typecycling <#typecycling>`__`ability <#ability>`__. Any effect <#effect>`__that stops `players from`cycling <#cycling>`__ cards willstop players from activating`cards <#card>`__»typecycling <#typecycling>`__`abilities. Any`effect <#effect>`__ that increases or reduces a`cycling <#cycling>`__ cost willincrease or reduce a`typecycling <#typecycling>`__ cost.Any effect that looks for a`card <#card>`__ with cycling <#cycling>`__will find a `card with`typecycling <#typecycling>`__.

702.29. Echo

702.29a. Echo is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Echo [cost]” means „Atthe beginning of your upkeep, ifthis permanent came under`your <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__ since thebeginning of your last upkeep,`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ it`unless <#unless>`__ you <#you_your>`__`pay [cost].”

702.29b. Urza block <#block>`__`cards with the echo <#echo>`__`ability were printed without an`echo <#echo>`__ cost. These`cards <#card>`__ have been given errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference;each one now has an echo <#echo>`__`cost equal to its manacost.

702.30.`Horsemanship <#horsemanship>`__

702.30a.`Horsemanship <#horsemanship>`__ is an evasionability.

702.30b. A creature <#creature>`__with `horsemanship can’t beblocked by creatures without`horsemanship <#horsemanship>`__. A`creature <#creature>`__ with`horsemanship <#horsemanship>`__ can`block <#block>`__ a creature <#creature>`__with or without`horsemanship. (See rule`509 <#R509>`__, „Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.30c. Multiple instances of`horsemanship <#horsemanship>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.31. Fading

702.31a. Fading is akeyword that represents two`abilities <#ability>`__. „Fading <#fading>`__N” means „This `permanent <#permanent>`__`enters thebattlefield with Nfade counters on it” and „At thebeginning of your upkeep, removea fade counter from this`permanent <#permanent>`__. If`you <#you_your>`__ can’t,`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ the`permanent <#permanent>`__.”

702.32. Kicker

702.32a. Kicker isa static ability thatfunctions while the spell with`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `pay an additional[cost] as you <#you_your>`__`cast this spell.”Paying a spell’s`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__`cost <#cost>`__(s) follows the rules forpaying additional costs <#additional_cost>`__in rules `601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.32b. The phrase”Kicker [cost <#cost>`__1] and/or [`cost 2]” means the samething as „Kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__[`cost 1],`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__ [`cost <#cost>`__2].”

702.32c. Multikicker <#multikicker>`__is a `variant of the`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__`ability <#ability>`__.”Multikicker <#multikicker>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `pay an additional[cost] any number of times as`you <#you_your>`__ cast this`spell <#spell>`__.” A`multikicker <#multikicker>`__ cost <#cost>`__is a `kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__`cost.

702.32d. If a spell’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ declaresthe intention to pay any of that`spell <#spell>`__’s kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__`costs, that spell hasbeen „kicked.” If a`spell <#spell>`__ has two`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__ costs orhas multikicker, it may be`kicked <#kicker_kicked>`__ multiple times. Seerule 601.2b.

702.32e. Objects with`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__ or`multikicker <#multikicker>`__ have additional`abilities <#ability>`__ that specify whathappens if they are kicked.These abilities are linked to the`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__ or`multikicker <#multikicker>`__`abilities <#ability>`__ printed on that`object <#object>`__: they can refer only tothose specific kicker or`multikicker <#multikicker>`__`abilities <#ability>`__. See rule`607 <#R607>`__, „LinkedAbilities.”

702.32f. Objects withmore than one kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__`cost have abilities <#ability>`__that each correspond to a specific`kicker cost.They contain the phrases „if it was`kicked <#kicker_kicked>`__ with its [A]`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__” and „if it was`kicked <#kicker_kicked>`__ with its [B]`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__,” where A and B arethe first and second kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__`costs listed on the`card <#card>`__, respectively. Each of those`abilities <#ability>`__ is linked to theappropriate kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__`ability.

702.32g. If part of a`spell <#spell>`__’s ability hasits effect only if that`spell <#spell>`__ was`kicked <#kicker_kicked>`__, and that part ofthe ability includes anytargets, the`spell <#spell>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ choosesthose targets only if that`spell <#spell>`__ was`kicked <#kicker_kicked>`__. Otherwise, the`spell <#spell>`__ is cast as if itdid not have those targets. Seerule 601.2c.

702.33. Flashback

702.33a. Flashback <#flashback>`__appears on some `instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__. It represents two`static abilities <#static_ability>`__: one thatfunctions while the card is in a`player <#player>`__’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ and another thatfunctions while the card is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Flashback <#flashback>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `cast this card from`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard <#graveyard>`__if the resulting `spell is an`instant <#instant>`__ or sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell by paying [cost]rather than paying its manacost” and „If the`flashback <#flashback>`__ cost waspaid, exile this card <#card>`__`instead of putting it anywhereelse any time it would leave the`stack <#stack>`__.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ using its`flashback <#flashback>`__`ability <#ability>`__ follows the rules forpaying alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__in rules `601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.34. Madness

702.34a. Madness is akeyword that represents two`abilities <#ability>`__. The first is a staticability that functionswhile the card with`madness <#madness>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand. Thesecond is a triggeredability that functionswhen the first ability isapplied. „Madness <#madness>`__[`cost]” means „If a`player <#player>`__ would`discard <#discard>`__ this card,that player <#player>`__`discards it, but`exiles <#exile>`__ it instead ofputting it into their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__” and „When this`card <#card>`__ is exiled this way, its`owner <#owner>`__ may cast it bypaying [cost] rather than paying its`mana cost <#mana_cost>`__. If that`player <#player>`__ doesn’t, they put this`card <#card>`__ into their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”

702.34b. Casting a spell <#spell>`__using its `madness <#madness>`__`ability follows the rules forpaying alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__in rules `601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.34c. After resolving a`madness <#madness>`__ triggeredability, if the exiled`card <#card>`__ wasn’t cast and wasmoved to a public zone,`effects <#effect>`__ referencing the discarded`card <#card>`__ can find that card.See rule 400.7i.

702.35. Fear

702.35a. Fear is an`evasion ability <#evasion_ability>`__.

702.35b. A creature <#creature>`__with `fear can’t be blocked except by`artifact creatures <#artifact_creature>`__and/or black creatures. (Seerule 509, „Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.35c. Multiple instances of`fear <#fear>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.36. Morph

702.36a. Morph is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions in any zone from which`you <#you_your>`__ could play the`card <#card>`__ it’s on, and the`morph <#morph>`__ effect worksany time the card is facedown. „Morph <#morph>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `cast this card as a2/2 face-down creature with notext, no name, no`subtypes <#subtype>`__, and no manacost by paying {3} rather thanpaying its mana cost.” (Seerule 707, „Face-Down`Spells <#spell>`__ and`Permanents <#permanent>`__.”)

702.36b. Megamorph isa variant of the`morph <#morph>`__ ability.”Megamorph [cost]”means „You may cast <#cast>`__this `card as a 2/2 face-down`creature <#creature>`__ with no text, no`name <#name>`__, no subtypes,and no mana cost by paying {3}rather than paying its manacost” and „As this`permanent <#permanent>`__ is turned faceup, put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on it if its`megamorph <#megamorph>`__ cost waspaid to turn it face up.” A`megamorph <#megamorph>`__ cost is a`morph <#morph>`__ cost.

702.36c. To cast a`card <#card>`__ using its morph <#morph>`__`ability, turn it facedown. It becomes <#becomes>`__a 2/2 face-down `creature <#creature>`__`card with no text, no`name <#name>`__, no subtypes,and no mana cost. Any`effects <#effect>`__ or prohibitions that wouldapply to casting a card with these`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ (and notthe face-up card’s`characteristics <#characteristics>`__) areapplied to casting this card. Thesevalues are the copiablevalues of that`object <#object>`__’s`characteristics <#characteristics>`__. (Seerule 613, „Interaction of`Continuous Effects <#continuous_effect>`__,”and rule 706, „Copying`Objects <#object>`__.”) Put it onto the`stack <#stack>`__ (as a face-down`spell <#spell>`__ with the same`characteristics <#characteristics>`__), and`pay <#pay>`__ {3} rather than pay <#pay>`__its `mana cost. This follows therules for paying alternativecosts.`You <#you_your>`__ can use a morph <#morph>`__`ability to cast a`card <#card>`__ from any zone fromwhich you could normally`play <#play>`__ it. When the spell <#spell>`__`resolves, it enters thebattlefield withthe same characteristics <#characteristics>`__the `spell had. The`morph <#morph>`__ effect appliesto the face-down object whereverit is, and it ends when the`permanent <#permanent>`__ is turned faceup.

702.36d. You can’tnormally cast a card <#card>`__`face down. A morph <#morph>`__`ability allows`you <#you_your>`__ to do so.

702.36e. Any time you <#you_your>`__have `priority,`you <#you_your>`__ may turn a face-down`permanent <#permanent>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control with a`morph <#morph>`__ ability faceup. This is a specialaction; it doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__ (see rule 116).To do this, show all players whatthe permanent’s`morph <#morph>`__ cost would be ifit were face up, pay <#pay>`__that `cost, then turn the`permanent <#permanent>`__ faceup. (If the`permanent <#permanent>`__ wouldn’t have a`morph <#morph>`__ cost if it were`face up <#face_up>`__, it can’t be turned faceup this way.) The`morph <#morph>`__ effect on itends, and it regains its normal`characteristics <#characteristics>`__. Any`abilities <#ability>`__ relating to the`permanent <#permanent>`__ entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ don’t`trigger <#trigger>`__ when it’s turned faceup and don’t have any`effect <#effect>`__, because the`permanent <#permanent>`__ has already enteredthe battlefield.

702.36f. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__’s morph <#morph>`__`cost includes X, other`abilities <#ability>`__ of that`permanent <#permanent>`__ may also refer to`X <#x>`__. The value of X in those`abilities <#ability>`__ is equal to the valueof X chosen as the morph <#morph>`__`special action was taken.

702.36g. See rule 707,”Face-Down Spells and`Permanents <#permanent>`__,” for moreinformation about how to cast <#cast>`__`cards with a morph <#morph>`__`ability.

702.37. Amplify

702.37a. Amplify is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.”Amplify N” means „As this`object <#object>`__ enters thebattlefield,`reveal <#reveal>`__ any number of`cards <#card>`__ from your <#you_your>`__`hand that share a creaturetype with it. This`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield with N+1/+1 counters on it for each`card <#card>`__ revealed this way.`You <#you_your>`__ can’t reveal <#reveal>`__this `card or any other`cards <#card>`__ that are entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ at the same timeas this card.”

702.37b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`amplify, each one worksseparately.

702.38. Provoke

702.38a. Provoke is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Provoke” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ attacks,`you <#you_your>`__ may choose to have`target <#target>`__ creature <#creature>`__`defending player <#defending_player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__`block this creature <#creature>`__this combat if able. If `you do,`untap <#untap>`__ that`creature <#creature>`__.”

702.38b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`provoke, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.39. Storm

702.39a. Storm is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ thatfunctions on the stack.”Storm” means „When`you <#you_your>`__ cast this`spell <#spell>`__, copy it for eachother spell that was`cast <#cast>`__ before it this turn. If the`spell <#spell>`__ has anytargets, you <#you_your>`__may choose new `targets for any ofthe copies.”

702.39b. If a spell hasmultiple instances of storm, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.40. Affinity

702.40a. Affinity is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the spell with`affinity <#affinity>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Affinity <#affinity>`__for [text]” means „This `spell <#spell>`__`costs you {1} lessto cast for each [text]`you <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__.”

702.40b. If a spell hasmultiple instances of affinity,each of them applies.

702.41. Entwine

702.41a. Entwine is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ of`modal <#modal_mode>`__ spells (seerule 700.2) that functions whilethe spell is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Entwine <#entwine>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may choose all `modes of this`spell <#spell>`__ instead ofjust the number specified. If`you <#you_your>`__ do, you <#you_your>`__`pay an additional[cost].” Using the`entwine <#entwine>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for choosing`modes and paying additionalcosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.41b. If the entwine <#entwine>`__`cost was paid, follow the text ofeach of the modes in the orderwritten on the card when the`spell <#spell>`__ resolves.

702.42. Modular

702.42a. Modular <#modular>`__represents both a `staticability and a triggeredability.”Modular N” means „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield with N+1/+1 counters on it” and „Whenthis permanent is put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`you <#you_your>`__ may put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on target <#target>`__`artifact creature foreach +1/+1 counter on this`permanent <#permanent>`__.”

702.42b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`modular, each one worksseparately.

702.43. Sunburst

702.43a. Sunburst is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions as an object is enteringthe battlefield.”Sunburst” means „If this`object <#object>`__ is entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ as a`creature <#creature>`__, ignoring any`type-changingeffects <#type-changing_effect>`__ that wouldaffect it, it enters thebattlefield with a+1/+1 counter on it for each`color <#color>`__ of mana spent to`cast <#cast>`__ it. Otherwise, it enters thebattlefield with acharge counter on it for each`color <#color>`__ of mana spent to`cast <#cast>`__ it.”

702.43b. Sunburst adds`counters <#counter>`__ only if the`object <#object>`__ with`sunburst <#sunburst>`__ is entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ from the`stack <#stack>`__ as a resolving`spell <#spell>`__ and only if one or morecolored mana was spent on its`costs <#cost>`__, including additional or`alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__.

702.43c. Sunburst canalso be used to set a variable number foranother ability. If the keywordis used in this way, it doesn’t matter whetherthe ability is on a`creature <#creature>`__ spell oron a noncreature spell. Example:Theability„Modular–Sunburst„means”Thispermanententers thebattlefieldwitha +1/+1counteron it foreachcolorofmanaspenttocastit” and „Whenthispermanentis put intoagraveyardfromthebattlefield,youmayput a+1/+1counterontargetartifactcreaturefor each+1/+1counteronthispermanent.”

702.43d. If an object hasmultiple instances of sunburst,each one works separately.

702.44. Bushido

702.44a. Bushido is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Bushido N” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ blocks or`becomes <#becomes>`__ blocked, it gets +N/+Nuntil end of turn.” (See rule 509,”Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.44b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`bushido, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.45. Soulshift

702.45a. Soulshift isa triggered ability.”Soulshift N” means „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ is put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`you <#you_your>`__ may return`target <#target>`__ Spirit card <#card>`__with `converted manacost N or less from`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard <#graveyard>`__to `your hand.”

702.45b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of soulshift, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.46. Splice

702.46a. Splice is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while a card is in`your <#you_your>`__ hand.”Splice onto [quality][cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `reveal this card <#card>`__from `your hand as`you <#you_your>`__ cast a [quality]`spell <#spell>`__. If you do,that spell gains the text of this`card <#card>`__’s rules text <#rules_text>`__and `you pay <#pay>`__[`cost] as an additionalcost to cast <#cast>`__that `spell.” Paying a`card <#card>`__’s splice <#splice>`__`cost follows the rules for paying`additional costs <#additional_cost>`__ in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.*Example: Sincethe*cardwithspliceremainsintheplayer«shand,it can later becastnormally orspliced onto anotherspell. Itcan even be discarded topaya”discardacard„costofthespellit’s spliced onto.

702.46b. You can’tchoose to use a splice <#splice>`__`ability if you <#you_your>`__can’t make the required choices(`targets, etc.) for that`card <#card>`__’s rules text.`You <#you_your>`__ can’t splice <#splice>`__any one `card onto the same`spell <#spell>`__ more than once. If`you <#you_your>`__’re splicing more than one`card <#card>`__ onto a spell,`reveal <#reveal>`__ them all at once and choosethe order in which their effects <#effect>`__will happen. The `effects of themain spell must happen first.

702.46c. The spell has the`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ of themain spell, plus the rulestext of each of the spliced`cards <#card>`__. This is a text-changingeffect (see rule`612 <#R612>`__, „Text-ChangingEffects”). The`spell <#spell>`__ doesn’t gain any other`characteristics <#characteristics>`__(name, mana cost,`color <#color>`__, supertypes,`card types <#card_type>`__,`subtypes <#subtype>`__, etc.) of the spliced`cards <#card>`__. Text gained by the`spell <#spell>`__ that refers to a`card <#card>`__ by name refers tothe spell on the`stack <#stack>`__, not the card <#card>`__from which the text was copied. *Example:Glacial Ray is ared*`cardwithspliceontoArcane that reads, „GlacialRaydeals2damagetoanytarget.” Suppose Glacial Rayis spliced ontoReachThroughMists, a bluespell.Thespellis still blue,andReachThroughMistsdealsthedamage.This means thattheabilitycantargetacreaturewithprotectionfromredanddeal2damagetothatcreature.

702.46d. Choose targets <#target>`__for the added text normally (see rule`601.2c). Note that a`spell <#spell>`__ with one or more`targets <#target>`__ won’t`resolve <#resolve>`__ if all of its`targets <#target>`__ are illegal on resolution.

702.46e. The spell losesany splice changes once it leavesthe stack for any reason.

702.47. Offering

702.47a. Offering is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the spell with`offering <#offering>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „[Subtype]`offering <#offering>`__” means „As an`additional cost <#additional_cost>`__ to`cast <#cast>`__ this spell,`you <#you_your>`__ may`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ a[subtype]`permanent <#permanent>`__. If`you <#you_your>`__ chose to pay the`additional cost <#additional_cost>`__, this`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost is reduced by thesacrificed permanent’s manacost, and you <#you_your>`__may `cast this spell anytime you could cast <#cast>`__an `instant.”

702.47b. You choosewhich permanent to`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ as`you <#you_your>`__ make choices for the`spell <#spell>`__ (see rule`601.2b <#R6012b>`__), and you <#you_your>`__`sacrifice that`permanent <#permanent>`__ as`you <#you_your>`__ pay the totalcost (see rule`601.2h <#R6012h>`__).

702.47c. Genericmana in the sacrificed`permanent <#permanent>`__’s manacost reduces genericmana in the`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost. Colored and`colorless <#colorless>`__ mana inthe sacrificed permanent’s`mana cost <#mana_cost>`__ reduces`mana <#mana>`__ of the same type in`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost, and any excess reducesthat much generic mana in`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost. (See rule`118.7 <#R1187>`__.)

702.48. Ninjutsu

702.48a. Ninjutsu is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ thatfunctions only while the card with`ninjutsu <#ninjutsu>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand.”Ninjutsu [cost]”means „[Cost], Reveal <#reveal>`__this `card from your <#you_your>`__`hand, Return an unblocked attackingcreature <#attacking_creature>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control to its`owner <#owner>`__’s hand: Put this`card <#card>`__ onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ from`your <#you_your>`__ hand <#hand>`__`tapped and attacking.”

702.48b. The card with`ninjutsu <#ninjutsu>`__ remains revealed fromthe time the ability is announceduntil the ability leaves the`stack <#stack>`__.

702.48c. A ninjutsu <#ninjutsu>`__`ability may be activated onlywhile a creature on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ is unblocked (seerule 509.1h). The`creature <#creature>`__ with`ninjutsu <#ninjutsu>`__ is put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ unblocked.
