Itwill be attacking the same player <#player>`__or `planeswalker as the`creature <#creature>`__ that was returned toits owner’s hand.

702.48d. Commanderninjutsu is a`variant <#variant>`__ of the`ninjutsu <#ninjutsu>`__ ability <#ability>`__that also functions while the `card <#card>`__with `commanderninjutsu is in the`command <#command>`__ zone.”Commander ninjutsu <#commander_ninjutsu>`__[`cost]” means „[Cost],`Reveal <#reveal>`__ this card from`your <#you_your>`__ hand or fromthe command zone,Return an unblocked attackingcreature <#attacking_creature>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control to its`owner <#owner>`__’s hand: Put this`card <#card>`__ onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__`tapped <#tapped>`__ and attacking.”

702.49. Epic

702.49a. Epic representstwo spell abilities, one ofwhich creates a delayed triggeredability.”Epic” means „For the rest of thegame, you can’t cast <#cast>`__`spells,” and „At the beginning ofeach of your upkeeps for therest of the game, copy this`spell <#spell>`__ except for its`epic <#epic>`__ ability. If the`spell <#spell>`__ has anytargets, you <#you_your>`__may choose new `targets for the`copy <#copy>`__.” See rule`706.10 <#R70610>`__.

702.49b. A player can’t`cast <#cast>`__ spells once a`spell <#spell>`__ with epic they`control <#control_controller>`__`resolves <#resolve>`__, but`effects <#effect>`__ (such as the`epic <#epic>`__ ability itself)can still put copies of`spells <#spell>`__ onto the stack.

702.50. Convoke

702.50a. Convoke is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the spell with`convoke <#convoke>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Convoke”means „For each colored mana in this`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost, you may`tap <#tap>`__ an untapped <#untapped>`__`creature of that`color <#color>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control rather than`pay <#pay>`__ that mana. For each`generic mana <#generic_mana>`__ in this`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost, you may`tap <#tap>`__ an untapped <#untapped>`__`creature you <#you_your>`__`control rather than`pay <#pay>`__ that mana.”

702.50b. The convoke <#convoke>`__`ability isn’t an additional or`alternative cost <#alternative_cost>`__ andapplies only after the totalcost of the spell <#spell>`__with `convoke is determined.*Example: Heartless Summoning says, in part,”`Creature <#creature>`__`spells <#spell>`__`you <#you_your>`__`cast <#cast>`__`cost <#cost>`__*{2}lesstocast.”YoucontrolHeartlessSummoning andcastSiege Wurm,aspellwithconvokethatcosts{5}{G}{G}.ThetotalcosttocastSiegeWurm is {3}{G}{G}. After activatingmanaabilities,youpaythattotalcost.Youmaytapupto two greencreaturesandup to threeothercreaturestopaythatcost,and the remainder is paidwithmana.

702.50c. A creature <#creature>`__`tapped to pay for`mana <#mana>`__ in a spell’s`total cost <#total_cost>`__ this way is said tohave „convoked” that spell.

702.50d. Multiple instances of`convoke <#convoke>`__ on the same`spell <#spell>`__ are redundant.

702.51. Dredge

702.51a. Dredge is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions only while the card with`dredge <#dredge>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Dredge N” means „As long as`you <#you_your>`__ have at least N`cards <#card>`__ in your <#you_your>`__`library, if you <#you_your>`__would `draw a card,`you <#you_your>`__ may instead <#instead>`__`mill N cards and returnthis card from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard to`your <#you_your>`__ hand.”

702.51b. A player withfewer cards in their`library <#library>`__ than the number requiredby a dredge ability <#ability>`__can’t `mill any of them this way.

702.52. Transmute

702.52a. Transmute isan activated ability <#activated_ability>`__that functions only while the `card <#card>`__with `transmute is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand.”Transmute [cost]”means „[Cost],`Discard <#discard>`__ this card:Search your <#you_your>`__`library for a card <#card>`__with the same `converted manacost as the discarded`card <#card>`__, reveal that`card <#card>`__, and put it into`your <#you_your>`__ hand. Then`shuffle <#shuffle>`__ your <#you_your>`__`library. Activate <#activate>`__this `ability only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.52b. Although the`transmute <#transmute>`__`ability <#ability>`__ can be activated only ifthe card is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand, itcontinues to exist while the`object <#object>`__ is on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ and in all other`zones <#zone>`__. Therefore`objects <#object>`__ with`transmute <#transmute>`__ will be affected by`effects <#effect>`__ that depend on`objects <#object>`__ having one or more`activated abilities <#activated_ability>`__.

702.53. Bloodthirst

702.53a. Bloodthirst <#bloodthirst>`__is a `static ability.”Bloodthirst N” means „If an`opponent <#opponent>`__ was dealt`damage <#damage>`__ this turn, this`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield with N+1/+1 counters on it.”

702.53b.”Bloodthirst X” is aspecial form of bloodthirst.”Bloodthirst X”means „This permanent entersthe battlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__with `X +1/+1 counters onit, where X is the total`damage <#damage>`__ your <#you_your>`__`opponents have been dealt thisturn.”

702.53c. If an object hasmultiple instances of`bloodthirst <#bloodthirst>`__, each appliesseparately.

702.54. Haunt

702.54a. Haunt is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Haunt” on a`permanent <#permanent>`__ means „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ is put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`exile <#exile>`__ it haunting`target <#target>`__ creature.””Haunt” on an`instant <#instant>`__ or sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell means „When this`spell <#spell>`__ is put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ during <#during>`__its resolution, `exile it haunting`target <#target>`__ creature.”

702.54b. Cards that are inthe exile zone as theresult of a haunt <#haunt>`__`ability „haunt” the`creature <#creature>`__ targeted by that`ability <#ability>`__. The phrase”creature it`haunts <#haunt>`__” refers to the`object <#object>`__ targeted by the`haunt <#haunt>`__ ability,regardless of whether or not that`object <#object>`__ is still a`creature <#creature>`__.

702.54c. Triggeredabilities of`cards <#card>`__ with haunt thatrefer to the haunted creature <#creature>`__can `trigger in the`exile <#exile>`__ zone.

702.55. Replicate

702.55a. Replicate isa keyword that represents two`abilities <#ability>`__. The first is a staticability that functionswhile the spell with`replicate <#replicate>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. The second is a triggeredability that functionswhile the spell with`replicate <#replicate>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Replicate <#replicate>`__[`cost]” means „As an additionalcost to cast <#cast>`__this `spell, you may`pay <#pay>`__ [cost] any number oftimes” and „When you <#you_your>`__`cast this spell, if a`replicate <#replicate>`__ cost waspaid for it, copy it for each timeits replicate cost <#cost>`__was paid. If the `spell has anytargets, you <#you_your>`__may choose new `targets for any ofthe copies.” Paying a`spell <#spell>`__’s replicate <#replicate>`__`cost follows the rules for paying`additional costs <#additional_cost>`__ in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.55b. If a spell hasmultiple instances of`replicate <#replicate>`__, each is paidseparately and triggers based onthe payments made for it, not any other instanceof replicate.

702.56. Forecast

702.56a. A forecast <#forecast>`__`ability is a special kind of`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ thatcan be activated only from a`player <#player>`__’s hand. It’swritten „Forecast – [Activatedability].”

702.56b. A forecast <#forecast>`__`ability may be activated only`during <#during>`__ the upkeepstep of the card’s`owner <#owner>`__ and only once each turn. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of the`forecast <#forecast>`__ ability <#ability>`__`reveals the card withthat ability from their`hand <#hand>`__ as the ability <#ability>`__is activated. That `player playswith that card revealed in their`hand <#hand>`__ until it leaves the`player <#player>`__’s hand or untila step or phase thatisn’t an upkeep step begins,whichever comes first.

702.57. Graft

702.57a. Graft representsboth a static ability anda triggered ability.”Graft N” means „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield with N+1/+1 counters on it” and”Whenever another creature <#creature>`__`enters thebattlefield, ifthis permanent has a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on it,`you <#you_your>`__ may move a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ from this`permanent <#permanent>`__ onto that`creature <#creature>`__.”

702.57b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of graft, each one worksseparately.

702.58. Recover

702.58a. Recover is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ thatfunctions only while the card with`recover <#recover>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Recover [cost]”means „When a creature is putinto your <#you_your>`__`graveyard from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`you <#you_your>`__ may pay <#pay>`__[`cost]. If you do,return this card from`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard <#graveyard>`__to `your hand.Otherwise, exile this`card <#card>`__.”

702.59. Ripple

702.59a. Ripple is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ thatfunctions only while the card with`ripple <#ripple>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Ripple N”means „When you cast <#cast>`__this `spell, you may`reveal <#reveal>`__ the top N cards <#card>`__of `your library,or, if there are fewer than N cards <#card>`__in `your library,`you <#you_your>`__ may reveal allthe cards in your <#you_your>`__`library. If you <#you_your>`__`reveal cards from`your <#you_your>`__ library thisway, you may cast <#cast>`__any of those `cards with the same`name <#name>`__ as this spell <#spell>`__without paying their `manacosts, then put all revealed`cards <#card>`__ not cast this wayon the bottom of your <#you_your>`__`library in any order.”

702.59b. If a spell hasmultiple instances of ripple, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.60. SplitSecond

702.60a. Splitsecond is a staticability that functions onlywhile the spell with splitsecond is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Splitsecond” means „As long asthis spell is on the`stack <#stack>`__, players can’t`cast <#cast>`__ other spells or`activate <#activate>`__`abilities <#ability>`__ that aren’t manaabilities.”

702.60b. Players may`activate <#activate>`__ manaabilities and take specialactions while a`spell <#spell>`__ with splitsecond is on the`stack <#stack>`__. Triggeredabilities <#triggered_ability>`__`trigger and are put on the`stack <#stack>`__ as normal while a`spell <#spell>`__ with splitsecond is on the`stack <#stack>`__.

702.60c. Multiple instances of splitsecond on the same`spell <#spell>`__ are redundant.

702.61. Suspend

702.61a. Suspend is akeyword that represents three`abilities <#ability>`__. The first is a staticability that functionswhile the card with`suspend <#suspend>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand. Thesecond and third are triggeredabilities that functionin the exile zone.”Suspend N–[cost]”means „If you could begin to`cast <#cast>`__ this card byputting it onto the stack from`your <#you_your>`__ hand,`you <#you_your>`__ may pay <#pay>`__[`cost] and exile itwith N time counters on it. Thisaction doesn’t use the stack,” and”At the beginning of your <#you_your>`__upkeep, if this `card is suspended,remove a time counter from it,”and „When the last time counter <#counter>`__is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from this `card, if it’s exiled,`play <#play>`__ it without paying its manacost if able. If`you <#you_your>`__ can’t, it remains exiled. If`you <#you_your>`__ cast a`creature <#creature>`__ spell thisway, it gains haste until`you <#you_your>`__ lose`control <#control_controller>`__ of the`spell <#spell>`__ or the`permanent <#permanent>`__ it`becomes <#becomes>`__.”

702.61b. A card is”suspended” if it’s in the exile <#exile>`__`zone, has suspend,and has a time counter on it.

702.61c. While determining if`you <#you_your>`__ could begin to`cast <#cast>`__ a card with`suspend <#suspend>`__, take into considerationany effects that would prohibitthat card from being`cast <#cast>`__.

702.61d. Casting a spell <#spell>`__as an `effect of its`suspend <#suspend>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.62. Vanishing

702.62a. Vanishing isa keyword that represents three`abilities <#ability>`__.”Vanishing N” means „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield with Ntime counters on it,” „At thebeginning of your upkeep, ifthis permanent has a time`counter <#counter>`__ on it, remove a time`counter <#counter>`__ from it,” and „When thelast time counter is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from this permanent,`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ it.”

702.62b. Vanishing <#vanishing>`__without a number means „At the beginning of`your upkeep, if this`permanent <#permanent>`__ has a time`counter <#counter>`__ on it, remove a time`counter <#counter>`__ from it” and „When thelast time counter is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from this permanent,`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ it.”

702.62c. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of vanishing, eachworks separately.

702.63. Absorb

702.63a. Absorb is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.”Absorb N” means „If a sourcewould deal damage tothis creature,`prevent <#prevent>`__ N of that`damage <#damage>`__.”

702.63b. Each absorb <#absorb>`__`ability can`prevent <#prevent>`__ only N`damage <#damage>`__ from any one source at anyone time. It will apply separately to`damage <#damage>`__ from other sources, or to`damage <#damage>`__ dealt by the same source ata different time.

702.63c. If an object hasmultiple instances of absorb, eachapplies separately.

702.64. Aura Swap

702.64a. Aura swap isan activated ability ofsome Aura cards. „Auraswap [cost]” means”[Cost]: You may`exchange <#exchange>`__ this`permanent <#permanent>`__ with an`Aura <#aura>`__ card in`your <#you_your>`__ hand.”

702.64b. If either half of the`exchange <#exchange>`__ can’t be completed, the`ability <#ability>`__ has no`effect <#effect>`__.*Example:`You <#you_your>`__`activate <#activate>`__*theauraswapabilityofanAura. TheonlyAuracardinyourhandcan’tenchantthepermanentthat’senchanted bytheAurawithauraswap.Theabilityhasnoeffect.**Example:YouactivatetheauraswapabilityofanAurathatyoucontrolbutyoudon’town. Theabilityhasnoeffect.

702.65. Delve

702.65a. Delve is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the spell with`delve <#delve>`__ is on the stack.”Delve” means „For each genericmana in this`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost, you may`exile <#exile>`__ a card from`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard <#graveyard>`__rather than `pay that`mana <#mana>`__.”

702.65b. The delve <#delve>`__`ability isn’t an additional or`alternative cost <#alternative_cost>`__ andapplies only after the totalcost of the spell <#spell>`__with `delve is determined.

702.65c. Multiple instances of`delve <#delve>`__ on the same`spell <#spell>`__ are redundant.

702.66. Fortify

702.66a. Fortify is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ of`Fortification <#fortification>`__`cards <#card>`__. „Fortify <#fortify>`__[`cost]” means „[Cost]:Attach this`Fortification <#fortification>`__ to`target <#target>`__ land <#land>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.66b. For more information about`Fortifications <#fortification>`__, see rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts.”

702.66c. If a`Fortification <#fortification>`__ has multipleinstances of fortify, any of its`fortify <#fortify>`__ `abilities <#ability>`__may be used.

702.67. Frenzy

702.67a. Frenzy is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Frenzy N” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ attacks and isn’tblocked, it gets+N/+0 until end of turn.”

702.67b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `frenzy,each triggers separately.

702.68. Gravestorm

702.68a. Gravestorm <#gravestorm>`__is a `triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__that functions on the `stack.”Gravestorm” means „When`you <#you_your>`__ cast this`spell <#spell>`__, copy it for each`permanent <#permanent>`__ that was put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ this turn. If the`spell <#spell>`__ has anytargets, you <#you_your>`__may choose new `targets for any ofthe copies.”

702.68b. If a spell hasmultiple instances of`gravestorm <#gravestorm>`__, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.69. Poisonous

702.69a. Poisonous isa triggered ability.”Poisonous N” means „Wheneverthis creature deals <#deal>`__`combat damage to a`player <#player>`__, that player <#player>`__gets N `poison counters.”(For information about poisoncounters, see rule`104.3d <#R1043d>`__.)

702.69b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`poisonous, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.70. Transfigure

702.70a. Transfigure <#transfigure>`__is an `activatedability.”Transfigure <#transfigure>`__[`cost]” means „[Cost],`Sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ this`permanent <#permanent>`__: Search <#search>`__`your library fora creature card withthe same converted manacost as this`permanent <#permanent>`__ and put it onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. Then`shuffle <#shuffle>`__ your <#you_your>`__`library. Activate <#activate>`__this `ability only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.71.`Champion <#champion_championed>`__

702.71a.`Champion <#champion_championed>`__ representstwo triggeredabilities.”Champion an[object]” means „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield,`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ it`unless <#unless>`__ you <#you_your>`__`exile another[object] you <#you_your>`__`control” and „Whenthis permanent leaves thebattlefield, returnthe exiled card to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ under its`owner <#owner>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__.”

702.71b. The two`abilities <#ability>`__ represented by`champion <#champion_championed>`__ are linked.See rule 607, „LinkedAbilities.”

702.71c. A permanent <#permanent>`__is „`championed” byanother permanent if the latter`exiles <#exile>`__ the former as the directresult of a champion <#champion_championed>`__`ability.

702.72. Changeling

702.72a. Changeling <#changeling>`__is a `characteristic-definingability.”Changeling” means „This`object <#object>`__ is every creaturetype.” This`ability <#ability>`__ works everywhere, even`outside the game <#outside_the_game>`__. Seerule 604.3.

702.73. Evoke

702.73a. Evoke representstwo abilities: a staticability that functions inany zone from which the`card <#card>`__ with evoke can be`cast <#cast>`__ and a triggeredability that functionson the battlefield.”Evoke [cost]” means”You may cast this`card <#card>`__ by paying [cost]rather than paying its manacost” and „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield, if its`evoke <#evoke>`__ cost was paid,its controller <#control_controller>`__`sacrifices it.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ for its evoke <#evoke>`__`cost follows the rules for paying`alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__ inrules 601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.74. Hideaway

702.74a. Hideaway <#hideaway>`__represents a `staticability and a triggeredability.”Hideaway” means „This`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__`tapped” and „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield, lookat the top four cards of`your <#you_your>`__ library.`Exile <#exile>`__ one of them facedown and put the rest on thebottom of your <#you_your>`__`library in any order. The exiled`card <#card>`__ gains «Any player <#player>`__who has controlled the`permanent that exiled this`card <#card>`__ may look at this`card <#card>`__ in the exile <#exile>`__`zone.»”

702.75. Prowl

702.75a. Prowl is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions on the stack.”Prowl [cost]” means”You may pay <#pay>`__[`cost] rather than pay <#pay>`__this `spell’s manacost if a player <#player>`__was dealt `combat damage <#combat_damage>`__this turn by a source that, at the time it dealtthat `damage, was under`your <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__ and had any ofthis spell’s creaturetypes.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ for its prowl <#prowl>`__`cost follows the rules for paying`alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__ inrules 601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.76. Reinforce

702.76a. Reinforce isan activated ability <#activated_ability>`__that functions only while the `card <#card>`__with `reinforce is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand.”Reinforce <#reinforce>`__N–[`cost]” means”[Cost], Discard this`card <#card>`__: Put N +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on target <#target>`__`creature.”

702.76b. Although the`reinforce <#reinforce>`__`ability <#ability>`__ can be activated only ifthe card is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand, itcontinues to exist while the`object <#object>`__ is on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ and in all other`zones <#zone>`__. Therefore`objects <#object>`__ with`reinforce <#reinforce>`__ will be affected by`effects <#effect>`__ that depend on`objects <#object>`__ having one or more`activated abilities <#activated_ability>`__.

702.77. Conspire

702.77a. Conspire is akeyword that represents two`abilities <#ability>`__. The first is a staticability that functionswhile the spell with`conspire <#conspire>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. The second is a triggeredability that functionswhile the spell with`conspire <#conspire>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Conspire”means „As an additionalcost to cast <#cast>`__this `spell, you may`tap <#tap>`__ two untapped <#untapped>`__`creatures you <#you_your>`__`control that eachshare a color with it” and „When`you <#you_your>`__ cast this`spell <#spell>`__, if its`conspire <#conspire>`__ cost waspaid, copy it. If the`spell <#spell>`__ has anytargets, you <#you_your>`__may choose new `targets for the`copy <#copy>`__.” Paying a spell’s`conspire <#conspire>`__ cost <#cost>`__follows the rules for paying `additionalcosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.77b. If a spell hasmultiple instances of conspire,each is paid separately and`triggers <#trigger>`__ based on its ownpayment, not any other instance of`conspire <#conspire>`__.

702.78. Persist

702.78a. Persist is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Persist” means „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ is put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, if it had no-1/-1 counters on it, return itto the battlefield under its`owner <#owner>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__ with a -1/-1`counter <#counter>`__ on it.”

702.79. Wither

702.79a. Wither is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.`Damage <#damage>`__ dealt to a`creature <#creature>`__ by a source with`wither <#wither>`__ isn’t marked on that`creature <#creature>`__. Rather, it causes thatsource’s controller toput that many -1/-1 counters onthat creature. See rule`120.3 <#R1203>`__.

702.79b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ leaves thebattlefield beforean effect causes it to`deal <#deal>`__ damage, its lastknown information <#last_known_information>`__is used to determine whether it had`wither.

702.79c. The wither rulesfunction no matter what zone an`object <#object>`__ with wither <#wither>`__`deals damage from.

702.79d. Multiple instances of`wither <#wither>`__ on the same`object <#object>`__ are redundant.

702.80. Retrace

702.80a. Retrace appearson some instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__. It represents a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the card with`retrace <#retrace>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Retrace” means”You may cast this`card <#card>`__ from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard by discarding a`land <#land>`__ card as an`additional cost <#additional_cost>`__ to`cast <#cast>`__ it.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ using its`retrace <#retrace>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `additionalcosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.81. Devour

702.81a. Devour is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.”Devour N” means „As this`object <#object>`__ enters thebattlefield,`you <#you_your>`__ may`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ any number of`creatures <#creature>`__. This`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield with N+1/+1 counters on it for each`creature <#creature>`__ sacrificed this way.”

702.81b. Some objects <#object>`__have `abilities that refer to thenumber of creatures the`permanent <#permanent>`__ devoured. „Itdevoured” means „sacrificed as a result of its`devour <#devour>`__ ability asit entered the battlefield.”

702.82. Exalted

702.82a. Exalted is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Exalted” means „Whenever a`creature <#creature>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__`attacks alone, that`creature <#creature>`__ gets +1/+1 until end ofturn.”

702.82b. A creature”attacks alone” if it’s the only`creature <#creature>`__ declared as an attackerin a given combat phase. Seerule 506.5.

702.83. Unearth

702.83a. Unearth is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the card with`unearth <#unearth>`__ is in a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Unearth [cost]”means „[Cost]: Return this`card <#card>`__ from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. It gains`haste <#haste>`__. Exile it at thebeginning of the next end step.If it would leave the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`exile <#exile>`__ it instead ofputting it anywhere else.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.84. Cascade

702.84a. Cascade is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ thatfunctions only while the spell with`cascade <#cascade>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Cascade”means „When you cast <#cast>`__this `spell, exile <#exile>`__`cards from the top of`your <#you_your>`__ library <#library>`__until `you exile anonland card whose converted manacost is less than this`spell <#spell>`__’s converted manacost.`You <#you_your>`__ may cast that`card <#card>`__ without paying its manacost. Then put all`cards <#card>`__ exiled this way that weren’t`cast <#cast>`__ on the bottom of`your <#you_your>`__ library in arandom order.”

702.84b. If an effect <#effect>`__allows a `player to take an actionwith one or more of the exiled cards”as you cascade,”the player may take that actionafter they have finished exiling`cards <#card>`__ due to the`cascade <#cascade>`__ ability.This action is taken before choosing whether to`cast <#cast>`__ the last exiled`card <#card>`__ or, if no appropriate`card <#card>`__ was exiled, before putting theexiled cards on the bottom of their`library <#library>`__ in a random order.

702.84c. If a spell hasmultiple instances of cascade,each triggers separately.

702.85. Annihilator

702.85a. Annihilator <#annihilator>`__is a `triggered ability.”Annihilator N” means”Whenever this creature <#creature>`__`attacks, defendingplayer <#defending_player>`__`sacrifices N`permanents <#permanent>`__.”

702.85b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`annihilator, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.86. Level Up

702.86a. Level up is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__.”Level up [cost]”means „[Cost]: Put a level`counter <#counter>`__ on this`permanent <#permanent>`__.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.86b. Each card printedwith a level up <#level_up>`__`ability is known as a levelercard. It has a nonstandardlayout and includes two levelsymbols that are themselves`keyword abilities <#keyword_ability>`__. Seerule 710, „LevelerCards.”

702.87. Rebound

702.87a. Rebound appearson some instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__. It represents a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the spell is on the`stack <#stack>`__ and may create <#create>`__a `delayed triggeredability.”Rebound” means „If this`spell <#spell>`__ was cast from`your <#you_your>`__ hand,`instead <#instead>`__ of putting it into`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard <#graveyard>`__as it `resolves,`exile <#exile>`__ it and, at the beginning of`your <#you_your>`__ next upkeep,`you <#you_your>`__ may cast this`card <#card>`__ from exile withoutpaying its mana cost.”

702.87b. Casting a spell <#spell>`__as an `effect of its`rebound <#rebound>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.87c. Multiple instances of`rebound <#rebound>`__ on the same`spell <#spell>`__ are redundant.

702.88. Totem Armor

702.88a. Totem armor <#totem_armor>`__is a `static ability thatappears on some Auras. „Totemarmor” means „If enchanted`permanent <#permanent>`__ would be destroyed,`instead <#instead>`__ remove all`damage <#damage>`__ marked on it and`destroy <#destroy>`__ this Aura.”

702.89. Infect

702.89a. Infect is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__.

702.89b. Damage dealt toa player by a source with`infect <#infect>`__ doesn’t cause that`player <#player>`__ to lose`life <#life_life_total>`__. Rather, it causesthat source’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ to give the`player <#player>`__ that many poisoncounters. See rule`120.3 <#R1203>`__.

702.89c. Damage dealt toa creature by a source with`infect <#infect>`__ isn’t marked on that`creature <#creature>`__. Rather, it causes thatsource’s controller toput that many -1/-1 counters onthat creature. See rule`120.3 <#R1203>`__.

702.89d. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ leaves thebattlefield beforean effect causes it to`deal <#deal>`__ damage, its lastknown information <#last_known_information>`__is used to determine whether it had`infect.

702.89e. The infect rulesfunction no matter what zone an`object <#object>`__ with infect <#infect>`__`deals damage from.

702.89f. Multiple instances of`infect <#infect>`__ on the same`object <#object>`__ are redundant.

702.90. Battle Cry

702.90a. Battle cry <#battle_cry>`__is a `triggered ability.”Battle cry” means „Wheneverthis creature <#creature>`__`attacks, each other attackingcreature gets +1/+0until end of turn.”

702.90b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `battlecry, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.91. LivingWeapon

702.91a. Livingweapon is a triggeredability. „Livingweapon” means „When this`Equipment <#equipment>`__ enters thebattlefield,`create <#create>`__ a 0/0 black Germ`creature <#creature>`__ token,then attach this`Equipment <#equipment>`__ to it.”

702.92. Undying

702.92a. Undying is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Undying” means „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ is put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, if it had no+1/+1 counters on it, return itto the battlefield under its`owner <#owner>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__ with a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on it.”

702.93. Miracle

702.93a. Miracle is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ linked to a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__. (Seerule 603.11.)”Miracle [cost]”means „You may`reveal <#reveal>`__ this card from`your <#you_your>`__ hand as`you <#you_your>`__ draw it if it’sthe first card <#card>`__`you’ve drawn this turn. When`you <#you_your>`__ reveal this`card <#card>`__ this way, you <#you_your>`__may `cast it by paying[cost] rather than its manacost.”

702.93b. If a player <#player>`__chooses to `reveal a`card <#card>`__ using its`miracle <#miracle>`__ ability,they play with that card <#card>`__revealed until that `card leavestheir hand, that`ability <#ability>`__ resolves,or that ability otherwise leavesthe stack. (See rule`701.16a <#R70116a>`__.)

702.94. Soulbond

702.94a. Soulbond is akeyword that represents two triggeredabilities.”Soulbond” means „When this`creature <#creature>`__ enters thebattlefield, if`you <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__ both this`creature <#creature>`__ and another`creature <#creature>`__ and both are unpaired,`you <#you_your>`__ may pair this`creature <#creature>`__ with another unpaired`creature <#creature>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control for as long asboth remain creatures on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ under`your <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__” and „Wheneveranother creature enters thebattlefield under`your <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__, if`you <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__ both that`creature <#creature>`__ and this one and bothare unpaired, you may pair that`creature <#creature>`__ with this`creature <#creature>`__ for as long as bothremain creatures on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ under`your <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__.”

702.94b. A creature <#creature>`__`becomes „paired”with another as the result of a`soulbond <#soulbond>`__ ability.`Abilities <#ability>`__ may refer to a`paired <#paired>`__ creature,the creature another`creature <#creature>`__ is paired <#paired>`__with, or whether a `creature is`paired <#paired>`__. An „unpaired”creature is one that is not`paired <#paired>`__.

702.94c. When the`soulbond <#soulbond>`__ ability <#ability>`__`resolves, if either`object <#object>`__ that would be`paired <#paired>`__ is no longer a`creature <#creature>`__, no longer on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__, or no longerunder the control ofthe player who`controls <#control_controller>`__ the`soulbond <#soulbond>`__ ability,neither object <#object>`__`becomes paired.

702.94d. A creature canbe paired with only one other`creature <#creature>`__.

702.94e. A paired <#paired>`__`creature becomes <#becomes>`__unpaired if any of the following occur: another`player gains`control <#control_controller>`__ of it or the`creature <#creature>`__ it’s`paired <#paired>`__ with; it or the`creature <#creature>`__ it’s`paired <#paired>`__ with stops being a`creature <#creature>`__; or it or the`creature <#creature>`__ it’s`paired <#paired>`__ with leaves thebattlefield.

702.95. Overload

702.95a. Overload is akeyword that represents two staticabilities that functionwhile the spell with`overload <#overload>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. Overload <#overload>`__[`cost] means „You <#you_your>`__may choose to `pay [cost]rather than pay this`spell <#spell>`__’s mana cost”and „If you chose to`pay <#pay>`__ this spell’s`overload <#overload>`__ cost,change its text by replacing all instances ofthe word «target» with the word’each.»” Casting a spell using its`overload <#overload>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.95b. If a player <#player>`__chooses to `pay the`overload <#overload>`__ cost of a`spell <#spell>`__, that spell <#spell>`__won’t require `any targets. Itmay affect objects that couldn’tbe chosen as legal targets if the`spell <#spell>`__ were cast withoutits overload `cost <#cost>`__being paid.

702.95c. Overload’ssecond ability <#ability>`__`creates a text-changingeffect. See rule`612 <#R612>`__, „Text-ChangingEffects.”

702.96. Scavenge

702.96a. Scavenge is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ thatfunctions only while the card with`scavenge <#scavenge>`__ is in a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Scavenge [cost]”means „[Cost], Exile <#exile>`__this `card from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard: Put a number of+1/+1 counters equal to the`power <#power>`__ of the card <#card>`__`you exiled on`target <#target>`__ creature.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.97. Unleash

702.97a. Unleash is akeyword that represents two staticabilities.”Unleash” means”You may have this`permanent <#permanent>`__ enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with anadditional +1/+1 counter on it”and „This permanent can’t`block <#block>`__ as long as it has a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on it.”

702.98. Cipher

702.98a. Cipher appearson some instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__. It represents two`abilities <#ability>`__. The first is a spellability that functions whilethe spell with cipher <#cipher>`__is on the `stack. The second is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the card with`cipher <#cipher>`__ is in the`exile <#exile>`__ zone.”Cipher” means „If this`spell <#spell>`__ is represented by a`card <#card>`__, you may`exile <#exile>`__ this card <#card>`__`encoded on a`creature <#creature>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control” and „For aslong as this card is`encoded <#encoded>`__ on that`creature <#creature>`__, that`creature <#creature>`__ has «Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ deals <#deal>`__`combat damage to a`player <#player>`__, you may`copy <#copy>`__ the encoded <#encoded>`__`card and you may`cast <#cast>`__ the copy withoutpaying its mana cost.»”

702.98b. The term”encoded” describes therelationship between the card with`cipher <#cipher>`__ while in the`exile <#exile>`__ zone and the`creature <#creature>`__ chosen when the`spell <#spell>`__ represented by that`card <#card>`__ resolves.

702.98c. The card with`cipher <#cipher>`__ remains`encoded <#encoded>`__ on the chosen`creature <#creature>`__ as long as the`card <#card>`__ with cipher <#cipher>`__remains exiled and the `creature <#creature>`__remains on the `battlefield.The card remains`encoded <#encoded>`__ on that`object <#object>`__ even if it changes`controller <#control_controller>`__ or stopsbeing a creature, as long as itremains on the battlefield.

702.99. Evolve

702.99a. Evolve is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Evolve” means „Whenever a`creature <#creature>`__ enters thebattlefield under`your <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__, if that`creature <#creature>`__’s power isgreater than this creature’s`power <#power>`__ and/or that`creature <#creature>`__’s`toughness <#toughness>`__ is greater than this`creature <#creature>`__’s`toughness <#toughness>`__, put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on this`creature <#creature>`__.”

702.99b. A creature”evolves” when one or more +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ are put on it as aresult of its evolve <#evolve>`__`ability resolving.

702.99c. A creature <#creature>`__can’t have a greater `power or`toughness <#toughness>`__ than a noncreature`permanent <#permanent>`__.

702.99d. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `evolve,each triggers separately.

702.100. Extort

702.100a. Extort is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Extort” means „Whenever`you <#you_your>`__ cast a`spell <#spell>`__, you may`pay <#pay>`__ {W/B}. If you do,each opponent loses 1`life <#life_life_total>`__ and`you <#you_your>`__ gain`life <#life_life_total>`__ equal to the total`life <#life_life_total>`__ lost this way.”

702.100b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of extort, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.101. Fuse

702.101a. Fuse is a staticability found on some`split cards <#split_cards>`__ (see rule`708 <#R708>`__, „SplitCards”) that applies while the`card <#card>`__ with fuse is in a`player <#player>`__’s hand. If a`player <#player>`__ casts a splitcard with fuse <#fuse>`__from their `hand, the`player <#player>`__ may choose to`cast <#cast>`__ both halves of that splitcard rather than choose onehalf. This choice is made before putting the`split card <#split_cards>`__ with`fuse <#fuse>`__ onto the stack.The resulting spell is a fusedsplit spell.

702.101b. A fused splitspell has the combined`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ of itstwo halves. (See rule 708.4.)

702.101c. The totalcost of a fused splitspell includes the manacost of each half.

702.101d. As a fused splitspell <#fused_split_spell>`__`resolves, the`controller <#control_controller>`__ of the`spell <#spell>`__ follows the instructions ofthe left half and then follows the instructionsof the right half.

702.102. Bestow

702.102a. Bestow <#bestow>`__represents a `staticability that functions inany zone from which`you <#you_your>`__ could play the`card <#card>`__ it’s on. „Bestow <#bestow>`__[`cost]” means „As`you <#you_your>`__ cast this`spell <#spell>`__, you maychoose to cast it bestowed. If`you <#you_your>`__ do, you <#you_your>`__`pay [cost] rather thanits mana cost.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ using its`bestow <#bestow>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts (see`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h).

702.102b. As a spell <#spell>`__`cast bestowed is put onto the`stack <#stack>`__, it becomes an`Aura <#aura>`__ enchantment <#enchantment>`__and gains `enchant <#enchant>`__`creature. It is a bestowed`Aura <#aura>`__ spell, and the`permanent <#permanent>`__ it`becomes <#becomes>`__ as it`resolves <#resolve>`__ will be a bestowed`Aura <#aura>`__. These effects <#effect>`__last until the `spell or the`permanent <#permanent>`__ it`becomes <#becomes>`__ ceases to be bestowed(see rules 702.102d-f). Becausethe spell is an Aura <#aura>`__`spell, its`controller <#control_controller>`__ must choosea legal target for that`spell <#spell>`__ as defined by its`enchant <#enchant>`__ creature <#creature>`__`ability and rule`601.2c <#R6012c>`__. See also rule`303.4 <#R3034>`__.

702.102c. When casting a`spell <#spell>`__ bestowed, only its`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ asmodified by the bestow <#bestow>`__`ability are evaluated todetermine if it can be cast.*Example: Aether*Stormisanenchantmentwiththeability„Creaturespellscan’tbecast.”Thiseffectdoesn’t stopacreaturecardwithbestowfrombeingcastbestowed. Example:Garruk’s Horde says, in part,”Youmaycastcreaturespellsfromthe topofyourlibrary.”IfyoucontrolGarruk’sHorde and thetopcardofyourlibraryisacreaturecardwithbestow,youcancastitasacreaturespell,butyoucan’tcastitbestowed.

702.102d. As a bestowed`Aura <#aura>`__ spell beginsresolving, if its target isillegal, it ceases to be bestowed and the`effect <#effect>`__ making it an`Aura <#aura>`__ spell ends. Itcontinues resolving as a`creature <#creature>`__ spell andwill be put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ under the`control <#control_controller>`__ of the`spell <#spell>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__. This is anexception to rule 608.3a.

702.102e. If a bestowed`Aura <#aura>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__unattached, it ceases to be bestowed. If abestowed `Aura is attached to anillegal object or`player <#player>`__, it becomes <#becomes>`__unattached and ceases to be bestowed. This is anexception to rule `704.5m.

702.102f. If a bestowed`Aura <#aura>`__ phases inunattached, it ceases to be bestowed. See rule`702.25 <#R70225>`__, „Phasing.”

702.103. Tribute

702.103a. Tribute is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions as the creature with`tribute <#tribute>`__ is entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__.”Tribute N” means „As this`creature <#creature>`__ enters thebattlefield, choosean opponent. That`player <#player>`__ may put an additional N+1/+1 counters on it as it`enters thebattlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__.”

702.103b. Objects with`tribute <#tribute>`__ have triggeredabilities that check „if`tribute <#tribute>`__ wasn’t paid.” Thiscondition is true if the`opponent <#opponent>`__ chosen as a result ofthe tribute <#tribute>`__`ability didn’t have the`creature <#creature>`__ enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ as specified by the`creature <#creature>`__’s`tribute <#tribute>`__ ability.

702.104. Dethrone

702.104a. Dethrone is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Dethrone” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ attacks <#attack>`__the `player with the most`life <#life_life_total>`__ or tied for most`life <#life_life_total>`__, put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on this`creature <#creature>`__.”

702.104b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`dethrone, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.105. HiddenAgenda

702.105a. Hiddenagenda is a staticability that functions as a`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ card <#card>`__with `hidden agenda is putinto the command <#command>`__`zone. „Hiddenagenda” means „As`you <#you_your>`__ put this`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ card <#card>`__into the `command <#command>`__`zone, turn it facedown and secretly choose a`card <#card>`__ name.”

702.105b. To secretly choose a`card <#card>`__ name, note that`name <#name>`__ on a piece of paper kept withthe face-down conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`card.

702.105c. Any time you <#you_your>`__have `priority,`you <#you_your>`__ may turn a face-down`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ card <#card>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control in the`command <#command>`__ zone faceup. This is a specialaction. Doing so will`reveal <#reveal>`__ the chosen`name <#name>`__. See rule 116.2j.

702.105d. Hiddenagenda and another`ability <#ability>`__ of the`object <#object>`__ with hiddenagenda that refers to „thechosen name” are linked. The second`ability <#ability>`__ refers only to the`card <#card>`__ name chosen as aresult of that object’s hiddenagenda <#hidden_agenda>`__`ability. See rule`607.2d <#R6072d>`__.

702.105e. If a player <#player>`__leaves the game, all face-down`conspiracy cards <#card>`__controlled by that `player must berevealed to all players. At theend of each game, all face-down`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ cards <#card>`__must be revealed to all `players.

702.105f. Doubleagenda is a`variant <#variant>`__ of the hiddenagenda <#hidden_agenda>`__`ability. As you <#you_your>`__put a `conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__`card with doubleagenda into the`command <#command>`__ zone,`you <#you_your>`__ secretly name <#name>`__two different `cards rather than one.`You <#you_your>`__ don’t reveal <#reveal>`__that more than one `name was secretlychosen until you <#you_your>`__`reveal the chosen`names <#name>`__.

702.106. Outlast

702.106a. Outlast is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__.”Outlast [cost]”means „[Cost], {T}: Put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on this`creature <#creature>`__.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.107. Prowess

702.107a. Prowess is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Prowess” means „Whenever`you <#you_your>`__ cast anoncreature spell, this`creature <#creature>`__ gets +1/+1 until end ofturn.”

702.107b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`prowess, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.108. Dash

702.108a. Dash representsthree abilities: two staticabilities that functionwhile the card with dash <#dash>`__is on the `stack, one of which may`create <#create>`__ a delayed triggeredability, and a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the object with`dash <#dash>`__ is on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__.”Dash [cost]” means”You may cast this`card <#card>`__ by paying [cost]rather than its mana cost,” „Ifthis spell’s dash <#dash>`__`cost was paid, return the`permanent <#permanent>`__ this`spell <#spell>`__ becomes to its`owner <#owner>`__’s hand at thebeginning of the next end step,”and „As long as this`permanent <#permanent>`__’s dash <#dash>`__`cost was paid, it has`haste <#haste>`__.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ for its dash <#dash>`__`cost follows the rules for paying`alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__ inrules 601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.109. Exploit

702.109a. Exploit is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Exploit” means „When this`creature <#creature>`__ enters thebattlefield,`you <#you_your>`__ may`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ a`creature <#creature>`__.”

702.109b. A creature <#creature>`__with `exploit”exploits a`creature <#creature>`__” when the`controller <#control_controller>`__ of the`exploit <#exploit>`__ ability <#ability>`__`sacrifices a`creature <#creature>`__ as that`ability <#ability>`__ resolves.

702.110. Menace

702.110a. Menace is an`evasion ability <#evasion_ability>`__.

702.110b. A creature <#creature>`__with `menace can’t be blockedexcept by two or more creatures.(See rule 509, „Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.110c. Multiple instances of`menace <#menace>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.111. Renown

702.111a. Renown is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Renown N” means „When this`creature <#creature>`__ deals <#deal>`__`combat damage to a`player <#player>`__, if it isn’t`renowned <#renowned>`__, put N +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it and it`becomes <#becomes>`__`renowned <#renowned>`__.”

702.111b. Renowned is adesignation that has no rules meaning other thanto act as a marker that the renown <#renown>`__`ability and other`spells <#spell>`__ and abilities <#ability>`__can identify. Only `permanents <#permanent>`__can be or `become <#becomes>`__`renowned. Once a`permanent <#permanent>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ renowned,it stays renowned until it`leaves thebattlefield <#leaves_the_battlefield>`__.`Renowned <#renowned>`__ is neither an`ability <#ability>`__ nor part of the`permanent <#permanent>`__’s copiablevalues.

702.111c. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `renown,each triggers separately. Thefirst such ability to`resolve <#resolve>`__ will cause the`creature <#creature>`__ to`become <#becomes>`__ renowned,and subsequent abilities willhave no effect. (See rule`603.4 <#R6034>`__)

702.112. Awaken

702.112a. Awaken appearson some instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__. It represents two`abilities <#ability>`__: a staticability that functionswhile the spell with`awaken <#awaken>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__ and a spellability.”Awaken N–[cost]”means „You may pay <#pay>`__[`cost] rather than pay <#pay>`__this `spell’s manacost as you <#you_your>`__`cast this spell” and”If this spell’s`awaken <#awaken>`__ cost was paid,put N +1/+1 counters on`target <#target>`__ land <#land>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control. That`land <#land>`__ becomes a 0/0Elemental creature with`haste <#haste>`__. It’s still a`land <#land>`__.” Casting a spell <#spell>`__using its `awaken <#awaken>`__`ability follows the rules forpaying alternative costs <#alternative_cost>`__in rules `601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.112b. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of a`spell <#spell>`__ with awaken <#awaken>`__chooses the `target of the`awaken <#awaken>`__ spellability only if that`player <#player>`__ chose to pay the`spell <#spell>`__’s awaken <#awaken>`__`cost. Otherwise the`spell <#spell>`__ is cast as if itdidn’t have that target.

702.113. Devoid

702.113a. Devoid is a`characteristic-definingability <#characteristic-defining_ability>`__.”Devoid” means „This`object <#object>`__ is`colorless <#colorless>`__.” This`ability <#ability>`__ functions everywhere,even outside the game.See rule 604.3.

702.114. Ingest

702.114a. Ingest is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Ingest” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ deals <#deal>`__`combat damage to a`player <#player>`__, that player <#player>`__`exiles the top card oftheir library.”

702.114b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `ingest,each triggers separately.

702.115. Myriad

702.115a. Myriad is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ thatmay also create a delayedtriggeredability.”Myriad” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ attacks,for each opponent other than`defending player <#defending_player>`__,`you <#you_your>`__ may create a`token <#token>`__ that’s a copy ofthis creature that’s`tapped <#tapped>`__ and attacking that`player <#player>`__ or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__. If one ormore tokens are created this way,`exile <#exile>`__ the tokens atend of combat.”

702.115b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `myriad,each triggers separately.

702.116. Surge

702.116a. Surge is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the spell with`surge <#surge>`__ is on the stack.”Surge [cost]” means”You may pay <#pay>`__[`cost] rather than pay <#pay>`__this `spell’s manacost as you <#you_your>`__`cast this spell if`you <#you_your>`__ or one of`your <#you_your>`__ teammates <#teammate>`__has `cast another spell <#spell>`__this turn.” Casting a `spell for its`surge <#surge>`__ cost follows therules for paying alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.117. Skulk

702.117a. Skulk is an`evasion ability <#evasion_ability>`__.

702.117b. A creature <#creature>`__with `skulk can’t be blocked by`creatures <#creature>`__ with greater`power <#power>`__. (See rule 509,”Declare BlockersStep.”)

702.117c. Multiple instances of`skulk <#skulk>`__ on the same`creature <#creature>`__ are redundant.

702.118. Emerge

702.118a. Emerge <#emerge>`__represents two `staticabilities that functionwhile the spell with`emerge <#emerge>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Emerge <#emerge>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `cast this spell bypaying [cost] and sacrificing a`creature <#creature>`__ rather than paying its`mana cost <#mana_cost>`__” and „If`you <#you_your>`__ chose to pay this`spell <#spell>`__’s emerge <#emerge>`__`cost, its totalcost is reduced by an amount of`generic mana <#generic_mana>`__ equal to thesacrificed creature’s convertedmana cost.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ using its`emerge <#emerge>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.118b. You choosewhich creature to`sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ as`you <#you_your>`__ choose to pay a`spell <#spell>`__’s emerge <#emerge>`__`cost (see rule`601.2b <#R6012b>`__), and you <#you_your>`__`sacrifice that`creature <#creature>`__ as you <#you_your>`__`pay the total cost <#total_cost>`__(see rule `601.2h).

702.119. Escalate

702.119a. Escalate is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ of`modal <#modal_mode>`__ spells (seerule 700.2) that functions whilethe spell with`escalate <#escalate>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Escalate <#escalate>`__[`cost]” means „For each`mode <#modal_mode>`__ you <#you_your>`__choose beyond the first as `you <#you_your>`__`cast this spell,`you <#you_your>`__ pay an additional[cost].” Paying a`spell <#spell>`__’s escalate <#escalate>`__`cost follows the rules for paying`additional costs <#additional_cost>`__ in rules`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.120. Melee

702.120a. Melee is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Melee” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ attacks,it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each`opponent <#opponent>`__ you <#you_your>`__attacked with a `creature thiscombat.”

702.120b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `melee,each triggers separately.

702.121. Crew

702.121a. Crew is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ of`Vehicle <#vehicle>`__ cards.”Crew N” means „Tap anynumber of untapped <#untapped>`__`creatures you <#you_your>`__`control with total`power <#power>`__ N or greater: This`permanent <#permanent>`__`becomes <#becomes>`__ an artifactcreature until end ofturn.”

702.121b. A creature”crews a Vehicle”when it’s tapped to pay <#pay>`__the `cost to activate <#activate>`__a `Vehicle’s crew <#crew>`__`ability.

702.121c. If an effect <#effect>`__states that a `creature „can’t`crew <#crew>`__ Vehicles,” that`creature <#creature>`__ can’t be`tapped <#tapped>`__ to pay the`crew <#crew>`__ cost of a`Vehicle <#vehicle>`__.

702.122. Fabricate

702.122a. Fabricate isa triggered ability.”Fabricate N” means „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield,`you <#you_your>`__ may put N +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it. If`you <#you_your>`__ don’t, create <#create>`__N 1/1 `colorless Servo artifactcreature <#artifact_creature>`__`tokens.”

702.122b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of fabricate, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.123.`Partner <#partner_partner_with_name>`__

702.123a.`Partner <#partner_partner_with_name>`__ is an`ability <#ability>`__ that modifies the rulesfor deck construction in the`Commander <#commander>`__`variant <#variant>`__ (see rule`903 <#R903>`__), and it functions before thegame begins. Rather than a single`legendary <#legendary>`__`creature <#creature>`__ card,`you <#you_your>`__ may designate two`legendary <#legendary>`__`creature <#creature>`__ cards as`your <#you_your>`__ commander <#commander>`__if each has`partner.

702.123b. Your <#you_your>`__`deck must contain exactly`100 <#R100>`__ cards, including itstwo commanders. Both`commanders <#commander>`__ begin the game inthe command zone.

702.123c. A rule or`effect <#effect>`__ that refers to`your <#you_your>`__`commander <#commander>`__’s coloridentity refers to thecombined color identities <#color_identity>`__of `your two`commanders <#commander>`__. See rule`903.4 <#R9034>`__.

702.123d. Except for determining the`color identity <#color_identity>`__ of`your <#you_your>`__ commander,the two commanders functionindependently. When casting a`commander <#commander>`__ with`partner <#partner_partner_with_name>`__, ignorehow many times your other`commander <#commander>`__ has been`cast <#cast>`__ (see rule 903.6).When determining whether a player <#player>`__has been dealt 21 or more `combatdamage by the same`commander <#commander>`__, consider`damage <#damage>`__ from each of`your <#you_your>`__ two`commanders <#commander>`__ separately (see rule`903.10a <#R90310a>`__).

702.123e. If an effect <#effect>`__refers to `your <#you_your>`__`commander while`you <#you_your>`__ have two`commanders <#commander>`__, it refers to eitherone. If an effect causes`you <#you_your>`__ to perform an action on`your <#you_your>`__ commander <#commander>`__and it could affect both, `you <#you_your>`__choose which it refers to at the time the`effect is applied.

702.123f.”Partner with[name]” is a variant <#variant>`__of the `partner <#partner_partner_with_name>`__`ability.”Partner with[name]” represents two`abilities <#ability>`__. One is a staticability that modifies therules for deck construction. Ratherthan a single legendary <#legendary>`__`creature card,`you <#you_your>`__ may designate two`legendary <#legendary>`__`creature <#creature>`__ cards as`your <#you_your>`__ commander <#commander>`__if each has a”`partner with[name]” ability withthe other’s name.`You <#you_your>`__ can’t designate two`legendary <#legendary>`__ cards as`your <#you_your>`__ commander <#commander>`__if one has a”`partner with[name]” ability andthe other isn’t the named card. Theother ability represented by”partner with[name]” is a triggeredability that means „Whenthis permanent enters thebattlefield,`target <#target>`__ player may`search <#search>`__ their`library <#library>`__ for a card <#card>`__named [`name], reveal <#reveal>`__it, put it into their `hand, then`shuffle <#shuffle>`__ their`library <#library>`__.”

702.124. Undaunted

702.124a. Undaunted isa static ability thatfunctions while the spell with`undaunted <#undaunted>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. Undaunted <#undaunted>`__means „This `spell costs <#cost>`__{1} less to `cast for each`opponent <#opponent>`__ `you <#you_your>`__have.”

702.124b. Players whohave left the game are not counted whendetermining how many opponents <#opponent>`__`you have.

702.124c. If a spell hasmultiple instances of`undaunted <#undaunted>`__, each of themapplies.

702.125. Improvise

702.125a. Improvise isa static ability thatfunctions while the spell with`improvise <#improvise>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Improvise”means „For each generic mana <#generic_mana>`__in this `spell’s totalcost, you may`tap <#tap>`__ an untapped <#untapped>`__`artifact you <#you_your>`__`control rather than`pay <#pay>`__ that mana.”

702.125b. The`improvise <#improvise>`__`ability <#ability>`__ isn’t an additional or`alternative cost <#alternative_cost>`__ andapplies only after the totalcost of the spell <#spell>`__with `improvise is determined.

702.125c. Multiple instances of`improvise <#improvise>`__ on the same`spell <#spell>`__ are redundant.

702.126. Aftermath

702.126a. Aftermath isan ability found on some splitcards (see rule`708 <#R708>`__, „SplitCards”). It represents three`static abilities <#static_ability>`__.”Aftermath” means”You may cast thishalf of this split card from`your <#you_your>`__`graveyard <#graveyard>`__,” „This half of this`split card <#split_cards>`__ can’t be`cast <#cast>`__ from any zone otherthan a graveyard,” and „If this`spell <#spell>`__ was cast from a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__, exile <#exile>`__it `instead of putting it anywhereelse any time it would leave the`stack <#stack>`__.”

702.127. Embalm

702.127a. Embalm is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the card with`embalm <#embalm>`__ is in a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Embalm [cost]” means”[Cost], Exile this`card <#card>`__ from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard: Create <#create>`__a `token that’s a copy <#copy>`__of this `card, except it’s white, ithas no mana cost, and it’s aZombie in addition to its other`types <#type>`__. Activate this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.127b. A token is”embalmed” if it’s created by a resolving`embalm <#embalm>`__ ability.

702.128. Eternalize

702.128a. Eternalize <#eternalize>`__is an `activated ability <#activated_ability>`__that functions while the `card with`eternalize <#eternalize>`__ is in a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Eternalize <#eternalize>`__[`cost]” means „[Cost],`Exile <#exile>`__ this card from`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard:Create a token that’sa copy of this card,except it’s black, it’s 4/4, it has no manacost, and it’s a Zombie inaddition to its other types.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.129. Afflict

702.129a. Afflict is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Afflict N” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__blocked, `defendingplayer loses N`life <#life_life_total>`__.”

702.129b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of`afflict, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.130. Ascend

702.130a. Ascend on an`instant <#instant>`__ or sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell represents a spellability. It means „If`you <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__ ten or more`permanents <#permanent>`__ and`you <#you_your>`__ don’t have the city’sblessing,`you <#you_your>`__ get the city’sblessing for the rest ofthe game.”

702.130b. Ascend on a`permanent <#permanent>`__ represents a staticability. It means „Any time`you <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__ ten or more`permanents <#permanent>`__ and`you <#you_your>`__ don’t have the city’sblessing,`you <#you_your>`__ get the city’sblessing for the rest ofthe game.”

702.130c. The city’sblessing is a designationthat has no rules meaning other than to act as amarker that other rules and`effects <#effect>`__ can identify. Any numberof players may have the city’sblessing at the same time.

702.130d. After a player <#player>`__gets the `city’s blessing,`continuous effects <#continuous_effect>`__ arereapplied before the game checks to see if thegame state or preceding events havematched any triggerconditions.

702.131. Assist

702.131a. Assist is a`static ability <#static_ability>`__ thatmodifies the rules of paying for the`spell <#spell>`__ with assist <#assist>`__(see rules `601.2g-h). If the`total cost <#total_cost>`__ to cast <#cast>`__a `spell with assist <#assist>`__includes a `generic mana <#generic_mana>`__component, before `you <#you_your>`__`activate manaabilities while casting it,`you <#you_your>`__ may choose another`player <#player>`__. That player <#player>`__has a chance to `activate manaabilities. Once that`player <#player>`__ chooses not to`activate <#activate>`__ any more manaabilities,`you <#you_your>`__ have a chance to`activate <#activate>`__ manaabilities. Before`you <#you_your>`__ begin to pay the`total cost <#total_cost>`__ of the`spell <#spell>`__, the player <#player>`__`you chose may pay forany amount of the genericmana in the`spell <#spell>`__’s totalcost.

702.132. Jump-Start

702.132a. Jump-start <#jump-start>`__appears on some `instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__. It represents two`static abilities <#static_ability>`__: one thatfunctions while the card is in a`player <#player>`__’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ and another thatfunctions while the card is on the`stack <#stack>`__.”Jump-start” means”You may cast this`card <#card>`__ from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard if the resulting`spell <#spell>`__ is an instant <#instant>`__or `sorcery spell bydiscarding a card as an additionalcost to cast <#cast>`__it” and „If this `spell was`cast <#cast>`__ using its`jump-start <#jump-start>`__`ability <#ability>`__, exile this`card <#card>`__ instead ofputting it anywhere else any time it would leavethe stack.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ using its`jump-start <#jump-start>`__`ability <#ability>`__ follows the rules forpaying additional costs <#additional_cost>`__in rules `601.2b and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h.

702.133. Mentor

702.133a. Mentor is a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__.”Mentor” means „Whenever this`creature <#creature>`__ attacks,put a +1/+1 counter on`target <#target>`__ attackingcreature with`power <#power>`__ less than this`creature <#creature>`__’s power.”

702.133b. If a creature <#creature>`__has multiple instances of `mentor,each triggers separately.

702.134. Afterlife

702.134a. Afterlife isa triggered ability.”Afterlife N” means „When this`permanent <#permanent>`__ is put into a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__,`create <#create>`__ N 1/1 white and blackSpirit creature <#creature>`__`tokens with flying.”

702.134b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of afterlife, each`triggers <#trigger>`__ separately.

702.135. Riot

702.135a. Riot is a staticability. „Riot”means „You may have this`permanent <#permanent>`__ enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with anadditional +1/+1 counter on it.If you don’t, it gains`haste <#haste>`__.”

702.135b. If a`permanent <#permanent>`__ has multipleinstances of riot, each worksseparately.

702.136. Spectacle

702.136a. Spectacle isa static ability thatfunctions on the stack.”Spectacle [cost]”means „You may pay <#pay>`__[`cost] rather than pay <#pay>`__this `spell’s manacost if an`opponent <#opponent>`__ lost`life <#life_life_total>`__ this turn.” Castinga spell for its`spectacle <#spectacle>`__ cost <#cost>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.137. Escape

702.137a. Escape <#escape>`__represents a `staticability that functionswhile the card with`escape <#escape>`__ is in a`player <#player>`__’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Escape [cost]” means”You may cast this`card <#card>`__ from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard by paying[cost] rather than paying its manacost.” Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ using its`escape <#escape>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.137b. A spell or`permanent <#permanent>`__ „escaped” if that`spell <#spell>`__ or the spell <#spell>`__that became that `permanent asit resolved was cast from a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ with an`escape <#escape>`__ ability.

702.137c. An ability <#ability>`__that reads „[This `permanent]`escapes <#escape>`__ with …” means „If this`permanent <#permanent>`__ escaped, it entersthe battlefield <#enters_the_battlefield>`__with …” That `ability may havea triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__linked to it that `triggers „Whenit enters thebattlefield thisway.” (See rule 603.11.) Such a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__`triggers <#trigger>`__ when that`permanent <#permanent>`__ enters thebattlefield afterits replacement effect <#replacement_effect>`__was applied, even if that `replacementeffect had no`effect <#effect>`__.

702.138. Companion

702.138a. Companion isa keyword ability thatfunctions outside thegame. It’s written as”Companion–[Condition].”Before the game begins, you may`reveal <#reveal>`__ one card <#card>`__`you own from outside thegame with a`companion <#companion>`__`ability <#ability>`__ whose condition isfulfilled by your startingdeck. (See rule`103.2b <#R1032b>`__.) Once during <#during>`__the game, any time `you have`priority <#priority>`__ and the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty, but only`during <#during>`__ a mainphase of your <#you_your>`__turn, `you may pay {3}and put that card into`your <#you_your>`__ hand. This is a`special action <#special_action>`__ thatdoesn’t use the stack (see rule`116.2g <#R1162g>`__). This is a change fromprevious rules.

702.138b. If a`companion <#companion>`__`ability <#ability>`__ refers to`your <#you_your>`__ startingdeck, it refers to`your <#you_your>`__ deck after`you <#you_your>`__’ve setaside any`sideboard <#sideboard>`__ cards. Ina Commander game, this is alsobefore you’ve setaside your <#you_your>`__`commander.

702.138c. Once you takethe special action and putthe card with`companion <#companion>`__ into`your <#you_your>`__ hand, itremains in the game until the game ends.

702.139. Mutate

702.139a. Mutate appearson some creature <#creature>`__`cards. It represents a staticability that functionswhile the spell with`mutate <#mutate>`__ is on the`stack <#stack>`__. „Mutate <#mutate>`__[`cost]” means „You <#you_your>`__may `pay [cost] ratherthan pay this spell’s`mana cost <#mana_cost>`__. If`you <#you_your>`__ do, it`becomes <#becomes>`__ a mutating creaturespell and`targets <#target>`__ a non-Human`creature <#creature>`__ with the same`owner <#owner>`__ as this spell.”Casting a spell using its`mutate <#mutate>`__ ability <#ability>`__follows the rules for paying `alternativecosts (see`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and`601.2f <#R6012f>`__-h).

702.139b. As a mutating creaturespell beginsresolving, if its target isillegal, it ceases to be a mutating creaturespell andcontinues resolving as a`creature <#creature>`__ spell andwill be put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ under the`control <#control_controller>`__ of the`spell <#spell>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__.

702.139c. As a mutating creaturespell <#mutating_creature_spell>`__`resolves, if its`target <#target>`__ is legal, it doesn’t enterthe battlefield. Rather, itmerges with the target <#target>`__`creature and`becomes <#becomes>`__ one object <#object>`__represented by more than one `card or`token <#token>`__ (see rule 721,”Merging with Permanents”). The`spell <#spell>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__ chooseswhether the spell is put on top ofthe creature or on the bottom.The resulting permanent is amutated permanent.

702.139d. An ability <#ability>`__that `triggers whenever a`creature <#creature>`__ mutates <#mutate>`__`triggers when a`spell <#spell>`__ merges with a`creature <#creature>`__ as a result of aresolving mutating creaturespell.

702.139e. A mutated`permanent <#permanent>`__ has all`abilities <#ability>`__ of each`card <#card>`__ and token thatrepresents it. Its other`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ arederived from the topmost card or`token <#token>`__.

702.139f. Any effect thatrefers to or modifies the mutating creaturespell refers to ormodifies the mutated permanent <#permanent>`__it merges with as it `resolves.

702.140. Encore

702.140a. Encore is an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ thatfunctions while the card with`encore <#encore>`__ is in a`graveyard <#graveyard>`__.”Encore [cost]” means”[Cost], Exile this`card <#card>`__ from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard: For each`opponent <#opponent>`__, create a`token <#token>`__ that’s a copy ofthis card that attacks <#attack>`__that `opponent this turn if able.The tokens gain haste.`Sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ them at the beginningof the next end step.`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only any time`you <#you_your>`__ could cast a`sorcery <#sorcery>`__.”

702.141. Boast

702.141a. A boast <#boast>`__`ability is a special kind of`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__.”Boast – [Cost]:[Effect]” means”[Cost]: [Effect].`Activate <#activate>`__ this`ability <#ability>`__ only if this`creature <#creature>`__ attacked this turn andonly once each turn.”

702.141b. Effects mayrefer to boast <#boast>`__`abilities. If an`effect <#effect>`__ refers to a`creature <#creature>`__ boasting, it means its`boast <#boast>`__ ability beingactivated.

702.142. Foretell

702.142a. Foretell is akeyword that functions while the`card <#card>`__ with foretell <#foretell>`__is in a `player’s hand.Any time a player has`priority <#priority>`__ during <#during>`__their turn, that `player may`pay <#pay>`__ {2} and exile a`card <#card>`__ with foretell <#foretell>`__from their `hand facedown. That player <#player>`__may look at that `card as long as itremains in exile. They may`cast <#cast>`__ that card after thecurrent turn has ended by paying any`foretell <#foretell>`__ cost it hasrather than paying that spell’s`mana cost <#mana_cost>`__. Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ this way follows the rulesfor paying alternativecosts in rules`601.2b <#R6012b>`__ and 601.2f-h.

702.142b. Exiling a card <#card>`__using its `foretell <#foretell>`__`ability is a specialaction, which doesn’t usethe stack. See rule`116 <#R116>`__, „SpecialActions.”

702.142c. If an effect <#effect>`__refers to foretelling a `card, itmeans performing the specialaction associated with a`foretell <#foretell>`__ ability.If an effect refers to a`card <#card>`__ or spell that was`foretold <#foretold>`__, it means a`card <#card>`__ put in the exile <#exile>`__`zone as a result of the specialaction associated with a`foretell <#foretell>`__ ability,or a spell that was a`foretold <#foretold>`__ card beforeit was cast, even if it was`cast <#cast>`__ for a cost otherthan a foretell <#foretell>`__`cost.

702.142d. If an effect <#effect>`__states that a `card in`exile <#exile>`__ becomes <#becomes>`__`foretold, that card <#card>`__`becomes a`foretold <#foretold>`__ card. That`effect <#effect>`__ may give the`card <#card>`__ a foretell <#foretell>`__`cost. That card may be`cast <#cast>`__ for any`foretell <#foretell>`__ cost it hasafter the turn it became a`foretold <#foretold>`__ card hasended, even if the resulting spell <#spell>`__doesn’t have `foretell.

702.142e. If a player <#player>`__owns multiple `foretold <#foretold>`__`cards in exile, theymust ensure that those cards can beeasily differentiated from each other and fromany other face-down cards in`exile <#exile>`__ which that`player <#player>`__ owns. This includes knowingboth the order in which those cards <#card>`__were put into `exile and any`foretell <#foretell>`__ costs otherthan their printed foretell <#foretell>`__`costs those cards mayhave.

702.142f. If a player <#player>`__leaves the game, all face-down`foretold cards that`player <#player>`__ owns must be revealed toall players. At the end of eachgame, all face-down foretold <#foretold>`__`cards must be revealed to all`players <#player>`__.

703. Turn-BasedActions

703.1. Turn-basedactions are gameactions that happen automatically when certain`steps <#step>`__ or phases begin,or when each step and`phase <#phase>`__ ends. Turn-basedactions don’t use the`stack <#stack>`__.

703.1a. Abilities thatwatch for a specified step or`phase <#phase>`__ to begin are triggeredabilities, not`turn-based actions <#turn-based_actions>`__.(See rule 603, „Handling TriggeredAbilities.”)

703.2. Turn-basedactions are notcontrolled by any player.

703.3. Whenever a step or`phase <#phase>`__ begins, if it’s a`step <#step>`__ or phase that hasany turn-based action <#turn-based_actions>`__associated with it, those `turn-basedactions areautomatically dealt with first. This happensbefore state-basedactions are checked,before triggeredabilities are put on the`stack <#stack>`__, and before`players <#player>`__ receive`priority <#priority>`__.

703.4. The turn-basedactions are as follows:

703.4a. Immediately after the untapstep begins, all phased-in`permanents <#permanent>`__ with`phasing <#phasing>`__ that the activeplayer <#active_player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__`phase out, and all phased-out`permanents <#permanent>`__ that the activeplayer controlled when they`phased out <#phased_in_phased_out>`__`phase <#phase>`__ in. This all happenssimultaneously. See rule 502.1.

703.4b. Immediately after the`phasing <#phasing>`__ action has been completed`during <#during>`__ the untapstep, the activeplayer determines which`permanents <#permanent>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__ will`untap <#untap>`__. Then they untap <#untap>`__them all simultaneously. See rule`502.2.

703.4c. Immediately after the drawstep begins, the activeplayer draws a`card <#card>`__. See rule 504.1.

703.4d. In an`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__ game (see rule`904 <#R904>`__), immediately after the`archenemy <#archenemy>`__’s precombat mainphase begins, that`player <#player>`__ sets the top`card <#card>`__ of their scheme <#scheme>`__`deck in motion. See rule`701.25 <#R70125>`__.

703.4e. Immediately after a`player <#player>`__’s precombat mainphase begins, that`player <#player>`__ puts a lore`counter <#counter>`__ on each Saga <#saga>`__`enchantment they`control <#control_controller>`__. In an`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__ game, this happensafter the archenemy’s`scheme <#scheme>`__ action. See rule`714 <#R714>`__, „Saga <#saga>`__`Cards.”

703.4f. Immediately after the`beginning of combatstep <#beginning_of_combat_step>`__ begins, ifthe game being played is a multiplayergame in which the activeplayer’s`opponents <#opponent>`__ don’t allautomatically become defendingplayers, the activeplayer chooses one of their`opponents <#opponent>`__. That`player <#player>`__ becomes the`defending player <#defending_player>`__. Seerule 507.1.

703.4g. Immediately after the declareattackers step <#declare_attackers_step>`__begins, the `active player <#active_player>`__declares attackers. See rule `508.1.

703.4h. Immediately after the declareblockers step <#declare_blockers_step>`__begins, the `defendingplayer declares blockers.See rule 509.1.

703.4i. Immediately after blockers havebeen declared during the declareblockers step, foreach attackingcreature that’s`become <#becomes>`__ blocked by multiple`creatures <#creature>`__, the activeplayer announces the damageassignment order <#damage_assignment_order>`__among the `blockingcreatures. See rule`509.2 <#R5092>`__.

703.4j. Immediately after the activeplayer has announced damageassignment orders <#damage_assignment_order>`__(if necessary) `during the declareblockers step, foreach creature that’s blockingmultiple creatures, the`defending player <#defending_player>`__announces the damage assignmentorder among the`attacking creatures <#attacking_creature>`__.See rule 509.3.

703.4k. Immediately after the combatdamage step begins,each player in APNAPorder announces how eachattacking or blockingcreature they`control <#control_controller>`__ assigns its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__. See rule`510.1 <#R5101>`__.

703.4m. Immediately after combatdamage has been assigned`during <#during>`__ the combat damagestep, all combatdamage is dealtsimultaneously. See rule 510.2.

703.4n. Immediately after the cleanupstep begins, if the activeplayer’s hand <#hand>`__contains more `cards than their`maximum hand size <#maximum_hand_size>`__(normally seven), they discard <#discard>`__enough `cards to reduce their`hand <#hand>`__ size to that number. See rule`514.1 <#R5141>`__.

703.4p. Immediately after the activeplayer has discarded`cards <#card>`__ (if necessary)`during <#during>`__ the cleanupstep, all`damage <#damage>`__ is`removed <#remove_from_the_game_removed_removed-from-the-game_zone>`__from permanents and all „untilend of turn” and „this turn”effects end.
