810.10. Effects thatcause players to get poisoncounters happen to each`player <#player>`__ individually. The poisoncounters are shared by the`team <#team>`__.

810.10a. If an effect <#effect>`__needs to know how many `poisoncounters an individual`player <#player>`__ has, that`effect <#effect>`__ uses the number of poisoncounters that`player <#player>`__’s team has. Ifan effect needs to know how many`poison counters <#poison_counter>`__ a`player <#player>`__’s opponents <#opponent>`__have, that `effect uses the numberof poison counters <#poison_counter>`__opposing `teams have.

810.10b. If an effect <#effect>`__says that a `player loses poisoncounters, that`player <#player>`__’s team losesthat many poison counters.

810.10c. If an effect <#effect>`__says that a `player can’t get`poison counters <#poison_counter>`__, no`player <#player>`__ on that`player <#player>`__’s team can get`poison counters <#poison_counter>`__.

810.10d. If a rule or`effect <#effect>`__ needs to know what kinds of`counters <#counter>`__ an individual`player <#player>`__ has, that`effect <#effect>`__ uses the kinds of`counters <#counter>`__ that`player <#player>`__ has and the kinds of`counters <#counter>`__ that`player <#player>`__’s team has. A`player <#player>`__ is”poisoned” if that`player <#player>`__’s team has oneor more poison counters.

810.11. The Two-Headed Giantvariant can alsobe played with equally sized teams <#team>`__of more than two `players. For each`player <#player>`__ a team hasbeyond the second, that team’s`starting life total <#starting_life_total>`__is increased by 15 and the number of poisoncounters required for the`team <#team>`__ to lose is increased by five.(These variants are calledThree-Headed Giant, Four-Headed Giant, and soon.)

811. Alternating TeamsVariant

811.1. Alternating Teams <#team>`__games are played with two or more`teams of equal size.

811.2. Any multiplayer`options <#option>`__ used are determined before`play <#play>`__ begins. The Alternating Teamsvariant uses thefollowing default options.

811.2a. The recommended range ofinfluence is 2. Seerule 801, „Limited Range ofInfluence <#limited_range_of_influence>`__`Option.”

811.2b. Exactly one of the`attack <#attack>`__ left, attack <#attack>`__right, and `attack multiple playersoptions <#attack_multiple_players_option>`__must be used. See rule `803,”Attack Left and Attack RightOptions,” and rule`802 <#R802>`__, „Attack Multiple PlayersOption.”

811.2c. The deploy creaturesoption isn’tnormally used in the Alternating Teamsvariant.

811.3. At the start of the game,`players <#player>`__ are seated so that no oneis next to a teammate and each`team <#team>`__ is equally spaced out.*Example: In anAlternating*Teamsgame withthreeteams, A, B, and C, theseating around the table at the start of thegame is A1, B1, C1, A2, B2, C2, A3, B3, C3, andso on.

811.4. A player can’t`attack <#attack>`__ `opponents <#opponent>`__who aren’t seated next to them.

811.5. In the Alternating Teamsvariant, a`team <#team>`__’s resources (cards <#card>`__in `hand, mana, and soon) are not shared. Teammates <#teammate>`__can’t review each other’s `hands <#hand>`__`unless they are sitting next toeach other. Teammates maydiscuss strategies at any time.`Teammates <#teammate>`__ can’t manipulate eachother’s cards or`permanents <#permanent>`__.

9. Casual Variants

900. General

900.1. This section contains additionaloptional rules that can be used for certaincasual game variants. It is by nomeans comprehensive.

900.2. The casual`variants <#variant>`__ detailed here usesupplemental zones, rules,`cards <#card>`__, and other game implements notused in traditional Magic games.

901. Planechase

901.1. In the`Planechase <#planechase>`__`variant <#variant>`__, plane <#plane>`__`cards and`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards <#card>`__add additional `abilities andrandomness to the game. The`Planechase <#planechase>`__`variant <#variant>`__ uses all the normal rulesfor a Magic game, with the following additions.

901.2. A Planechase <#planechase>`__game may be a two-`player game or a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__. Thedefault multiplayer setup is the`Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__`variant <#variant>`__ with the attack multipleplayersoption andwithout the limited range ofinfluence <#limited_range_of_influence>`__`option. See rule 806,”Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__`Variant.”

901.3. In addition to the normal gamematerials, each player needs a`planar deck <#planar_deck>`__ of at least ten`plane <#plane>`__ and/or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards <#card>`__and the game needs one `planardie. No more than two`cards <#card>`__ in a planardeck can be`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards.Each card in a planardeck must have a differentEnglish name. (See rule`309 <#R309>`__, „Planes,” and rule`310 <#R310>`__, „Phenomena.”)

901.3a. A planar die <#planar_die>`__is a six-sided `die. One face has the`Planeswalker symbol <#planeswalker_symbol>`__{PW}. One face has the chaossymbol {CHAOS}. The otherfaces are blank.

901.4. At the start of the game, each`player <#player>`__ shuffles <#shuffle>`__their `planar deck so that the`cards <#card>`__ are in a random order. Each`deck <#deck>`__ is placed facedown next to its`owner <#owner>`__’s library. All`plane <#plane>`__ and`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards <#card>`__remain in the `command <#command>`__`zone throughout the game, both whilethey’re part of a planar deck <#planar_deck>`__and while they’re `face up.

901.5. Once all players <#player>`__have kept their `openinghands and used the`abilities <#ability>`__ of cards <#card>`__that allow them to take an action with those`cards from their openinghands, the startingplayer moves <#move>`__the top `card of their planardeck off that planardeck and turns it faceup. If it’s a`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card,the player puts that`card <#card>`__ on the bottom of their planardeck and repeats this processuntil a plane card isturned face up. (See rule`103.6 <#R1036>`__.) No abilities <#ability>`__of any `card turned faceup this way trigger <#trigger>`__`during this process. The face-up`plane <#plane>`__ card <#card>`__`becomes the starting`plane <#plane>`__.

901.6. The owner of a`plane <#plane>`__ or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card isthe player who started the gamewith it in their planar deck.The controller of aface-up plane or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card isthe player designated as theplanar controller.Normally, the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ is whoeverthe active player is.However, if the current planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ would leavethe game, instead the next`player <#player>`__ in turn order that wouldn’tleave the game becomes the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__, then theold planar controller <#control_controller>`__leaves the game. The new planar`controller retainsthat designation until they leave the game or adifferent player <#player>`__`becomes the activeplayer, whichever comesfirst.

901.7. Any abilities ofa face-up plane card or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card inthe command zone <#zone>`__function from that `zone. The`card <#card>`__’s staticabilities affect the game,its triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__may `trigger, and its activatedabilities may beactivated.

901.7a. A face-up plane <#plane>`__`card or phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`card that’s turned facedown becomes anew object.

901.8. Planechase <#planechase>`__games have an inherent `triggeredability known as the”planeswalking ability.” The fulltext of this ability is „Whenever`you <#you_your>`__ roll {PW},`planeswalk <#planeswalk>`__.” (See rule`701.24 <#R70124>`__,”Planeswalk.”) This`ability <#ability>`__ has no source and iscontrolled by the player whose`planar die <#planar_die>`__ roll caused it to`trigger <#trigger>`__. This is an exception torule 113.8.

901.9. Any time the activeplayer has`priority <#priority>`__ and the`stack <#stack>`__ is empty, but only`during <#during>`__ a mainphase of their turn, that`player <#player>`__ may roll the planardie. Taking this action`costs <#cost>`__ a player anamount of mana equal to the numberof times they have previously taken this actionon that turn. This is a specialaction and doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__. Note that this number won’tbe equal to the number of times the`player <#player>`__ has rolled the planardie that turn if an`effect <#effect>`__ has caused the`player <#player>`__ to roll the planardie that turn. (See rule`116.2i <#R1162i>`__.)

901.9a. If the die roll isa blank face, nothing happens. The activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__.

901.9b. If the die roll isthe chaos symbol {CHAOS},any ability of a face-up`plane <#plane>`__ that starts „When`you <#you_your>`__ roll {CHAOS}”triggers and is put on the`stack <#stack>`__. The activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__.

901.9c. If the die roll isthe Planeswalkersymbol {PW}, the”planeswalking ability”triggers and is put on the`stack <#stack>`__. The activeplayer gets`priority <#priority>`__. (See rule`901.8 <#R9018>`__.)

901.10. When a player <#player>`__leaves the game, all `objects ownedby that player except`abilities <#ability>`__ from phenomena leavethe game. (See rule 800.4a.) Ifthat includes a face-up plane <#plane>`__`card or phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`card, the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ turns thetop card of their planardeck face up.This is not a state-basedaction. It happens assoon as the player leaves thegame.

901.10a. If a plane leavesthe game while a „planeswalking`ability <#ability>`__” is on the`stack <#stack>`__, that `ability <#ability>`__ceases to exist.

901.10b. Abilities fromphenomena owned by a player wholeft the game remain on the stack <#stack>`__controlled by the new planar`controller.

901.11. After the game has started, ifa player moves the top`card <#card>`__ of their planardeck off that planardeck and turns it faceup, that player has”planeswalked.” Continuouseffects with durationsthat last until a player <#player>`__`planeswalks end.`Abilities <#ability>`__ that`trigger <#trigger>`__ when a`player <#player>`__`planeswalks <#planeswalk>`__`trigger <#trigger>`__. See rule`701.24 <#R70124>`__.

901.11a. A player may`planeswalk <#planeswalk>`__ as the result ofthe „planeswalking ability” (seerule 901.8), because the`owner <#owner>`__ of a face-up`plane <#plane>`__ card or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card <#card>`__leaves the game (see rule `901.10),or because a phenomenon’s`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__leaves the stack (see rule`704.6f <#R7046f>`__). Abilities <#ability>`__may also instruct a `player to`planeswalk <#planeswalk>`__.

901.11b. The plane <#plane>`__`card that’s turned faceup is the plane the`player <#player>`__`planeswalks <#planeswalk>`__ to. The`plane <#plane>`__ card or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card <#card>`__that’s turned `face down, orthat leaves the game, is the plane <#plane>`__or `phenomenon the`player <#player>`__`planeswalks <#planeswalk>`__ away from.

901.11c. If a player <#player>`__`planeswalks when there is morethan one face-up plane <#plane>`__`card, that player <#player>`__`planeswalks away from all such`planes <#plane>`__.

901.12. A Two-Headed Giant`Planechase <#planechase>`__ game uses all therules for the Two-Headed Giant multiplayer`variant <#variant>`__ and all the rules for the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__, with the followingadditions.

901.12a. Each player hastheir own planar deck.

901.12b. The planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ is normallythe primary player of the activeteam. However, if the currentplanar controller’s`team <#team>`__ would leave the game,`instead <#instead>`__ the primary`player <#player>`__ of the next`team <#team>`__ in turn order that wouldn’tleave the game becomes the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__, then theold planar`controller <#control_controller>`__’s`team <#team>`__ leaves the game. The new planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ retainsthat designation until they leave the game or adifferent team <#team>`__`becomes the activeteam, whichever comes first.

901.12c. Even though the face-up`plane <#plane>`__ or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ is controlled byjust one player, any`ability <#ability>`__ of that`plane <#plane>`__ or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ that refers to”you” applies to both members ofthe planar`controller <#control_controller>`__’s`team <#team>`__.

901.12d. Since each member of the`active team <#active_team>`__ is an activeplayer, each of them mayroll the planar die. Each`player <#player>`__’s cost to rollthe planar die is based on thenumber of times that particular`player <#player>`__ has already rolled the`planar die <#planar_die>`__ that turn.

901.13. In multiplayer formats otherthan Grand Melee,`plane <#plane>`__ cards and`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards <#card>`__are exempt from the `limited range ofinfluence <#limited_range_of_influence>`__`option. Their`abilities <#ability>`__, and the`effects <#effect>`__ of those`abilities <#ability>`__, affect all applicable`objects <#object>`__ and players <#player>`__in the game. (See rule `801,”Limited Range ofInfluence <#limited_range_of_influence>`__`Option.”)

901.14. In GrandMelee <#grand_melee>`__`Planechase games, multiple`plane <#plane>`__ cards or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards <#card>`__may be `face up at the same time.

901.14a. Before the first turn of thegame of the game, each player whowill start the game with a turnmarker sets a starting`plane <#plane>`__ (see rule`901.5 <#R9015>`__). Each of them is a planar`controller <#control_controller>`__.

901.14b. If a player <#player>`__would leave the game and that`player leaving the game wouldreduce the number of turnmarkers in the game, that`player <#player>`__ first ceases to be a planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ (but noother player <#player>`__`becomes a planar`controller <#control_controller>`__), then that`player <#player>`__ leaves the game. Eachface-up plane card or`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card <#card>`__that `player controlled is put onthe bottom of its owner’s planardeck. No `player <#player>`__is considered to have planeswalked.

901.15. Single PlanarDeck Option

901.15a. As an alternative`option <#option>`__, a`Planechase <#planechase>`__ game may be playedwith just a single communal planardeck. In that case, the numberof cards in the planardeck must be at least forty orat least ten times the number of`players <#player>`__ in the game, whichever issmaller. The planar deck <#planar_deck>`__can’t contain more `phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`cards than twice the number of`players <#player>`__ in the game. Each`card <#card>`__ in the planardeck must have a differentEnglish name.

901.15b. In a`Planechase <#planechase>`__ game using thesingle planar deck <#planar_deck>`__`option, the planar`controller <#control_controller>`__ isconsidered to be the owner of all`cards <#card>`__ in the planardeck.

901.15c. If any rule or`ability <#ability>`__ refers to a`player <#player>`__’s planardeck, the communal planardeck is used.

902. Vanguard

902.1. In the Vanguard <#vanguard>`__`variant, a`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card allowseach player to play <#play>`__the role of a famous character. Each`player will have one face-up`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card whose`abilities <#ability>`__ and other`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ affectthe game. The Vanguard <#vanguard>`__`variant uses all the normal rulesfor a Magic game, with the following additions.

902.2. A Vanguard gamemay be a two-player game or a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__.

902.3. In addition to the normal gamematerials, each player needs a`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card. Each`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card is`placed <#placed>`__ face up nextto its owner’s`library <#library>`__ before the game begins.All vanguard cards <#card>`__remain in the `command <#command>`__`zone throughout the game.

902.4. Each player’s`starting life total <#starting_life_total>`__is 20 plus or minus the lifemodifier of their`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card.*Example: The*lifemodifierofaplayer«svanguardcardis-3. Thatplayer«sstartinglife totalis 17.

902.5. Each player’s`starting hand size <#starting_hand_size>`__ isseven cards, as modified by the`hand modifier <#hand_modifier>`__ of their`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card.

902.5a. If a player takesa mulligan in a`Vanguard <#vanguard>`__ game, just like in anormal game, that player <#player>`__`shuffles their hand <#hand>`__back into their `library, then`draws <#draw>`__ a new hand equalto their starting handsize. (In a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__, a`player <#player>`__’s first`mulligan <#mulligan>`__ is for the same numberof cards as they had before.) Seerule 103.4. Example: Thehandmodifierofaplayer«svanguardcardis+2. Thatplayerstarts thegame with ahandof9cards. Iftheplayertakesamulliganthree timesbefore keeping, theydrawanewhandofninecardsand put three ofthose on the bottom oftheirlibrary.

902.5b. A player’s`maximum hand size <#maximum_hand_size>`__ isseven, as modified by the handmodifier of their`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card.*Example: The*handmodifierofaplayer«svanguardcardis-1. Thatplayer«smaximumhand sizeis six. Ifthatplayerhas more thansixcardsintheirhandas theircleanupstepbegins, theywilldiscardall but six ofthem.

902.6. The owner of a`vanguard <#vanguard>`__ card is the`player <#player>`__ who started the game withit in the command <#command>`__`zone. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of aface-up vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card is its owner.

902.7. Any abilities ofa face-up vanguard <#vanguard>`__`card in the command <#command>`__`zone function from that`zone <#zone>`__. The card’s staticabilities affect the game,its triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__may `trigger, and its activatedabilities may beactivated.

903. Commander

903.1. In the`Commander <#commander>`__`variant <#variant>`__, each deck isled by a legendary <#legendary>`__`creature designated as that`deck <#deck>`__’s commander.The Commander <#commander>`__`variant was created andpopularized by fans; an`independent <#independent>`__ rules committeemaintains additional resources atMTGCommander.net. The Commander <#commander>`__`variant uses all the normal rulesfor a Magic game, with the following additions.

903.2. A Commander <#commander>`__game may be a two-`player game or a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__. Thedefault multiplayer setup is the`Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__`variant <#variant>`__ with the attack multipleplayersoption andwithout the limited range ofinfluence <#limited_range_of_influence>`__`option. See rule 806,”Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__`Variant.”

903.3. Each deck has a`legendary <#legendary>`__`creature <#creature>`__ card <#card>`__designated as its `commander.This designation is not a`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ of the`object <#object>`__ represented by the`card <#card>`__; rather, it is an attribute ofthe card itself. The`card <#card>`__ retains this designation evenwhen it changes zones. Example:Acommanderthat’s beenturnedface down(due toIxidron’seffect, forexample) is stillacommander.Acommanderthat’s copyinganothercard(due toCytoshape’seffect, forexample) is stillacommander.Apermanentthat’s copyingacommander(such as a BodyDouble, for example, copyingacommanderinaplayer«sgraveyard)is not acommander.

903.3a. Some`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`cards <#card>`__ have an ability <#ability>`__that states the `card can be`your <#you_your>`__ commander.This ability modifies the rulesfor deck construction, and itfunctions before the game begins. See also rule`113.6m <#R1136m>`__.

903.3b. If a player’s`commander <#commander>`__ is a meldcard and it’s melded with theother member of its meld pair, theresulting melded permanent isthat player’s`commander <#commander>`__.

903.3c. If a player’s`commander <#commander>`__ is a component of a`merged permanent <#merged_permanent>`__, theresulting mergedpermanent is that`player <#player>`__’s`commander <#commander>`__.

903.3d. If an effect <#effect>`__refers to controlling a`commander, it refers to a`permanent <#permanent>`__ on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ that is a`commander <#commander>`__. If an`effect <#effect>`__ refers to casting a`commander <#commander>`__, it refers to a`spell <#spell>`__ that is a`commander <#commander>`__. If an`effect <#effect>`__ refers to a`commander <#commander>`__ in a specific`zone <#zone>`__, it refers to a`card <#card>`__ in that zone thatis a commander.

903.4. The Commander <#commander>`__`variant uses coloridentity to determine what`cards <#card>`__ can be in a deck <#deck>`__with a certain `commander. The`color identity <#color_identity>`__ of a`card <#card>`__ is the color or`colors <#color>`__ of any manasymbols in that`card <#card>`__’s mana cost or`rules text <#rules_text>`__, plus any`colors <#color>`__ defined by its`characteristic-definingabilities <#characteristic-defining_ability>`__(see rule 604.3) or colorindicator (see rule`204 <#R204>`__). Example: Bosh, Iron Golem isalegendaryartifactcreaturewithmanacost{8} andtheability„{3}{R},Sacrificeanartifact:Bosh, IronGolemdealsdamageequalto thesacrificedartifact«sconvertedmana costtoanytarget.” Bosh’scoloridentityis red.

903.4a. Coloridentity is establishedbefore the game begins.

903.4b. If a commander <#commander>`__has a `static ability thatcauses a player to choose its`color <#color>`__ before the game begins, thatchoice applies during <#during>`__`deck construction and throughout thegame, even as the commander <#commander>`__changes `zones. That choice affectsthe commander’s coloridentity. The`player <#player>`__ reveals thatchoice as they put their`commander <#commander>`__ into the`command <#command>`__ zone beforethe game begins. See rules 103.2c <#R1032c>`__and `607.2n.

903.4c. Remindertext is ignored whendetermining a card’s coloridentity. See rule`207.2 <#R2072>`__.

903.4d. The back face of a`double-faced card <#double-faced_cards>`__ (seerule 711) is included whendetermining a card’s coloridentity. This is anexception to rule 711.4a.*Example: Civilized Scholar is the front face ofa*double-facedcardwithmanacost{2}{U}. Homicidal Bruteis the back face of thatdouble-facedcardand has aredcolor indicator.Thecard«scoloridentityis blue andred.

903.4e. If an ability <#ability>`__refers to the `colors or number of`colors <#color>`__ in a`commander <#commander>`__’s coloridentity, that quality isundefined if that player doesn’thave a commander. That part ofthe ability won’t do anything.`Costs <#cost>`__ that refer to that quality areunpayable.

903.5. Each Commander <#commander>`__`deck is subject to the following`deck <#deck>`__ construction rules.

903.5a. Each deck mustcontain exactly 100 <#R100>`__`cards, including its`commander <#commander>`__. In other words, the`minimum deck size <#minimum_deck_size>`__ andthe maximum deck size are both`100. <#R100>`__

903.5b. Other than basic <#basic>`__`lands, each card in a`Commander <#commander>`__ deck musthave a different English name.

903.5c. A card can beincluded in a Commander <#commander>`__`deck only if every`color <#color>`__ in its coloridentity is also found inthe color identity of the`deck <#deck>`__’s commander.*Example: Wort, the Raidmother isa*legendarycreaturewithmanacost{4}{R/G}{R/G}.Wort’scoloridentityis red andgreen. Eachcardin aWortCommanderdeckmustbe only red, only green, both red and green, orhave nocolor. Eachmanasymbolin themanacostorrulestextofacardinthisdeckmust be only red, onlygreen, both red and green, or havenocolor.

903.5d. A card with a`basic land type <#basic_land_type>`__ may beincluded in a Commander <#commander>`__`deck only if each color <#color>`__of `mana it could produce is includedin the commander’s coloridentity. Example: Wort,the Raidmother’scoloridentityis red andgreen. AWortCommanderdeckmayincludelandcardswiththebasic landtypesMountainand/orForest.It can’t includeanylandcardswiththebasic landtypesPlains,Island,orSwamp.

903.6. At the start of the game, each`player <#player>`__ puts their`commander <#commander>`__ from their`deck <#deck>`__ face up into the`command <#command>`__ zone. Theneach player <#player>`__`shuffles the remaining 99`cards <#card>`__ of their deck sothat the cards are in a randomorder. Those cards <#card>`__`become the player’s`library <#library>`__.

903.7. Once the startingplayer has beendetermined, each player sets their`life total <#life_life_total>`__ to 40 and`draws <#draw>`__ a hand of seven`cards <#card>`__.

903.8. A player may`cast <#cast>`__ a commander <#commander>`__they own from the `command <#command>`__`zone. A commander <#commander>`__`cast from the command <#command>`__`zone costs an additional{2} for each previous time the`player <#player>`__ casting it has`cast <#cast>`__ it from the`command <#command>`__ zone thatgame. This additionalcost is informally knownas the „commander tax.”

903.9. A commander mayreturn to the command <#command>`__`zone during a`Commander <#commander>`__ game.

903.9a. If a commander <#commander>`__is in a `graveyard or in`exile <#exile>`__ and that object <#object>`__was put into that `zone since thelast time state-basedactions were checked,its owner may put it into the`command <#command>`__ zone. This isa state-based action.See rule 704.

903.9b. If a commander <#commander>`__would be put into its `owner’s`hand <#hand>`__ or library fromanywhere, its owner may put it intothe command zone <#zone>`__`instead. This replacementeffect may apply morethan once to the same event. Thisis an exception to rule 614.5.

903.9c. If a commander <#commander>`__is a melded `permanent or a`merged permanent <#merged_permanent>`__ and its`owner <#owner>`__ chooses to put it into the`command <#command>`__ zone usingthe replacement effect <#replacement_effect>`__described in rule `903.9b, that`permanent <#permanent>`__ and each componentrepresenting it that isn’t a`commander <#commander>`__ are put into theappropriate zone, and the`card <#card>`__ that represents it and is a`commander <#commander>`__ is put into the`command <#command>`__ zone.

903.10. The Commander <#commander>`__`variant includes the followingspecification for winning and losing the game.All other rules for ending the game also apply.(See rule 104.)

903.10a. A player that’sbeen dealt 21 or more combatdamage by the same`commander <#commander>`__ over the course ofthe game loses the game. (This is a state-basedaction. See rule`704. <#R704>`__)

903.11. If a player isallowed to bring a card from`outside the game <#outside_the_game>`__ into a`Commander <#commander>`__ game, that`player <#player>`__ can’t bring a`card <#card>`__ into the game this way if ithas the same name as a`card <#card>`__ that player hadin their starting deck, ifit has the same name as a`card <#card>`__ that the player <#player>`__has already brought into the game, or if any`color in its coloridentity isn’t in the`color identity <#color_identity>`__ of the`player <#player>`__’s`commander <#commander>`__.

903.12. Brawl <#brawl>`__`Option

903.12a. Brawl is an`option <#option>`__ for a different style of`Commander <#commander>`__ game.`Brawl <#brawl>`__ games use the normal rulesfor the Commander <#commander>`__`variant with the followingmodifications.

903.12b. Brawl <#brawl>`__`decks are usually`constructed <#constructed>`__ using`cards <#card>`__ from the Standard format.

903.12c. A player <#player>`__designates either a `legendary <#legendary>`__`planeswalker or a`legendary <#legendary>`__`creature <#creature>`__ as their`commander <#commander>`__.

903.12d. A player’s`deck <#deck>`__ must contain exactly 60`cards <#card>`__, including its`commander <#commander>`__. In other words, the`minimum deck size <#minimum_deck_size>`__ andthe maximum deck size are both 60.

903.12e. If a player’s`commander <#commander>`__ has no`colors <#color>`__ in its coloridentity, that`player <#player>`__’s deck maycontain any number of basic <#basic>`__`lands of one basic landtype of their choice. Thisis an exception to rule 903.5d.

903.12f. In a two-player <#player>`__`Brawl game, each`player <#player>`__’s starting lifetotal is 25. In amultiplayer Brawl game, each`player <#player>`__’s starting lifetotal is 30.

903.12g. In any Brawl <#brawl>`__game, the first `mulligan a`player <#player>`__ takes doesn’t count towardthe number of cards that`player <#player>`__ will put on the bottom oftheir library or the number of`mulligans <#mulligan>`__ that`player <#player>`__ may take. Subsequent`mulligans <#mulligan>`__ are counted towardthese numbers as normal.

903.12h. Brawl games donot use the state-basedaction described inrule 704.6c, which causes a`player <#player>`__ to lose thegame if they’ve been dealt21 or more combat damage bya commander.

903.13. CommanderDraft

903.13a. CommanderDraft is an`option <#option>`__ for a different style of`Commander <#commander>`__ game. It consists ofa draft (a style of`limited <#limited>`__ play where`players <#player>`__ choose cards <#card>`__from sealed `booster packs tobuild their decks) followed by a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__. The`Commander Draft <#commander_draft>`__`option <#option>`__ uses`Commander <#commander>`__ Legends <#legend>`__`booster packs by default.

903.13b. A draft typicallyconsists of three draftrounds. In each draftround, each`player <#player>`__ opens a boosterpack, drafts two`cards <#card>`__ by placing them in a face-down`pile <#pile>`__ in front of them, then`passes <#pass>`__ the remaining`cards <#card>`__ to the next`player <#player>`__. Each player <#player>`__then `drafts two cards <#card>`__from the `booster pack passedto them and passes the remaining`cards <#card>`__. This procedure continuesuntil all cards in that draftround have been drafted.

903.13c. In the first and third draftrounds, boosterpacks are passed to each`player <#player>`__’s left. In the second`draft round <#draft_round>`__, boosterpacks are passed to each`player <#player>`__’s right.

903.13d. During the`draft <#draft>`__, a player canlook only at cards in the boosterpack they are currentlydrafting from and cards they havealready drafted. A player may not`reveal <#reveal>`__ drafted cards <#card>`__to other `players <#player>`__`unless an `ability <#ability>`__instructs them to.

903.13e. After the draft <#draft>`__is complete, the `cards a`player <#player>`__ drafted`become <#becomes>`__ that`player <#player>`__’s cardpool. A player mayadd up to two cards named ThePrismatic Piper to their cardpool, but only if those`cards <#card>`__ are used as the`player <#player>`__’s`commander <#commander>`__(s).

903.13f. CommanderDraft deck <#deck>`__construction follows the same rules as`Commander deck <#deck>`__construction (see rule `903.5) withtwo exceptions: (1) A player’s`deck <#deck>`__ must contain at least 60`cards <#card>`__. There is no maximum`deck <#deck>`__ size. (2) A`player <#player>`__’s deck mayinclude any number of cards fromthat player’s cardpool with the same`name <#name>`__.

903.13g. CommanderDraft games follow thesame rules as Commander games.See rules 903.6-903.11.

904. Archenemy

904.1. In the`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__`variant <#variant>`__, a team of`players <#player>`__ faces off against a single`opponent <#opponent>`__ strengthened withpowerful scheme cards.The Archenemy <#archenemy>`__`variant uses all the normal rulesfor a Magic game, with the following additions.

904.2. The default setup for an`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__ game is the`Team <#team>`__ vs. Team <#team>`__multiplayer `variant (see rule`808 <#R808>`__) involving exactly two`teams <#team>`__. The attack multiple playersoption (seerule 802) and the shared team turnsoption (see rule`805 <#R805>`__) are used; no other multiplayer`options <#option>`__ are used.

904.2a. One of the teams <#team>`__consists of exactly one `player,who is designated the`archenemy <#archenemy>`__.

904.2b. The other team <#team>`__consists of any number of `players.

904.3. In addition to the normal gamematerials, the archenemy needsa scheme deck of atleast twenty scheme <#scheme>`__`cards. A scheme <#scheme>`__`deck may contain no more than two ofany card with a particular English`name <#name>`__. (See rule 312,”Schemes.”)

904.4. At the start of the game, the`archenemy <#archenemy>`__`shuffles <#shuffle>`__ their`scheme <#scheme>`__ deck so thatthe cards are in a random order. The`scheme <#scheme>`__ deck is`placed <#placed>`__ face down <#face_down>`__next to the `archenemy’s`library <#library>`__. All scheme <#scheme>`__`cards remain in the`command <#command>`__ zone <#zone>`__throughout the game, both while they’re part ofa `scheme deck andwhile they’re face up.

904.5. The archenemy’s`starting life total <#starting_life_total>`__is 40. Each other player’s`starting life total <#starting_life_total>`__is 20.

904.6. Rather than a randomlydetermined player, the`archenemy <#archenemy>`__ takes the first turnof the game.

904.7. The owner of a`scheme <#scheme>`__ card is the`player <#player>`__ who started the game withit in the command <#command>`__`zone. The`controller <#control_controller>`__ of aface-up scheme card isits owner.

904.8. Any abilities ofa face-up scheme card <#card>`__in the `command zone <#zone>`__function from that `zone. The`card <#card>`__’s staticabilities affect the game,its triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__may `trigger, and its activatedabilities may beactivated.

904.9. Immediately after the`archenemy <#archenemy>`__’s precombat mainphase begins`during <#during>`__ each of their turns, that`player <#player>`__ moves the top`card <#card>`__ of their scheme <#scheme>`__`deck off that scheme <#scheme>`__`deck and turns it faceup. This is called „setting that`scheme <#scheme>`__ in motion.” (See rule`701.25 <#R70125>`__.) This turn-basedaction doesn’t use the`stack <#stack>`__. Abilities ofthat scheme card that`trigger <#trigger>`__ „When you <#you_your>`__set this `scheme in motion”trigger.

904.10. If a non-ongoing <#ongoing>`__`scheme card is faceup in the command <#command>`__`zone, and no triggeredabilities of any`scheme <#scheme>`__ are on the`stack <#stack>`__ or waiting to be put on the`stack <#stack>`__, that scheme <#scheme>`__`card is turned facedown and put on the bottom ofits owner’s scheme <#scheme>`__`deck the next time a`player <#player>`__ would receive`priority <#priority>`__. (This is a`state-based action <#state-based_actions>`__.See rule 704.)

904.11. Once an ongoing <#ongoing>`__`scheme card is set inmotion, it remains faceup in the command <#command>`__`zone until an ability <#ability>`__causes it to be abandoned (see rule`701.26).

904.12. SupervillainRumble <#supervillain_rumble>`__`Option

904.12a. As an alternative`option <#option>`__, players may`play <#play>`__ a`Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__ game in whicheach player has their own`scheme <#scheme>`__ deck. The`attack multiple playersoption <#attack_multiple_players_option>`__ (seerule 802) is used; no othermultiplayer options are used.

904.12b. Each player inthis game is an archenemy.

904.12c. As in a normal`Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__ game, the`starting player <#starting_player>`__ israndomly determined. All other rules that applyto the archenemy in an`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__ game apply to each`player <#player>`__ in a SupervillainRumble game.

905. ConspiracyDraft

905.1. The ConspiracyDraft <#conspiracy_draft>`__`variant consists of a`draft <#draft>`__ (a style of`limited <#limited>`__ play where`players <#player>`__ choose cards <#card>`__from sealed `booster packs tobuild their decks) followed by a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__. The`Conspiracy Draft <#conspiracy_draft>`__`variant <#variant>`__ uses Magic: TheGathering–Conspiracy (tm)and/or Conspiracy: Take theCrown (tm) booster packs bydefault.

905.1a. A draft typicallyconsists of three draftrounds. In each draftround, each`player <#player>`__ opens a boosterpack, drafts one`card <#card>`__ by placing that`card <#card>`__ in a face-down pile <#pile>`__in front of the `player, then`passes <#pass>`__ the remaining`cards <#card>`__ to the next`player <#player>`__. Each player <#player>`__then `drafts a card fromthe booster pack passed tothem and passes the remaining`cards <#card>`__. This procedure continuesuntil all cards in that draftround have been drafted.

905.1b. In the first and third draftrounds, boosterpacks are passed to each`player <#player>`__’s left. In the second`draft round <#draft_round>`__, boosterpacks are passed to each`player <#player>`__’s right.

905.1c. During the`draft <#draft>`__, a player canlook only at cards in the boosterpack they are currentlydrafting from, cards they havealready drafted, cards that arecurrently revealed as described in rule`905.2b <#R9052b>`__, and cards thathave been drafted face up asdescribed in rule 905.2c. A`player <#player>`__ may not`reveal <#reveal>`__ drafted cards <#card>`__to other `players <#player>`__`unless an `ability <#ability>`__instructs them to.

905.1d. After the draft <#draft>`__and all actions that may be taken`during or after the`draft <#draft>`__, all the cards a`player <#player>`__ has drafted`become <#becomes>`__ that`player <#player>`__’s cardpool. The player <#player>`__builds their `deck from only these`cards <#card>`__ and any number of`basic <#basic>`__ land <#land>`__`cards. See rules`100.2b <#R1002b>`__ and 100.4b.

905.2. Some cards have`abilities <#ability>`__ that function`during <#during>`__ the draft.

905.2a. During a`draft <#draft>`__, there is no activeplayer or system of`priority <#priority>`__. If multiple`players <#player>`__ wish to take an action atthe same time during the`draft <#draft>`__ and can’t agree on an order,those actions are taken in a random order.

905.2b. Some cards instruct`players <#player>`__ to reveal <#reveal>`__them as they’re drafted and then note someinformation, such as a number or`color. This information can bereferred to by other abilities <#ability>`__`during the game. Any`player <#player>`__ can look at thisinformation at any time during the`draft <#draft>`__ or game. After theinformation is noted, the drafted`card <#card>`__ is turned facedown and added to the`player <#player>`__’s drafted cards <#card>`__`pile.

905.2c. Some cards instruct`players <#player>`__ to draft them`face up <#face_up>`__. Each such`card <#card>`__ remains face up <#face_up>`__until the `draft is complete, an`effect <#effect>`__ instructs the person whodrafted it to turn it facedown, or the card <#card>`__leaves that `player’s drafted`cards <#card>`__ pile. While the`card <#card>`__ is face up, all`players <#player>`__ may look at it.

905.3. A ConspiracyDraft game is a`multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__. Thedefault multiplayer setup is the`Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__`variant <#variant>`__ with the attack multipleplayersoption andwithout the limited range ofinfluence <#limited_range_of_influence>`__`option. See rule 806,”Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__`Variant.”

905.4. At the start of the game, before`decks <#deck>`__ are shuffled, each`player <#player>`__ may put any number of`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ cards <#card>`__from their `sideboard into the`command <#command>`__ zone.

905.4a. Conspiracy cards with hiddenagenda are put into the command zone face down. Any time a player has priority, they may turn a face-down conspiracy card they control face up. See rule 702.105, „HiddenAgenda.”

905.5. The owner of a conspiracy card is the player who put it into the command zone at the start of the game. The controller of a conspiracy card is its owner.

905.6. Once the starting player has been determined, each player sets their life total to 20 and draws a hand of seven cards.

Glossary

APNAP Order: See Active Player, Nonactive PlayerOrder.

Abandon: To turn a face-up ongoing <#ongoing>`__`scheme card facedown and put it on the bottom ofits owner’s scheme <#scheme>`__`deck. See rule 701.26,”Abandon.”

Ability: 1. Text on an object thatexplains what that object does or cando. 2. An activated or triggered ability on the`stack <#stack>`__. This kind of ability is an`object <#object>`__. See rule 113, „Abilities,” and section 6,”Spells, Abilities, and Effects.”

Ability Word: An italicized word with no rulesmeaning that ties together abilities <#ability>`__on different `cards that have similarfunctionality. See rule 207.2c.

Absorb: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that `prevents damage.See rule 702.63, „Absorb.”

Activate: To put an activatedability onto the`stack <#stack>`__ and pay its`costs <#cost>`__, so that it will eventually`resolve <#resolve>`__ and have its`effect <#effect>`__. See rule 602,”Activating ActivatedAbilities.”

Activated Ability: A kind of`ability <#ability>`__. Activated abilities arewritten as „[Cost]:[Effect.] [Activation instructions(if any).]” See rule 113,”Abilities,” and rule`602 <#R602>`__, „Activating Activated Abilities.”

Activation Cost: Everything that appears before thecolon in an activatedability’s text. It must bepaid to activate the`ability <#ability>`__. See rule 118,”Costs,” and rule 602,”Activating ActivatedAbilities.”

Active Player: The player whose turnit is. See rule 102.1.

Active Player, Nonactive Player Order: A systemthat determines the order by which`players <#player>`__ make choices if multiple`players <#player>`__ are instructed to makechoices at the same time. See rule`101.4 <#R1014>`__. This rule is modified for gamesusing the shared team turnsoption; see rule`805.6 <#R8056>`__.

Active Team: The team whose turn it isin a game using the shared team turnsoption. See rule`805.4a <#R8054a>`__.

Adapt: A keyword action thatputs +1/+1 counters on a`creature <#creature>`__ that doesn’t have any yet.See rule 701.43, „Adapt.”

Additional Cost: A cost a`spell <#spell>`__ may have that its`controller <#control_controller>`__ may`pay <#pay>`__ (or, in some cases, must`pay <#pay>`__) in addition to its manacost to cast that`spell <#spell>`__. See rule 118,”Costs,” and rule 601,”Casting Spells.”

Adventurer Card: Cards with a two-part`card <#card>`__ frame (one part of which is inseton the left) on a single card. See rule`715 <#R715>`__, „Adventurer Cards.”

Affinity: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that reduces how much `mana <#mana>`__`you need to spend to`cast <#cast>`__ a spell. See rule`702.40 <#R70240>`__, „Affinity.”

Afflict: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that makes the `defendingplayer lose`life <#life_life_total>`__ for blocking. See rule`702.129 <#R702129>`__, „Afflict.”

Afterlife: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that leaves behind Spirit `creature <#creature>`__`tokens when certain`creatures <#creature>`__ die. See rule`702.134 <#R702134>`__, „Afterlife.”

Aftermath: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player cast <#cast>`__one half of a `split card onlyfrom their graveyard. See rule`702.126 <#R702126>`__, „Aftermath.”

Alternating Teams Variant: A multiplayer`variant <#variant>`__ played among two or more`teams <#team>`__ of equal size. See rule`811 <#R811>`__, „Alternating Teams Variant.”

Alternative Cost: A cost a`spell <#spell>`__ may have that its`controller <#control_controller>`__ can`pay <#pay>`__ rather than paying its manacost. See rule 118,”Costs,” and rule 601,”Casting Spells.”

Amass: A keyword action thangives you a Zombie Army`creature <#creature>`__ token orgrows an Army you already have. Seerule 701.44, „Amass.”

Amplify: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__than can have a `creature enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it. See rule`702.37 <#R70237>`__, „Amplify.”

Anchor Word: A word that precedes one of two`abilities <#ability>`__ a`permanent <#permanent>`__ may enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with. See rule`614.12b <#R61412b>`__.

Annihilator: A keywordability that can make a`creature <#creature>`__ particularly brutal whenit attacks. See rule`702.85 <#R70285>`__, „Annihilator.”

Ante: 1. A zone used only when playing”for keeps.” 2. To put a card into theante zone. See rule 407,”Ante.”

Any Target: A spell or`ability <#ability>`__ may require „any target.””Any target” is the same as „target <#target>`__`creature, player, or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__.” See rule`115.4 <#R1154>`__.

Archenemy: 1. A casual variant inwhich a team of players <#player>`__faces off against a single `opponent <#opponent>`__strengthened with powerful `scheme <#scheme>`__`cards. See rule 904,”Archenemy.” 2. A player in anArchenemy game who is playing with a`scheme <#scheme>`__ deck.

Artifact: A card type. An artifactis a permanent. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts.”

Artifact Creature: A combination of`artifact <#artifact>`__ and`creature <#creature>`__ that’s subject to therules for both. See rule 301,”Artifacts,” and rule`302 <#R302>`__, „Creatures.”

Artifact Land: A combination of`artifact <#artifact>`__ and land <#land>`__that’s subject to the rules for both. Artifactlands can only be played as `lands, not`cast <#cast>`__ as spells. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts,” andrule 305, „Lands.”

Artifact Type: A subtype that’scorrelated to the artifact cardtype. See rule 301,”Artifacts.” See rule`205.3g <#R2053g>`__ for the list of artifacttypes.

As Though: Text used to indicate that the game, forsome specific purpose, treats a condition as trueeven though it’s not. See rule 609.4.

Ascend: A keyword causing a player toget the designation of the city’sblessing once they`control <#control_controller>`__ ten`permanents <#permanent>`__. See rule`702.130 <#R702130>`__, „Ascend.”

Assemble: Assemble is a keywordaction in the Unstable setthat puts Contraptions onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. `Cards <#card>`__and mechanics from the Unstable set aren’t includedin these rules.

Assign Combat Damage: To determine how an attackingor blocking creature will`deal <#deal>`__ its combatdamage. See rule`510 <#R510>`__, „Combat DamageStep.”

Assist: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets another `player help`you <#you_your>`__ pay for a`spell <#spell>`__. See rule`702.131 <#R702131>`__, „Assist.”

At End of Turn (Obsolete): A triggercondition printed on`abilities <#ability>`__ that triggered at thebeginning of the end step (which isnot the last thing to happen in the turn).`Cards <#card>`__ that were printed with that texthave received errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to say „at the beginningof the end step” or „at thebeginning of the next end step.”See rule 513, „EndStep.”

Attach: To move an Aura,`Equipment <#equipment>`__, or`Fortification <#fortification>`__ onto another`object <#object>`__ or player. Seerule 701.3, „Attach.”

Attack: To send a creature intocombat offensively. A creature canattack a player or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__. See rule`508 <#R508>`__, „Declare AttackersStep.”

Attack Alone: A creature”attacks alone” if it’s the only`creature <#creature>`__ declared as an attacker`during <#during>`__ the declare attackersstep. A`creature <#creature>`__ „is attacking alone” ifit’s attacking but no other`creatures <#creature>`__ are. See rule`506.5 <#R5065>`__.

Attack Left Option: An option thatmay be used in certain multiplayer`variants <#variant>`__. See rule 803,”Attack Left and Attack RightOptions.”

Attack Multiple Players Option: An`option <#option>`__ that may be used in certainmultiplayer variants. See rule`802 <#R802>`__, „Attack Multiple Players Option.”

Attack Right Option: An option thatmay be used in certain multiplayer`variants <#variant>`__. See rule 803,”Attack Left and Attack RightOptions.”

Attacking Creature: A creature thathas either been declared as part of a legal`attack <#attack>`__ during the`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ (once all`costs <#cost>`__ to attack, if any,have been paid), or a creature thathas been put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ attacking. Itremains an attacking creature until it’s removedfrom combat or the`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ ends, whichevercomes first. See rule 508, „DeclareAttackers Step.”

Attacking Team: The team who can`attack <#attack>`__ during the`combat phase <#combat_phase>`__ of a multiplayergame using the shared teamturns option. Seerule 805, „Shared Team TurnsOption.”

Attacks and Isn’t Blocked: An`ability <#ability>`__ that triggers <#trigger>`__when a `creature „attacks and isn’tblocked” triggers when the`creature <#creature>`__ becomes anunblocked attackingcreature. See rule`509.1h <#R5091h>`__.

Aura: An enchantment <#enchantment>`__`subtype. Aura spells <#spell>`__`target objects or`players <#player>`__, and Aura`permanents <#permanent>`__ are attached to`objects <#object>`__ or players. Seerule 303,”Enchantments,” and rule`702.5 <#R7025>`__, „Enchant.”

Aura Swap: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you <#you_your>`__`exchange an Aura on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with one in`your <#you_your>`__ hand. See rule`702.64 <#R70264>`__, „Aura Swap.”

Awaken: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you turn a`land <#land>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control into a`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.112 <#R702112>`__, „Awaken.”

Banding, „Bands with Other”: Banding is a keywordability that modifies therules for declaring attackers and assigning combatdamage. „Bands with other” is aspecialized version of the ability.See rule 702.21, „Banding.”

Base Power, Base Toughness: Effects <#effect>`__that change the base power and/or base toughness ofa `creature set one or both of thosevalues to a specific number. See rule`613 <#R613>`__, „Interaction of ContinuousEffects.”

Basic: A supertype that’s normallyrelevant on lands. Any land <#land>`__with this `supertype is a basic`land <#land>`__. See rule 205.4,”Supertypes.”

Basic Land Type: There are five „basic land types”:Plains, Island,`Swamp <#swamp>`__, Mountain, and`Forest <#forest>`__. Each one has a manaability associated with it. Seerule 305, „Lands.”

Basic Landcycling: See`Typecycling <#typecycling>`__.

Battle Cry: A keywordability that makes other`attacking creatures <#attacking_creature>`__better in combat. See rule 702.90,”Battle Cry.”

Battlefield: A zone. The battlefield isthe zone in which`permanents <#permanent>`__ exist. It used to beknown as the „in-play”zone. See rule 403,”Battlefield.”

Becomes: A word used in some triggerevents to indicate a change in`status <#status>`__ or`characteristics <#characteristics>`__. See rule`603.2e <#R6032e>`__.

Beginning Phase: Part of the turn. This`phase <#phase>`__ is the first phase <#phase>`__of the turn. See rule `501, „BeginningPhase.”

Beginning of Combat Step: Part of the turn. This`step <#step>`__ is the first step ofthe combat phase. See rule`507 <#R507>`__, „Beginning of Combat Step.”

Bestow: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `creature <#creature>`__`card be cast as an`Aura <#aura>`__. See rule 702.102,”Bestow.”

Block: To send a creature intocombat defensively. A creature canblock an attackingcreature. See rule`509 <#R509>`__, „Declare BlockersStep.”

Block Alone: A creature”blocks alone” if it’s the only`creature <#creature>`__ declared as a blocker`during <#during>`__ the declare blockersstep. A`creature <#creature>`__ „is blocking alone” ifit’s blocking but no other`creatures <#creature>`__ are. See rule`506.5 <#R5065>`__.

Blocked Creature: An attackingcreature that another`creature <#creature>`__ blocks orthat an effect causes to`become <#becomes>`__ blocked. It remains a blockedcreature until it’s removed fromcombat, an`effect <#effect>`__ says that it`becomes <#becomes>`__ unblocked, or the combatphase ends, whichever comesfirst. See rule 509, „Declare BlockersStep.”

Blocking Creature: A creature thathas either been declared as part of a legal`block <#block>`__ during the combatphase (once all`costs <#cost>`__ to block, if any,have been paid), or a creature thathas been put onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ blocking. It remainsa blocking creature until it’s removed fromcombat or the combatphase ends, whichever comesfirst. See rule 509, „Declare BlockersStep.”

Bloodthirst: A keywordability that can have a`creature <#creature>`__ enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it. See rule`702.53 <#R70253>`__, „Bloodthirst.”

Boast: A special kind of activatedability that can beactivated only once each turn if the`creature <#creature>`__ with the boast`ability <#ability>`__ attacked that turn. See rule`702.141 <#R702141>`__, „Boast.”

Bolster: A keyword action <#keyword_action>`__that puts +1/+1 `counters on theweakest creature a`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__. See rule`701.33 <#R70133>`__, „Bolster.”

Booster Pack: A group of unopened Magic`cards <#card>`__ from a particular expansion.Booster packs are used in Limited <#limited>`__formats. See rule `100.2b.

Brawl: An option for the`Commander <#commander>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. See rule`903.12 <#R90312>`__, „Brawl Option.”

Bury (Obsolete): A term that meant „put [a`permanent <#permanent>`__] into its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard.”In general, cards thatwere printed with the term „bury” have receivederrata in the Oracle card <#card>`__reference to read, „`Destroy [a`permanent <#permanent>`__]. It can’t beregenerated,” or „Sacrifice [a`permanent <#permanent>`__].”

Bushido: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can make a `creature better incombat. See rule 702.44, „Bushido.”

Buyback: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__of `instants and`sorceries <#sorcery>`__ that can let the`spell <#spell>`__ return to its`owner <#owner>`__’s hand as it`resolves <#resolve>`__. See rule`702.26 <#R70226>`__, „Buyback.”

Card: The standard component of the game. Magiccards may be traditional or nontraditional.`Tokens <#token>`__ aren’t considered cards. In thetext of spells or`abilities <#ability>`__, the term „card” is usedonly to refer to a card that’s not on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ or on the`stack <#stack>`__, such as a`creature <#creature>`__ card in a`player <#player>`__’s hand. See rule`108 <#R108>`__, „Cards.”

Card Pool: In a Limited format, the`cards <#card>`__ a player may use,in addition to basic land <#land>`__`cards, to build their deck.

Card Type: A characteristic.Except for abilities on the`stack <#stack>`__, each object has acard type, even if that object isn’ta card. Each card type has its ownrules. See rule 205, „TypeLine,” and section 3,”Card Types.”

Cascade: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that may let a `player <#player>`__`cast a random extra spell <#spell>`__for no `cost. See rule`702.84 <#R70284>`__, „Cascade.”

Cast: To take a card from where it is(usually the hand), put it on the`stack <#stack>`__, and pay its`costs <#cost>`__, so that it will eventually`resolve <#resolve>`__ and have its`effect <#effect>`__. See rule 601,”Casting Spells.”

Caster (Obsolete): An obsolete term that referredto the player who cast a`spell <#spell>`__. In general,`cards <#card>`__ that were printed with the term”caster” have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference tosay „controller.”

Casting Cost (Obsolete): An obsolete term for manacost. Cards printedwith this text have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.

Champion, Championed: „Champion” is a keywordability that lets one`creature <#creature>`__ temporarily replaceanother. A permanent is”championed” by another permanent <#permanent>`__if the latter `exiles the former as thedirect result of a champion ability.See rule 702.71, „Champion.”

Change a Target: To choose a new, legal`target <#target>`__ for a spell or`ability <#ability>`__. See rule`115.7 <#R1157>`__.

Changeling: A characteristic-definingability thatgrants the object it’s on every`creature type <#creature_type>`__. See rule`702.72 <#R70272>`__, „Changeling.”

Chaos Ability: An ability of a`plane <#plane>`__ card that`triggers <#trigger>`__ „Whenever`you <#you_your>`__ roll {CHAOS}” on the planardie in the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. See rule`309.7 <#R3097>`__.

Chaos Symbol: The chaos symbol {CHAOS} appears onthe planar die and in some`triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__ of`plane <#plane>`__ cards in the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. See rule`107.12 <#R10712>`__.

Characteristic-Defining Ability: A kind of staticability that conveysinformation about an object’s`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ that wouldnormally be found elsewhere on that`object <#object>`__ (such as in its manacost, type line,or power/toughness <#toughness>`__box). See rule `604.3.

Characteristics: Information that defines an`object <#object>`__. See rule 109.3.

Cipher: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows `you to encode a`card <#card>`__ on a creature and`cast <#cast>`__ that card wheneverthat creature deals <#deal>`__`combat damage to a`player <#player>`__. See rule`702.98 <#R70298>`__, „Cipher.”

City’s Blessing: A designation a`player <#player>`__ can have. The`ascend <#ascend>`__ keyword causes a`player <#player>`__ to get this designation oncethey control ten`permanents <#permanent>`__. See rule`702.130 <#R702130>`__, „Ascend.”

Clash: To have a mini-contest involving the top`cards <#card>`__ of players»libraries. See rule`701.23 <#R70123>`__, „Clash.”

Cleanup Step: Part of the turn. This`step <#step>`__ is the second and final`step <#step>`__ of the endingphase. See rule 514,”Cleanup Step.”

Collector Number: A number printed on most`cards <#card>`__ that has no effect <#effect>`__on game `play. See rule 212,”Information Below the Text Box.”

Color: 1. A characteristic <#characteristics>`__of an `object. See rule`105 <#R105>`__, „Colors,” and rule`202 <#R202>`__, „Mana Cost andColor.” 2. An attribute mana may have.See rule 106, „Mana.”

Color Identity: A set of colors thatdetermines what cards may be includedin a deck for the`Commander <#commander>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. See rule`903.4 <#R9034>`__.

Color Indicator: A`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ of an`object <#object>`__. See rule 105,”Colors,” and rule 204,”Color Indicator.”

Colorless: 1. An object with no`color <#color>`__ is colorless. Colorless is not a`color <#color>`__. See rule 105,”Colors,” and rule 202,”Mana Cost and`Color <#color>`__.” 2. A type of`mana <#mana>`__. See rule 106,”Mana,” and rule 107.4c.

Combat Damage: Damage dealt`during <#during>`__ the combat damagestep by attackingcreatures and blockingcreatures as a consequenceof combat. See rule 510, „CombatDamage Step.”

Combat Damage Step: Part of the turn. This`step <#step>`__ is the fourth step ofthe combat phase. See rule`510 <#R510>`__, „Combat Damage Step.”

Combat Phase: Part of the turn. This`phase <#phase>`__ is the third phase <#phase>`__of the turn. See rule `506, „CombatPhase.”

Command: A zone for certain specialized`objects <#object>`__ that have an overarching`effect <#effect>`__ on the game, yet are not`permanents <#permanent>`__ and cannot bedestroyed. See rule 408, „Command.”

Commander: 1. A casual variant inwhich each deck is led by a`legendary <#legendary>`__`creature <#creature>`__. See rule 903,”Commander.” 2. A designation given to one`legendary <#legendary>`__ creature <#creature>`__`card in each player’s`deck <#deck>`__ in the Commander casual`variant <#variant>`__.

Commander Draft: A casual variant inwhich players participate in abooster draft and then`play <#play>`__ multiplayergames. See rule`903.13 <#R90313>`__, „Commander Draft.”

Commander Ninjutsu: A variant of the`ninjutsu <#ninjutsu>`__ ability.See rule 702.48,”Ninjutsu.”

Commander Tax: Informal term for the additionalcost to cast a`commander <#commander>`__ based on the number oftimes a player has cast <#cast>`__it previously this game. See rule`903.8.

Companion: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows a `player to choose one`creature <#creature>`__ card from`outside the game <#outside_the_game>`__ as acompanion if the restriction ofthat card’s companion`ability <#ability>`__ is met. Once a`player <#player>`__ has chosen a companion, that`player <#player>`__ may pay {3} to putit into their hand once`during <#during>`__ the game. See rule`702.138 <#R702138>`__, „Companion.”

Concede: To quit the game. Conceding a gameimmediately causes that player toleave that game and lose that game. See rule`104 <#R104>`__, „Ending the Game.”

Conspiracy: A card type used in`Limited <#limited>`__ formats such as ConspiracyDraft. A conspiracy`card <#card>`__ is not a`permanent <#permanent>`__. See rule`313 <#R313>`__, „Conspiracies.”

Conspiracy Draft: A casual variant <#variant>`__in which `players participate in abooster draft and then`play <#play>`__ multiplayergames. See rule`905 <#R905>`__, „Conspiracy Draft.”

Conspire: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that `creates a copy of a`spell <#spell>`__. See rule 702.77,”Conspire.”

Constructed: A way of playing in which each`player <#player>`__ creates theirown deck ahead of time. See rule`100.2a <#R1002a>`__.

Continuous Artifact (Obsolete): An obsolete termthat appeared on the type line of`artifacts <#artifact>`__ without activatedabilities.`Cards <#card>`__ printed with this text havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to simply say”Artifact.”

Continuous Effect: An effect thatmodifies characteristics of`objects <#object>`__, modifies`control <#control_controller>`__ of`objects <#object>`__, or affects`players <#player>`__ or the rules of the game, fora fixed or indefinite period. See rule`611 <#R611>`__, „Continuous Effects.”

Control Another Player: To make all choices anddecisions that player is allowed tomake, or is told to make, by rules or by any`objects <#object>`__. See rule 716,”Controlling Another Player.”

Control, Controller: „Control” is the system thatdetermines who gets to use an object <#object>`__in the game. An `object’s „controller”is the player who currently controlsit. See rule 108.4.

Converted Mana Cost: The total amount of`mana <#mana>`__ in a mana cost,regardless of color. See rule`202.3 <#R2023>`__.

Convoke: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you tap <#tap>`__`creatures rather than`pay <#pay>`__ mana to cast <#cast>`__a `spell. See rule`702.50 <#R70250>`__, „Convoke.”

Copiable Values: Values of an`object <#object>`__’s`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ that arechecked by copy effects.See rules 613.2, 706.2,and 706.3.

Copy: 1. To create a new`object <#object>`__ whose copiablevalues have been set to thoseof another object. 2. An`object <#object>`__ whose copiablevalues have been set to thoseof another object. See rule`706 <#R706>`__, „Copying Objects.”

Cost: An action or payment necessary to takeanother action or to stop another action fromtaking place. See rule 118, „Costs.”

Counter: 1. To cancel a spell or`ability <#ability>`__ so it doesn’t`resolve <#resolve>`__ and none of its`effects <#effect>`__ occur. See rule`701.5 <#R7015>`__, „Counter.” 2. A marker`placed <#placed>`__ on an object or`player <#player>`__ that modifies its`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ or interactswith a rule or ability. See rule`122 <#R122>`__, „Counters.”

Counts As (Obsolete): Some older cards <#card>`__were printed with text stating that the`card „counts as” something.`Cards <#card>`__ printed with this text havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to state that the`card <#card>`__ actually is that thing.

Create: To create a token is to put a`token <#token>`__ onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. See rule`701.6 <#R7016>`__, „Create.”

Creature: A card type. A creatureis a permanent. See rule`302 <#R302>`__, „Creatures.”

Creature Type: A subtype that’scorrelated to the creature cardtype and the tribal <#tribal>`__`card type. See rule`302 <#R302>`__, „Creatures,” andrule 308, „Tribals.” Seerule 205.3m for the list of creaturetypes.

Crew: A keyword ability thatlets you tap <#tap>`__`creatures to turn a`Vehicle <#vehicle>`__ into an artifactcreature. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts,” andrule 702.121, „Crew.”

Cumulative Upkeep: A keywordability that imposes anincreasing cost to keep a`permanent <#permanent>`__ on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. See rule`702.23 <#R70223>`__, „Cumulative Upkeep.”

Cycling: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `card be discarded andreplaced with a new card. See rule`702.28 <#R70228>`__, „Cycling.”

Damage: Objects can deal”damage” to creatures,`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__, and`players <#player>`__. This is generallydetrimental to the object or`player <#player>`__ that receives that damage. Seerule 120, „Damage.”

Damage Assignment Order: The order, announced`during <#during>`__ the declare blockersstep, that an`attacking creature <#attacking_creature>`__ willassign its combat damage amongthe multiple creatures blocking it,or that a blockingcreature will assign its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ among themultiple creatures it’s blocking.See rules 509.2 and`509.3 <#R5093>`__.

Dash: A keyword ability thatallows creatures to be especiallyaggressive. See rule 702.108,”Dash.”

Deal: See Damage.

Deathtouch: A keywordability that causes`damage <#damage>`__ dealt by an`object <#object>`__ to be especially effective.See rule 702.2, „Deathtouch.”

Deck: The collection of cards a`player <#player>`__ starts the game with; it`becomes <#becomes>`__ that player’s`library <#library>`__. See rule 100,”General,” and rule 103,”Starting the Game.”

Declare Attackers: To choose a set of`creatures <#creature>`__ that will`attack <#attack>`__, declare whether each`creature <#creature>`__ is attacking the`defending player <#defending_player>`__ or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__, and`pay <#pay>`__ any costs required toallow those creatures to`attack <#attack>`__. See rule 508.1.

Declare Attackers Step: Part of the turn. This`step <#step>`__ is the second step ofthe combat phase. See rule`508 <#R508>`__, „Declare Attackers Step.”

Declare Blockers: To choose a set of`creatures <#creature>`__ that will`block <#block>`__, declare which attackingcreature each`creature <#creature>`__ is blocking, and`pay <#pay>`__ any costs required toallow those creatures to`block <#block>`__. See rule 509.1.

Declare Blockers Step: Part of the turn. This`step <#step>`__ is the third step ofthe combat phase. See rule`509 <#R509>`__, „Declare Blockers Step.”

Defender: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that prohibits a `creature fromattacking. See rule 702.3, „Defender.”

Defending Player: The player who canbe attacked, and whose`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ can be attacked,`during <#during>`__ the combatphase. See rule`506.2 <#R5062>`__. In certain multiplayergames, there may be morethan one defending player; see rule`802 <#R802>`__, „Attack Multiple PlayersOption,” andrule 805.10.

Defending Team: The team who can beattacked, and whose`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ can be attacked,`during <#during>`__ the combatphase of a multiplayergame using the shared teamturns option. Seerule 805, „Shared Team TurnsOption.”

Delayed Triggered Ability: An`ability <#ability>`__ created by`effects <#effect>`__ generated when some`spells <#spell>`__ or abilities <#ability>`__`resolve, or when some replacementeffects are applied, thatdoes something later on rather than at that time.See rule 603.7.

Delve: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you exile <#exile>`__`cards from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard rather than`pay <#pay>`__ generic mana to`cast <#cast>`__ a spell. See rule`702.65 <#R70265>`__, „Delve.”

Dependency: A system that may be used to determinein which order continuouseffects in the same`layer <#layer>`__ or sublayer are applied. Seerule 613.8. See also TimestampOrder.

Deploy Creatures Option: An option <#option>`__that may be used in certain multiplayer`variants to pass <#pass>`__`control of`creatures <#creature>`__ between`teammates <#teammate>`__. See rule`804 <#R804>`__, „Deploy Creatures Option.”

Destroy: To move a`permanent <#permanent>`__ from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ to its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard.See rule 701.7, „Destroy.”

Detain: A keyword action thattemporarily stops a permanent fromattacking, blocking, or having its activatedabilities activated. Seerule 701.29, „Detain.”

Dethrone: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that puts a +1/+1 `counter on a`creature <#creature>`__ when it`attacks <#attack>`__ the player withthe most life. See rule`702.104 <#R702104>`__, „Dethrone.”

Devoid: A characteristic-definingability thatmakes an object <#object>`__`colorless. See rule`702.113 <#R702113>`__, „Devoid.”

Devotion: A numerical value a player <#player>`__has, equal to the number of `manasymbols of a certain`color <#color>`__ among the manacosts of`permanents <#permanent>`__ that`player <#player>`__`controls <#control_controller>`__. See rule`700.5 <#R7005>`__.

Devour: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can have a `creature enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it. See rule`702.81 <#R70281>`__, „Devour.”

Dies: A creature or`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ „dies” if it isput into a graveyard from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. See rule`700.4 <#R7004>`__.

Discard: To move a card <#card>`__from its `owner’s hand tothat player’s`graveyard <#graveyard>`__. See rule`701.8 <#R7018>`__, „Discard.”

Double Agenda: A variant of the`hidden agenda <#hidden_agenda>`__`ability <#ability>`__. See rule`702.105 <#R702105>`__, „HiddenAgenda.”

Double Strike: A keywordability that lets a`creature <#creature>`__ deal its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ twice. See rule`702.4 <#R7024>`__, „Double Strike.”

Double-Faced Cards: Cards with twofaces, one on each side of the card,and no Magic card back. See rule`711 <#R711>`__, „Double-Faced Cards.”

Draft: 1. A Limited format in which`players <#player>`__ choose cards oneat a time from booster packs,then construct a deck solely from thechosen cards and basic <#basic>`__`land cards. 2. To choose a`card <#card>`__ during a draft andput it into your cardpool.

Draft Round: Part of a draft in whicheach player opens an unopened`booster pack <#booster_pack>`__ and the`cards <#card>`__ in those boosterpacks are drafted. See rules`905.1a <#R9051a>`__ and 905.1b.

Draw: 1. To put the top card of a`player <#player>`__’s library intotheir hand as a turn-basedaction or as the result ofan effect that uses the word „draw.”See rule 121, „Drawing a`Card <#card>`__.” 2. The result of a game in whichneither player wins or loses. Seerule 104.4.

Draw Step: Part of the turn. This step <#step>`__is the third and final `step of the`beginning phase <#beginning_phase>`__. See rule`504 <#R504>`__, „Draw Step.”

Dredge: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player return a`card <#card>`__ from their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ to their`hand <#hand>`__. See rule 702.51,”Dredge.”

During (Obsolete): Some older cards <#card>`__used the phrase „during [`phase],[action].” These abilities werecalled „phase <#phase>`__`abilities.” In`general <#general>`__, cards that wereprinted with phase <#phase>`__`abilities have received errata inthe Oracle card referenceso they have abilities that`trigger <#trigger>`__ at the beginning of a`step <#step>`__ or phase. „During”still appears in current card text, butonly in its normal English sense and not as gameterminology.

EDH (Obsolete): An older name for the`Commander <#commander>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. See rule 903,”Commander.”

Echo: A keyword ability thatimposes a cost to keep a`permanent <#permanent>`__ on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. See rule`702.29 <#R70229>`__, „Echo.”

Effect: Something that happens in the game as aresult of a spell or`ability <#ability>`__. See rule 609,”Effects.”

Embalm: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player exile <#exile>`__a `creature card fromtheir graveyard to`create <#create>`__ a mummified token <#token>`__version of that `card. See rule`702.127 <#R702127>`__, „Embalm.”

Emblem: An emblem is a marker used to represent an`object <#object>`__ that has one or more`abilities <#ability>`__, but no other`characteristics <#characteristics>`__. See rule`114 <#R114>`__, „Emblems.”

Emerge: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player cast a`spell <#spell>`__ for less by sacrificing a`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.118 <#R702118>`__, „Emerge.”

Emperor: The middle player on each`team <#team>`__ in an Emperor game. See rule`809 <#R809>`__, „EmperorVariant.”

Emperor Variant: A multiplayer`variant <#variant>`__ played amongthree-player teams. Seerule 809, „Emperor Variant.”

Enchant: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that defines what an `Aura <#aura>`__`spell can target andwhat an Aura permanent <#permanent>`__can be attached to. See rule `303,”Enchantments,” and rule`702.5 <#R7025>`__, „Enchant.”

Enchantment: A card type. Anenchantment is a permanent. Seerule 303, „Enchantments.” See also`Aura <#aura>`__.

Enchantment Type: A subtype that’scorrelated to the enchantment <#enchantment>`__`card type. See rule`303 <#R303>`__, „Enchantments.”See rule 205.3h for the list ofenchantment types.

Encoded: A term that describes the relationshipbetween a permanent and a`card <#card>`__ exiled by a cipher <#cipher>`__`ability. See rule`702.98 <#R70298>`__, „Cipher.”

Encore: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player exile <#exile>`__a `creature card fromtheir graveyard to, for each`opponent <#opponent>`__, create a`token <#token>`__ that’s a copy ofthat card to attack that`opponent <#opponent>`__.

Encounter: To move a`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ card offthe top of a planar deck andturn it face up. See rule`310 <#R310>`__, „Phenomena.”

End Step: Part of the turn. This step <#step>`__is the first `step of the endingphase. See rule 513,”End Step.”

End of Combat Step: Part of the turn. This`step <#step>`__ is the fifth and final`step <#step>`__ of the combatphase. See rule 511,”End of Combat Step.”

End the Combat Phase: To „end the combat phase” asthe result of an effect is to performan expedited process that skips <#skip>`__everything else that would happen that`phase. See rule 717,”Ending Turns and Phases.”

End the Turn: To „end the turn” as the result of an`effect <#effect>`__ is to perform an expeditedprocess that skips nearly everythingelse that would happen that turn. See rule`717 <#R717>`__, „Ending Turns and`Phases <#phase>`__.”

Ending Phase: Part of the turn. This`phase <#phase>`__ is the fifth and final`phase <#phase>`__ of the turn. See rule`512 <#R512>`__, „Ending Phase.”

Energy Symbol: The energy symbol {E} represents oneenergy counter. To pay <#pay>`__{E}, a `player removes one energy`counter <#counter>`__ from themselves.

Enters the Battlefield: A nontoken`permanent <#permanent>`__ „enters the battlefield”when it’s moved onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ from another`zone <#zone>`__. A token „enters thebattlefield” when it’s created. See rules`403.3 <#R4033>`__, 603.6a,`603.6d <#R6036d>`__, and 614.12.

Entwine: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player choose all`modes <#modal_mode>`__ for a spell <#spell>`__rather than just the number specified. See rule`702.41, „Entwine.”

Epic: A keyword ability thatlets a player copy a`spell <#spell>`__ at the beginning of each oftheir upkeeps at the expense of casting any other`spells <#spell>`__ for the rest of the game. Seerule 702.49, „Epic.”

Equip: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player <#player>`__`attach an Equipment <#equipment>`__to a `creature they`control <#control_controller>`__. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts,” andrule 702.6, „Equip.”

Equipment: An artifact <#artifact>`__`subtype. Equipment can be attachedto creatures. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts,” andrule 702.6, „Equip.”

Escalate: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__on some `modal spells <#spell>`__that adds a `cost for choosingadditional modes. See rule`702.119 <#R702119>`__, „Escalate.”

Escape: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player cast a`card <#card>`__ from their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__. See rule`702.137 <#R702137>`__, „Escape.”

Eternalize: A keywordability that lets a`player <#player>`__ exile a`creature <#creature>`__ card fromtheir graveyard to`create <#create>`__ an eternalized`token <#token>`__ version of that`card <#card>`__. See rule 702.128,”Eternalize.”

Evasion Ability: An ability thatrestricts what creatures can`block <#block>`__ an attackingcreature. See rules`509.1b <#R5091b>`__-c.

Event: Anything that happens in a game. See rule`700.1 <#R7001>`__.

Evoke: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that causes a `permanent to besacrificed when it enters thebattlefield. See rule`702.73 <#R70273>`__, „Evoke.”

Evolve: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you put a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on a`creature <#creature>`__ when a larger`creature <#creature>`__ enters thebattlefield under`your <#you_your>`__`control <#control_controller>`__. See rule`702.99 <#R70299>`__, „Evolve.”

Exalted: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can make a `creature better incombat. See rule 702.82, „Exalted.”

Excess Damage: Some spells that resultin damage being dealt to a`creature <#creature>`__ state that excess damageis dealt to another object or`player <#player>`__ instead. Seerule 120.4a.

Exchange: To swap two things, such as`objects <#object>`__, sets of`objects <#object>`__, or lifetotals. See rule`701.10 <#R70110>`__, „Exchange.”

Exert: A keyword action thatstops a permanent from untapping`during <#during>`__ the next untapstep of the player <#player>`__who exerted it. See rule `701.39,”Exert.”

Exile: 1. A zone. Exile is essentiallya holding area for cards. It used to beknown as the”removed-from-the-game”zone. 2. To put an object <#object>`__into the exile `zone from whatever`zone <#zone>`__ it’s currently in. An „exiled”card is one that’s been put into theexile zone. See rule 406,”Exile.”

Expansion Symbol: A card’s expansionsymbol is a small icon normally printed below theright edge of the illustration <#illustration>`__that has no `effect on game`play <#play>`__. See rule 206,”Expansion Symbol.”

Exploit: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you <#you_your>`__`sacrifice a`creature <#creature>`__ for a benefit. See rule`702.109 <#R702109>`__, „Exploit.”

Explore: A keyword action <#keyword_action>`__that causes a `player to`reveal <#reveal>`__ the top card oftheir library and then to takedifferent actions depending on whether a`land <#land>`__ card is revealed thisway. See rule 701.40, „Explore.”

Extort: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you gain`life <#life_life_total>`__ and have`opponents <#opponent>`__ lose`life <#life_life_total>`__ whenever`you <#you_your>`__ cast a`spell <#spell>`__. See rule`702.100 <#R702100>`__, „Extort.”

Extra Turn: A turn created by an`effect <#effect>`__ of a spell or`ability <#ability>`__. See rule`500.7 <#R5007>`__. For rules about extra turns ina multiplayer game usingthe shared team turnsoption, see`805.8 <#R8058>`__. For rules about extra turns ina Grand Melee game, see rule`807.4 <#R8074>`__.

Fabricate: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you choose whether to`create <#create>`__ Servo tokens orput +1/+1 counters on a`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.122 <#R702122>`__, „Fabricate.”

Face Down: 1. A card is „face down” ifit’s physically positioned so the card <#card>`__back is showing. `Cards in some`zones <#zone>`__ are normally kept face down. See`section 4 <#R4>`__, „Zones.” 2. A`status <#status>`__ a permanent <#permanent>`__may have. See rule `110.5 and rule`702.36 <#R70236>`__, „Morph.” 3.Face-down spells have additionalrules. See rule 707, „Face-Down`Spells <#spell>`__ and`Permanents <#permanent>`__,” and rule`702.36 <#R70236>`__, „Morph.”
