Face Up: 1. A card is „face up” if it’sphysically positioned so the card frontis showing. Cards in some`zones <#zone>`__ are normally kept face up. See`section 4 <#R4>`__, „Zones.” 2. Adefault status a`permanent <#permanent>`__ may have. See rule`110.5 <#R1105>`__ and rule 702.36,”Morph.”

Fading: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that limits how long a `permanent <#permanent>`__remains on the `battlefield. Seerule 702.31, „Fading.”

Fateseal: To manipulate some of the`cards <#card>`__ on top of an`opponent <#opponent>`__’s library.See rule 701.22, „Fateseal.”

Fear: A keyword ability thatrestricts how a creature may beblocked. See rule 702.35, „Fear.”

Fight: When two creatures fight,each deals damage equalto its power to the other. See rule`701.12 <#R70112>`__, „Fight.”

First Strike: A keywordability that lets a`creature <#creature>`__ deal its`combat damage <#combat_damage>`__ before other`creatures <#creature>`__. See rule`702.7 <#R7027>`__, „First Strike.”

Flanking: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can make a `creature better incombat. See rule 702.24, „Flanking.”

Flash: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player play a`card <#card>`__ any time they could`cast <#cast>`__ an instant. Seerule 702.8, „Flash.”

Flashback: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player cast a`card <#card>`__ from their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__. See rule`702.33 <#R70233>`__, „Flashback.”

Flavor Text: Text in italics (but not inparentheses) in the text box of a`card <#card>`__ that has no effect <#effect>`__on `play. See rule 207.2.

Flip Cards: Cards with a two-part`card <#card>`__ frame (one part of which isprinted upside down) on a single card.See rule 709, „Flip Cards.”

Flipped: A status a`permanent <#permanent>`__ may have. See rule`110.5 <#R1105>`__ and rule 709, „FlipCards.” See also`Unflipped <#unflipped>`__.

Flipping a Coin: A method of randomization with twopossible outcomes of equal likelihood. See rule`705 <#R705>`__, „Flipping a Coin.”

Flying: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that restricts how a `creature maybe blocked. See rule 702.9, „Flying.”

Food Token: A Food token is a`colorless <#colorless>`__ artifact <#artifact>`__`token with „{2}, {T},`Sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ this`artifact <#artifact>`__: You gain3 life.” For moreinformation about predefined tokens,see rule 111.10.

Forecast: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows an `activatedability to be activatedfrom a player’s hand. Seerule 702.56, „Forecast.”

Forest: One of the five basic landtypes. Any land <#land>`__with this `subtype has the`ability <#ability>`__ „{T}: Add {G}.” See rule`305.6 <#R3056>`__.

Forestcycling: See Typecycling.

Forestwalk: See Landwalk.

Foretell: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player exile <#exile>`__`cards from their hand and`cast <#cast>`__ them for an alternativecost on future turns. Seerule 702.142, „Foretell.”

Foretold: A card exiled using the`foretell <#foretell>`__ specialaction becomes <#becomes>`__foretold. Other `effects can also makean exiled card foretold. A`spell <#spell>`__ was foretold if it was aforetold card in exile <#exile>`__before it was `cast.

Fortification: An artifact <#artifact>`__`subtype. Fortifications can beattached to lands. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts,” andrule 702.66,”Fortify.”

Fortify: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player <#player>`__`attach a`Fortification <#fortification>`__ to a`land <#land>`__ they`control <#control_controller>`__. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts,” andrule 702.66, „Fortify.”

Free-for-All: A multiplayer variant <#variant>`__in which a group of `players competeas individuals against each other. See rule`806 <#R806>`__, „Free-for-All`Variant <#variant>`__.”

Frenzy: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can make a `creature better incombat. See rule 702.67, „Frenzy.”

Full Party: A player has a full partyif the number of creatures in their`party <#party>`__ is four. See rule`700.8 <#R7008>`__.

Fuse: A keyword ability thatallows a player to cast <#cast>`__both halves of a `split card. Seerule 702.101, „Fuse.”

Fused Split Spell: A split card <#split_cards>`__on the `stack that has been`cast <#cast>`__ using the fuse <#fuse>`__`ability or a copy ofsuch a card. See rule`702.101 <#R702101>`__, „Fuse.”

General: Any player in the`Emperor <#emperor>`__ multiplayer`variant <#variant>`__ who isn’t an`emperor <#emperor>`__. See rule 809,”Emperor Variant.”

Generic Mana: Mana in a`cost <#cost>`__ represented by numerical symbols(such as {1}) or variable symbols (such as{X}) that can be paid with`mana <#mana>`__ of any type. See rule`107.4 <#R1074>`__.

Global Enchantment (Obsolete): An obsolete term fora non-Aura <#aura>`__`enchantment. Cards <#card>`__printed with this text have received errata in the`Oracle card reference.

Goad: A keyword action thatforces a creature to`attack <#attack>`__ and to attack <#attack>`__another `player if able. See rule`701.38 <#R70138>`__, „Goad.”

Gold Token: A Gold token is a`colorless <#colorless>`__ artifact <#artifact>`__`token with „Sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__this `artifact: Add one`mana <#mana>`__ of any color.” Formore information on predefined tokens,see rule 111.10.

Graft: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that has a `permanent enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it and can`move <#move>`__ those counters toother creatures. See rule`702.57 <#R70257>`__, „Graft.”

Grand Melee: A multiplayer variant <#variant>`__in which a large group of `players <#player>`__(usually ten or more) compete as individualsagainst each other. See rule `807,”Grand Melee Variant.”

Gravestorm: A keywordability that`creates <#create>`__ copies of a`spell <#spell>`__. See rule 702.68,”Gravestorm.”

Graveyard: 1. A zone. A`player <#player>`__’s graveyard is their`discard <#discard>`__ pile. 2. All the`cards <#card>`__ in a player’sgraveyard. See rule 404, „Graveyard.”

Hand: 1. A zone. A`player <#player>`__’s hand is where that`player <#player>`__ holds cards theyhave drawn but not played yet. 2. All the`cards <#card>`__ in a player’s hand.See rule 402, „Hand.”

Hand Modifier: A`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ that only`vanguards <#vanguard>`__ have. See rule`210 <#R210>`__, „Hand Modifier.”

Haste: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `creature ignore the”summoning sickness” rule. See rule`702.10 <#R70210>`__, „Haste,” and rule`302.6 <#R3026>`__.

Haunt: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that `exiles cards. A`card <#card>`__ exiled this way „haunts” a`creature <#creature>`__ targeted by the haunt`ability <#ability>`__. See rule`702.54 <#R70254>`__, „Haunt.”

Hexproof: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that precludes a `permanent or`player <#player>`__ from being targeted by an`opponent <#opponent>`__. See rule`702.11 <#R70211>`__, „Hexproof.”

Hidden Agenda: A keywordability that allows a`conspiracy <#conspiracy>`__ card to beput into the command <#command>`__`zone face down. Seerule 702.105, „Hidden Agenda.”

Hidden Zone: A zone in which not all`players <#player>`__ can be expected to see the`cards <#card>`__» faces. See rule`400.2 <#R4002>`__. See also PublicZone.

Hideaway: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player store a secret`card <#card>`__. See rule 702.74,”Hideaway.”

Historic: An object is historic if ithas the legendary <#legendary>`__`supertype, the`artifact <#artifact>`__ cardtype, or the Saga <#saga>`__`subtype. See rule`700.6 <#R7006>`__.

Horsemanship: A keywordability that restricts how a`creature <#creature>`__ may be blocked. See rule`702.30 <#R70230>`__, „Horsemanship.”

Hybrid Card: A card with one or more`hybrid mana symbols <#hybrid_mana_symbols>`__ inits mana cost. See rule`202.2f <#R2022f>`__.

Hybrid Mana Symbols: A manasymbol that represents a`cost <#cost>`__ that can be paid in one of twoways. See rule 107.4.

If: See Intervening „If”Clause.

Illegal Action: An action that violates the rulesof the game and/or requirements <#requirement>`__or `restrictions created by`effects <#effect>`__. See rule 723,”Handling Illegal Actions.”

Illegal Target: A target that nolonger exists or no longer meets the specificationsstated by the spell or`ability <#ability>`__ that’s targeting it. Seerule 608.2b.

Illustration: A picture printed on the upper halfof a card that has no`effect <#effect>`__ on game play. Seerule 203, „Illustration.”

Illustration Credit: Information printed directlybelow the text box that has no`effect <#effect>`__ on game play. Seerule 212, „Information Below the TextBox.”

Imprint: „Imprint” used to be a keywordability. It is now an`ability word <#ability_word>`__ and has no rulesmeaning. All cards printed with theimprint keyword have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.

Improvise: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you tap <#tap>`__`artifacts rather than`pay <#pay>`__ mana to cast <#cast>`__a `spell. See rule`702.125 <#R702125>`__, „Improvise.”

In Play (Obsolete): An obsolete term for the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. Cards <#card>`__that were printed with text that contain thephrases „in play,” „from `play,” „into`play <#play>`__,” or the like are referring to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ and have receivederrata in the Oracle card <#card>`__reference. See `Battlefield.

In Response To: An instant <#instant>`__`spell that’s been cast, oran activated ability <#activated_ability>`__that’s been activated, while another`spell or ability is onthe stack has been cast oractivated „in response to” the earlier`spell <#spell>`__ or ability. Seerule 117.7.

Independent: See Dependency.

Indestructible: A keywordability that precludes a`permanent <#permanent>`__ from being destroyed.See rule 702.12.

Infect: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that affects how an `object <#object>`__`deals damage to`creatures <#creature>`__ and`players <#player>`__. See rule`702.89 <#R70289>`__, „Infect.”

Ingest: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can `exile the top`card <#card>`__ of a player’s`library <#library>`__. See rule`702.114 <#R702114>`__, „Ingest.”

Instant: A card type. An instantis not a permanent. See rule`304 <#R304>`__, „Instants.”

Instead: Effects that use the word”instead” are replacementeffects. The word”instead” indicates what an event willbe replaced with. See rule 614,”Replacement Effects.”

Interrupt (Obsolete): An obsolete cardtype. All cards printedwith this card type are now`instants <#instant>`__. All`abilities <#ability>`__ that, as printed, said a`player <#player>`__ could „play as aninterrupt” can now be activated like any other`activated abilities <#activated_ability>`__(unless they’re manaabilities, in which case theyfollow those rules instead). Allrelevant cards have been given erratain the Oracle `card <#card>`__reference.

Intervening „If” Clause: A specially wordedcondition checked as a triggeredability would`trigger <#trigger>`__ and again as it would`resolve <#resolve>`__. See rule 603.4

Intimidate: A keywordability that restricts how a`creature <#creature>`__ may be blocked. See rule`702.13 <#R70213>`__, „Intimidate.”

Investigate: A keyword action <#keyword_action>`__that `creates a Clue`artifact <#artifact>`__ token. Seerule 701.36, „Investigate.”

Island: One of the five basic landtypes. Any land <#land>`__with this `subtype has the`ability <#ability>`__ „{T}: Add {U}.” See rule`305.6 <#R3056>`__.

Islandcycling: See Typecycling.

Islandhome (Obsolete): An obsolete keywordability that meant „This`creature <#creature>`__ can’t attack <#attack>`__`unless defendingplayer <#defending_player>`__`controls an`Island <#island>`__” and „When you <#you_your>`__`control no`Islands <#island>`__, sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__this `creature.” Cards <#card>`__printed with this `ability have beengiven errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference.

Islandwalk: See Landwalk.

Jump-Start: A keywordability that lets a`player <#player>`__ cast a`card <#card>`__ from their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ by discarding a`card <#card>`__. See rule 702.132,”Jump-Start.”

Keyword Ability: A game term, such as”flying” or „haste,”used as shorthand for a longer`ability <#ability>`__ or group of`abilities <#ability>`__. See rule 702,”Keyword Abilities.”

Keyword Action: A verb, such as”destroy” or „cast,”used as a game term rather than as its normalEnglish meaning. See rule 701, „KeywordActions.”

Keyword Counter: A marker placed onan object that modifies its`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ by grantingit a keyword. See rule 122,”Counters.”

Kicker, Kicked: Kicker is a keywordability that represents anoptional additional cost. A`spell <#spell>`__ has been kicked if its`controller <#control_controller>`__ declared theintention to pay any or all of itskicker costs. See rule`702.32 <#R70232>`__, „Kicker.”

Land: A card type. A land is a`permanent <#permanent>`__. See rule`305 <#R305>`__, „Lands.”

Land Type: A subtype that’scorrelated to the land cardtype. See rule 305,”Lands.” See rule `205.3i <#R2053i>`__for the list of land types.

Landwalk: A generic term for a group of keywordabilities that restrictwhether a creature may be blocked.See rule 702.14, „Landwalk.”

Last Known Information: Information about an`object <#object>`__ that’s no longer in the`zone <#zone>`__ it’s expected to be in, orinformation about a player that’s nolonger in the game. This information captures that`object <#object>`__’s last existence in that`zone <#zone>`__ or that player’slast existence in the game. See rules`113.7a <#R1137a>`__, 608.2b,`608.2h <#R6082h>`__, and 800.4h.

Layer: A system used to determine in which order`continuous effects <#continuous_effect>`__ areapplied. See rule 613, „Interaction of`Continuous Effects <#continuous_effect>`__.” Seealso Dependency, TimestampOrder.

Leaves the Battlefield: A`permanent <#permanent>`__ „leaves the battlefield”when it’s moved from the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ to another`zone <#zone>`__, or (if it’s phasedin) when it leaves thegame because its owner leaves thegame. See rules 603.6c and`603.10 <#R60310>`__.

Legal Text: Information printed directly below the`text box <#text_box>`__ that has no`effect <#effect>`__ on game play. Seerule 212, „Information Below the TextBox.”

Legend (Obsolete): An obsolete creaturetype. Cards printedwith this subtype have been givenerrata in the Oracle card <#card>`__reference so they have the`legendary <#legendary>`__`supertype instead.See Legendary.

Legend Rule: A state-basedaction that causes a`player <#player>`__ who`controls <#control_controller>`__ two or more`legendary <#legendary>`__`permanents <#permanent>`__ with the same`name <#name>`__ to put all but one into their`owners <#owner>`__» graveyards.See rule 704.5j.

Legendary: A supertype that’snormally relevant on permanents.See rule 205.4,”Supertypes.” See also LegendRule.

Lethal Damage: An amount of damage <#damage>`__greater than or equal to a`creature’s`toughness <#toughness>`__. See rules`120.4a <#R1204a>`__, 120.6,`510.1 <#R5101>`__, and 704.5g.

Level Symbol: A symbol that represents a keywordability indicating`abilities <#ability>`__, power, and`toughness <#toughness>`__ a levelercard may have. See rule`107.8 <#R1078>`__ and rule 710,”Leveler Cards.”

Level Up: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can put level `counters on a`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.86 <#R70286>`__, „Level Up.”

Leveler Cards: Cards with striated`text boxes <#text_box>`__ and three`power <#power>`__/toughness <#toughness>`__boxes. See rule `710, „Leveler Cards.”

Library: 1. A zone. A`player <#player>`__’s library is where that`player <#player>`__ draws <#draw>`__`cards from. 2. All the`cards <#card>`__ in a player’slibrary. See rule 401, „Library.”

Life Modifier: A`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ that only`vanguards <#vanguard>`__ have. See rule`211 <#R211>`__, „Life Modifier.”

Life, Life Total: Each player has anamount of „life,” represented by that`player <#player>`__’s „life total.” Life may begained or lost. See rule 119, „Life.”

Lifelink: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that causes a `player to gain`life <#life_life_total>`__. See rule`702.15 <#R70215>`__, „Lifelink.”

Limited: A way of playing in which each`player <#player>`__ gets a quantity of unopenedMagic product and creates their own`deck <#deck>`__ on the spot. See rule`100.2 <#R1002>`__.

Limited Range of Influence: An optional rule usedin some multiplayer games <#multiplayer_game>`__that limits what a `player can affect.See rule 801, „Limited Range ofInfluence Option.”

Linked Abilities: Two abilities <#ability>`__printed on the same `object such thatone of them causes actions to be taken or`objects <#object>`__ to be affected and the otherone directly refers to those actions or`objects <#object>`__. See rule 607,”Linked Abilities.”

Living Weapon: A keywordability that`creates <#create>`__ a creature <#creature>`__`token and then attaches <#attach>`__the `Equipment with the`ability <#ability>`__ to that token.See rule 702.91, „Living Weapon.”

Local Enchantment (Obsolete): An obsolete term foran Aura. Cards printed withthis text have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.

London Mulligan: Informal term for the currentsystem of mulligan rules. See rule`103.4 <#R1034>`__.

Loop: A set of actions that could be repeatedindefinitely. See rule 722, „Taking`Shortcuts <#shortcut>`__.”

Lose the Game: There are several ways to lose thegame. See rule 104, „Ending the Game,”rule 810.8 (for additional rules forTwo-Headed Giant games), rule 809.5 <#R8095>`__(for additional rules for `Emperor <#emperor>`__games), and rule `903.10 (for anadditional rule for `Commander <#commander>`__games).

Loyalty: 1. Part of a card that only`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ have. A`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ card’sloyalty is printed in its lower right corner. Seerule 209, „Loyalty.” 2. A`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ that only`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ have. See rule`306.5 <#R3065>`__.

Loyalty Ability: An activatedability with a`loyalty <#loyalty>`__ symbol in its`cost <#cost>`__. See rule 606,”Loyalty Abilities.”

Madness: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player cast a`card <#card>`__ they discard. Seerule 702.34, „Madness.”

Main Game: The game in which a spell <#spell>`__(or `ability) that created a`subgame <#subgame>`__ was cast (oractivated). See rule 720,”Subgames.”

Main Phase: Part of the turn. The first, orprecombat, main phase is the second`phase <#phase>`__ of the turn. The second, orpostcombat, main phase is the fourth`phase <#phase>`__ of the turn. See rule`505 <#R505>`__, „Main Phase.”

Mana: The primary resource in the game. It is spentto pay costs, usually whencasting spells and activating`abilities <#ability>`__. See rule 106,”Mana,” rule 107.4, and rule`202 <#R202>`__, „Mana Cost and`Color <#color>`__.”

Mana Ability: An activated or triggeredability that could`create <#create>`__ mana and doesn’tuse the stack. See rule`605 <#R605>`__, „Mana Abilities.”

Mana Burn (Obsolete): Older versions of the rulesstated that unspent mana caused a`player <#player>`__ to lose`life <#life_life_total>`__; this was called „manaburn.” That rule no longer exists.

Mana Cost: A characteristic,and part of a card. A`card <#card>`__’s mana cost is indicated by the`mana symbols <#mana_symbol>`__ printed in itsupper right corner. See rule 107.4 andrule 202, „Mana Cost and`Color <#color>`__.”

Mana Pool: Where mana created by an`effect <#effect>`__ is temporarily stored. Seerule 106.4.

Mana Source (Obsolete): An obsolete cardtype. All cards printedwith this card type are now`instants <#instant>`__. All`abilities <#ability>`__ that, as printed, said a`player <#player>`__ could „play as amana source” are now manaabilities. All relevant`cards <#card>`__ have been given errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.

Mana Symbol: An icon that represents`mana <#mana>`__ or a mana cost.See rule 107.4.

Manifest: A keyword action <#keyword_action>`__that puts a `card onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ facedown as a 2/2`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`701.34 <#R70134>`__, „Manifest,” and rule`707 <#R707>`__, „Face-Down Spells and`Permanents <#permanent>`__.”

Match: A multiplayer game <#multiplayer_game>`__or a two-`player series of games(usually best-two-of-three) played in a`tournament <#tournament>`__. See rule`100.6 <#R1006>`__.

Maximum Hand Size: The number of cards <#card>`__in `hand a player must`discard <#discard>`__ down to during <#during>`__their `cleanup step. See rule`402.2 <#R4022>`__ and 514.1.

Megamorph: A variant of the`morph <#morph>`__ ability that putsa +1/+1 counter on the`creature <#creature>`__ as it turns faceup. See rule 702.36,”Morph.”

Meld: To turn two members of a meld pair so theirback faces are up and combined into one oversizedMagic card. See rule`701.37 <#R70137>`__, „Meld.”

Meld Cards: Cards with a Magic`card <#card>`__ face on one side and half of anoversized Magic card face on the other.See rule 712, „Meld Cards.”

Melee: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that improves an `attackingcreature based on thenumber of opponents <#opponent>`__`you attacked. See rule`702.120 <#R702120>`__, „Melee.”

Menace: An evasion ability <#evasion_ability>`__that makes `creatures <#creature>`__`unblockable by a single`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.110 <#R702110>`__, „Menace.”

Mentor: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `your bigger`creatures <#creature>`__ power up`your <#you_your>`__ smaller`creatures <#creature>`__ when they`attack <#attack>`__ together. See rule`702.133 <#R702133>`__, „Mentor.”

Merged Permanent: A card or`token <#token>`__ may merge with a`permanent <#permanent>`__ to form a mergedpermanent. This merged permanent is represented bymore than one card and/or`token <#token>`__. See rule 721,”Merging with Permanents.”

Mill: To mill a number of cards, a`player <#player>`__ puts that many`cards <#card>`__ from the top of their`library <#library>`__ into their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__. See rule`701.13 <#R70113>`__.

Minimum Deck Size: If a rule or`effect <#effect>`__ states that a`player <#player>`__’s deck mustcontain at least a specific number of`cards <#card>`__, that number is the`player <#player>`__’s minimum deck size.

Miracle: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets `you cast a`spell <#spell>`__ for a reduced cost <#cost>`__if it’s the first `card <#card>`__`you draw in a turn. Seerule 702.93, „Miracle.”

Modal Double-Faced Cards: One of two kinds of`double-faced cards <#double-faced_cards>`__. Modaldouble-faced cards can be played with either oftheir two faces up and can’t`transform <#transform>`__. See rule`711 <#R711>`__, „Double-FacedCards.”

Modal, Mode: A spell or`ability <#ability>`__ is „modal” if it has two ormore options in a bulleted listpreceded by instructions for a player <#player>`__to choose a number of those `options,such as „Choose one –.” See rule`700.2 <#R7002>`__.

Modular: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that has a `permanent enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on it and can`move <#move>`__ those counters toother artifact creatures.See rule 702.42, „Modular.”

Monarch: A designation a player canhave. Some effects instruct a`player <#player>`__ to become themonarch. The monarch draws a`card <#card>`__ at the beginning of their endstep. Dealing combatdamage to the monarch stealsthe title from that player. See rule`718 <#R718>`__, „The Monarch.”

Mono Artifact (Obsolete): An obsolete term thatappeared on the type line of`artifacts <#artifact>`__ with activatedabilities that caused the`artifact <#artifact>`__ to become <#becomes>`__`tapped as a cost.`Cards <#card>`__ printed with this text havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to simply say”Artifact,” and those`abilities <#ability>`__ now include the tapsymbol in their costs.

Monocolored: An object with exactlyone color is monocolored.`Colorless <#colorless>`__ objects <#object>`__aren’t monocolored. See rule `105,”Colors,” and rule 202,”Mana Cost and`Color <#color>`__.”

Monocolored Hybrid Mana Symbols: See Hybrid ManaSymbols.

Monstrosity: A keyword action <#keyword_action>`__that puts +1/+1 `counters on a`creature <#creature>`__ and makes it`become <#becomes>`__ monstrous.See rule 701.31, „Monstrosity.”

Monstrous: A designation given to a`creature <#creature>`__ whose`ability <#ability>`__ including a`monstrosity <#monstrosity>`__ instruction hasresolved. See rule 701.31,”Monstrosity.”

Morph: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `card be cast <#cast>`__`face down as a 2/2`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.36 <#R70236>`__, „Morph,” and rule`707 <#R707>`__, „Face-Down Spells and`Permanents <#permanent>`__.”

Mountain: One of the five basic landtypes. Any land <#land>`__with this `subtype has the`ability <#ability>`__ „{T}: Add {R}.” See rule`305.6 <#R3056>`__.

Mountaincycling: See`Typecycling <#typecycling>`__.

Mountainwalk: See Landwalk.

Move: To remove a counter from one`object <#object>`__ and put it on a different`object <#object>`__. See rule 122.5.Some older cards used „move” withrespect to Auras; those`cards <#card>`__ have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference andnow use the word „attach.”

Mulligan: To take a mulligan is to reject aprospective opening hand infavor of a new one. See rule 103.4.

Multicolored: An object with two ormore colors is multicolored.Multicolored is not a color. See rule`105 <#R105>`__, „Colors,” and rule`202 <#R202>`__, „Mana Cost and`Color <#color>`__.”

Multikicker: Multikicker is a`variant <#variant>`__ of the`kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__ keywordability. It represents anoptional additional cost <#additional_cost>`__that may be paid any number of times. See rule`702.32,”Kicker.” See also`Kicker <#kicker_kicked>`__.

Multiplayer Game: A game that begins with more thantwo players. See section 8,”Multiplayer Rules.”

Mutate: A keyword that lets a`creature <#creature>`__ card be`cast <#cast>`__ as a mutating creaturespell. See rule`702.139 <#R702139>`__, „Mutate.”

Mutating Creature Spell: A creature <#creature>`__`spell cast using the`mutate <#mutate>`__ keywordability. As it`resolves <#resolve>`__, if its`target <#target>`__ creature islegal, it merges with the target <#target>`__`creature. The resulting`creature <#creature>`__ has all`characteristics <#characteristics>`__ of thetopmost component and has the`abilities <#ability>`__ of each component. Seerule 702.139,”Mutate,” and rule 721,”Merging with Permanents.”

Myriad: Myriad is a triggeredability that effectivelylets a creature <#creature>`__`attack in all possible directions.See rule 702.115, „Myriad.”

Name: A characteristic, andpart of a card. A card’sname is printed in its upper left corner. See rule`201 <#R201>`__, „Name.”

Ninjutsu: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `creature suddenly entercombat. See rule 702.48, „Ninjutsu.”

Nonbasic Land: Any land that doesn’thave the supertype”basic.” See rule 205.4,”Supertypes.”

Nontraditional Magic Card: An oversized Magic`card <#card>`__ that has a Magic card <#card>`__back but not a „Deckmaster” back. See rule`108.2.

Object: An ability on the`stack <#stack>`__, a card, a`copy <#copy>`__ of a card, a`token <#token>`__, a spell, or a`permanent <#permanent>`__. See rule`109 <#R109>`__, „Objects.”

Offering: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that modifies when `you can`cast <#cast>`__ a spell and how much`mana <#mana>`__ you need to spendto do it. See rule 702.47,”Offering.”

One-Shot Effect: An effect that doessomething just once and doesn’t have a duration.See rule 610, „One-Shot Effects.” Seealso Continuous Effects.

Ongoing: A supertype that appearsonly on scheme cards. Seerule 205.4,”Supertypes.”

Opening Hand: The hand of`cards <#card>`__ a player starts thegame with, once the player hasdecided not to take any further`mulligans <#mulligan>`__. See rule`103.4 <#R1034>`__.

Opponent: Someone a player is playingagainst. See rules 102.2 and`102.3 <#R1023>`__.

Option: An additional rule or set of rules that canbe used in a multiplayergame. See rule`800.2 <#R8002>`__.

Oracle: The reference that contains theup-to-date wordings (in English) forall tournament-legal`cards <#card>`__. A card’s Oracle textcan be found using the Gatherer card <#card>`__database at`Gatherer.Wizards.com.See rule 108.1.

Outlast: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows a `creature to growlarger over time. See rule 702.106,”Outlast.”

Outside the Game: An object is”outside the game” if it isn’t in any of the game’s`zones <#zone>`__. See rule 400.11.

Overload: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows a `spell to affect either asingle target or many`objects <#object>`__. See rule`702.95 <#R70295>`__, „Overload.”

Owner: The player who (for purposesof the game) a card,`permanent <#permanent>`__, token, or`spell <#spell>`__ belongs to. See rules`108.3 <#R1083>`__, 110.2,`111.2 <#R1112>`__, and 112.2.

Paired: A term that describes a`creature <#creature>`__ that’s been affected by a`soulbond <#soulbond>`__ ability.See rule 702.94,”Soulbond.”

Paris Mulligan: Informal term for a previous systemof taking a mulligan. Using theParis mulligan, a player who took a`mulligan <#mulligan>`__ shuffled their`hand <#hand>`__ into their library <#library>`__and drew one fewer `card. For current`mulligan <#mulligan>`__ rules, see rule`103.4 <#R1034>`__.

Partner, „Partner with [name]”: A keywordability that lets two`legendary <#legendary>`__`creatures <#creature>`__ or`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ be`your <#you_your>`__ commander inthe Commander <#commander>`__`variant rather than one. „Partnerwith [name]” is a specialized versionof the ability that works evenoutside of the Commander <#commander>`__`variant to help two`cards <#card>`__ reach the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ together. See rule`702.123 <#R702123>`__, „Partner,” and rule`903 <#R903>`__, „Commander.”

Party: Some cards refer to the numberof creatures in`your <#you_your>`__ party. A`player <#player>`__’s party includes up to oneeach of Cleric, Rogue, Warrior, and Wizard. Seerule 700.8.

Pass: To decline to take any action (such ascasting a spell or activating an`ability <#ability>`__) when you <#you_your>`__have `priority. See rule`117 <#R117>`__, „Timing and`Priority <#priority>`__.”

Pass in Succession: All players „passin succession” if each player in thegame (starting with any one of them) opts not totake an action upon receiving`priority <#priority>`__. See rule 117,”Timing and Priority.”

Pay: To perform the actions required by a`cost <#cost>`__. This often means, but is notrestricted to, spending resources such as`mana <#mana>`__ or life.See rule 118, „Costs.”

Permanent: A card or token <#token>`__on the `battlefield. See rule`110 <#R110>`__, „Permanents.”

Permanent Card: A card that could beput onto the battlefield. Seerule 110.4a.

Permanent Spell: A spell that willenter the battlefield as a`permanent <#permanent>`__ as part of itsresolution. See rule 110.4b.

Permanently (Obsolete): An obsolete term used toindicate that a continuouseffect has no duration andthus lasts until the end of the game.`Cards <#card>`__ printed with this term havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to delete it.

Persist: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can return a `creature from the`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. See rule`702.78 <#R70278>`__, „Persist.”

Phase: 1. A subsection of a turn. See section5, „Turn Structure.” 2. A`permanent <#permanent>`__ „phases in” when its`status <#status>`__ changes from phasedout to phasedin. A`permanent <#permanent>`__ „phases out” when its`status <#status>`__ changes from phasedin to phasedout. See rule`702.25 <#R70225>`__, „Phasing.”

Phased In, Phased Out: A status a`permanent <#permanent>`__ may have. Phased-in isthe default status. Phased-out`permanents <#permanent>`__ are treated asthough they do not exist. See rule`110.5 <#R1105>`__ and rule 702.25,”Phasing.” („Phased-out” was a`zone <#zone>`__ in older versions of the rules.)

Phasing: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that causes a `permanent tosometimes be treated as though itdoes not exist. See rule 702.25,”Phasing.”

Phenomenon: A card type seen onlyon nontraditional Magiccards in the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. A phenomenon`card <#card>`__ is not a`permanent <#permanent>`__. See rule`310 <#R310>`__, „Phenomena.”

Phyrexian Mana Symbol: A manasymbol that represents a`cost <#cost>`__ that can be paid either byspending colored mana or by paying`life <#life_life_total>`__. See rule`107.4 <#R1074>`__.

Phyrexian Symbol: A symbol used in rulestext to represent any of the five`Phyrexian manasymbols <#phyrexian_mana_symbol>`__. See rule`107.4g <#R1074g>`__.

Pile: A temporary grouping of cards.See rule 700.3.

Placed: (Obsolete) Some spells and`abilities <#ability>`__ previously referred to a`counter <#counter>`__ being „placed” on a`permanent <#permanent>`__. These cards <#card>`__have received errata in the `Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to use the term „put”instead. Due to a rules change,these cards continue to function asthey did before. See rule 122,”Counters.”

Plains: One of the five basic landtypes. Any land <#land>`__with this `subtype has the`ability <#ability>`__ „{T}: Add {W}.” See rule`305.6 <#R3056>`__.

Plainscycling: See Typecycling.

Plainswalk: See Landwalk.

Planar Deck: A deck of at least ten`plane <#plane>`__ cards needed to`play <#play>`__ the Planechase <#planechase>`__casual `variant. See rule`901.3 <#R9013>`__.

Planar Die: A specialized six-sided die <#dies>`__needed to `play the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. See rule`901.3 <#R9013>`__.

Plane: A card type seen only on`nontraditional Magiccards <#nontraditional_magic_card>`__ in the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. A plane card isnot a permanent. See rule`309 <#R309>`__, „Planes.”

Planechase: A casual variant inwhich plane cards and`phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__ cards addadditional abilities and randomnessto the game. See rule 901,”Planechase.”

Planeswalk: To put each face-up plane <#plane>`__`card or phenomenon <#phenomenon>`__`card on the bottom of its`owner <#owner>`__’s planar deck <#planar_deck>`__`face down, then move <#move>`__the top `card of your <#you_your>`__`planar deck off that planardeck and turn it faceup in a Planechase <#planechase>`__game. See rule `701.24, „Planeswalk.”

Planeswalker: A card type. Aplaneswalker is a permanent. Seerule 306, „Planeswalkers.”

Planeswalker Symbol: The Planeswalker symbol {PW}appears on the planar die in the`Planechase <#planechase>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. See rule`107.11 <#R10711>`__.

Planeswalker Type: A subtype that’scorrelated to the planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__`card type. See rule`306 <#R306>`__,”Planeswalkers.” See rule`205.3j <#R2053j>`__ for the list of planeswalkertypes.

Planeswalker Uniqueness Rule (Obsolete): Olderversions of the rules stated that a`player <#player>`__ who controlled two or more`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ with the same`planeswalker type <#planeswalker_type>`__ wouldput all but one of those`planeswalkers <#planeswalker>`__ into their`owners <#owner>`__» graveyards.This rule was called the „planeswalker uniquenessrule” and no longer exists.

Play: 1. To play a land is to put a`land <#land>`__ onto the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ as a specialaction. See rule`116 <#R116>`__, „SpecialActions,” and rule`305 <#R305>`__, „Lands.” 2. To play a`card <#card>`__ is to play that card <#card>`__as a `land or cast that`card <#card>`__ as a spell, whicheveris appropriate. See rule 601, „Casting`Spells <#spell>`__.” 3. (Obsolete) Casting a`spell <#spell>`__ used to be known as playing a`spell <#spell>`__. Cards with thattext have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.See Cast. 4. (Obsolete) Activating an`activated ability <#activated_ability>`__ used tobe known as playing an activatedability. Cards <#card>`__with that text have received errata in the`Oracle card reference.See Activate. 5. (Obsolete) The`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ used to be known asthe in-play zone. Cards <#card>`__that were printed with text that contains thephrases „`in play,” „from play,””into play,” or the like are referring to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ and have receivederrata in the Oracle card <#card>`__reference. See `Battlefield.

Player: One of the people in the game. See rule`102 <#R102>`__, „Players.”

Poison Counter: A counter that maybe given to a player. See rule`122 <#R122>`__, „Counters,” andrule 704.5c.

Poisoned: Having one or more poisoncounters. See rule`122 <#R122>`__, „Counters.”

Poisonous: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that causes a `player to get poisoncounters. See rule`702.69 <#R70269>`__, „Poisonous.”

Poly Artifact (Obsolete): An obsolete term thatappeared on the type line of`artifacts <#artifact>`__ with activatedabilities that didn’t causethe artifact to be`tapped <#tapped>`__ as a cost.`Cards <#card>`__ printed with this text havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to simply say”Artifact.”

Populate: A keyword action <#keyword_action>`__that `creates a copy of a`creature <#creature>`__ token <#token>`__`you <#you_your>`__`control. See rule`701.30 <#R70130>`__, „Populate.”

Postcombat Main Phase: A mainphase that occurs after a combatphase. See MainPhase.

Power: 1. Part of a card that only`creatures <#creature>`__ have. A`creature <#creature>`__ card’s poweris printed before the slash in its lower rightcorner. See rule 208,”Power/Toughness.” 2. A`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ that only`creatures <#creature>`__ have. See rule`302.4 <#R3024>`__.

Precombat Main Phase: The first mainphase of a turn. See MainPhase.

Prevent: A word used by preventioneffects to indicate what`damage <#damage>`__ will not be dealt. See rule`615 <#R615>`__, „PreventionEffects.”

Prevention Effect: A kind of continuouseffect that watches for a`damage <#damage>`__ event that wouldhappen and completely or partially`prevents <#prevent>`__ the damage <#damage>`__that would be dealt. See rule `615,”Prevention Effects.”

Priority: Which player can takeactions at any given time is determined by a systemof „priority.” See rule 117, „Timingand Priority.”

Proliferate: To give an additional`counter <#counter>`__ to any number of`players <#player>`__ and/or`permanents <#permanent>`__ of each kind theyalready have. See rule 701.27,”Proliferate.”

Protection: A keywordability that provides a rangeof benefits against objects with aspecific quality. See rule 702.16,”Protection.”

Provoke: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can force a `creature to`block <#block>`__. See rule 702.38,”Provoke.”

Prowess: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that causes a `creature to get +1/+1whenever its controller <#control_controller>`__`casts a noncreature spell.See rule 702.107, „Prowess.”

Prowl: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that may allow a `spell to be`cast <#cast>`__ for an alternativecost. See rule`702.75 <#R70275>`__, „Prowl.”

Public Zone: A zone in which all`players <#player>`__ can be expected to see the`cards <#card>`__» faces. See rule`400.2 <#R4002>`__. See also HiddenZone.

Rampage: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can make a `creature better incombat. See rule 702.22, „Rampage.”

Range of Influence: See Limited Range ofInfluence.

Reach: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows a `creature to`block <#block>`__ an attackingcreature with`flying <#flying>`__. See rule`702.17 <#R70217>`__, „Reach.” See also`Flying <#flying>`__.

Rebound: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows an `instant or`sorcery <#sorcery>`__ spell to be`cast <#cast>`__ a second time. See rule`702.87 <#R70287>`__, „Rebound.”

Recover: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player return a`card <#card>`__ from their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ to their`hand <#hand>`__. See rule 702.58,”Recover.”

Redirect (Obsolete): Some older cards <#card>`__were printed with the term „redirect” to indicate a`redirection effect. Such`cards <#card>`__ have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference sothey explicitly state that damage <#damage>`__that would be dealt to one `object or`player <#player>`__ is dealt”instead” to another. See`Redirection Effect <#redirection_effect>`__.

Redirection Effect: A kind of replacementeffect that causes`damage <#damage>`__ that would be dealt to one`creature <#creature>`__,`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__, or`player <#player>`__ to be dealt`instead <#instead>`__ to another`creature <#creature>`__,`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__, or`player <#player>`__. See rule 614.9.

Reflexive Triggered Ability: An`ability <#ability>`__ that triggers <#trigger>`__based on actions taken earlier `during <#during>`__a `spell or ability’sresolution. See rule 603.12.

Regenerate: To replace a`permanent <#permanent>`__’s destruction with analternate sequence of events. See rule`701.15 <#R70115>`__, „Regenerate.”

Reinforce: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player put +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on a`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.76 <#R70276>`__, „Reinforce.”

Reminder Text: Parenthetical text in italics in the`text box <#text_box>`__ of a card thatsummarizes a rule that applies to that`card <#card>`__, but is not actually rulestext and has no`effect <#effect>`__ on play. See rule`207.2 <#R2072>`__.

Remove from the Game, Removed,Removed-from-the-Game Zone (Obsolete): „Remove[something] from the game” is an obsolete term for”exile [something].” „The removed`card <#card>`__” is an obsolete term for „theexiled card.” The removed-from-the-gamezone is an obsolete term for the exile <#exile>`__`zone. Cards with that texthave received errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference. See Exile.

Removed from Combat: Certain events <#event>`__can cause an attacking or `blockingcreature, or a`planeswalker <#planeswalker>`__ that’s beingattacked, to be „removed from combat.” A`permanent <#permanent>`__ that’s removed fromcombat has no further involvement in that combatphase. See rule`506.4 <#R5064>`__.

Renown: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that makes a `creature strongerafter it deals combatdamage to a`player <#player>`__. See rule`702.111 <#R702111>`__, „Renown.”

Renowned: A designation given to a`permanent <#permanent>`__ as a result of the`renown <#renown>`__ ability. Seerule 702.111,”Renown.”

Replacement Effect: A kind of continuouseffect that watches for aparticular event that would happen andcompletely or partially replaces that`event <#event>`__ with a different`event <#event>`__. See rule 614,”Replacement Effects.”

Replicate: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that `creates copies of a`spell <#spell>`__. See rule 702.55,”Replicate.”

Requirement: An effect that forcesone or more creatures to`attack <#attack>`__ or block. Seerules 508.1d and`509.1c <#R5091c>`__.

Resolve: When the spell or`ability <#ability>`__ on top of the`stack <#stack>`__ „resolves,” its instructions arefollowed and it has its effect. Seerule 608, „Resolving`Spells <#spell>`__ and Abilities.”

Respond: To cast an`instant <#instant>`__ spell or`activate <#activate>`__ an ability <#ability>`__while another `spell or`ability <#ability>`__ is already on the`stack <#stack>`__. See rule 117.7.

Restart the Game: To immediately end the currentgame and restart it. See rule 104,”Ending the Game.”

Restriction: An effect that precludesone or more creatures fromattacking or blocking. See rules`508.1c <#R5081c>`__ and 509.1b.

Retrace: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player cast a`card <#card>`__ from their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__. See rule`702.80 <#R70280>`__, „Retrace.”

Reveal: To show a card to all`players <#player>`__ for a brief time. See rule`701.16 <#R70116>`__, „Reveal.”

Riot: A keyword ability thatlets a player choose whether certain`creatures <#creature>`__ enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with`haste <#haste>`__ or with a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__. See rule`702.135 <#R702135>`__, „Riot.”

Ripple: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that may let a `player <#player>`__`cast extra cards from their`library <#library>`__ for no cost. Seerule 702.59, „Ripple.”

Rules Text: A characteristic <#characteristics>`__that defines a `card’s`abilities <#ability>`__. See rule`207.1 <#R2071>`__.

Sacrifice: To move a`permanent <#permanent>`__ you <#you_your>`__`control to its`owner <#owner>`__’s graveyard.See rule 701.17, „Sacrifice.”

Saga: An enchantment <#enchantment>`__`subtype. Sagas have a number ofchapter abilities that take`effect <#effect>`__ over a number of turns to tella story. See rule 714, „Saga`Cards <#card>`__.”

Scavenge: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows `you to`exile <#exile>`__ a creature <#creature>`__`card from your <#you_your>`__`graveyard to put +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on a`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.96 <#R70296>`__, „Scavenge.”

Scheme: A card type seen only on`nontraditional Magiccards <#nontraditional_magic_card>`__ in the`Archenemy <#archenemy>`__ casual`variant <#variant>`__. A scheme card <#card>`__is not a `permanent. See rule`312 <#R312>`__, „Schemes.”

Scry: To manipulate some of the cards <#card>`__on top of `your <#you_your>`__`library. See rule`701.18 <#R70118>`__, „Scry.”

Search: To look at all cards in astated zone and possibly find a`card <#card>`__ that matches a givendescription. See rule 701.19,”Search.”

Set Aside (Obsolete): „Set [something] aside” is anobsolete term for „exile [something].”Cards with that text have receivederrata in the Oracle card <#card>`__reference. See `Exile.

Set in Motion: To move a`scheme <#scheme>`__ card off the topof your scheme <#scheme>`__`deck and turn it faceup. See rule 701.25,”Set in Motion.”

Shadow: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that restricts how a `creature maybe blocked and which creatures itcan block. See rule`702.27 <#R70227>`__, „Shadow.”

Shard Token: A Shard token is a`colorless <#colorless>`__`enchantment <#enchantment>`__ token <#token>`__with „{2}, `Sacrifice this`enchantment <#enchantment>`__: Scry 1,then draw a card.” For moreinformation on predefined tokens, seerule 111.10.

Shared Life Total: In the Two-Headed Giantmultiplayer variant, each`team <#team>`__ has a „shared life total” ratherthan each player having an individual`life total <#life_life_total>`__. See rule`810 <#R810>`__, „Two-Headed GiantVariant.”

Shared Team Turns Option: An option <#option>`__that may be used in certain multiplayer`variants, such as Two-Headed Giantand Archenemy. See rule`805 <#R805>`__, „Shared Team Turns Option.”

Shortcut: A mutually understood way for the game toadvance forward a number of game choices (eithertaking an action or passing`priority <#priority>`__) without`players <#player>`__ needing to explicitlyidentify each such choice. See rule`722 <#R722>`__, „Taking Shortcuts.”

Shroud: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that precludes a `permanent or`player <#player>`__ from being targeted. See rule`702.18 <#R70218>`__, „Shroud.”

Shuffle: To randomize the cards in a`deck <#deck>`__ (before a game) or`library <#library>`__ (during agame). See rule 103.2.

Sideboard: Extra cards that may be usedto modify a deck between games of a`match <#match>`__. See rules 100.4.

Silver-Bordered: Cards in certain setsand certain promotional cards areprinted with a silver border. Silver-bordered`cards <#card>`__ are intended for casual`play <#play>`__ and may have features and textthat aren’t covered by these rules.

Skip: Effects that use the word”skip” are replacementeffects. The word „skip”indicates what events,`steps <#step>`__, phases, or turnswill be replaced with nothing. See rule`614 <#R614>`__, „ReplacementEffects.”

Skulk: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that restricts how a `creature maybe blocked. See rule 702.117,”Skulk.”

Slivercycling: See Typecycling.

Snow: A supertype that’s normallyrelevant on permanents. See rule`205.4 <#R2054>`__, „Supertypes.”

Snow Mana Symbol: The snow mana symbol {S}represents a cost that can be paid withone mana produced by a snow <#snow>`__source. It can also represent `mana froma snow source that was spent to`pay <#pay>`__ a cost. See rule`107.4h <#R1074h>`__.

Snow-Covered (Obsolete): Some older`cards <#card>`__ were printed with the term”snow-covered” in their rulestext. Except when referencing`card <#card>`__ names, such`cards <#card>`__ have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference toreference the supertype”snow” instead. See`Snow <#snow>`__.

Sorcery: A card type. A sorcery isnot a permanent. See rule`307 <#R307>`__, „Sorceries.”

Soulbond: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that makes `creatures better bypairing them together. See rule`702.94 <#R70294>`__, „Soulbond.”

Soulshift: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player return a`card <#card>`__ from their`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ to their`hand <#hand>`__. See rule 702.45,”Soulshift.”

Source of Damage: The object thatdealt that damage. See rule`609.7 <#R6097>`__.

Source of Mana: The spell thatproduced mana or the source of the`ability <#ability>`__ that produced`mana <#mana>`__. See rule 106.3.

Source of an Ability: The object thatgenerated that ability. See rule`113.7 <#R1137>`__.

Special Action: An action a player <#player>`__may take that doesn’t use the `stack.See rule 116, „Special Actions.”

Spectacle: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows certain `spells to be`cast <#cast>`__ for an alternativecost if an`opponent <#opponent>`__ has lost`life <#life_life_total>`__. See rule`702.136 <#R702136>`__, „Spectacle.”

Spell: A card on the`stack <#stack>`__. Also a copy (ofeither a card or another spell) on the`stack <#stack>`__. See rule 112,”Spells.”

Spell Ability: A kind of ability.Spell abilities are abilities thatare followed as instructions while an`instant <#instant>`__ or sorcery <#sorcery>`__`spell is resolving. See rule`113.3a <#R1133a>`__.

Spell Type: A subtype that’scorrelated to the instant cardtype and the sorcery <#sorcery>`__`card type. See rule`304 <#R304>`__, „Instants,” andrule 307, „Sorceries.”See rule 205.3k for the list of spelltypes.

Splice: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player add a`card <#card>`__’s rules text <#rules_text>`__onto another `spell. See rule`702.46 <#R70246>`__, „Splice.”

Split Cards: Cards with two`card <#card>`__ faces on a single`card <#card>`__. See rule 708, „SplitCards.”

Split Second: A keywordability that makes it nearlyimpossible for a player to`respond <#respond>`__ to a spell. Seerule 702.60, „Split Second.”

Stack: A zone. The stack is the`zone <#zone>`__ in which spells,`activated abilities <#activated_ability>`__, and`triggered abilities <#triggered_ability>`__ waitto resolve. See rule`405 <#R405>`__, „Stack.”

Starting Deck: After a player has`set aside <#set_aside>`__ their`sideboard <#sideboard>`__, their remaining`deck <#deck>`__ becomes theirstarting deck. See rule 103.2.

Starting Hand Size: The number of cards <#card>`__a `player draws as a gamebegins. In most games, each player’sstarting hand size is seven. See rule`103.4 <#R1034>`__.

Starting Life Total: The amount of`life <#life_life_total>`__ a player <#player>`__has as a game begins. In most games, each`player’s starting life total is 20.See rule 103.3.

Starting Player: The player chosen totake the first turn of a game. See rule`103.1 <#R1031>`__.

Starting Team: The team chosen to takethe first turn of a game using the shared teamturns option. Seerule 103.1.

State Trigger: A triggeredability that`triggers <#trigger>`__ when a game state is truerather than triggering when an event <#event>`__occurs. See rule `603.8.

State-Based Actions: Game actions that happenautomatically whenever certain conditions are met.See rule 704, „State-Based Actions.”

Static Ability: A kind of ability.Static abilities do something all the time ratherthan being activated or triggered. See rule`113 <#R113>`__, „Abilities,” andrule 604, „Handling Static Abilities.”

Status: The physical state of a`permanent <#permanent>`__. See rule`110.5 <#R1105>`__.

Step: A subsection of a phase. See`section 5 <#R5>`__, „Turn Structure.”

Storm: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that `creates copies of a`spell <#spell>`__. See rule 702.39,”Storm.”

Subgame: A completely separate Magic game createdby an effect. See rule`720 <#R720>`__, „Subgames.”

Substitute Card: A game supplement with a Magic`card <#card>`__ back that can be used to representa double-faced card or`meld card <#meld_cards>`__. See rule`713 <#R713>`__, „Substitute Cards.”

Subtype: A characteristic <#characteristics>`__that appears after the `card type <#card_type>`__and a long `dash on a card’s`type line <#type_line>`__. See rule`205.3 <#R2053>`__, „Subtypes.”

Successfully Cast (Obsolete): A term that wasprinted on some older cards. In`general <#general>`__, cards thatreferred to a spell being”successfully cast” have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference tosimply refer to a spell being”cast.”

Summon (Obsolete): Older creature <#creature>`__`cards were printed with „Summon[creature type]” on their`type lines <#type_line>`__. All such`cards <#card>`__ have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference tosay „Creature – [creaturetype].” (Many of these`cards <#card>`__» creaturetypes have also been updated.)See Creature.

Summoning Sickness Rule: Informal term for a`player <#player>`__’s inability to`attack <#attack>`__ with a`creature <#creature>`__ or to`activate <#activate>`__ its`abilities <#ability>`__ that include the tapsymbol or the untapsymbol unless the`creature <#creature>`__ has been under that`player <#player>`__’s`control <#control_controller>`__ since thebeginning of that player’s mostrecent turn. See rule 302.6. See also`Haste <#haste>`__.

Sunburst: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can have a `permanent enterthe battlefield with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ or charge`counters <#counter>`__ on it. See rule`702.43 <#R70243>`__, „Sunburst.”

Supertype: A characteristic <#characteristics>`__that appears before the `card type <#card_type>`__on a `card’s type line.Most cards don’t have a supertype. Seerule 205.4, „Supertypes.”

Supervillain Rumble: A`Free-for-All <#free-for-all>`__ game in which each`player <#player>`__ is an`archenemy <#archenemy>`__. See rule`806 <#R806>`__,”Free-for-All,” and rule`904 <#R904>`__, „Archenemy.”

Support: A keyword action <#keyword_action>`__that lets `you put +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ on`creatures <#creature>`__. See rule`701.35 <#R70135>`__, „Support.”

Surge: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that provides an `alternativecost to cast a`card <#card>`__ if you or one of`your <#you_your>`__ teammates has`cast <#cast>`__ another spell in thesame turn. See rule 702.116,”Surge.”

Surveil: To manipulate some of the`cards <#card>`__ on top of your <#you_your>`__`library, sending some of them to`your <#you_your>`__ graveyard andrearranging the rest. See rule`701.42 <#R70142>`__, „Surveil.”

Suspend: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that provides an alternative way to`play a card. See rule`702.61 <#R70261>`__, „Suspend.” A card <#card>`__is „suspended” if it’s in the `exile <#exile>`__`zone, has suspend, and has a time`counter <#counter>`__ on it.

Swamp: One of the five basic landtypes. Any land <#land>`__with this `subtype has the`ability <#ability>`__ „{T}: Add {B}.” See rule`305.6 <#R3056>`__.

Swampcycling: See Typecycling.

Swampwalk: See Landwalk.

Tap: To turn a permanent sidewaysfrom an upright position. See rule`701.21 <#R70121>`__, „Tap and Untap.”

Tap Symbol: The tap symbol {T} in an activationcost means „Tap <#tap>`__this `permanent.” See rule`107.5 <#R1075>`__.

Tapped: A status a`permanent <#permanent>`__ may have. See rule`110.5 <#R1105>`__ and rule 701.21,”Tap and Untap.” See also`Untapped <#untapped>`__.

Target: A preselected object or`player <#player>`__ a spell or`ability <#ability>`__ will affect. See rule`115 <#R115>`__, „Targets.”

Team: A group of players who share acommon victory condition in a multiplayergame. See rule`808 <#R808>`__, „Team vs. TeamVariant,” rule`809 <#R809>`__, „EmperorVariant,” rule`810 <#R810>`__, „Two-Headed GiantVariant,” and rule`811 <#R811>`__, „Alternating TeamsVariant.”

Team vs. Team Variant: A multiplayer`variant <#variant>`__ played among two or more`teams <#team>`__, each of which sits together. Seerule 808, „Team vs. Team Variant.”

Teammate: In a multiplayergame between`teams <#team>`__, a player’steammates are the other players ontheir team. See rule`102.3 <#R1023>`__.

Text Box: Part of a card. The text boxis printed on the lower half of the`card <#card>`__ and contains the`card <#card>`__’s rules text,`reminder text <#reminder_text>`__, and flavortext. See rule 207,”Text Box.”

Text-Changing Effect: A continuouseffect that changes thetext that appears in an object’s`text box <#text_box>`__ and/or typeline. See rule 612,”Text-Changing Effects.”

Threshold: „Threshold” used to be a keywordability. It is now an`ability word <#ability_word>`__ and has no rulesmeaning. All cards printed with thethreshold keyword have received errata in the`Oracle <#oracle>`__ card reference.

Timestamp Order: A system used to determine inwhich order continuouseffects in the same`layer <#layer>`__ or sublayer are applied. Seerule 613.7. See also`Dependency <#dependency>`__.

Token: A marker used to represent any`permanent <#permanent>`__ that isn’t representedby a card. See rule 111,”Tokens.”

Tombstone Icon: An icon that appears in the upperleft of some Odyssey block <#block>`__`cards that has no effect <#effect>`__on game `play. See rule`107.9 <#R1079>`__.

Total Casting Cost (Obsolete): An obsolete term for`converted mana cost <#converted_mana_cost>`__.`Cards <#card>`__ printed with this text havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference.

Total Cost: What a player actuallyhas to pay, in practical terms, to`cast <#cast>`__ a spell or activatedability: the manacost, activationcost, or alternativecost, plus all`cost <#cost>`__ increases (including additionalcosts) and minus all`cost <#cost>`__ reductions. See rule`601.2f <#R6012f>`__.

Totem Armor: A keywordability that allows an`Aura <#aura>`__ to protect the`permanent <#permanent>`__ it’s enchanting. Seerule 702.88, „Totem Armor.”

Toughness: 1. Part of a card that only`creatures <#creature>`__ have. A`creature <#creature>`__ card’stoughness is printed after the slash in its lowerright corner. See rule 208,”Power/Toughness.” 2. A`characteristic <#characteristics>`__ that only`creatures <#creature>`__ have. See rule`302.4 <#R3024>`__.

Tournament: An organized play activitywhere players compete against other`players <#player>`__. See rule 100.6.

Tournament Rules: Additional rules that apply togames played in a sanctioned`tournament <#tournament>`__. See rule`100.6 <#R1006>`__.

Traditional Magic Card: A Magic card <#card>`__that measures approximately 2.5 inches (6.3centimeters) by 3.5 inches (8.8 centimeters). Seerule `108.2.

Trample: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that modifies how a `creature <#creature>`__assigns `combat damage. Seerule 702.19, „Trample.”

Transfigure: A keywordability that lets a`player <#player>`__ search their`library <#library>`__ for a replacement`creature <#creature>`__ card. See rule`702.70 <#R70270>`__, „Transfigure.”

Transform: To turn a double-facedcard so its other face isup. See rule 701.28, „Transform.”

Transforming Double-Faced Cards: One of two kindsof double-faced cards.Transforming double-faced cards default to theirfront faces but can transform totheir back faces in some way. See rule`711 <#R711>`__, „Double-FacedCards.”

Transmute: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player <#player>`__`search their library <#library>`__for a replacement `card. See rule`702.52 <#R70252>`__, „Transmute.”

Treasure Token: A Treasure token is a`colorless <#colorless>`__ artifact <#artifact>`__`token with „{T},`Sacrifice <#sacrifice>`__ this`artifact <#artifact>`__: Add one mana <#mana>`__of any `color.” For more informationabout predefined tokens, see rule`111.10 <#R11110>`__.

Tribal: A card type. Whether ornot a tribal is a permanent <#permanent>`__depends on its other `card type.See rule 308, „Tribals.”

Tribute: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows an `opponent to choosebetween a creature entering the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with +1/+1`counters <#counter>`__ or an additional`ability <#ability>`__. See rule`702.103 <#R702103>`__, „Tribute.”

Trigger: Whenever a game event or gamestate matches a triggeredability’s triggerevent, that`ability <#ability>`__ automatically „triggers.”That means its controller <#control_controller>`__puts it on the `stack the next time a`player <#player>`__ would receive`priority <#priority>`__. See rule 603,”Handling TriggeredAbilities.”

Trigger Condition: The first part of a triggeredability, consisting of”when,” „whenever,” or „at” followed by a triggerevent. See rule`603 <#R603>`__, „Handling TriggeredAbilities.”

Trigger Event: The event that a`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__ looksfor. Whenever the trigger event occurs, the`triggered ability <#triggered_ability>`__`triggers <#trigger>`__. See rule 603,”Handling TriggeredAbilities.”

Triggered Ability: A kind of`ability <#ability>`__. Triggered abilities beginwith the word „when,” „whenever,” or „at.” They’rewritten as „[Triggercondition],[effect].” See rule 113,”Abilities,” and rule`603 <#R603>`__, „Handling Triggered Abilities.”

Turn Markers: Markers used to keep track of which`players <#player>`__ are taking turns in a GrandMelee game. See rule`807.4 <#R8074>`__.

Turn-Based Actions: Game actions that happenautomatically when certain steps or`phases <#phase>`__ begin, or when each`step <#step>`__ or phase ends. Seerule 703, „Turn-Based Actions.”

Two-Headed Giant Variant: A multiplayer`variant <#variant>`__ played amongtwo-player teams thateach have a shared lifetotal and take asimultaneous turn. See rule 810,”Two-Headed Giant Variant.”

Type: 1. An object’s cardtype or, more broadly, its cardtype, subtype,and/or supertype. See rule`205 <#R205>`__, „Type Line,” and`section 3 <#R3>`__, „Card Types.”2. An attribute mana has. See rule`106 <#R106>`__, „Mana.”

Type Icon: An icon that appears in the upper leftof some Future Sight cards that has no`effect <#effect>`__ on game play. Seerule 107.10.

Type Line: Part of a card. The typeline is printed directly below the`illustration <#illustration>`__ and contains the`card <#card>`__’s card type(s),`subtype <#subtype>`__(s), and/or`supertype <#supertype>`__(s). See rule`205 <#R205>`__, „Type Line.”

Type-Changing Effect: An effect thatchanges an object’s cardtype, subtype,and/or supertype. See rules`205.1a <#R2051a>`__-b, 305.7, and`613.1d <#R6131d>`__.

Typecycling: A variant of the`cycling <#cycling>`__ ability. Seerule 702.28,”Cycling.”

Unattach: To move an`Equipment <#equipment>`__ away from the`creature <#creature>`__ it’s attached to so thatthe Equipment is on the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ but is not equippinganything. See rule 701.3d.

Unblockable (Obsolete): A term that meant „can’t beblocked.” Cards that used this termhave received errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference.

Unblocked Creature: An attackingcreature once no`creature <#creature>`__ has been declared as ablocker for it, unless an`effect <#effect>`__ has caused it to`become <#becomes>`__ blocked. It remains anunblocked creature until it’s removed fromcombat or the combatphase ends, whichever comesfirst. See rule 509, „Declare BlockersStep.”

Undaunted: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that reduces the `cost of a`spell <#spell>`__ based on the number of`opponents <#opponent>`__ you have.See rule 702.124, „Undaunted.”

Undying: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that can return a `creature from the`graveyard <#graveyard>`__ to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. See rule`702.92 <#R70292>`__, „Undying.”

Unearth: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `player return a`creature <#creature>`__ card fromtheir graveyard to the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__. See rule`702.83 <#R70283>`__, „Unearth.”

Unflipped: A default status a`permanent <#permanent>`__ may have. See rule`110.5 <#R1105>`__ and rule 709, „FlipCards.” See also`Flipped <#flipped>`__.

Unleash: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that allows a `creature to enter the`battlefield <#battlefield>`__ with a +1/+1`counter <#counter>`__ on it and stops it fromblocking if it has a +1/+1 counter <#counter>`__on it. See rule `702.97, „Unleash.”

Unless: A word used to indicate a certain style of`cost <#cost>`__. See rule 118.12a.

Untap: To rotate a permanent backto the upright position from a sideways position.See rule 701.21, „Tap andUntap.”

Untap Step: Part of the turn. This step <#step>`__is the first `step of the beginningphase. See rule`502 <#R502>`__, „Untap Step.”

Untap Symbol: The untap symbol {Q} in an`activation cost <#activation_cost>`__ means”Untap this`permanent <#permanent>`__.” See rule`107.6 <#R1076>`__.

Untapped: A default status a`permanent <#permanent>`__ may have. See rule`110.5 <#R1105>`__ and rule 701.21,”Tap and Untap.” See also`Tapped <#tapped>`__.

Upkeep Step: Part of the turn. This`step <#step>`__ is the second step ofthe beginning phase. Seerule 503, „Upkeep Step.”

Vancouver Mulligan: Informal term for a previoussystem of taking a mulligan. Usingthe Vancouver mulligan, a player whotook a mulligan shuffled their`hand <#hand>`__ into their library <#library>`__and drew one fewer `card. After choosingto not mulligan, a`player <#player>`__ who took a`mulligan <#mulligan>`__ looked at the top`card <#card>`__ of their library <#library>`__and could put it on the bottom of their`library. For current`mulligan <#mulligan>`__ rules, see rule`103.4 <#R1034>`__.

Vanguard: 1. A casual variant inwhich each player plays the role of afamous character. See rule 902,”Vanguard.” 2. A card type seenonly on nontraditional Magiccards in theVanguard casual variant. A vanguard`card <#card>`__ is not a`permanent <#permanent>`__. See rule`311 <#R311>`__, „Vanguards.”

Vanishing: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that limits how long a `permanent <#permanent>`__remains on the `battlefield. Seerule 702.62, „Vanishing.”

Variant: An additional set of rules that determinesthe style of a multiplayergame. See rule`800.2 <#R8002>`__.

Vehicle: An artifact <#artifact>`__`subtype. Vehicles can`become <#becomes>`__ artifactcreatures. See rule`301 <#R301>`__, „Artifacts,” andrule 702.121, „Crew.”

Vigilance: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that lets a `creature <#creature>`__`attack without tapping. See rule`702.20 <#R70220>`__, „Vigilance.”

Vote: Some cards instruct`players <#player>`__ to vote from among given`options <#option>`__. See rule`701.32 <#R70132>`__, „Vote.”

Walker Token: A Walker token is a 2/2 black Zombie`creature <#creature>`__ token namedWalker. For more information on predefined`tokens <#token>`__, see rule 111.10.

Wall: A creature type with noparticular rules meaning. Older cards <#card>`__with the Wall `creature type <#creature_type>`__but without `defender had anunwritten ability that precludedthem from attacking. Those cards havereceived errata in the Oracle <#oracle>`__`card reference to have`defender <#defender>`__. Some older`cards <#card>`__ that referenced the Wall`creature type <#creature_type>`__ have alsoreceived errata. See Defender.

Win the Game: There are several ways to win thegame. See rule 104, „Ending the Game,”and rules 810.8 (for additional rulesfor Two-Headed Giant games) and rule`809.5 <#R8095>`__ (for additional rules for`Emperor <#emperor>`__ games).

Wither: A keyword ability <#keyword_ability>`__that affects how an `object <#object>`__`deals damage to a`creature <#creature>`__. See rule`702.79 <#R70279>`__, „Wither.”

Wizardcycling: See Typecycling.

World: A supertype that’s normallyrelevant on enchantments. Seerule 205.4,”Supertypes.” See also WorldRule.

World Rule: A state-basedaction that causes all`permanents <#permanent>`__ with the`world <#world>`__ supertype <#supertype>`__except the one that has had the `world <#world>`__`supertype for the shortest amountof time are put into their owners»graveyards. See rule`704.5k <#R7045k>`__.

X: A placeholder for a number that needs to bedetermined. See rule 107.3.

Y: See X.

You, Your: Words that refer to an`object <#object>`__’s`controller <#control_controller>`__, its would-be`controller <#control_controller>`__ (if a`player <#player>`__ is attempting to`cast <#cast>`__ or activate it),or its owner (if it has no`controller <#control_controller>`__). See rule`109.5 <#R1095>`__.

Zone: A place where objects can be`during <#during>`__ a game. See section4, „Zones.”

Zone-Change Triggers: Triggerevents that involve`objects <#object>`__ changing zones.See rule 603.6.

Szybkie wyszukiwanie
